Woo-jin was already a genius monster, a different league altogether.
Thus, he realized.
Ahn Woo-jin was an invincible opponent, not even suitable for gaining experience points.
The mere fact that he challenged him might have been arrogance.
“Ah…!”
Crack! The goblin mask shattered from the impact and fell to the ground.
Finally, Sindo-rim’s true face was revealed.
“Huh!? Sindo-rim’s mask…?”
“Hey, isn’t that Park Sung-tae?”
“Park Sung-tae? That third-year from the Chrysanthemum Hall?”
“I knew it! It was Park Sung-tae! I was right!”
The audience murmured.
The true identity of the Sindo-rim Swordmaster was exposed.

chapters.title: Chapter 10.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 10.2 (Continued)
Park Sung-tae.
A third-year student at Ahsung High, known for his high grades among the gathered prodigies.
His face showed no trace of the challenger’s bravado.
Only shock filled his expression.
“Damn it….”
Park Sung-tae propped himself up on the ground.
His body refused to move as he willed it.
He had endured multiple shocks and electric attacks, enough to knock anyone unconscious.
Yet, Sung-tae struggled to rise.
There was another reason he had challenged Woo-jin. This duel wasn’t just about gaining meaningful combat experience.
Sung-tae had always considered himself a genius.
He believed that his outstanding talent had allowed him to achieve high grades even within Ahsung High School.
However, the spotlight always shone on his juniors.
Especially on Oh Baek-seo, an unparalleled genius, and Ahn Woo-jin, who had surpassed him to become the Disciplinary Committee Leader.
He acknowledged the difference in talent.
But Sung-tae wasn’t willing to accept being considered mediocre.
He had resolved to use another genius as experience points to rise above.
Only then…
‘I must defeat him to prove myself….’
He wanted to show the audience that his belief in his own talent was not misplaced.
Sung-tae managed to stand up and took his sword again. Whoosh! The flames responded to his call once more.
“He’s pretty tough….”
“Does he really need to go this far, though? Doesn’t seem like it.”
“The Disciplinary Committee Leader is amazing, isn’t he? Sindo-rim doesn’t stand a chance.”
“I didn’t expect it to be this bad…. How is his mana control like that…?”
The audience started praising Ahn Woo-jin.
Their interest in Sindo-rim waned rapidly as his identity was revealed and the duel turned one-sided.
But Sung-tae focused solely on Ahn Woo-jin.
He couldn’t hear the murmurs of the audience with the towering wall right in front of him.
Click, clack.
Woo-jin walked forward.
His steps were resolute.
Sindo-rim instinctively held his breath.
“If you’re my senior, I should have shown more respect.”
Woo-jin spoke in a monotone voice.
“I’ll stop holding back now. Let’s finish this quickly.”
“……!”
Sung-tae’s eyes widened.
“You mean, you haven’t been serious at all…?”
“Unfortunately, senior, you’re not an opponent worth my serious effort.”
“Grr…!”
Park Sung-tae gritted his teeth.
“Don’t be ridiculous!”
Sung-tae charged at Woo-jin again with a fierce cry.
Thud!
What followed was the expected conclusion.
Sung-tae’s sword strike was effortlessly deflected, and the electrified three-section staff plunged into his body.
Teal arcs flashed through the air, accompanied by five rapid, dull impacts. Crackle! The lightning mana enhanced the strikes with greater force.
‘What…?’
Sung-tae couldn’t comprehend what was happening.
The audience watched in shock, mouths agape.
Bang!
With a final swing of Woo-jin’s three-section staff, a booming sound echoed as Sung-tae was sent flying out of the arena.
Whoosh! The wind pressure spread. As his hat threatened to fly off, Woo-jin caught it and put it back on.
Crash! Sung-tae hit the wall and collapsed, unconscious.
For a moment, silence filled the arena. Woo-jin stood quietly, watching Sung-tae.
“D-d-d-d-duel over…!”
The referee’s shout broke the silence.
“The winner is Disciplinary Committee Leader Ahn Woo-jin!”
Students who had been in a daze started clapping one by one.
Healers administered basic healing magic to Sung-tae and carried him away on a stretcher.
Rumble. Woo-jin wiped the blood off the three-section staff with a handkerchief, retracted the metal rods, and reattached it to his belt. Adjusting his hat, he extended his hand to the referee.
“Um…? Would you like to say a few words…?”
Woo-jin took the microphone from the referee without responding.
He spoke towards the camera filming the duel.
“I hereby declare: any student who issues another challenge to the Disciplinary Committee will be severely punished according to school regulations. Please take note.”
Woo-jin’s voice was solemn.
After delivering his warning, he returned the microphone to the referee and stepped off the arena.
The referee and audience watched his back in stunned silence.
“Goodness… he’s something else.”
In the audience, Lee Se-Ah smiled brightly.
She had known he was strong, being the Disciplinary Committee Leader and the one who single-handedly quelled the subway incident….
But she hadn’t expected this level of power.
Watching the duel, she felt a constant chill.
Considering his mana level and combat sense, Woo-jin had long surpassed the typical fourth rank.
Though he didn’t possess a unique ability to qualify for the fifth rank, evaluating Woo-jin’s strength solely based on rank was misleading.
Se-Ah’s desire to have Woo-jin grew stronger.
If she could recruit him, he would undoubtedly become a formidable ally.
“Yesong, why aren’t you going to your boyfriend candidate?”
“I’ve always disliked that senior. I was fooled by the mask. He’s out of the running….”
Woo-jin left the arena with Vice President Oh Baek-seo and Officer Ha Ye-song.
At this moment.
In front of the city’s big names who were watching, Woo-jin established himself as an ‘unknown powerhouse.’
…
A woman watched the duel between Woo-jin and Sindo-rim on Jtube.
It was a video she had replayed countless times.
She paused the video and enlarged the screen, gently caressing Woo-jin’s cheek with her finger. The screen moved with her finger’s motion.
The sensation under her fingertip was that of the hard screen, not Woo-jin’s soft skin.
“He’s gotten so strong, Woo-jin. This much….”
Kim Dalbi smiled contentedly, continuing to gaze at Woo-jin.

chapters.title: Chapter 11.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 11 – Rule 7: The Leader Does Not Concern himself with Black Day
The primary difference between the Old Humanity and the New Humanity lies in their magical responsiveness. While most of the Old Humanity struggled with even basic levels of magic despite awakening to it, the New Humanity could manipulate magic as effortlessly as breathing.
Magic is a mysterious energy that flows within the body, enhancing living beings and transforming them into stronger entities. This strength is categorized into the ‘Nine Tiers.’
1st Tier.
At this level, individuals possess magic but cannot wield its power. This term also describes ordinary people. The New Humanity does not fall under this category.
2nd Tier.
This level can enhance physical abilities using magic. Depending on their skill, they might withstand gunfire or anti-aircraft guns. This is the starting point for the New Humanity.
3rd Tier.
This level can channel magic into objects with built-in magic circuits, augmenting their functionality or hardness.
4th Tier.
This level can convert magic into the power of a single element while maintaining the magic’s enhancement effects. The element that can be converted depends on the innate nature of the magic.
5th Tier.
This level has awakened a ‘Unique Ability,’ a special power that only one individual can use. Those who reach the 5th Tier are considered geniuses.
6th Tier.
This level can simultaneously use a Unique Ability and elemental power, requiring excellent magic manipulation skills.
7th Tier.
This level’s Unique Ability becomes powerful enough to cause calamities. Those who reach the 7th Tier instil fear in the world just by their name.
8th Tier.
This level reshapes heaven and earth. Among humans, the modern ‘Argonauts’ who once set out to subdue the Golden Sheep fall under this Tier. However, they all died in defeat to the Golden Sheep.
9th Tier.
This level refers exclusively to the ‘Golden Sheep.’ The Golden Sheep is an entity that has achieved the pinnacle of magic and is sometimes regarded as a god. No one but the Golden Sheep is expected to reach this Tier.
The concept of the Nine Tiers is based on the observed existence of these entities.
“Ultimately, it’s the 4th Tier.”
After watching the sparring video, several academies evaluated the Disciplinary Committee Leader of Ahsung High School.
“He seems strong in personal combat, but in an actual fight, he might be weaker than us. After all, he’s only at the 4th Tier.”
“How can we judge based on that brief spar? However, he does seem strong.”
“His skills are considerable, but… it’s still hard to say for sure.”
They acknowledged Ahn Woo-jin’s combat abilities but remained uncertain about whether he was suitable as the Disciplinary Committee Leader over Oh Baek-seo.
However, it was still difficult to gauge the full extent of Woo-jin’s unrevealed ‘capabilities.’ They remained cautious of him.
Meanwhile.
“So, the Disciplinary Committee Leader of Ahsung High is at the 4th Tier…”
Mayeon High School’s Disciplinary Committee Leader, Lee Jae-ho, muttered as he adjusted his glasses. His Vice, who also wore glasses, stroked his chin and replied.
“For a 4th Tier, he’s exceptionally strong.”
“Vice, this isn’t something that can be measured just by the fact that he’s at the 4th Tier.”
“Pardon?”
Lee Jae-ho remained in a state of surprise.
His ability to manipulate magic was superior to my own. His dazzling combat style was on an astounding level, akin to an agent from the Federation Council’s Black Ops performing covert operations within Academy City.
“Well, yes. I’ve never seen anyone this formidable in personal combat. It’s surprising that someone like this is still at the 4th Tier.”
“Perhaps.”
Lee Jae-ho leaned back in his chair and sipped his hot espresso.
“He might have achieved many accomplishments while staying at the 4th Tier due to hitting an early wall of talent.”
“Is that possible? That the wall of talent is so high?”
“It’s possible.”
Lee Jae-ho leaned back in his chair.
“If the conditions to acquire a new Unique Ability are exceptionally difficult. In other words, if his potential is at an insane level…”
If Woo-jin manages to break through the wall of the 5th Tier.
He might become a monster beyond the term genius.
“He might not be much now, but he’s definitely not someone to be taken lightly.”
Lee Jae-ho also considered Woo-jin’s potential.
Perhaps Ahsung High’s decision to appoint Ahn Woo-jin as the Disciplinary Committee Leader instead of Oh Baek-seo was appropriate, he thought.
“Hmm… So, you’re saying it’s favorable. That’s a relief.”
“What?”
Suddenly, the Vice handed a document to Lee Jae-ho.
“Vice, what’s this?”
“It’s a proposal for an exchange meeting with Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee.”
“?”
Lee Jae-ho looked at the Vice with a puzzled face. His eyes showed confusion.
“Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee and Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee have not been on good terms. This proposal aims to foster friendship starting this year. ‘Peace forever,’ they say.”
“What the…! Do you think I’ll approve such a thing, Vice!?”
“This proposal came under the Student Council President’s directive. Who knows, if you handle this well, the President might favor you…”
Scratch!
Lee Jae-ho signed the approval line without hesitation.
The Vice naturally retrieved the document.
“Yes, it’s approved.”
“Grrr…. Listen carefully, Vice. I only signed because it was the Student Council President’s directive… I would never get friendly with the Ahsung High Disciplinary Committee even if Neo Seoul were to collapse…!”
Lee Jae-ho’s face turned red and blue in no time. He grasped the pen with trembling hands, solidifying his resolve.
“Yes, I understand. Well noted.”
The Vice nodded nonchalantly.
Currently, the student council president of Mayeon High School was Lee Jae-ho’s adopted sister.
He respected his sister deeply and sought her recognition.
…to put it nicely.
Lee Jae-ho was a sister complex, unable to refuse any of her requests and drooling over her photo every day.
“Then I’ll submit this approved document to the student council. Since it’s under the student council president’s directive, the approval should be quick, so I’ll notify Ahsung High in advance.”
“Grrr…”
Lee Jae-ho’s body trembled with frustration.
* * *
“Leader, the views are off the charts!”
April 14th, in the Disciplinary Committee’s office.
Ha Yesong cheerfully shouted as she held up her smartphone.
“As expected, you’re a goldmine, Leader!”
“Isn’t that an odd way to put it?”
“It’s my way of praising you. Not everyone can be profitable, you know? Unless they sell their organs or something.”
That’s an inappropriate expression.
“Ha Yesong, as a Disciplinary Committee member, you should refrain from such immoral expressions.”
“Hehe, sorry about that.”
“Well… there’s no reason to be happy. All the revenue generated from that video will go to the student council anyway.”
“Still, if we’re going to milk it, it feels better to squeeze out as much as we can, right?”
“That’s totally the mindset of a predatory loan shark…”
Calling her a mosquito might also be apt.
“Besides, we’re not even sure if we’ll be able to confiscate it yet.”
“That’s true.”
The revenue generated from the sparring video with the Sindo-rim Swordmaster was to be confiscated by the Disciplinary Committee, as it was considered illicit profit due to illegal activities.
Thus, Sindo-rim was in a position where he had to hand over the revenue generated from the sparring video to us every month until graduation.
In the end, Sindo-rim filed a constitutional appeal against this regulation with the academic court.
Having already discarded their pride, their resolve was quite impressive.
Eventually, the revenue confiscation was fully suspended until the constitutionality was determined.
If the decision was constitutional, Sindo-rim would have to pay back all the unpaid revenue.
If it was deemed unconstitutional, the confiscation would be canceled, and the regulation would disappear, but I didn’t care. Since the confiscated money would go to the student council anyway, I had no vested interest. Only Sindo-rim would be troubled with proving the unconstitutionality.
Ding.
“Hmm?”
A text notification sounded from Yesong’s school uniform pocket. She immediately checked her smartphone.
TL Note –
Our MC, Ahn Woo-jin is not the student council President. He is the disciplinary committee Leader. This was my misconception due to previous translator translated him as a student council president. I have corrected all errors in previous chapters.

chapters.title: Chapter 11.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 11 (Continued)
“Leader, I’m going to eat jjajangmyeon with the Gourmet Club members.”
The Gourmet Club was a food exploration club that Yesong was part of in addition to the Disciplinary Committee.
“Jjajangmyeon?”
“Today, we have to eat jjajangmyeon. It’s a significant matter!”
“?”
Not ‘want to eat,’ but ‘have to eat’?
Ah, maybe she just phrased her desire differently.
“Enjoy your meal, Leader!”
Yesong left the office with a bounce in her step.
‘Jjajangmyeon, huh… Now that I hear it, I want some too.’
Come to think of it, it’s been a while since I had jjajangmyeon.
I decided to order it for lunch.
I pulled out my smartphone to order jjajangmyeon via the delivery app.
Just then, my phone vibrated with a message on CoconutTalk.
It was a message from Vice_ Leader Oh Baek-seo.
[Oh Baek-seo: Leader]
[Oh Baek-seo: Have you had lunch?]
Baek-seo’s profile picture on Cocotalk was the back view of her in a hanbok in a flower garden.
Even through CoconutTalk, she exuded elegance.
[Ahn Woo-jin: I was just about to order]
[Ahn Woo-jin: What about you?]
[Oh Baek-seo: Not yet]
[Ahn Woo-jin: Let’s eat together]
[Oh Baek-seo: Sure]
[Oh Baek-seo: Sounds good, haha]
[Oh Baek-seo: (Cat laughing emoji)]
[Ahn Woo-jin: Come to the office]
[Ahn Woo-jin: Is jjajangmyeon okay?]
[Oh Baek-seo: ?]
What’s with the question mark?
[Oh Baek-seo: Really?]
What does she mean by ‘really’?
[Oh Baek-seo: I like it]
Oh, just an exclamation, I guess.
[Ahn Woo-jin: Jja? Jjam?]
[Oh Baek-seo: Jjajangmyeon]
[Ahn Woo-jin: Got it]
[Ahn Woo-jin: (OK sign dog emoji)]
[Oh Baek-seo: I’ll be there soon, hehe]
I ordered two bowls of jjajangmyeon and a tangsuyuk set from the delivery app.
Soon, Baek-seo arrived at the office, and 10 minutes later, the jjajangmyeon set was delivered.
After setting the food on the table, Baek-seo and I sat on the sofa.
‘Oh, the smell is amazing.’
The aroma of jjajangmyeon I hadn’t smelled in a while was very stimulating.
My mouth watered.
“You ordered tangsuyuk too?”
“Do you not like tangsuyuk?”
“Not at all. I love it.”
Baek-seo shook her head, smiling gently as always.
I rubbed the wooden chopsticks in my hands to warm them up. Then, with a bit of force, they split perfectly in half.
…Wait a second.
‘Oops.’
Had the act of heating the wooden chopsticks through palm friction been unrefined?
No, it was within acceptable limits. The purpose was to precisely split the chopsticks using a scientific principle. It was a logical and reasonable action.
‘I should maintain my dignity even while eating jjajangmyeon.’
That was the appropriate demeanor expected of a Disciplinary Committee Leader.
Thankfully, I became aware in time. I almost shook the packaged jjajangmyeon to mix it, which would have been undignified. At least, it wasn’t something to do in front of the Vice.
After removing the plastic wrap from the jjajangmyeon, I stirred the noodles and sauce with my chopsticks. The white noodles slowly turned black as they absorbed the sauce with a slurping sound.
‘Yes, this is it.’
There was no way that a mere jjajangmyeon could tarnish my dignity, even slightly.
Finally, I lifted a chopstickful of jjajangmyeon to my mouth. Slurp. A rich, savory flavor with the right balance of salty and sweet burst forth.
‘This is fantastic.’
As I was happily slurping the noodles,
“Leader.”
“What?”
“Why jjajangmyeon all of a sudden? And with me?”
Baek-seo asked with a smiling face.
I didn’t understand her intent.
“I wanted to eat it. And if I’m going to eat, it’s better to eat together.”
“Is that so…?”
Baek-seo tucked a strand of hair behind her ear and slurped a few strands of jjajangmyeon. A meaningful smile played on her lips.
‘What’s this?’
Something felt off.
I suddenly remembered Yesong shouting that she had to eat jjajangmyeon today. Baek-seo seemed to know something as well.
There were no significant memories related to jjajangmyeon within the Disciplinary Committee.
So then?
I took out my smartphone and accessed the internet. Upon searching for ‘jjajangmyeon,’ I found information I hadn’t paid attention to before.
April 14th.
Black Day.
It’s a day when men and women who didn’t receive chocolates or candies on Valentine’s Day and White Day gather to eat jjajangmyeon together.
All clothes and accessories must be black, and they should drink black coffee at cafes.
It’s a day for singles to comfort each other and sometimes become couples.
“Ah.”
I finally understood Yesong’s earlier remark and Baek-seo’s reaction.
Today was April 14th, Black Day.
It was coincidental that I decided to have jjajangmyeon today after a long time, and my company was Baek-seo. She might have interpreted my invitation differently.
[It’s a day when singles become couples.]
That particular phrase lingered in my mind.
‘Should I explain this…?’
Should I clarify that there was no hidden meaning behind my invitation to eat jjajangmyeon together? No, that would be undignified. It would make me seem desperate and pitiful.
“Hm…”
I was lost in thought, forgetting about the jjajangmyeon in front of me.
“Leader.”
“Yeah.”
“The jjajangmyeon is delicious.”
Baek-seo said with a smile.
“Shall we make this our regular spot?”
“……”
Surprisingly, seeing Baek-seo’s calm smile, my mind cleared instantly.
‘Well… what does it matter if today is Black Day or not.’
Baek-seo must have known it was Black Day.
Normally, Baek-seo would not miss the opportunity to tease me in such a situation. How could she not take advantage of the funny scenario where I invited her to eat jjajangmyeon on Black Day?
Yet, she made no jokes about it.
This meant she wasn’t concerned about Black Day.
‘Paying attention to such things would be childish and undignified. Baek-seo knows this well.’
Making a fuss to explain myself would only damage my dignity. I didn’t want to do that anyway.
I had worried over nothing.
“It doesn’t matter.”
I answered with a raised corner of my mouth.
Later, while eating jjajangmyeon without any particular thoughts,
Baek-seo quietly munched on a piece of pickled radish and said,
“Leader, you won’t be eating jjajangmyeon again today, will you?”
“Probably not.”
“Then that’s good.”
?
Slurp. Baek-seo finished her remaining jjajangmyeon.

chapters.title: Chapter 12.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 12 – Rule 8. The Leader Maintains Dignity Even at Exchange Meetings (1)
“Apparently, the student council president wants us to hold an exchange meeting with Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee.”
I was in the middle of eating an egg mayo sandwich made by Oh Baek-seo when my friend from the student council suddenly mentioned this odd proposal.
“An exchange meeting with Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee?”
“Yeah.”
Mayeon High School: the school we had the most conflicts with and avoided the most. And now, an exchange meeting?
If it were a business partner, we’d need to be polite, but there’s no reason to be on good terms with these guys.
As the Disciplinary Committee Leader, I intended to avoid any involvement with them. There’s no need to step in dog poop if you can walk around it.
“Why the hell?”
“How should I know? Apparently, it was agreed upon.”
“Getting friendly with street rats would be more realistic. Aren’t Mayeon High and Ahsung High practically in a cold war?”
“Honestly, it seems like you won’t be able to refuse. There’s a positive atmosphere about it in the student council.”
Really?
“Why?”
“Our school district and Mayeon High’s district are very closely connected. Continuing to fight is just a game of chicken. If we cut off the exchange meeting too, things will just get more awkward. They probably want to reconcile, at least on the surface, and establish a somewhat peaceful relationship.”
If it were any other school, I would welcome it with open arms.
But not Mayeon High. Historically, we have fought countless dirty battles and snarled at each other.
Naturally, I felt resistant.
“Why do we have to do this? We can just stay awkward with them.”
So I argued.
“Our student council president wants to show some achievements.”
“Oh…”
I immediately shut my mouth.
Improving relations with Mayeon High.
If such an achievement were recorded in the school life record under the student council president’s tenure…
That would be a very powerful credential.
“I don’t know what the other student council president’s motive is, but there’s nothing to lose. On the contrary, establishing a friendly relationship on the surface might benefit both sides. Since there hasn’t been any recent conflict, the student council president wants to proceed positively for their and the school’s future. What can we do?”
It was a carefree statement.
“…But the exchange meeting is between the Disciplinary Committees, not the student councils.”
I’m the one stepping in shit.
“All conflicts originated from the Disciplinary Committees. The student council presidents will likely meet too, but you have to bear with it. If you handle this well, it’ll be an achievement for you too. If the Mayeon High students act up, just handle them appropriately.”
I sighed.
As the Disciplinary Committee Leader, I couldn’t ignore the student council president’s orders.
“Who suggested this?”
“The Mayeon High student council president.”
“What?”
They suggested it first?
‘Oh, right.’
I recalled some game information I had noted down. It was information I had forgotten because I didn’t think it was important.
The current student council president of Mayeon High was a bright, cheerful girl who seemed to have a field of flowers blooming in her mind.
She was always saying “Peace forever, peace.”
She prioritized peace and friendship, only considering the school’s interests afterward. You could say she had an altruistic nature.
I remember being fond of her character in the game because she was exceptionally kind. She just lacked a bit of awareness.
‘If it’s her, there likely aren’t any shady motives.’
Therefore, the reason why the Mayeon High student council president wanted to proceed with the exchange meeting was probably because she genuinely wished for her school’s Disciplinary Committee to reconcile with ours.
‘The problem is their Disciplinary Committee members.’
The student council president’s kindness didn’t necessarily reflect the character of the Disciplinary Committee members.
The street scum I referred to were not the student council president, but the members of the Mayeon High Disciplinary Committee.
“Anyway, I’ve told you. Sorry, but bear with it. As I said, if it goes well, you’ll benefit too.”
My student council friend patted my shoulder and left.
Did I have any say in this?
If the higher-ups command, I have to comply.
If this were an opportunity to build a record of achievements, I’d welcome it.
…
“…So that’s how it is.”
I informed Deputy Oh Baek-seo and officer Ha Yesong about the exchange meeting with Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee.
Since it was the student council president’s directive, the exchange meeting proposal was swiftly and decisively approved.
There’s no port to escape the storm.
Under these circumstances, the Disciplinary Committee had no choice but to go through with this exchange meeting.
“Ugh, looks like we’ll have a lot of work to do…”
Ye-song sighed.
She worried about preparing for the exchange meeting, not about the confrontation with Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee.
Since she wasn’t interested in the history of conflicts between Ahsung High and Mayeon High, her reaction was understandable.
“When is it?”
“In nine days.”
“My god, why is it so rushed!?”
“I was just informed about this proposal yesterday, so I have nothing to say.”
“How could such a big event get approved in just one day?”
“Because it’s the student council president’s order.”
“Oh, then I understand.”
Yesong also understood the basic social order that if the higher-ups command, you have to comply.
“Oh dear…, we’ll have to start preparing right away.”
“We need to gather the rest of the officers. Since it’s an exchange meeting, all officers must participate.”
Baek-seo spoke with her usual kind smile on her face.
“Other executives. That means, the secretary and the treasurer.”
The exchange meeting with Mayeon High School is an important event. We need to start preparing immediately. Thus, it was necessary to assemble the five executive parts in one place for an executive assembly.
“I’ll call the treasurer.”
“I’ll handle Minhyuk!”
Park Minhyuk was the name of the Disciplinary Committee’s secretary.
Yesong and I each called the executives. …They aren’t picking up.
“They’re not answering.”
“Neither are mine. Oh, I got a text.”
“What does it say?”
Yesong showed the text message to Baek-seo and me.
[Please do not look for someone like me…]
How poignant. It was clear that the low self-esteem secretary, who falls in love easily, was once again heartbroken or feeling self-deprecating.
“I guess he might be hiding in the trash can, so I’ll go check there.”
Yesong deduced calmly.
“Alright. Vice-Leader, help Yesong.”
“Okay.”
“I’ll go find the treasurer.”
“Let’s contact each other once we find them!”
After leaving the room, we scattered.
The treasurer of Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee, ‘Yoo Doha’. Among the students, Doha is humorously called ‘Calculating Ghost’ because she calculates everything before taking action.
Fortunately, there was no participatory class in the class the treasurer belonged to. When she had free time, she usually locked herself in an empty classroom, saying she needed to prove various things.
She didn’t stay in one fixed place. She moved to any classroom she liked daily. However, she preferred classrooms with large blackboards, so some classrooms could be excluded.
“Senior!”
While crossing the schoolyard, a female student called out to me. I stopped and looked over.
“Lee Se-Ah?”
The girl in the black uniform, Lee Se-Ah, ran towards me. A bright smile spread across her face as if she was happy to find me.
“Where are you headed?”
“I’m just looking for someone.”
“That sounds fun! Can I help? I’m a specialist at finding people.”
Se-Ah showed a confident attitude. She was an expert at everything, it seemed.
“What about your classes?”
“I only have BD class left. I have plenty of free time.”
“Hmm.”
Having someone to help was welcome.
I didn’t assign the task of finding the executives to the Disciplinary Committee members because it would look bad. So, if someone unrelated to the committee helped, it wouldn’t be a problem.
Lee Se-Ah might become a great villain in the Black Market someday, but she wasn’t someone who would bring about the dystopia I feared. Therefore, I had no ill feelings towards her. In fact, having frequent conversations through CoconutTalk made us somewhat close.
Additionally, keeping my distance from her would look strange, and there was no reason to distance myself from her anyway. She didn’t seem like someone who would harm the Disciplinary Committee.
So, I spoke without hesitation.
“I’m looking for the Disciplinary Committee treasurer. She looks like this.”
I showed her a photo of Yoo Doha on my smartphone. Se-Ah nodded.
“Okay, okay.”
“She should be in an empty classroom. One with a large blackboard. I’ll search from this direction.”
“Then I’ll check this line. Let’s contact each other if we find her.”
Se-Ah waved her smartphone and started backing away before turning towards the classroom building.

chapters.title: Chapter 12.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 12 (Continued)
I quickened my pace in the direction I was heading.
Buzz.
As I walked down the corridor, checking the classrooms, my smartphone vibrated.
[Lee Se-Ah: Senior]
[Lee Se-Ah: Found the treasurer!]
[Lee Se-Ah: (photo)]
[Lee Se-Ah: She’s in the Chrysanthemum Hall laboratory]
Se-Ah had secretly taken a picture of a girl writing calculations on the blackboard inside the lab.
It was the back of Yoo Doha, the treasurer.
‘Found her already?’
That was fast. Did she use some method? Or just luck?
In any case, it was helpful.
[Ann Woo-jin: Thank you]
[Ann Woo-jin: (thumbs-up puppy emoji)]
[Lee Se-Ah: Praise me]
[Ann Woo-jin: Good job]
[Lee Se-Ah: lol]
[Lee Se-Ah: (dancing flying squirrel emoji)]
I arrived at the entrance of the Chrysanthemum Hall laboratory.
Leaning against the wall in the corridor, Se-Ah greeted me with a wave. She put her hand to her mouth and whispered softly.
“She’s completely focused.”
She pointed towards the open lab door.
Standing at the entrance, I saw Yoo Doha deeply absorbed in front of the blackboard. Se-Ah and I each leaned against the doorframe, peeking at Doha.
“First, I need to decompose these… Then, if I use the complex exponential function here… What a beautiful relationship…! Now, I need to reconstruct these parts…!”
Acting like a mad scientist, Yoo Doha grinned fiercely, scribbling furiously with the chalk.
The blackboard was filled with incomprehensible formulas, and I couldn’t understand a word he was saying.
In my past life and current life, I was a humanities student. Just looking at the formulas made me feel queasy.
“Should I bring her over?”
“Yes. But not yet.”
“Why not?”
“She really hates being interrupted when she’s focused. We need to wait until her concentration breaks.”
If I interrupted her now, even if Neo Seoul were being destroyed, she would firmly push me away, saying, ‘Do not disturb me at this moment, Woo-jin…!’ At times like these, Doha was like an impregnable fortress.
This was an established principle from our first year. I was in charge of bringing the eccentric Yoo Doha from the Disciplinary Committee.
“Is that so?”
“Anyway, thanks for finding her. You can go now… Wait, what are you doing?”
Suddenly, Se-Ah entered the lab. She approached Yoo Doha with her hands behind her back.
“It’s Fermat’s Last Theorem, right?”
“!”
As soon as a coquettish voice echoed through the lab, Doha flinched. She quickly turned her head and saw Se-Ah.
“Who are you?”
Doha looked wary.
“Do you know that this proof is complete?”
“Hah!”
Doha scoffed confidently.
“You’re asking the obvious. Don’t you think I know Andrew Wiles proved it? But I want to fully understand the process…! The way he proved it, Taniyama-Shimura conjecture, and all those elliptic curves…”
“Wow, you’re trying to savor the beauty of the proof? That’s amazing.”
“What?”
Doha, who was passionately explaining, showed signs of confusion.
‘Oh?’
It was the first time I’d seen Doha react like this.
Se-Ah smiled slyly.
“How elliptic curves connect with modular forms? It’s quite an interesting topic.”
“Isn’t it? That connection is very fascinating…!”
Huh?
I didn’t understand their conversation, but it was clear Doha was getting hooked.
Doha and Se-Ah continued discussing various incomprehensible topics.
Se-Ah even understood the equations on the blackboard and picked up a piece of chalk, adding her own notes.
Doha watched with an intrigued expression, nodding in agreement.
‘What is that?’
It was terrifying.
“Oh, by the way.”
After a short while, Se-Ah spoke.
“The Disciplinary Committee Leader is here to see you.”
“The Leader?”
“Yes, do you have time?”
Surprisingly, Se-Ah managed to create a natural opportunity for me to step in.
She gained Doha’s favor, invaded her territory, and it only took about 2 minutes. Considering my best time was 15 minutes, it was an impressive speed.
“Leader?”
Doha tilted her head.
Anticipating this, I had been leaning against the door frame with my arms crossed, setting the mood.
“Yoo Doha. Emergency executive meeting. Stop what you’re doing and come with me.”
“…What’s the matter?”
“I’ll tell you when we get there.”
“Hmm.”
Doha looked back and forth between Se-Ah and the blackboard. Se-Ah was still smiling slyly.
“Alright, I’ll come with you.”
……
“Wow, Leader! You succeeded in bringing the treasurer!”
“Of course. With a little help.”
“That’s the shortest time ever! As expected of the Leader!”
Upon arriving at the room with the treasurer, Yoo Doha, Yesong welcomed me.
Doha warned, “Don’t treat bringing me as a mission,” but Yesong ignored her, grinning widely.
“And the secretary?”
“Over there, overcoming the pain of heartbreak.”
When I opened the cabinet, a startled male student inside exclaimed, “Leader!” It was the secretary, Park Minhyuk.
“Get out.”
“Y-Yes…”
At my firm command, he lowered his head and stepped out of the cabinet.
“Leader.”
“Hmm?”
Suddenly, Baek-seo approached me. I flinched at the closeness of her face but didn’t show it.
“Who did you bring the treasurer with?”
Baek-seo asked in a low, whispering voice.
It was chilling. Despite her kind tone, it felt like a cold blade was pressed against my neck.
I had felt this way before…
“Why do you ask?”
Baek-seo stared into my eyes.
“…It’s nothing. Never mind.”
She shook her head with a smile and returned to the sofa.
What was that…?
It made me a little nervous.
In a scary way.
Anyway, all five parts of the Disciplinary Committee were gathered in the executive room.
The always kind vice-leader, Oh Baek-seo.
The male secretary, Park Minhyuk, with leaves in his hair and shoulders slumped in despair.
The female treasurer, Yoo Doha, sitting arrogantly with her arms crossed and legs folded.
The dog, Ha Yesong.
And me.
After explaining why I had gathered the executives, I made the declaration.
“Starting today, we’ll prepare for the Disciplinary Committee exchange meeting. We have 9 days left. The time is tight, so let’s all do our best.”
“Okay.”
“Yes…”
“Of course.”
“Got it!”
And so, 9 days later, the Disciplinary Committee of Mayeon High School visited Ahsung High School.

chapters.title: Chapter 13.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 13 – Rule 8. The Leader Maintains Dignity Even at Exchange Meetings (2)
Mayeon High School.
One of the major schools in Academy City with self-governing authority.
More than any other school, it shares the highest ratio of bordering district with Ahsung High School.
As a result, disputes often arose over the punishment of criminals who crossed between the two school districts.
Over time, the conflicts deepened, and the two schools frequently glared and growled at each other.
Thus, it was famously known as the school with the worst relationship with Ahsung High School.
Since I became the Disciplinary Committee Leader, there have been no conflicts with Mayeon High.
Of course, I was always prepared for one to occur in the future.
Today might be that day.
‘I hope the exchange meeting ends without incident….’
Although not religious, I had prayed to God this morning.
Be it God, Buddha, or ,Golden Sheep I hoped they would hear my prayer.
There were scheduled to be two Disciplinary Committee exchange meetings this year.
The first semester at Ahsung High School and the second semester at Mayeon High School.
So this time, the exchange meeting was held at Ahsung High School.
Our Ahsung High greeted the Mayeon High students, dressed in their maroon uniforms.
“Welcome, students of Mayeon High School.”
“Thank you for the warm welcome, Ahsung High School.”
The student council presidents of both schools led the way, exchanging cordial greetings.
‘So she is the student council president.’
The girl smiling brightly like a fully bloomed flower was the student council president of Mayeon High.
Her smile seemed to create a field of flowers, like something out of a romance comic.
Because of that, the atmosphere of the Disciplinary Committee standing behind her looked dramatically contrasting.
Gloomy, one might say.
Our Disciplinary Committee was no different.
Because we were wary of each other.
The Disciplinary Committees also greeted each other.
“Welcome, Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee Leader. I am the Disciplinary Committee Leader, Ahn Woo-jin, and this is Vice-Leader Oh Baek-seo.”
“Ha ha. Nice to meet you, Leader Ahn Woo-jin. I am Leader Lee Jae-ho, and this is Vice-Leader Shin Ga-yeon.”
We shook hands out of courtesy.
“Ha ha.”
“Ho ho.”
Oh boy, what a firm grip.
Let’s not start a power struggle here….
Lee Jae-ho, the bespectacled male Disciplinary Committee Leader, was openly displaying his wariness towards me.
I immediately recognized him as a tiger cub hiding its claws.
Ready to scratch my face at any moment.
I had no choice but to reveal my own wariness.
“Oh my, it’s nice to see you both smiling. I’m relieved….”
“It’s fortunate to see that we’re already getting along.”
The student council presidents of Mayeon High and Ahsung High babbled nonsense as they watched us.
I already felt troubled at the thought of seeing this guy twice.
“Everyone, please come this way! We’ve prepared plenty of delicious food!”
Ha Ye-song cheerfully led the Mayeon High students.
At least Ye-song was bright.
We went to the banquet hall and enjoyed the food and drinks set up buffet style. It was arranged with the support of the student council.
The somewhat unpleasant atmosphere was significantly mitigated by the cheerful music filling the banquet hall.
The student council presidents and key members of the student council were to dine in a separate space.
Meanwhile, I had no choice but to dine with the Mayeon High Disciplinary Committee Leader and Vice-Leader, along with Oh Baek-seo. It couldn’t be helped; it would look odd if we weren’t together.
In the midst of the awkward atmosphere, while we were only moving our utensils, Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee Leader Lee Jae-ho raised his glass and spoke.
“I’m not pleased.”
Jae-ho muttered, almost to himself.
His gaze was fixed on the banner on the stage.
The banner read “Ahsung High School & Mayeon High School Exchange Meeting” in large letters.
“Having Ahsung High before Mayeon High is unacceptable.”
Jae-ho clicked his tongue.
‘Did he just say that out loud?’
I was utterly dumbfounded.
“This is Ahsung High. Next time, you can put Mayeon High first.”
“So you heard me. I was planning to do so anyway.”
Jae-ho’s petty mumbling broke the silence after several minutes, opening up conversation. I appreciated that.
“By the way, I’ve heard quite a lot about you, Leader Ahn Woo-jin.”
“Is that so?”
“Yes. From resolving the Anomia train abduction incident single-handedly on your first day of activity to recently overwhelming the Sword Master of Sindorim in a duel…. You’ve already made quite a name for yourself. You’ll soon be a famous figure, won’t you?”
“It just happened that way. The duel with the Sword Master was particularly troublesome, though.”
Jae-ho adjusted his glasses once.
“Still, it’s fortunate. Leader Ahn Woo-jin, you haven’t troubled us with jurisdiction issues ‘yet’. It seems you have some sense.”
“……”
A subtle attempt at dominance.
It was incredibly uncomfortable.
“Leader Lee Jae-ho.”
“Yes.”
“We do not intend to cause conflicts with Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee.”
“We feel the same. However, please understand one thing. We have no intention of forming a friendly relationship with Ahsung High.”
Is this guy for real…?

chapters.title: Chapter 13.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 13 (Continued)
Even Mayeon High’s Vice-Leader, Shin Ga-yeon, flinched at her leader’s comment and subtly poked his thigh. She too seemed troubled.
However, Jae-ho wiped the bit of sauce from his mouth with a tissue, maintaining his determined attitude.
“We are only attending this exchange meeting under the directive of our student council president. I hope there are no misunderstandings.”
This is just great….
“…Leader Lee Jae-ho.”
Seeing the Vice-Leader of Mayeon High giving signals to maintain decorum, I considered keeping polite. But it was no use.
This bespectacled guy was crossing the line, and if I stayed silent, my reputation as the Disciplinary Committee Leader would be tarnished.
I leaned back in my chair and spoke.
“Why don’t we drop the formalities? It seems uncomfortable for you to keep using polite speech.”
“Are you sure about that?”
“Go ahead. We’re the same age anyway, aren’t we?”
“I’m a year older than you, kid.”
The moment he switched to informal speech, the tension eased slightly.
Although the atmosphere worsened and my morning prayer seemed in vain, this was preferable.
“Leader, mind your manners…”
Shin Ga-yeon, the Vice-Leader, whispered reproachfully to her leader.
“It still baffles me.”
Yet, Jae-ho didn’t stop. He folded his arms and continued.
“Why Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee chose a fourth-rank human over Oh Baek-seo for the leader position… Tsk.”
Jae-ho clicked his tongue.
‘Is this a provocation?’
Whether he thought so or not, Jae-ho knew that statement was a sore spot for me.
It was clear he was provoking me, hoping I would lose my temper.
If I showed anger here, the situation would surely escalate. Yes, Jae-ho was testing me arrogantly.
So, just as I was about to steer the conversation away,
“Stop with the pointless talk….”
“Care to repeat that?”
“……?”
While I was trying to avoid the provocation and change the topic, a sharp voice came from beside me.
A soft yet cold tone.
It was Oh Baek-seo, seated next to me, who spoke.
Baek-seo was smiling only with her mouth, her eyes fiercely glaring at the Mayeon High leader.
Jae-ho and Ga-yeon showed signs of surprise.
Especially Jae-ho, who seemed not to expect Baek-seo to get angry instead of me.
“Woo-jin became the leader because he deserved it.”
While we remained silent, Baek-seo spoke clearly in a smooth yet firm voice.
“Why we should bother getting close to people who can’t even recognize that, is beyond us too.”
Baek-seo smiled sweetly.
Despite her polite phrasing, it was evident she was furious.
“…I see. I apologize for the earlier rudeness.”
Jae-ho closed his eyes and adjusted his glasses.
It became evident that his intent was to provoke me as the leader. He desired a power struggle between the leaders.
If he had a grudge against Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee as a whole, he would have shown anger when Baek-seo made his sharp remark.
“Tsk.”
Clicking my tongue lightly, I seized the opportunity Baek-seo had created.
“The recreation activities will begin shortly.”
I looked towards the stage.
“We’ve prepared activities filled with ‘competitive elements’ to foster our ‘friendship,’ so I hope you enjoy it to the fullest.”
I emphasized “friendship” and “competitive elements” on purpose.
Recreation.
It’s typically just an event to foster some enjoyment in an awkward group setting.
Given the bad relationship between Ahsung High and Mayeon High, planning such an event seemed rather clueless.
However,
What if the so-called “recreation” was actually a “competition” to determine who is superior?
The significance changes entirely.
“Splendid. You’ve prepared a lot. We’ll gladly enjoy it, Ahsung High.”
Jae-ho smirked.
Thankfully, he understood my hidden message immediately.
In fact, I had anticipated Jae-ho’s aggressive attitude from the start.
While preparing for the exchange meeting, I had gathered information on Mayeon High’s current Disciplinary Committee Leader, Lee Jae-ho.
Lee Jae-ho had a tendency to assert dominance over Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee.
Much like the saying “A nation that forgets its history has no future,” he believed that standing superior to Ahsung High, known for frequent disputes, was the way to benefit Mayeon High.
I respected his intentions.
His logic was to gain an upper hand for his school through the principle of power.
Thus, we had prepared a “competition” under the guise of “recreation.”
To respect his intent and determine which Disciplinary Committee was superior.
‘This is a crucial matter that concerns my dignity as the leader and the honor of our committee.’
What’s the point of being nice to those who want to trample over us?
We’d only end up being taken for fools.
Therefore, we had to win this contest.
Doing so would not only boost my prestige as the leader but also put the Mayeon High bunch in their place.
Shortly after, the lights in the banquet hall dimmed, leaving only the stage illuminated.
The music in the banquet hall quieted, and soon an Ahsung High Disciplinary Committee member took the stage with a microphone.
“Welcome everyone to the Disciplinary Committee Exchange Meeting!”
All eyes in the Disciplinary Committees were focused on the stage.
A large camera was directed at the stage.
The camera feed was being transmitted to the banquet hall where other Disciplinary Committee members were gathered.
Naturally, not all committee members were in this banquet hall. Otherwise, the hall would be packed.
Thus, some members were split into other halls to enjoy the exchange meeting.
“We have prepared some recreation activities for a joyous day like today.”
The host received formal cheers from both Disciplinary Committees as they introduced the activities and the prizes.
* * *
“Wow…. They’ve even prepared recreation activities! I wonder if this will help Mayeon High and Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committees get along better?”
“Of course it will. Just look at the leaders laughing and talking. They seem to get along well already. They might become close friends soon….”
“Oh my. That’s wonderful! My brother is such a kind person; he only befriends kind people, right? If Jae-ho likes him, he must be really kind…! This is great….”
The Mayeon High student council president chatted excitedly with the Ahsung High student council president while observing the banquet hall atmosphere through the window.
Her eyes sparkled brightly.
‘She’s more innocent than she looks.’
The Ahsung High student council president thought while sipping his drink.
Initially, he had been wary of Mayeon High’s proposal for an exchange meeting. The reason he eventually accepted the proposal was purely for the sake of achievements.
He had thought just meeting the formalities would be enough.
However, after several attempts to gauge the Mayeon High student council president, he realized her intentions were pure and decided to set aside his suspicions.
‘Might as well get along.’
If the two Disciplinary Committees became friendly, it would reduce troublesome issues during his term as the student council president.
Getting people to become friends is always a good thing.
The Ahsung High student council president thought so.
While he was letting his guard down,
Just as the recreation was reaching its final stage, the anticipated trouble finally occurred.

chapters.title: Chapter 14.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 14 – Rule 8. The Leader Maintains Dignity Even at Exchange Meetings (3)
“The recreation will be conducted on a points system! Each game victory earns 1 point! The school with the highest points at the end will be the winner! So, Ahsung High V.S. Mayeon High, who will come out on top? Let’s all enjoy it together!”
As the host shouted, special effects spread across the stage.
The Disciplinary Committee members clapped in unison.
Ahsung High V.S. Mayeon High.
It was a very blatant expression.
Most students, except for a few innocent ones, quickly realized the hidden meaning behind the recreation planned by Ahsung High.
“So, they want to challenge us.”
“Arrogant Ahsung High folks.”
This wasn’t just a simple recreation; it was a pride battle between the Disciplinary Committees of each school.
Both sides were eager for this.
“They’re making it interesting.”
“Glad you see it that way.”
Lee Jae-ho of Mayeon High adjusted his glasses.
Ahn Woo-jin of Ahsung High shrugged his shoulders.
“You didn’t rig the games, did you?”
“Do you think we’d stoop to such low tricks? This is a matter of pride. If you’re uncomfortable, you can change the game events.”
“Fine. Let’s see who comes out on top.”
Perhaps because they were showing their true intentions, the initial awkwardness had already dissipated.
Thus began the battle between Ahsung High and Mayeon High.
“Let’s start with something simple… a quiz!”
From the first to the fourth games, the Disciplinary Committee members competed in various events.
A quiz everyone could participate in, target hitting, magic power battles, and more.
The atmosphere heated up.
Ahsung High: 1
Mayeon High: 3
Mayeon High led in points, and the serious competition began from the fifth event.
“From the fifth game onward, it’s a representative match! Each side will choose their most capable representative to compete!”
The host shouted with a smile.
“First, we need one person from each side who claims to have the best memory. Please step forward!”
At the host’s call, Jae-ho showed interest.
“A memory competition? Good. Go, Seogi!”
Jae-ho sent out his secretary.
“Park Minhyuk, I choose you!”
“Whaaat!?”
Park Minhyuk, the secretary of Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee, shuddered at Woo-jin’s declaration.
“M-me…?”
“You have the best memory, don’t you?”
“But, even so, in front of all these people…? Leader, this is…!”
“Get up there. The honor of our Disciplinary Committee rests on your shoulders.”
“Ugh….”
Muttering, “If it’s the leader’s order, I have no choice…,” Minhyuk reluctantly headed to the stage.
The secretaries of Mayeon High and Ahsung High stood on stage.
‘Oh no….’
Minhyuk felt immense pressure and his legs trembled.
“Both committees have chosen their secretaries! What an exciting lineup! Let’s move on to the fifth game! This game is… the ‘Card Flip’ game!”
Committee members brought out a table. The screen behind the stage showed the table.
Over 100 cards were scattered on it, all facedown.
“Each side will take turns flipping cards to find matching pairs. The side with the most pairs wins! There are two full decks on the table! This will require incredible memory and concentration. Are both participants ready?”
“Yes.”
“Y-yes….”
“Then, let’s determine the order…. Okay, Mayeon High’s secretary will go first! Ready, set, go!”
After several rounds of flipping cards and assessing the pairs, Minhyuk, who initially trembled with fear, began to focus on the game.
“This card with this card… and…”
With cautious but confident movements, Minhyuk flipped cards unhesitatingly, earning admiration from Ahsung High members.
In contrast, the expressions of Mayeon High members hardened.
Flipping all the cards with ease, the match ended quickly.
“Unbelievable! Ahsung High’s secretary Park Minhyuk wins by a landslide! Ahsung High scores! They’re closing the gap rapidly!”
“Ugh.”
Jae-ho frowned and clenched his fist.
Meanwhile, Woo-jin hid his rising smile behind a propped fist.
“Vice-Leader, it’s time to secure our victory.”
“Huh?”
Jae-ho had no intention of letting Ahsung High gain the upper hand.
“The games might be rigged in favor of Ahsung High. We need to intervene here.”
After whispering to the Vice-Leader, Jae-ho looked at Woo-jin.
“Hey, Leader Ahn Woo-jin. You said we could choose the game events, right?”
Jae-ho asked, looking at Woo-jin.
“Yeah.”
“Then….”
Jae-ho whispered instructions to Shin Ga-yeon.
“…Understood.”
Ga-yeon went up on stage and whispered to the host. The committee members looked puzzled.
The host glanced at Woo-jin, who nodded. Then, the host handed the microphone and the cue cards to Ga-yeon.
“From now on, I will take over as the host, and the remaining games will be decided by Mayeon High.”
The Mayeon High members cheered in unison.
Although this was a ‘recreation’ under the guise of a ‘Disciplinary Committee battle,’ Ahsung High ultimately organized the events.
The suspicion that the games might be increasingly favorable to Ahsung High as they progressed was shared among Mayeon High members.
The announcement that their Vice-Leader would decide the game events was naturally welcomed.
In such a place where the original purpose of fun had faded and only the intention to determine superiority remained, the change of host mattered little.
The original host, feeling regretful that he could not continue, stepped down from the stage.
Now, only Mayeon High’s Vice-Leader, Shin Ga-yeon, remained on stage.
“There are two games left. Mayeon High will decide both. The next game is… a mental arithmetic competition. Please send out your best representatives for mental arithmetic.”
A mental arithmetic competition.
It was easy to create problems on the spot and highly fair.
The firm resolve of Mayeon High to allow no unfair advantage for Ahsung High was clear to the Disciplinary Committee members.
“A mental arithmetic competition, huh? Good. I trust you, Treasurer!”
Jae-ho sent out his treasurer.
“Park Minhyuk, come back. Go, Yoo Doha!”
“Hmph.”
Woo-jin also sent out his treasurer.
Yoo Doha, the treasurer of Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee, snorted and went up to the stage.
Thus, the treasurers of each school stood side by side on the stage.
“Go, Jin-du! Go, Jin-du!”
“Our genius of Mayeon High!”
“Master of mental arithmetic!”
Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee cheered loudly.
Mayeon High’s treasurer, Goo Jin-du.
He was a math genius who had swept math competitions since childhood and was a master of mental arithmetic with exceptional cognitive skills.
That’s why Mayeon High chose mental arithmetic as the game event, trusting in Jin-du.
“I will present the problems and manage the proceedings.”
Ga-yeon approached the Ahsung High Disciplinary Committee member sitting by the computer and began creating calculation problems with him.
Meanwhile, Jin-du looked at Doha.
‘Yoo Doha…. I knew you’d be here, but to meet like this…’
Jin-du knew Yoo Doha.
‘Ever since we were young, I always wanted to beat you.’
Once, when Yoo Doha participated in a math competition, she took first place, surpassing Jin-du.
It was the sudden rise of a supernova.
For Jin-du, who thought he was unmatched among his peers in mathematics, it was a shocking experience.
He poured all his energy into studying, determined to beat Doha.
But Doha never entered another competition.
Thus, Jin-du had been chasing Doha’s shadow, harboring a desire to surpass her.
Then last year,
He heard that Doha had become the treasurer of the Disciplinary Committee.
Why would such a genius become a club treasurer?
Did she give up on the path of mathematics?
With those questions, Jin-du decided to become the treasurer of Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee.
He wanted to understand why the genius Yoo Doha chose that path.
“Are you the treasurer of Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee?”
Goo Jin-du spoke to Doha.
To Doha, Jin-du would be a stranger.
That’s why he spoke to her that way.
“What of it?”
“Pitiful…”
“What did you say?”
In their private conversation, Doha’s eyes narrowed.
“As a committee member, you’re stuck serving someone far inferior to Vice-Leader Oh Baek-seo. An idiot who fell for a trivial provocateur’s taunt. I wouldn’t be able to stay under someone like that. The leader should be someone worthy of respect.”
Jin-du smiled insincerely.
“In that regard, our Leader Lee Jae-ho is a superior person. He’s a genius in the fifth rank and excels in combat. A leader worthy of my respect, unlike a certain deficient Disciplinary Committee.”
Jin-du was a follower of Lee Jae-ho.
He supported Jae-ho’s belief in gaining an upper hand over Ahsung High through strength.
Moreover, Jin-du had been looking forward to competing with Yoo Doha again.
So, he belittled Ahsung High’s leader and provoked Doha as much as he could.
In other words, it was an attempt at psychological dominance.
However,
“Ha! How childish.”
“What?”
It didn’t work on Doha.
She grinned, showing her white teeth.
“I remember you, Goo Jin-du…. Weren’t you once called a math genius?”
“…So what?”
Jin-du felt a brief gratitude that Doha remembered him, but it was short-lived.
“It was laughable. At best, you were treated as a talented fool.”
“What?”
“A wise person bows as they grow taller. You, on the other hand, have become an arrogant fool.”
Doha’s arrogant laughter left Jin-du stunned.
His face darkened as he glared at her.
“…Are you confident? Confident you can beat me.”
“Hmph.”
Doha answered with a snort, as if it was obvious.
Soon, Ga-yeon spoke into the microphone.
“All the problems are ready. When the problem appears on the screen, press the buzzer and give your answer. The first person to solve the problem gets the point.”
Ga-yeon activated the recording function on her smartphone to verify the answers.
“Here comes the first problem.”
The white screen on the stage filled with numbers.
“What is the answer to the following multiplication?”
Buzz!
“162,726,355,641,251,339,887,408.”
“…!?”
As soon as the problem appeared on the screen, the buzzer was pressed, and the answer was immediately recited.
At such an unbelievable speed, all the committee members, including Goo Jin-du, were astonished.
The one who got the correct answer was Yoo Doha, the treasurer of Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee.
‘I haven’t even finished reading the problem…?’
Jin-du could perform mental arithmetic on long strings of numbers within four seconds.
However, Yoo Doha’s mental arithmetic speed was on another level.
“What is the answer to the next problem!?”
Buzz!
“63,535,204,842,302,171,750,112,507,137,882.”
“Next problem!”
Buzz!
“729,217,309,281,496,226,404,840,339,658,521,620,358.”
“The answer to the next multiplication problem…?”
Buzz!
Buzz!
Buzz!
With each problem that appeared, Doha immediately pressed the buzzer and nonchalantly recited the answers.
Due to the high numerical values, she quickly read the numbers like, “One six two seven two six three five five…”
After verifying with a computer calculator, all the numbers Doha recited were correct.
Just to be sure, the host, Ga-yeon, even played back the recordings on the device to confirm. Each time, the amazement only grew.
Thus, ten problems ended in an instant.
Mayeon High’s Goo Jin-du: 0 points
Ahsung High’s Yoo Doha: 10 points
It was a decisive victory for Yoo Doha.
“…Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee treasurer, Yoo Doha, wins. This ties the score between Mayeon High and Ahsung High.”
The members of Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee, who had been confident of victory, were all in shock.
Jae-ho and even Vice-Leader Ga-yeon were no exception.
“Wow!!”
“Amazing!
“Senior Doha, you’re incredible!”

chapters.title: Chapter 14.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 14 (Continued)
The Ahsung High Disciplinary Committee erupted in cheers.
Doha, having secured the victory, snorted arrogantly.
“How could anyone do such quick mental arithmetic…?”
“This is basic mental arithmetic.”
Jin-du was in disbelief.
He had always thought no one in Academy City could match his mental arithmetic skills.
Even if it was Yoo Doha, the only person who had ever beaten him, it seemed impossible.
An unexpected sense of helplessness began to overwhelm Jin-du, making his body tremble.
In a final effort, Jin-du decided to ask,
“…Do you remember? When you participated in the math competition.”
“What, you knew me? So what?”
“Why did you stop after just one participation?”
“That? Well, just because….”
Doha winked her right eye and dug into her right ear with her pinky finger.
“It was boring.”
“……!”
That one sentence stirred intense feelings of doubt within Jin-du.
The stage he had taken so seriously was just a brief amusement for Doha.
Jin-du couldn’t say another word.
He just lowered his head, shaking with self-doubt.
Doha observed Jin-du for a moment before speaking.
“Hey.”
“?”
Her voice was serious.
“Leader Ahn Woo-jin didn’t become our school’s Disciplinary Committee Leader for nothing.”
Suddenly, a memory surfaced in Doha’s mind.
Last year, when Yoo Doha was a first-year student.
During a survival test in a forest on the outskirts of Academy City, a dangerous incident
occurred involving a group of monsters due to a security breach in the test site.
Students, driven into a panic by the monster attack, were unable to evacuate.
At that time, Ahn Woo-jin hid the students in a nearby temporary shelter, locked the door, and fought the monsters to buy time.
─ “You shall not pass here.”
Despite having his flesh torn by strong jaws and coughing up blood from heavy blows, Woo-jin fought the monsters, roaring at them.
Senior members of the Disciplinary Committee and one of the few teachers in Academy City arrived just in time to help Woo-jin defeat the monster horde.
Afterward, despite bleeding heavily, Woo-jin casually checked on the students’ safety first.
Doha couldn’t understand Woo-jin no matter how much she thought about it.
How could he risk his life and fight such a lonely battle to protect the students?
So she asked.
Why did he fight so desperately?
Doha regretted asking right away.
Even she thought it was a ridiculous question. It was especially inappropriate to ask such a question to her savior.
But Woo-jin responded nonchalantly, as if it were the most obvious thing.
─ “I’m the Disciplinary Committee Leader.”
Doha could never forget Woo-jin from that day.
She would never forget him for the rest of her life.
“He became the leader because he deserves it. If you don’t understand, at least keep your mouth shut.”
“…….”
“A fool who can’t even do proper mental arithmetic.”
With a blunt insult, Doha stepped off the stage.
* * *
‘As expected of our treasurer!’
Thank you!
I wasn’t sure about her personality or intelligence, but I trusted her mental arithmetic abilities.
With this, Ahsung High and Mayeon High were tied.
“Tsk….”
Jae-ho clicked his tongue.
It seemed he was quite upset after witnessing the overwhelming defeat of Mayeon High’s pride.
“The next game is the last one. What will it be?”
“…You’ll see.”
Jae-ho’s tone was cryptic, suggesting he had something special in mind for the final game.
Jae-ho responded, his eyes filled with resentment as he stared at the stage.
“Now, for the final game. The strongest person with enhanced physical strength through magic. In other words, the person with the most power. Please step forward.”
“I’ll go.”
Unable to bear it any longer, Jae-ho decided to step up himself.
There was no more room to retreat.
Jae-ho looked at me.
“How about you join, Leader Ahn Woo-jin?”
“What?”
“We should have a proper match between us.”
I see.
He wanted the final game to be a showdown between the leaders.
‘…Why me?’
I didn’t want to.
If I lost, it would be humiliating.
The reason I could plan a competition under the guise of recreation was that my subordinates were incredibly capable.
Memory genius Park Minhyuk, mental arithmetic prodigy Yoo Doha, all-rounder Oh Baek-seo….
With them around, I was confident we wouldn’t lose.
But imagine a duel between the leaders.
What if I lost after my team had performed so well?
It would dramatically tarnish my honor as the Disciplinary Committee Leader and severely damage my reputation…!
Those who already doubted my capabilities would grow even more skeptical.
Moreover, the score between Ahsung High and Mayeon High was tied.
This was the highlight, the final game.
Considering that this match would conclude the pride battle between the two committees, the pressure was immense.
Therefore,
‘It would be best to avoid this challenge….’
“Leader…!”
“Leader, you’re not backing out, are you? We’ve done our part, now it’s your turn.”
Secretary Minhyuk and Treasurer Doha urged me.
“Leader?”
Perhaps due to my hesitation, even Baek-seo looked at me with questioning eyes.
‘Ah….’
Only then did I realize.
‘Now that I think about it, it was secretary versus secretary and treasurer versus treasurer, wasn’t it?’
The lineup was such that now, the other leader wanted to step up, and if I didn’t respond…
‘I can’t avoid this…!’
A leader of Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee couldn’t afford to act cowardly.
“Hmm…, I suppose I should.”
In the end, I had to pretend to be nonchalant as I stood up.
A cold sweat dripped down my cheek.
‘This is bad….’
If I had known it would come to this, I wouldn’t have prepared this recreation….
“Leader, fight on…!”
“If you lose, I won’t let you off, Leader.”
With the cheers from the secretary and the treasurer, I headed to the stage with Vice-Leader Oh Baek-seo.
‘The opponent is a genius who has reached the fifth rank, one of Mayeon High’s top fighters….’
He would have the upper hand in most games.
It was truly worrisome.
My steps felt heavy.
I felt like my legs might give out at any moment.
As I walked, the cheers from the committee members filled my ears.
“Leader, Vice-Leader!”
“You look great…!”
“Please defeat Mayeon High!”
Maintaining a cold exterior, I listened to their cheers.
I was acutely aware that every member of the Disciplinary Committee, except for those on duty, was present.
I wanted to close my eyes tightly.
But I barely resisted the urge, inwardly praying with all my heart.
‘I can’t lose, I can’t lose, I can’t lose…! I must win…! Please, let me win…!’
I pleaded.
If there’s any divine entity, please hear my prayer. Please….
‘I can’t lose. Think of this as a cliff. If I fall, it’s over. Finished…!’
“Leader.”
In the midst of hypnotizing myself, Baek-seo’s voice caught my attention.
“What?”
I tried to maintain a calm demeanor as I looked at Baek-seo.
“You know I serve you, right?”
“?”
Why bring that up now?
“You can win. Let’s defeat their leader. If you win, I’ll give you a reward.”
Baek-seo smiled kindly.
What could I say….
The Vice-Leader always seemed to say what I needed to hear at the right moment.
Almost as if he could read my mind.
‘Surely that can’t be the case.’
Did I let something slip?
No… I was keeping a poker face, so that couldn’t be it.
It must just be encouragement from her as the Vice-Leader.
A reward, huh.
“By the way, can I ask what the reward is in advance?”
“Well…, maybe the stockings I’m wearing now.”
“!”
My eyes instinctively moved towards Baek-seo’s legs, covered in black stockings.
I quickly regained control of my eyes and brought them back to their original position.
“Don’t joke like that. Especially as a Disciplinary Committee member.”
I gave her a stern look.
“Haha, sorry.”
Baek-seo laughed softly, covering her mouth with a lightly clenched fist.
I realized once again, I could never let my guard down around her.
‘…But I feel a bit better.’
Maybe it was the nature of the joke.
Perhaps it acted as a shock therapy, relieving some of my tension.
Baek-seo and I got on the stage.
Jae-ho stood on the opposite side.
“The leaders of each Disciplinary Committee have stepped forward.”
The announcement came, signaling the beginning of the final showdown between Ahsung High and Mayeon High.
The host, Ga-yeon, stood next to Jae-ho as she spoke.
Meanwhile, I glared at her, steeling my resolve.
‘Say whatever you want. If it seems even slightly unfair, I’ll protest immediately…!’
In fact, even if the game was fair, if it seemed disadvantageous to me, I planned to find a reason to protest. My brain was already working at full capacity for this.
“Vice-Leader, quickly announce the next game.”
Jae-ho adjusted his glasses, never taking his eyes off me.
“Yes, the next game is….”
The Disciplinary Committee members brought a sturdy table and two chairs, placing them between Jae-ho and me.
“Arm wrestling. However, magic reinforcement is allowed.”
Arm wrestling?
The committee members started murmuring among themselves.
A smile spread across Jae-ho’s face.
“This should be interesting.”
He seemed pleased with the choice of the game.
Now that I thought about it, didn’t he call for the strongest person earlier? And the game turned out to be arm wrestling….
‘This seems… too fair.’
There appeared to be no room for objections.
Arm wrestling.
A very straightforward competition to determine who was stronger.
And in arm wrestling, I felt I had a fair chance.
“In this event, the use of magic is permitted. Only up to body reinforcement. So, this arm wrestling match will not only test physical strength but also magic ability.”
In other words, it was a test of which side’s abilities were superior.
“Leaders, please step up to the table.”
* * *
“Hmph.”
Jae-ho adjusted his glasses and smiled, but internally, he was sweating bullets.
‘If I lose, it’s all over…! I absolutely can’t lose!’
With both Disciplinary Committees from Ahsung High and Mayeon High watching.
The secretary and treasurer had already lost, damaging Mayeon High’s pride.
The score was tied, and this was the final match.
Feeling the pressure, Jae-ho had decided to step up himself.
‘I spoke out of anger and called out Ahn Woo-jin…! I should have held back!’
Jae-ho clenched his fist, regretting his impulsive decision.
He felt he had no choice but to challenge Woo-jin to a leader versus leader match.
However, he quickly adjusted his thoughts.
‘No, those determined eyes and expression… He would have stepped up even if I hadn’t called him…!’
A leader versus leader match would have happened regardless.
The immense pressure bore down on Jae-ho.
If he lost here….
Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee’s pride would be shattered, and they would be seen as inferior to Ahsung High.
Moreover, after watching the sparring video between Woo-jin and the Sindo-rim Swordmaster, Jae-ho held a high opinion of Woo-jin.
The earlier disparaging remarks were merely to provoke him as part of their psychological warfare.
That’s why he had backed off when Baek-seo intervened.
‘Damn, why does this guy have such an imposing aura!? He looks unnecessarily strong…!’
From the moment he first met Woo-jin, Jae-ho had seen no sign of weakness.
Woo-jin was calm and stern.
Because of this, an inexplicable sense of intimidation radiated from Woo-jin.
Jae-ho swallowed dryly.
Suddenly, his mind was flooded with various anxious thoughts.
‘Did you hear? Our school’s leader lost to Ahsung High’s leader!’
‘They arm-wrestled with magic reinforcement, I heard.’
‘The secretary and treasurer got defeated too, at their own games.’
‘So what? Our Disciplinary Committee is inferior to Ahsung High’s?’
‘Is our Disciplinary Committee that weak?’
‘Pathetic.’
He imagined the students gossiping, the reputation of Mayeon High’s Disciplinary Committee plummeting, and screamed internally.
‘Calm down, Lee Jae-ho…! Your honor as Mayeon High’s leader is on the line here. You must win, even if it means risking everything…!’
Jae-ho felt extreme tension.
A slight lapse in concentration, and his legs might give out.
“Bring it on, Leader Ahn Woo-jin. Let’s see who’s superior here!”
“That’s exactly what I want.”
Jae-ho smirked confidently, while Woo-jin maintained a cold demeanor, lightly lowering his head and holding the brim of his cap.
The two men placed their elbows on the table and clasped hands.
And then.
‘Please let me win…!’
‘Please don’t let me lose, please…!’
Both men earnestly prayed inwardly.

chapters.title: Chapter 15.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 15 – Rule 8. The Leader Maintains Dignity Even at Exchange Meetings (4)
In Academy City, famous strong individuals are given appropriate ‘nicknames.’
A prime example is Oh Baek-seo, the military representative and strongest person at Ahsung High School, a peerless genius. Her nickname is ‘Daehan Butterfly.’
Mayeon High School is no exception. Separate from the student council president who represents the school’s military strength, the Disciplinary Committee Leader, Lee Jae-ho, also has a nickname. His is ‘Rock Cloud General’.
Ahn Woo-jin was feeling dizzy at the thought of arm-wrestling against someone with a nickname. However, he couldn’t back down.
“The match will be decided in a single round.”
The host, Shin Ga-yeon, placed both her hands over the clasped hands of Ahn Woo-jin and Lee Jae-ho.
“If you attempt any technique other than physical enhancement through magical power, such as a ‘Magic Formula,’ you will be immediately disqualified. Please keep this in mind.”
A magic formula refers to techniques derived from developing one’s unique abilities. This had nothing to do with Woo-jin, who had no unique abilities.
“The table is made of the hardest known magic stone, reinforced with magical coating, so don’t worry about it breaking unless you intend to destroy it.”
Woo-jin and Jae-ho flinched.
Their plan to discreetly break the table to nullify the match if they thought they were going to lose was shattered.
“That doesn’t matter! Who cares about the table; it won’t affect our match!”
“Even if the table broke, the match would continue.”
Since the table wasn’t going to break, the two, showing off a gladiator’s mindset, bluffed.
“You both have strong competitive spirits.”
Host Ga-yeon nodded, adjusting her glasses.
Jae-ho, grinding his teeth, shouted impatiently.
“Hurry up and start the match, vice leader!”
There was no retreat. Only moving forward remained.
“It’s a ‘match,’ sir, not a ‘duel.’”
“Whatever…!”
“Alright then, get ready.”
Woo-jin and Jae-ho focused on their clasped hands.
Their honor as disciplinary committee leaders was at stake.
“Begin!”
As soon as Ga-yeon shouted and removed her hands, the veins on Woo-jin and Jae-ho’s arms bulged.
Thud! They poured their magical power into strengthening their bodies, putting all their strength into their arms.
“Ugh…!”
“Argh…!”
The two let out grunts as the intense struggle for dominance began.
Rumble…!
The ground began to shake.
“What’s happening, an earthquake?”
“It feels like the air is trembling….”
The students murmured.
Rumble…!
The table, dishes, and glassware began to tremble and then shatter in succession, starting from the arm-wrestling match.
Clang!
“Ah!”
“Did the glass break!?”
“The dishes too!?”
Glassware and dishes around the two disciplinary committee leaders shattered like dominoes.
“Argh…!”
“Ugh…!”
Woo-jin and Jae-ho, eyes wide open, continued their power struggle.
Rumble! The magical power they poured into their bodies clashed violently, creating powerful shockwaves and a fierce wind. Their hair and clothes fluttered incessantly like flags in a storm.
Stage props toppled over, their remnants swept away by the magical shockwaves from the arm-wrestling match.
Amidst the chaos, Woo-jin and Jae-ho continued to arm-wrestle with all their might.
“Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee Leader isn’t being pushed back at all!”
“Our leader isn’t losing against the Rock Cloud General!”
“Amazing….”
The students were left speechless.
‘What is this guy!? He’s not budging at all…!?’
Jae-ho was astounded by Woo-jin’s unyielding arm. The collision of magical power was equally intense. Despite the clash, Woo-jin wasn’t being pushed back at all.
The arm strength and density of magical power. This was hardly something one would expect from someone at the fourth Level.
Did he deceive about his Level? No.
Those with unique abilities can instinctively identify others with unique abilities, confirming it later when they don’t use their abilities.
However, Woo-jin gave off not even a trace of that feeling. This man certainly hadn’t reached the fifth Level.
‘How can this be the fourth Level…!?’
Jae-ho recalled Woo-jin’s match against Shindo-rim.
Woo-jin’s mastery of magical power was at an artistic Level. Particularly, condensing lightning magic into a shockwave was an extraordinary technique. In such refined skill, Jae-ho judged Woo-jin to be superior.
However, in terms of the density or quantity of magical power, Jae-ho believed he was superior. Generally, the higher the Level, the more superior the magical power. The gap of even one Level is enormous.
But Woo-jin was different. He seemed to mock that common sense.
How could his magical power be so exceptional that he didn’t falter against someone a Level higher? Jae-ho was in utter disbelief.
‘One thing is certain…!’
Jae-ho’s initial doubt about Woo-jin transformed into certainty.
‘This guy isn’t just any strong fourth-Level. He’s a monster in the making…!’
Suddenly, images of heroes from fairy tales came to Jae-ho’s mind.
The historical heroes who led the Golden Ram Hunt.
The ‘Argonauts,’ who reached the eighth Tier among humans.
Jae-ho liked the history of the Argonauts and memorized their chronicles in detail.
So he knew. The Argonauts took a very long time to reach the fifth Level, but they had already distinguished themselves at the fourth Level.
The more exceptional the unique ability, the more time and effort it took to awaken that ability. The conditions for achievement were stringent.
For someone with overwhelming talent like Oh Baek-seo, the required time and effort were significantly reduced. However, Woo-jin didn’t seem any less talented than Baek-seo.
If Woo-jin was this capable at the fourth Level, there was a high possibility he had talent surpassing even Baek-seo.
‘This guy will reach the fifth Level soon.’
Having achieved this much at the fourth Level, Woo-jin’s talent would undoubtedly break through the barrier to the fifth Level.
‘If this guy is of Argonaut caliber….’
A hero’s rank.
Woo-jin might become a titan who could turn Academy City upside down.
Rumble!
“The ground…!”
“Everyone, get away!”
As the magical power waves spread in all directions, the ground began to crumble. The disciplinary committee members all ran away.
Crash! As the stage floor shattered and sank, Woo-jin and Jae-ho were startled but quickly composed themselves and continued their arm-wrestling.
Boom!
The aftermath of the arm-wrestling caused a storm, scattering the debris of the stage floor everywhere. Before long, the banquet hall was left with only Woo-jin and Jae-ho, who were fiercely arm-wrestling, and their vice-leader.
“Grrr!”
Jae-ho’s arm started to move backward.
‘No, this can’t happen…!’
Jae-ho strained his muscles, veins bulging in his neck.
“Ugh…!”
Slowly, their arms returned to the center of the table.
Crack!
“Ugh…!”
Magical power waves continued to crash around them, shaking the air. Baek-seo and Ga-yeon, who were nearby, had to draw their weapons and take defensive stances to withstand the magical impact.
“Incredible….”
