I needed to stop thinking and rest for a while.
As the water boiled vigorously, I turned off the burner and headed towards the shower to ask when she would be finished.
The sound of water grew louder.
“Leader?”
Before I could speak, I heard her voice. It echoed in the shower.
“Are you here to peek?”
“What?”
What nonsense.
“Hm, I could pretend I didn’t see anything.”
Her gentle yet playful voice made me feel as if my fatigue was slightly melting away. It was as if her voice had a healing effect.
Maybe I was releasing dopamine.
KkIt wasn’t strange.
Hearing Baek-seo’s voice usually made me feel good.
A smile formed on my lips.
“As if I came here to do that.”
“Gasp.”
An unnatural exclamation.
“What?”
“Then, should we… shower together?”
An unsteady voice, naturally laced with mischief.
“Huh.”
A small exclamation escaped me, caught off guard by the absurdity of it all.
The temptation to close my eyes and go along with the joke was strong, but I held back.
We weren’t dating or even sure of each other’s feelings, so seriously considering it could ruin our relationship. I had to respect the trust she had in me.
Besides, Baek-seo had gone through a lot today and looked exhausted. She was likely trying to lighten the mood. I had to reciprocate her effort.
“…Why aren’t you answering?”
“?”
Ah.
I was lost in thought for a moment, creating a delay.
She might have found it suspicious.
“No, I was just thinking….”
“Were you seriously considering it? You pervert, our leader.”
“Pervert…!”
Even jokingly being called a pervert was unacceptable.
I was the Disciplinary Committee Leader. I had to protect my image rigidly.
“Don’t push me into something strange….”
From inside the shower, I heard Baek-seo’s soft laugh, “Huhu.”
“I’m planning to make ramen for when you’re done. How much longer do you need?”
“About ten more minutes.”
“Got it. Towels are on the shelf, so make sure you grab one.”
“Thanks.”
I returned to the kitchen.
***
The shower was filled with a dense mist.
Naked, Baek-seo stood under the stream of water, running her fingers through her hair. She had just finished her playful conversation with Woo-jin.
She wiped the steam from the mirror with her hand, revealing her face. Her expression was… not great.
“……”
Kim Dalbi.
There was something she needed to discuss with her.
They finally met today but couldn’t talk.
Given the circumstances, it was understandable.
Once Dalbi had targeted Woo-jin, Baek-seo could only think of brandishing her knife. Talking could come after finding and crushing Dalbi.
The problem lay elsewhere.
Baek-seo suspected the Head Principal was involved in targeting Woo-jin.
A villain had aimed for Woo-jin in the Federal Council’s territory, and Dalbi had also intervened. To Baek-seo, it was a natural conclusion.
Why would the Head Principal target Woo-jin?
The exact reason was unclear.
One thing was certain: Woo-jin could be in danger again.
There was no guarantee that today’s ambush wouldn’t be repeated.
If possible, she considered staying with Woo-jin until the Head Principal issue was resolved.
“…It’s okay.”
Thinking of Dalbi and the Head Principal, Baek-seo whispered to herself.
“I’ll protect him.”
She had already discarded her life once.
There was nothing better than risking her life to protect someone she cared about.
“I’ll protect him….”
Baek-seo looked down at her hands.
Under the bright shower light, her calloused, pale hands were visible.
Whenever she looked at them, her vision would shift to a dark, asphalt road at midnight, and her hands would appear covered in blood.
Then in a secluded alley.
Then in a sealed basement.
Then on a rainy rooftop.
Her hands were always soaked in blood in front of corpses.
The bright red blood in her memory had faded over time, turning gray.
Baek-seo hated that sight.
It felt like her humanity was fading away.
The price of using her unique ability, Wun-sa.
It intensely revived her trauma.
This was bearable.
The only thing that intensified was the persistent sense of dread, which she could endure.
Severe use of her unique ability would drag out the trauma and erode her mind. She wasn’t confident she could withstand that.
But it was okay.
She only needed to protect Woo-jin.
That thought alone sustained her.
As her hands trembled uncontrollably, she clenched her fists tightly, suppressing the memories that floated to the surface.
“Haa.”
She took a deep breath, struggling to calm her emotions.
Finally, she finished her shower and changed into her clothes.
His white dress shirt.
His underwear.
The shirt’s length covered her groin area, exposing her pale legs. It gave the impression that she wasn’t wearing anything below.
“Somehow, this feels embarrassing….”
There was a reason she chose the white dress shirt.
A man’s dream.
A girl he likes wearing his dress shirt.
She had learned this from the internet beforehand.
So, she chose the white dress shirt to look nice for Woo-jin.
But now, seeing herself in the mirror made her blush.
“……?”
The fragrant smell caught her attention.
The familiar scent of fabric softener.
It hit her that all the clothes she was wearing belonged to Woo-jin.
“…Sss.”
She brought the sleeve to her nose and closed her eyes, savoring the scent.
The smell she always associated with Woo-jin filled her senses, replacing the bloody memories with a cozy feeling.
Just then, the sound of boiling ramen filled the air. Baek-seo finished her light makeup and headed to the kitchen.
Woo-jin was lost in thought the moment he saw her.

chapters.title: Chapter 32.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 32 – Rule 14. The Leader Cares for Their Comrades (2)
Bubble, bubble.
‘This looks great.’
The ramen was cooked to perfection, mouth-watering from every angle.I set out some properly fermented kimchi and meat side dishes, placing a trivet in the center of the table.
The ramen pot went on the trivet. The perfectly cooked egg and chewy noodles looked incredibly appetizing. I must have been really hungry.
“Baek-seo, it’s ready. After seventeen years of eating ramen, this is my masterpiece.”
“Wow… It looks delicious,”
Baek-seo murmured in admiration as she made her way to the table. Her gentle voice made even her exclamations sound serene.
The familiar scent of shampoo and body lotion reached me.
I turned my head to look.“Come on, eat….” My words cut off abruptly.
‘Ugh…!’
Unbelievable.
Even though I had anticipated and prepared myself for this, the sight before me was more overwhelming than I had imagined.
Her hair was still wet from the shower, and she wore only my white dress shirt. Below the shirt’s hem, her pale, shapely legs were exposed. It was an undeniably alluring sight.
‘My heart…!’
A sudden shock hit my heart.
I bit my tongue to control my expression, but the intermittent trembling of my body was hard to hide.
“Can you give me an apron? I don’t want to splash anything on this.”
“Here you go.”
“…Why are you handing it to me so cautiously?”
Avoiding eye contact and extending my arm to give her the apron must have looked strange.
Baek-seo tilted her head and silently laughed. It seemed like a knowing smile.
We sat across from each other at the table and served ourselves ramen.
After all the exhausting events and head-splitting worries, I had forgotten how hungry I was. This ramen tasted almost as good as the ramen I ate during night marches in my previous life as a soldier.
I stole a glance at Baek-seo. She tucked a strand of hair behind her ear and used her chopsticks to pick up some kimchi and noodles together. She looked adorable.
‘If I get married, will I see this every day?’
A moment ago, I was consumed with grim thoughts, but now, a wave of happiness washed over me.
When I’m struggling, I look at Oh Baek-seo.
Just seeing her is healing.
But I couldn’t just indulge in her beauty without a care.
I continued eating ramen and thinking.
‘…She doesn’t know about the relationship between the Head Principal and Dalbi.’
Without my game knowledge, various clues, and the hobgoblin’s message, I wouldn’t have been certain that the Head Principal should be considered a target.
‘For now, it’s better if I’m the only one who knows. It’s hard to explain, and it would just burden her. I’d prefer if she could rest peacefully for now.’
I glanced at Baek-seo’s hands. Though her trembling had subsided, I couldn’t help but worry about her.
“Leader, you cook ramen well,”
Baek-seo suddenly spoke.
“I’ve eaten it often enough. This is basic.”
“You could be called a ramen master.”
“What’s with the way you talk? Anyway, if you want more, just let me know anytime.”
“You’re a perceptive little rookie, aren’t you?”
Baek-seo joked, smiling gently. Then, while eating ramen, she asked an unexpected question.
“By the way, has anyone else visited your house besides me?”
“?”
What kind of question was that?
Of course, there had been.
‘Other than Dalbi visiting frequently when we were kids, no one.’
I hadn’t invited anyone else over.
“Not since a friend came over in the past. Why?”
“…It’s nothing. Just curious.”
Baek-seo shook her head.
Was she worried someone might drop by in the middle of the night?
‘That’s understandable.’
If a friend suddenly showed up and saw Baek-seo and me together, how would they react?
Well, there was nothing to worry about.
“I see.”
We dropped the subject and continued eating ramen.
Every time Baek-seo entered my sight, I couldn’t help but focus on her outfit.
‘She looks beautiful….’
It was impressive.
The mind is heavily influenced by the body. Given my youthful vigor, it was hard not to be stimulated by the sight of a beautiful woman wearing only my dress shirt.
Especially when the person in question was someone I liked.
The stimulation was so intense that I couldn’t stand up from the chair. I had to silently recite the national anthem to calm myself down.
After we finished eating the ramen, Baek-seo stood up.
“Thank you for the meal. I’ll do the dishes.”
“No, guests should rest. I’ll take care of it.”
“Really…? But why aren’t you getting up?”
“I just remembered something to think about. Go ahead and rest.”
Despite reciting the national anthem four times, it hadn’t had much effect. I must have lacked patriotic fervor in my past life.
Baek-seo watched me for a moment before giving a slightly awkward smile.
“Okay…. Next time, I’ll do it.”
Fortunately, she left the room.
‘That was close….’
In the end, I had to recite the Lord’s Prayer and the Heart Sutra to get through the crisis. Truly, the power of faith was great.
After finishing the dishes, I returned to find Baek-seo sitting on the sofa, scrolling through her smartphone.
I wanted to just pick her up and…!
“I’m going to shower.”
…With that impulsive thought, I quickly headed to the shower.
***
While Ahn Woo-jin was showering, Oh Baek-seo looked around his home. She found his middle school graduation album.
She carefully touched the picture of Woo-jin with short hair. It was a side of him she didn’t know.
“……”
Tonight, she planned to pretend to sleep until Woo-jin fell asleep, then stay awake and keep watch with White Wheel Sword by her side. She couldn’t be sure when a threat might come.
So, she kept White Wheel Sword close to her. Outwardly calm, she remained vigilant internally.

chapters.title: Chapter 32.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 32 (Continued)
She remembered something Woo-jin had said.
─ ‘Other than a friend coming over in the past, no one.’
No one had visited recently.
At least, it seemed to be a fact for Woo-jin.
Baek-seo recalled the white porridge from the day Woo-jin had the flu, not knowing who made it. Who could have prepared that and left it behind?
Especially in a residential area with many security robots, without Woo-jin noticing…?
Baek-seo operated her smartphone, deploying personal security drones she had prepared nearby to Woo-jin’s address. It was possible because she had obtained approval from the local security team.
“For now, I guess I’ll stay with Woo-jin….”
She murmured to herself.
It seemed best to stay by his side until she was sure of his safety.
Living with Woo-jin would be ideal, but that was obviously not feasible.
Aside from seeking his permission, she didn’t want to intrude on his privacy.
“So then….”
She might need to dip into her savings soon.
Eventually, Woo-jin came out of the shower, changed, and entered the living room.
“Baek-seo.”
Then.
“Want to watch a movie?”
“?”
An unexpected suggestion came from Woo-jin.
A short while later, with all the lights turned off, the two sat side by side on the sofa, covered with a blanket. Woo-jin started the movie.
“What movie is it?”
“A superhero movie. Have you seen it?”
“I haven’t seen this one. Let’s watch it.”
Though it was a sudden situation, Baek-seo realized that Woo-jin was trying to be considerate and remained quietly appreciative.
The TV started playing a superhero movie, a relic of the old human culture.
A genius inventor in an iron suit flying through the sky, a man in tights with spider-like abilities, a blue-suited man with a shield—various heroes fighting evil villains with their skills.
Although it was an old movie made before the mystical power of ‘magic’ appeared in the world, the city in the movie was not much different from present-day Neo Seoul.
According to history, humanity’s culture and technology regressed while billions perished. Thus, it made sense that the environment now was similar to the past.
Woo-jin was engrossed in the movie. Oddly, his eyes reflected a sense of nostalgia. Baek-seo preferred watching Woo-jin’s expressions over the movie itself.
“Ah.”
Woo-jin suddenly gasped.
“What is it?”
“I forgot something important.”
Woo-jin brought over a large container of snacks and drinks, and they began sharing them.
“……”
Snuggled under a warm blanket, watching the movie together, Baek-seo felt a deep sense of contentment despite maintaining a state of vigilance.
Baek-seo subtly rubbed her forehead.
Her hand tremors had subsided, and the unwanted thoughts had faded. This improvement was likely due to the penalty of her unique ability, Wun-sa, easing over time, but the recovery speed was surprisingly quick.
As the movie approached its climax, Woo-jin’s eyes started drooping, his head nodding. He hadn’t fully recovered from his fatigue and was struggling to stay awake.
Baek-seo pretended not to notice and kept watching the movie silently.
“Baek-seo.”
“Yeah?”
Sensing he was about to fall asleep, Woo-jin spoke in a subdued voice.
“Recently, I set up new security drones. If anyone intrudes, an alarm will go off. So… I can escape if things get bad. Don’t worry too much.”
He was trying to reassure Baek-seo.
“Okay, I’ll keep that in mind.”
Baek-seo responded with a gentle smile.
When the movie ended and the credits started rolling, Baek-seo turned her head. Woo-jin was fast asleep, his head resting against the sofa.
“…Careless, Leader. What if someone attacks you?”
Baek-seo whispered playfully in a very soft voice.
She stood up, contemplating whether to lay him down, then carefully placed his head on her shoulder.
Ignoring her racing heart, she leaned her head against his.
Baek-seo closed her eyes slowly.
“You know everything….”
She said softly.
“Pretending not to know.”
They had already sensed each other’s feelings.
Considering everything they had shown each other, it wasn’t hard to guess.
However, Baek-seo was perceptive.
She had long realized Woo-jin was carrying significant burdens as the Disciplinary Committee Leader.
She didn’t know exactly what those burdens were, but she knew Woo-jin had no time to be distracted. She respected his dedication to his role.
Thus, Baek-seo had already resolved herself.
She would silently follow Woo-jin’s path.
Gradually integrating herself into his life until the day he could finally set down his burden as the leader, she would naturally reveal her feelings.
“…Good night.”
Baek-seo whispered, gently placing her hand over Woo-jin’s.
***
“Oh Baek-seo here. I’ve just moved in next door.”
“……?”
“Would you like some rice cakes for the housewarming?”
A new neighbor had suddenly appeared.

chapters.title: Chapter 33.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 33 – Rule 15. The Leader Has a Dedicated Weapon (1)
LKim Dalbi browsed photos of Ahsung High School’s disciplinary committee executives on her smartphone.
Leader: Ahn Woo-jin. Vice-Leader: Oh Baek-seo.
“…”
She already knew they were together. Dalbi often observed Woo-jin, wanting him to be safe.
Both were deeply connected to her childhood.
How they ended up entangled like this, she couldn’t fathom. The world felt cruel.Memories of New Yongsan Street resurfaced.
What remained most vivid wasn’t her confrontation with Woo-jin or her clash with Baek-seo. It was the image of the two strolling down the street, side by side.
That sight stabbed at her heart like needles.
Dalbi pressed her smartphone against her forehead, closed her eyes, and bowed her head.
A heavy silence enveloped her.
* * *
The outside was bustling with the sound of movers and robots carrying luggage.
At first, Woo-jin thought a new person had moved in next door, but then Oh Baek-seo greeted him directly. She explained that she’d discovered the vacancy next door and signed an automatic lease.
Some residential areas in Neo Seoul, like this one, were city-owned. You could sign a lease through an app and move in right away.
All you needed was money. And no entry ban.
“Why didn’t you tell me…?”
“Does it bother you?”
“Not really. Just thought you could have given me a heads-up.”
Baek-seo stroked her chin, humming in thought. Then, she spoke.
“… I’ve decided to stay close to the Head for the time being.”
Baek-seo went on to explain.
She had moved in next door because she was worried about him.
He was targeted by a bomber and clashed with Kim Dalbi. She wanted to be nearby, ready to intervene if anyone else targeted him.
He had no right to object.
It wasn’t illegal; she wasn’t intruding; he had no moral obligation to her, and strictly speaking, they weren’t even dating.
It was Baek-seo’s choice.
“I apologize, but please understand.”
“It’s nothing to apologize for…”
Still, this was… a little much.
‘This is overprotective.’
Was she his mother?
‘Well… it’s not like I mind having her around.’
Both in terms of security and daily life, having Baek-seo close by would be beneficial in many ways.
He offered to help her unpack, but Baek-seo firmly refused. She didn’t want to show him her private life.
For Baek-seo, who was always relaxed and generous, to refuse so directly meant she was dead serious about it. So, he didn’t push it.
‘Well, she can’t be completely perfect.’
Baek-seo must have a secret or two she didn’t want to share. Especially someone like her, known as Ms. Perfect, might have unique quirks.
‘…I’m curious.’
He wondered what it could be. Curiosity burned, but he suppressed it.
It was best to respect her privacy. Just like how he wouldn’t want anyone to find his hidden folder full of Brown-eared Bulbul videos.
“Head, want to have dinner together?”
From then on, as if it were natural, Baek-seo brought over side dishes or cooked at his place and they had meals together.
The next morning, too.
Baek-seo, wearing a pink apron, appeared at his door.
“I made too much food. Shall I pack you a lunch?”
“Uh… well, thanks.”
He ended up taking the lunchbox Baek-seo had prepared and headed to school with her.
“Let’s have dinner together at least once a week, okay?”
“Why?”
“I want to cook for you sometimes. You know I enjoy it.”
This was getting…
“Now that I think about it, I should probably get to know this neighborhood. Could you show me around later?”
“Is there anything to show? Like walking paths or good restaurants.”
“Yes, I like those.”
This was definitely…
“If you’re ever bored, just call me. I can at least be a listening ear.”
This was really…
‘This feels like dating… without actually dating.’
To be precise, it was a relationship that felt like a couple, but wasn’t.
It was too strange to be just friends, too ambiguous to be declared lovers. Somewhere in between.
‘It feels like we’re building a life together.’
Come to think of it… looking back, he realized something.
Starting with the egg mayo sandwich, the virus called Oh Baek-seo had gradually infiltrated his territory. And now, she had reached a point of no return.
He had a feeling that if she were to disappear, it would leave a gaping hole in his life. A hole that would be filled with a deep emptiness and loneliness.
‘I guess I should be grateful…?’
As he mentioned before, he was focused on fulfilling his duties as the Head of Discipline, and then confessing to Baek-seo.
Of course, he was anxious. Baek-seo could grow distant, or her heart could be captured by another man.
But Baek-seo’s recent actions, what could he call them? It felt like she was saying, ‘I’m ready to be with you.’
As if she knew his plan and was acting accordingly.
‘Am I overthinking it?’
Maybe he was getting ahead of himself. However.
‘…Still.’
Dangerously.
‘This is… happiness…!’
The stress from work, the pressure from future knowledge, all seemed to be neutralized by Baek-seo.

chapters.title: Chapter 33.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 33 (Continued)
He was overflowing with motivation.
“Thinking dirty thoughts again?”
“Don’t say weird things while we’re walking…”
He was innocent. He wasn’t thinking about anything inappropriate.
He was just pondering what to name their second child.
…
“Gasp! Head, you’re alive!”
“Isn’t that obvious…”
The Disciplinary Committee office.
Ha Yesong, upon seeing Woo-jin, exclaimed in surprise. She rushed towards him. He had expected this reaction, considering the chaos she caused on CocoTalk.
“Jtube and SNS are still going crazy! Catching a bomber, confronting the criminal Kim Dalbi…! It was a huge deal!”
“It was.”
The incident at New Yongsan Street had become a major topic. His heroism in catching the bomber and driving away Kim Dalbi was highlighted, adding tangible achievements to the Ahsung High Disciplinary Committee’s record.
Other districts might be different, but being in debt to the Federal Council meant bonus points for the school, whether they acknowledged it or not. Naturally, the Disciplinary Committee’s evaluation would improve.
“The Leader creates major incidents even on his day off! Is this also a quality of a good Leader?”
“Don’t make me sound like a jinx.”
“Hehe.”
Yesong giggled playfully and approached Oh Baek-seo, linking arms with her.
“Baek-seo, I’m so glad you’re safe!”
“Me too.”
As Baek-seo gently patted Yesong’s head with a kind smile, Yesong beamed.
“Head, I have so much I want to hear about today!”
“I can tell.”
“Let’s hear it over lunch! I’m looking forward to a lively story!”
“Ah, right, it’s lunchtime.”
It seemed Yesong had come during lunch break specifically to hear their story firsthand.
“I brought my lunch! Salad. I’m on a diet, hehe.”
‘You’ll be eating again soon.’
He had precognitive abilities, but they only worked on Ha Yesong.
“You two ordered delivery?”
“Let’s eat together. We have lunchboxes.”
“Wow…!”
Yesong gasped in admiration. Why?
“Not just Baek-seo’s, but the Leader’s lunchbox too. This is precious. I want to see it!”
Come to think of it, she was right.
He usually just grabbed bread and milk from the cafeteria for lunch.
They moved to a table and placed their lunchboxes down. As they opened their lids, a brilliant light seemed to emanate from them.
“!”
Neatly packed white rice. A perfect amount of black seaweed. Spotless rolled omelet, glistening stir-fried pork, egg-coated meatballs, fresh tomato slices, and green vegetables.
A perfectly ordinary yet perfect lunchbox world unfolded before his eyes.
He couldn’t help but smile. It was like a lunchbox lovingly prepared by a wife for her husband, filling him with a strange warmth. This was a feeling only a lunchbox could evoke.
“Head.”
Yesong narrowed her eyes, observing his lunchbox.
“Why is it the same as Baek-seo’s?”
A sharp question.
They had different lunchboxes, but the contents were identical, hence Yesong’s suspicion.
There was no need to hide it.
In fact, he felt a bit smug, wanting to show off his girlfriend’s skills. Was this what it felt like to boast about your significant other?
He felt a pang of guilt and doubt for having such thoughts when they weren’t even dating. He needed to control himself.
“Baek-seo prepared it. She made extra, so she made mine too.”
“Aha~. As expected of our angelic Baek-seo! Taking care of the Head’s nutritional balance too!”
Yesong nodded in understanding, not finding it strange at all. Baek-seo had such a kind image after all.
Baek-seo, with her usual gentle smile, responded.
“So!? What happened during the weekend!?”
Yesong swiftly changed the subject.
For a while, Woo-jin and Baek-seo recounted their experience at New Yongsan Street. They omitted the part about the Principal, of course.
Yesong listened intently, captivated by their dynamic storytelling.
* * *
“Leader, Baek-seo! It’s lunchtime!”
A few days later, at the Disciplinary Committee office.
Ha Yesong decided to have lunch with Ahn Woo-jin and Oh Baek-seo.
“I see Baek-seo packed lunch for the Head again today! I’m so jealous~.”
And a few days after that.
“Heehee, let’s have lunch together!”
As expected, Yesong joined Woo-jin and Baek-seo for their meal.
“Looks like Baek-seo made lunch again today…”
Yesong noticed something odd.
And the next day.
“Lunch time!”
Yesong witnessed it again.
“….”
As if it were the most natural thing, Woo-jin revealed the lunchbox Baek-seo had prepared.
And the day after that.
And a few days later, too.
‘What’s going on…?’
Yesong felt a strong sense of suspicion as she looked at Woo-jin’s lunchbox.
It wasn’t just occasional; it was strange for Baek-seo to prepare lunch this frequently.
‘I also heard rumors about the Leader and Baek-seo coming to school together…’
The source of the rumors were the Disciplinary Committee members.
They took turns patrolling the school gates every day, so they had witnessed the Leader and Vice-Leader arriving together.
Naturally, rumors began to spread amongst them that the Leader and Vice-Leader might be dating.
At first, Yesong brushed it off, thinking ‘no way’. However…
‘Packing lunch every day, coming to school together every day…’
A spark went off in her mind.
At this moment, the puzzle pieces clicked into place.
‘…They’re 200% a thing.’
Since when?
Yesong stared at Woo-jin and Baek-seo seriously. Baek-seo was looking at Woo-jin with a gentle smile.
“Our Head eats well, doesn’t he?”
“Stop treating me like a kid…”
“Hehe.”
Yesong finally sensed the strange atmosphere surrounding the two.
A bead of cold sweat trickled down Yesong’s cheek.
* * *
After the confrontation with Kim Dalbi, there were no further attacks from the Head Principal.
Despite their vigilance, they detected no suspicious activity.
Perhaps her earlier assessment was correct; the Head Principal had no reason to risk another attack. Or maybe something had happened to the Head Principal.
It was difficult to track her movements, as she rarely engaged in public activities that required her direct involvement.
In any case, he was grateful that she was underestimating him for now. He would make sure to return the favor when the opportunity arose.
And.
“Ready, Ahn?”
“Of course, Oh.”
Today was the momentous day he would finally receive his dedicated equipment.
Woo-jin headed to Deus Atelier in New Yongsan Street with Oh Baek-seo.

chapters.title: Chapter 34.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 34 – Rule 15. The Leader Has a Dedicated Weapon (2)
I inserted the platinum-grade access card into the slot.
[The platinum-grade equipment you ordered is ready for pickup. Please reply ‘Yes’ if you wish to receive it.]
The AI on the Deus Atelier screen spoke in a friendly tone.
“Yes.”
[Very well, I will guide you to the location. Please allow approximately 5 minutes for equipment retrieval.]
Oh Baek-seo and I moved to the room the AI guided us to and waited. After 5 minutes, a large case arrived in front of me on a rail.
*Shhh!*
The case opened with a hiss of heat.
[A three-section staff of lightning attribute, crafted with the highest quality, named ‘Iron Dragon Staff’ by our Deus Atelier.]
Inside the case was a three-section staff, perfectly straightened and secured with friction locks.
The exterior was exquisitely covered with the scales of a black ‘Ironclad Dragon’.
Grooves lined the precisely arranged magic circuits, resembling electronic circuitry.
The thickness was slightly thicker than my previous staff, and the length was a bit longer.
Inside the staff, ‘Lightningwing’ petals would be lined up. Lightningwing was a mystical flower that only bloomed in the heart of the Thunder God Beast’s territory, where lightning poured like rain. The petals fluttered like waves, greatly amplifying the power of lightning magic.
Most of the mileage was spent on the petals because of their high value.
Anyway.
‘Iron Dragon Staff…?’
I pondered, stroking my chin.
The name is pretty cool.
Iron and Dragon.
Wasn’t it a name that combined only cool elements?
Considering the exterior that clearly showed the Ironclad Dragon scales, it seemed like an appropriate name.
‘Originally, I was going to name it ‘Excellent Conversation Starter’.’
I had thought of that name because I didn’t want to give the equipment a cheesy name.
‘I stand corrected….’
Hearing the name ‘Iron Dragon Staff’ from the AI made my blood boil with excitement.
‘The name ‘Excellent Conversation Starter’ is cheesy, but it also lacks romance.’
It was a shameful thing that I, as a man, couldn’t tolerate.
Originally, cheesiness and romance were separated by a thin line.
Now that I had acquired my own personal weapon, it was only fitting to give it a cool name.
[If you don’t like the name, we can change it….]
“I like it. Iron Dragon Staff. It’s good.”
[I’m glad you like it.]
Let’s see.
I grabbed the Iron Dragon Staff.
‘Ah, this cool and heavy feeling….’
A strange sensation flowed from my palm throughout my entire body. It was as if the Iron Dragon Staff was judging whether I was worthy of being its owner.
Well, that was too romantic of an expression….
It was just ‘magic resistance’ kicking in.
The lower the magic compatibility with the equipment, the more severe the magic resistance.
As a result, it became difficult to operate magic through the equipment, and even caused pain. To use it, I would have to act pathetic.
However, my magical compatibility was top-notch.
The sensation the Iron Dragon Staff conveyed resonated within me like a soundboard, only aiding my magic circulation.
‘Thickness, length, durability, weight, grip. All satisfactory.’
As my magic flowed through the Iron Dragon Staff’s circuits and circulated throughout my body, I could sense how powerful a weapon this three-section staff was.
The AI said so.
That I would be able to use this three-section staff like an extension of my own body.
I think I knew why.
Because it fit perfectly in my hand, even though I hadn’t used it yet.
[Would you like to test the equipment?]
“Yes, please.”
[Activating the training dummy range. Please select the desired level of the dummy. Levels range from 1 to 10 and….]
“The sturdiest one, please.”
[Level 10 selected.]
*Creak!*
One of the walls went up, revealing a giant training dummy. Like in games, that dummy boasted a level of hardness that wouldn’t budge from normal attacks. Even if I fired a shotgun or a cannon, it would only leave a scratch.
*Woooosh!*
As the hologram image activated, the training dummy took on the form of a monster. It roared.
The hardness of the dummy according to its level was the same in all training grounds. This is because there cannot be any difference in the sandbags used to test newly forged equipment.
And Level 10 was a level that only those who were at least in the upper ranks of the 5th Tier and equipped with platinum-grade equipment could attempt.
‘Good.’
A level I wouldn’t have even looked at normally.
But the moment I held the Iron Dragon Staff, I was convinced that Level 10 was worth a try.
“I’ll be right back after hitting it once.”
“Sure. Fighting.”
Baek-seo smiled casually.
I approached the training dummy.
I activated the magic circuits. The magic gathered in my lower abdomen spread evenly throughout my body. I poured that magic into the Iron Dragon Staff.
*Bzzt!* With the sound of electricity flowing, blue-green magic circulated within the Iron Dragon Staff’s circuits.
‘Let’s go.’
*Whoosh!*
Kicking off the ground, I swung the Iron Dragon Staff towards the training dummy with all my might.
*Thud!!!*
*Crackle!!!*
An explosive roar.
Along with the heavy impact, multiple shockwaves of electricity engulfed the training dummy.
The amplified magic, thanks to the Iron Dragon Staff, was released powerfully. Ferocious lightning danced in the air, and a strong gust of wind momentarily sucked in the air.
*Crash!* The monster screamed and was driven straight into the wall. This was because the ankle of the training dummy, which was fixed to the ground, had been blown off.
*Zzzt.* The hologram flickered with static. Then, the form of the training dummy, hidden by the monster skin, was revealed. It was bent in half from a single blow.
“Wow….”
I heard Baek-seo’s exclamation of admiration behind me. It was the first time I had heard such a genuine exclamation from her.
I was just as surprised.
‘That was crazy….’
How much was my magic amplified with that blow?
I couldn’t tell.
‘…As expected, gear makes all the difference.’
Realizing the immutable truth once again, I looked down at the black three-section staff, named the Iron Dragon Staff.
Made of Ironclad Dragon scales, it continuously emitted blue-green electricity along its straight magic circuits. As if leaving an afterglow.
‘This is sick.’
The corners of my lips curled up.
My heart began to flutter involuntarily.
“Thank you. I’ll put it to good use.”
[You’re welcome. Have a good day.]
I wanted to get it enhanced right away, but I couldn’t because I didn’t have any platinum mileage left.

chapters.title: Chapter 34.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 34 (Continued)
The Federal Council had sent an official letter stating that they would compensate me with platinum mileage for the New Yongsan Street incident. However, according to the rules, it would be given after the final exams, so it was still a long way off. For now, I had to be satisfied with the unenhanced Iron Dragon Staff.
*Click.*
I channeled a small amount of magic into the groove of the handle and pressed the end of the Iron Dragon Staff, causing the staff to retract inwards. Then, I inserted the now-shortened staff into the holster on my belt.
“Baek-seo, let’s go.”
Baek-seo smiled faintly and tilted her head at me.
“Chief, you seem excited.”
“Hmm? No way…? I’m the same as always.”
We left the Deus Atelier.
“Do you like it? The power was no joke,huh?”
“It’s beyond my expectations.”
With the Iron Dragon Staff, I might even be able to land a proper blow against Kim Dalbi.
The reason I thought of Dalbi for comparison was that my attacks didn’t seem to work on her last time.
It might have been a different story if I had launched a series of attacks, but my consecutive attacks wouldn’t work on Dalbi, who even blocked Baek-seo’s.
Of course, I had no intention of harming Dalbi. However, if a situation arose where I had to subdue her, I would have to wield this three-section staff.
“It fits my hand perfectly. I like the weight and how sturdy it feels.”
Come to think of it….
I need to practice controlling my strength with this.
Because if I swing this at an average rule violator, it wouldn’t just end with a fracture.
“That’s good.”
Baek-seo smiled faintly.
“It would hurt if it hit me too.”
“Hurt…. Right….”
It was an answer that made me realize the difference in our skills, which I sometimes wanted to forget.
I don’t think I can beat Baek-seo even with the Iron Dragon Staff.
But there was no need to be discouraged.
I had finally gotten my hands on the dedicated weapon I had been longing for. This might even allow me to develop various techniques. I was only going to get stronger from here on out.
Well, that could wait.
‘The timing is good. I’ll have to deal with the Six Sinners soon anyway.’
In the game, the Six Sinners caused incidents all over Academy City and made headlines.
The game was designed in a way that the players would constantly come across news about the Six Sinners, making them think, ‘It would be fun to fight them’.
The academies were some of the stages where the Six Sinners wreaked havoc. Although the Six Sinners didn’t appear at Seoin High, where our protagonist Lee Tae-sung attended, other academies were different.
‘One of them will attack Ahsung High soon.’
I didn’t know why.
In the game, there was news that one of the Six Sinners had invaded Ahsung High.
I couldn’t figure out the exact details of the incident. Maybe it was because Ahsung High was far from the main stage of the game? I wasn’t sure.
Even if I could figure out the details, I might not have known because I was a casual player.
Anyway, I had to be prepared.
However.
‘I don’t know how Ahsung High’s security is breached….’
It was a question without a clear answer.
Since one of the Six Sinners appeared in the game, Ahsung High’s security would be breached. But I couldn’t help but have doubts based on my experience at Ahsung High.
This was because, as a major academy, Ahsung High’s system was well-designed to thoroughly prepare for external intrusions.
Moreover, security was strengthened last year because of the incident where magical beasts broke in during the exams. Even I felt reassured.
‘…Let’s put that question aside for now.’
Because there was no way I could find a clear answer at the moment.
I should eat now.
“I’m hungry, want to grab something to eat?”
“Leader.”
“What?”
“I have somewhere to be today. I’ll head there first.”
“?”
Baek-seo said with a faint smile.
Usually, Baek-seo was specific with her words. The fact that she wasn’t mentioning it meant that she didn’t want to talk about it. That’s why I didn’t bother asking, ‘Where?’
‘Is it something personal?’
Last time, I realized that Baek-seo had a personal life she didn’t want me to know about.
Even if it weren’t something like that, I didn’t feel like prying. I was just disappointed that our date in New Yongsan Street was canceled.
I guess our date would have to wait until I came back to enhance the Iron Dragon Staff.
“Alright. I’ll go on ahead then.”
“Okay. I’ll make dinner later, so wash your hands and wait.”
“?”
Is she my mom?
***
The navy blue sky was chasing away the sunset. It was the time when night approached.
Listening to the chirping crickets, Oh Baek-seo climbed a hill and arrived at a small playground. It was a secluded playground with nothing but a slide, a seesaw, and a swing set.
There was a girl there.
*Squeak, squeak.* The sound of the swing. She was sitting quietly on the swing, her toes touching the sand.
Flowing pink hair. Hanyang Federal Academy uniform without a name tag.
“You’re here. It’s been two weeks, right?”
Kim Dalbi, one of Academy City’s terrorists, greeted without making eye contact.
Baek-seo stopped and looked at Dalbi with an indifferent expression. However, Baek-seo’s left hand rested on the sword at her waist.
“Hello.”
Baek-seo greeted back with a faint smile.
“What a face I’ve been wanting to see.”
“I’ll take that as a compliment.”
Dalbi reacted playfully.
“…”
Baek-seo narrowed her eyes.
“It’s convenient to have a high Tier, isn’t it? There’s something called presence that only those in the 6th Tier can feel.”
“You’re telling me. You were blatantly revealing your presence.”
Baek-seo shrugged.
“Why did you call me? Unless it’s something important, I’m going to draw my sword.”
“Something important?”
“Then I’ll draw it a little later.”
“You’re still drawing it either way.”
Baek-seo hadn’t called the Disciplinary Committee on purpose. Dalbi seemed like she wanted to talk.
Baek-seo also wanted to talk to Dalbi before apprehending her. There was something she needed to ask and information she wanted to extract. In the current atmosphere, it seemed possible.
“Well…, I’m not planning on fighting today. I have something to tell you.”
Dalbi said firmly, looking at Baek-seo.
“Just give me three minutes. I have something to tell you about your Disciplinary Committee Leader….”
In the blink of an eye, Baek-seo plopped down on the swing next to Dalbi.
It was so fast, it was like she had used Flash Steps.
“Go ahead.”
“Wow…, you’re more straightforward than I thought.”
Dalbi chuckled in admiration.

chapters.title: Chapter 35.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 35. Rule 16. The Leader Scolds a Comrade
“Did you come here just to talk?”
Kim Dalbi, sitting on a swing next to Baek-seo, spoke.
When Baek-seo didn’t respond, Dalbi smiled and continued.
“…You know, I’ve been under strict control lately. But recently, the surveillance has loosened up a bit, so I came to find you. It seems ‘that person’ isn’t doing well.”
Security drones, programmed to detect any mention of the Head Principal, roamed the city. Dalbi referred to these as the ‘listening ears’.
So, Dalbi referred to the Head Principal as ‘that person’ to avoid detection by the listening ears.
“Start with the story about the Leader,”
Baek-seo squinted and spoke firmly.
“If you asked for just three minutes, doesn’t that mean we only have about three minutes since we met?”
“Well, actually, three minutes was just a rough estimate. It could be shorter. There’s not much to talk about anyway.”
Dalbi handed Baek-seo a folded paper.
“Here. Burn or eat it after reading.”
It was a letter containing the message she wanted to convey, prepared in advance knowing there wouldn’t be enough time for a conversation.
Baek-seo unfolded and read the paper.
“……”
Soon, she ignited a spark and burned the letter.
Dalbi proudly extended her index finger upward.
“From now on, what I say will be like an intro to a movie….”
At that moment, Dalbi stopped speaking and narrowed her eyes. The movements of the ‘listening ears,’ the security drones patrolling the area, had become unusually erratic.
“…This won’t work. They’ve already noticed.”
The Head Principal realized Dalbi had disappeared.
Dalbi stood up from the swing, looked down at Baek-seo with a playful smile, and placed a finger on her lips.
“Keep today’s meeting a secret. Since I’ve given you information, you’ll stay quiet, right? Let’s end it with, ‘Hey, next time we meet, we’re enemies.’”
Baek-seo slowly blinked and sighed.
“Can I ask you one thing?”
“No.”
“Why did you leave me?”
Baek-seo recalled the half-year she had spent with Dalbi.
Dalbi pondered, saying, “Hmm.”
A memory of Woo-jin and Baek-seo walking together through New Yongsan Street flashed through her mind.
Still smiling, Dalbi answered.
“It wouldn’t mean much to tell you now. It was my choice.”
“……”
“Take care. See you later….”
Swish!
“Ah.”
Suddenly, a sword struck.
Dalbi gracefully bent backward to avoid the strike, letting out a gasp. At that moment, bright flames bloomed from her body like petals.
In front of Dalbi, Baek-seo, holding her sword, glared coldly.
“I didn’t say you could leave.”
“It’s already too late.”
Dalbi laughed mischievously.
Whoosh!
In an instant, Dalbi’s body was engulfed in flames, and another sword strike cut through them.
Whoosh. The flames died.
Dalbi had vanished.
Dalbi had been prepared to use her escape technique from the start. She had no intention of fighting.
“…Such a troublesome ability.”
Baek-seo sighed.
***
[ Do not disclose the contents you’re reading now! Specifically, the parts related to the Head Principal. ]
Baek-seo couldn’t find Dalbi in the end.
As it got late, Baek-seo did some quick grocery shopping on her way home, recalling the contents of Dalbi’s letter.
[ Your Disciplinary Committee Leader has been targeted recently due to the Head Principal’s light retaliation. You guys dismantled the Anomia organization that the Head Principal was secretly nurturing, didn’t you? I don’t know why the Head Principal raised such an organization secretly or why she kept it at such a scale, so think about that on your own. ]
It explained the reason for the New Yongsan Street incident two weeks ago, helping Baek-seo grasp the context.
[ Anyway, it seems he’s currently observing the situation for some reason. Whether his mind has changed or he’s gone senile, I don’t know. ]
When she read that paragraph, Baek-seo understood why Dalbi had called her.
At that time, they had barely any time to talk, so she had to quickly grasp the letter’s contents. Even in such a situation, Baek-seo quickly understood the parts about the Head Principal.
[ And be careful. ]
Next, Dalbi had written another important piece of information.
[ One of the Six Sinners is hiding in your school as a student. I don’t know who it is, but don’t get caught off guard. You can talk about this information. Discuss it with your Leader. ]
That was the end of the letter’s contents Baek-seo recalled.
“……”
One of the Six Sinners is hiding in Ahsung High School as a student.
Baek-seo was conflicted about whether to believe it. After all, Kim Dalbi, one of the Six Sinners, wasn’t exactly trustworthy.
But she couldn’t figure out what benefit Dalbi would gain from lying about this.
So, was it information given out of old friendship?
That was also unknown.
Before she knew it, Baek-seo arrived at Woo-jin’s house.
Beep beep.
Baek-seo naturally unlocked the door and went inside.
“…Baek-seo?”
“Huh?”
Baek-seo stopped abruptly.

chapters.title: Chapter 35.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 35 (Continued)
The moist air brushed her skin.
Soon, Woo-jin, drying his hair with a towel, came into Baek-seo’s view.
Baek-seo swallowed a gasp as Woo-jin’s bare skin filled her sight.
A moment of silence followed.
Woo-jin glanced down at his body.
Whoosh!
He quickly kicked off the ground and dove into the nearest room.
Thud! The sound of Woo-jin’s hitting the floor echoed.
“Oh my….”
Baek-seo unconsciously let out a soft exclamation.
For a while, she couldn’t move.
No matter how composed Baek-seo was, it was difficult to stay calm. After all, she was just a girl who hadn’t satisfied her sexual curiosity. She could barely manage her expression.
“……”
Baek-seo covered her mouth.
Ironically, the sight of Woo-jin’s naked body blew away Baek-seo’s worries and occupied her mind.
***
“Kim Dalbi left a letter stating that ‘one of the Six Sinners is hiding in Ahsung High School as a student’…. Is that right?”
Ahn Woo-jin and Oh Baek-seo, both wearing aprons, were preparing the groceries they had bought together. Woo-jin summarized Baek-seo’s conversation.
In truth, it was more a recount than a summary.
Baek-seo nodded.
“And the letter burned up.”
Woo-jin believed the information was true.
‘So the Six Sinner appearing next… wasn’t about breaking through Ahsung High School’s security, but being a student from the start?’
It was a hypothesis he had considered before, but without clues, he couldn’t be sure.
Thanks to Dalbi’s letter, that hypothesis gained weight.
‘Although there’s no confirmation yet, it seems reasonable to consider that possibility seriously. …I’ll have to find the suspect during the practical evaluation.’
The Six Sinner would likely appear during the practical evaluation.
However, he wouldn’t cancel the evaluation. There was no telling when or how the Six Sinner would strike again if not then. The risk would increase absurdly.
Therefore, it would be best to identify and capture the suspect during the evaluation. Catching them before then would be ideal.
‘But….’
Woo-jin looked at Baek-seo.
“Why did you go alone?”
He couldn’t understand.
Despite sensing Dalbi’s presence, she went alone without informing him.
“It was too dangerous.”
“She seemed to have something to say. She released a presence only I could sense. If I had brought the Leader, Dalbi might have fled immediately.”
“Why did she call only you?”
“I don’t know.”
“……”
Woo-jin thought it was because Dalbi felt uncomfortable meeting him.
But more importantly.
“Baek-seo.”
“Yes?”
Woo-jin approached Baek-seo.
There was a height difference. The top of Baek-seo’s head barely reached Woo-jin’s lips, so he looked down at her.
Baek-seo silently looked up at Woo-jin. The air grew heavy. Her usual gentle smile was not present.
‘I know she’s more competent than I am… but this was too much. It was clearly a suspicious situation.’
It seemed Baek-seo was worried about Woo-jin and went to meet Dalbi alone. Ever since the confrontation with Dalbi two weeks ago, Baek-seo had been sticking close, worried about him.
However, Woo-jin couldn’t respect that sentiment. He decided he needed to scold Baek-seo as a Leader because she showed a tendency not to rely on him or the Disciplinary Committee.
If Baek-seo had been ambushed, Woo-jin might not have realized it immediately. Just the thought of it was terrifying.
Moreover, the opponent was the formidable Kim Dalbi.
It was extremely dangerous.
Thus, unless there was an unavoidable reason, Woo-jin felt it necessary to scold Baek-seo for not relying on the Disciplinary Committee.
“You should have called the Disciplinary Committee or told me so we could plan a strategy. If you went alone and the enemies had been lying in ambush….”
“……!”
“”
As Woo-jin approached to scold her, Baek-seo stepped back.
‘What?’
Woo-jin was confused.
As he stepped closer, Baek-seo stepped back further.
“I’m sorry for misjudging and letting her go. I’ll reflect on it.”
“But why are you avoiding me?”
“I don’t know.”
Despite the serious conversation, Baek-seo couldn’t calm herself as Woo-jin drew closer.
Her attention was focused on the sensation of Woo-jin’s skin.
The human brain works in fascinating ways. The memory of seeing Woo-jin’s naked body was vividly stored in her mind, making Woo-jin appear naked in her mind’s eye.
A sexy man was approaching.
With such thoughts, she couldn’t focus on Woo-jin’s words.
“Leader, I’m sorry.”
Baek-seo managed to control her expression but couldn’t calm her thoughts.
“You’re too close….”
She barely managed to express her desire for him to step back, and Woo-jin interpreted it that way.
However, Baek-seo’s true intention wasn’t properly conveyed.
‘…Could it be that she’s distancing herself because I scolded her?’
Or is there an unspeakable reason?
Various worries sprouted in Woo-jin’s mind.
He couldn’t let the situation pass like this.
Woo-jin decided not to comply with Baek-seo’s request to distance himself.
“Baek-seo.”
Woo-jin grabbed her shoulders to prevent her from running away.
Baek-seo flinched.
Staring into her eyes, Woo-jin saw her struggling to keep a smile while blushing.
Woo-jin spoke in a serious tone.
“If there’s something uncomfortable, tell me.”
This physical contact is uncomfortable.
“Honestly, did something happen?”
I saw your naked body and everything.
“…Woo-jin?”
Finally, Baek-seo addressed him by his name instead of ‘Leader,’ a clear sign of pressure.
Baek-seo began to smile gently, but her voice trembled.
“I feel embarrassed today. Could you give me some space?”
“…….”
“…….”
“…Ah.”
After Baek-seo confessed her honest feelings, Woo-jin understood the situation.
The heavy atmosphere became awkward.
After that, they pretended to have a natural conversation while eating curry together.
“Goodnight.”
“Goodnight….”
After Baek-seo left, Woo-jin stood at the entrance.
‘My presence….’
It had lessened.
“Ugh….”
Feelings of shame and doubt swept over him sequentially.
Woo-jin felt heat rise in his head, covered his face with his hands, and sighed.

chapters.title: Chapter 36.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 36- Rule 17. The Leader is Not Misunderstood
Park Minhyuk, the secretary of the Ahsung High School Disciplinary Committee, had a secret hobby.
On the weekend, Minhyuk entered a figure store with a large bag, wearing a hood and round glasses, a smile spreading across his face as if he had entered paradise.
Minhyuk’s steps halted in front of a limited-edition figure. The box shone brilliantly in his eyes: ‘Iron-blooded Girl Marina Silver Armor Second Version…!’
Minhyuk quietly breathed in excitement as he purchased the figure.
Up until the beginning of this year, Minhyuk wasn’t obsessed with figures. He had focused on romantic feelings toward real women.
However, unfortunately, Minhyuk’s romantic feelings always ended in despair.
─ ‘Sorry. Honestly… you’re not my type.’
─ ‘Just so you know, there’s a rumor you’re creepy.’
─ ‘Did you really think I was that easy…?’
─ ‘I didn’t think of you that way. I just saw you as a friend…. Can we just stay friends? I’m sorry.’
─ ‘Oh, Minhyuk…. Why would you confess to Nayeon? Who’s going to announce it now?’
Minhyuk had an exceptionally good memory. The rejections from his confessions accumulated clearly in his mind, causing his head to hang lower and lower.
Often, he would kick his blanket in self-loathing as he lay in bed.
He wanted to hide in a hole to escape the memories. Eventually, Minhyuk resorted to hiding in cabinets or trash cans to feel some relief from the world.
One day, Minhyuk had a realization: Was there any need to crave love from people who would just avoid him?
That’s when he noticed 2D characters.
Ideal beings that wouldn’t plunge him into self-loathing. From then on, the anime character he enjoyed watching, Iron-blooded Girl Marina, started to look different to him.
It was the beginning of his ‘otaku’ journey.
In other words, the start of ‘love.’
Minhyuk carried the bag with the figure box clutched to his chest. He left the store, his eyes scanning his surroundings cautiously.
There was no one suspicious.
‘Never again will I go through what happened last time,’ he thought.
Minhyuk repeated to himself like a mantra.
The day he was kidnapped by Anomia, he lost his limited-edition figure of Iron-blooded Girl Marina. Naturally, the experience stayed in his mind like a trauma.
The sale period was over, and only second-hand figures with other people’s fingerprints appeared on online marketplaces. Minhyuk eventually gave up on that figure.
Thus, Minhyuk made a resolution.
‘I will never lose Marina-chan, no matter what!’
Minhyuk moved forward cautiously, maintaining a state of extreme vigilance and even controlling his breathing.
But anxiety soon became reality.
Suddenly, a hand reached out from an alley and grabbed Minhyuk.
“Huh!”
Like a fish caught on a hook, the weak Minhyuk was dragged away. His heart sank.
The person pulling him was a mysterious woman wearing sunglasses and a mask.
Clearly suspicious.
“N-no…!”
Minhyuk’s voice trembled.
Were the heavens refusing to let him have Iron-blooded Girl Marina?
Remembering his previous attack, Minhyuk thought.
The woman before him was undoubtedly a villain targeting him.
“P-please spare me…!”
Minhyuk trembled like a cornered deer.
But he had to protect what mattered.
Curling up, Minhyuk clutched his bag.
“Just kill me if you want…! But please, just let Marina-chan go home!”
“Minhyuk, it’s me.”
“…?”
The woman took off her sunglasses and mask, revealing her face.
“The wild Ha Yesong appears!”
Ha Yesong, the Disciplinary Committee member in charge of regulating public morals at Ahsung High School, greeted energetically with her usual catchphrase.
“…….”
Minhyuk’s expression turned icy.
As the fear in his chest dissipated, his heart turned frigid in reaction.
Yesong grinned and placed her arm around Minhyuk’s shoulder.
“Hey, loser Minhyuk, what were you saying about Marina-chan? What’s in that bag, huh? Minhyuk-kun?”
“I’ll kill you.”
“Haha!”
Yesong burst into laughter.
“I don’t care about your privacy~. I’m not interested in the slightest, got it?”
“To trample on my innocent heart…, unforgivable….”
Tears welled up in Minhyuk’s eyes.
His fragile heart had already been shredded.
“Anyway, is that why you didn’t check your messages?”
“Messages?”
“There’s a very important issue right now!”
“Nothing’s more important than me going home right now.”
“Just come with me.”
Minhyuk, being weak, had no choice.
Yesong sniffed the air and poked her head out of the alley.
“This way!”
She led Minhyuk somewhere.
“Good thing you’re disguised too.”
“What are we doing?”
“We’re tailing someone.”
“Ah, stalking. Do that pathetic stuff on your own, please. It’s beneath me….”
“It looks like the Leader and Vice Leader are on a date.”
“!”
Minhyuk adjusted his posture and seriously followed Yesong.
“Where? Track them by scent immediately.”
“There they are…. Wait, am I a dog?”
Minhyuk didn’t deny it.
They spotted a man and woman entering a large burger restaurant. It was Ahn Woo-jin and Oh Baek-seo, the Leader and Vice Leader of the Disciplinary Committee, respectively, both in casual clothes.
“Let’s go.”
“Okay.”
Yesong and Minhyuk moved stealthily like spies.
“?”
However, to passersby, they just looked like a suspicious stalker and an otaku moving together.
The burger restaurant was spacious, providing many blind spots to observe Woo-jin and Baek-seo secretly.
Yesong and Minhyuk ordered burger sets and sat at a distance from Woo-jin and Baek-seo, hidden by a corner.
“Your double steak burger and teriyaki burger are ready.”
Receiving their burger sets, Yesong and Minhyuk ate while sneakily glancing at Woo-jin and Baek-seo, peeking out from the corner.
“A burger place, alone together on the weekend…. This smells suspicious?”
“It’s our respected Leader’s love life. We need to verify and support it…. If they’re a couple, it’s my duty to protect their relationship….”
Yesong and Minhyuk conversed in hushed, collective soliloquy.
At that moment, a blonde girl with a ponytail entered the burger place.
It was Yoo Doha, the treasurer of the Ahsung High School Disciplinary Committee.
She immediately spotted the suspicious duo and approached them.
“Hey, Ha Yesong.”
“Welcome, Yoo Doha.”
“Why did you call me out on a weekend afternoon? What’s this ‘urgent matter’?”
“First, cover your face.”
“?”

chapters.title: Chapter 36.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 36 (Continued)
Yesong put a prepared hat on Doha’s head. Minhyuk gestured urgently, and Doha crouched down.
“Lower your voice.”
Yesong said to Doha.
“It seems the Leader and Vice Leader are on a date. You’ve heard the rumors they might be dating, right?”
“I don’t care about that….”
“Our goal is to gather evidence that Leader and Vice Leader are dating. Keep that in mind.”
Doha frowned.
“Why are we doing this troublesome thing?”
“Because I’m in charge of regulating public morals? It’s my duty to verify if Leader and Vice Leader are dating.”
“Then there’s no need to call me….”
“I can’t leave Doha-chan out. This is something we all need to confirm together.”
“You’re just doing this for fun.”
“Yes.”
Doha decided not to question further.
“Hm.”
Whether the Leader and Vice Leader were dating or not didn’t matter to her. However, since she was here, she decided to satisfy her curiosity.
After all, the Leader was someone she served, so knowing wouldn’t hurt.
Doha sat with Yesong and Minhyuk, who nibbled on fries like rabbits while intensely spying on Woo-jin and Baek-seo.
***
We went to a burger place for a simple meal. But for some reason, strange stalkers began following us.
One of them was Ha Yesong, wearing sunglasses and a mask, and the other was Park Minhyuk, hugging a bag tightly. Yoo Doha had just joined them.
‘What are they doing…?’
I pretended not to notice. I didn’t want to acknowledge their presence.
‘Are they tailing us? Suddenly?’
I didn’t realize they were following us until we entered the burger place. But it was obvious now.
I suddenly admired the stoic junior who always kept a close eye on Lee Se-Ah.
‘Baek-seo must have noticed too, right?’
If I noticed, there was no way Baek-seo hadn’t.
At that moment, Baek-seo casually started speaking while sipping her drink through a straw.
“Hey, Leader.”
“Why?”
“Have you heard that rumor lately?”
“What rumor?”
She asked while sipping my drink.
“The rumor that you and I are dating.”
“Gah! Cough, cough!”
I choked on my drink and coughed repeatedly.
A rumor that we’re dating?
“Are you okay?”
“Ah, I just swallowed wrong.”
It didn’t seem like a joke.
‘How did I not know?’
Maybe I’ve been too busy lately.
Baek-seo rested her chin on her hand and smiled warmly.
“…Really?”
I asked to confirm.
“Yes. I heard that there’s a rumor going around the Disciplinary Committee. I don’t really mind.”
“But I do….”
You might not care about your reputation, but I do.
‘So those guys…?’
I finally understood.
‘They came to confirm if Baek-seo and I are dating?’
They must be serious about it if they’re tailing us.
Their initiative is impressive.
But still.
‘This is a mistake.’
It’s a perfectly reasonable rumor.
Recently, since Baek-seo has been living next door and we’ve been commuting together, it’s only natural for such a rumor to spread.
High school students tend to get excited and start rumors whenever boys and girls interact even a little.
Especially in Ahsung High School, where campus romances are strictly prohibited, such gossip becomes even more exciting.
‘I should have been more careful.’
I was concerned about this.
But it was hard to distance myself from Baek-seo, who worried about my safety and insisted on commuting together. Not that I wanted to, either.
However, it seems I need to be more cautious from now on.
As the Leader, I need to strictly adhere to the school rules.
‘For now, it’s best to make those guys believe that Baek-seo and I are just friends and not a couple.’
Let’s pretend not to know that they’re here. They’re clearly trying not to be noticed.
Right now, it’s time to talk to Baek-seo.
“Baek-seo.”
“Yes?”
“It’s disgraceful for rumors to spread that the Leader and Vice Leader might be breaking the school rules. We should always be seen as exemplary, strictly adhering to the rules. So, let’s be careful for a while….”
Just as I was about to speak firmly, Baek-seo interrupted.
“Leader, wait.”
“Huh?”
Baek-seo picked up a napkin and leaned towards me, wiping my mouth.
“You had ketchup on your face.”
“Ah, thanks…. But isn’t this too close?”
Baek-seo was leaning uncomfortably close to me.
Moreover, even after wiping the ketchup, she didn’t move her hand away from my mouth.
“Baek-seo? Wait, what are you…?”
She got even closer, almost as if she was going to kiss my cheek.
I swallowed nervously, feeling the tension rising.
“Leader.”
Baek-seo’s voice suddenly filled my ear.
“They took the bait.”
“?”
Baek-seo smiled sweetly.
Two figures quickly approached us.
Whoosh! One of them threw off their sunglasses and mask.
“I got it! I captured the moment they were about to kiss!”
Ha Yesong. She pointed at us proudly like a reporter who had caught a scoop. Next to her, Minhyuk, wearing round glasses, pointed at us with a surprised expression.
Baek-seo and I turned our gazes towards them.
“You guys…?”
“Hi?”
Baek-seo greeted naturally.
“Baek-seo, so you and the Leader are really…?”
“Leader, are you really in that kind of relationship with the Vice Leader…?”
At that moment, Baek-seo showed Yesong and Minhyuk her smartphone screen, displaying footage of them approaching.
“Ah.”
Instantly, Yesong and Minhyuk froze like ice.
Baek-seo’s smartphone displayed footage of Yesong and Minhyuk approaching from the street.
“A trap?”
Yesong asked, and Baek-seo nodded. Just then, Doha approached Yesong and Minhyuk from behind.
Baek-seo put her phone back in her pocket and sat down again.
Had she planned to tease them from the start?
“The Leader and I were meeting for work. The rumors are false, so don’t misunderstand.”
Baek-seo said with her usual gentle smile, voicing what I had wanted to say.
Yeah, this is better.
I guess I was being overly cautious.
Anyway, the matter was resolved.
“Really…? If Baek-seo says so, then it must be true….”
Yesong and Minhyuk looked disappointed, let down by the anti-climactic turn of events.
They exchanged glances with Doha, and then Yesong asked me.
“What should we do now, Leader?”
“Why are you asking me?”
After reprimanding them for tailing us for a while.
We decided to have fun at a karaoke.
Since we had already met up, we agreed to go to a karaoke and have some fun.
It turned out to be quite enjoyable.
***
A female student in an Ahsung High School uniform was training in a dark room. She wore a Disciplinary Committee armband on her arm.
The screams of the undead echoed around her. The girl, with an emotionless expression, watched her minions fight.
Her expressionless demeanor was something the Ahsung High School Disciplinary Committee Leader highly valued.
Eventually, the girl raised her arm and snapped her fingers.
Snap!
With a sharp sound, the undead vanished into the shadows, sinking into the ground.
Only the traces of giant claws scratching the training dummy, walls, and floor remained.
Similar claw marks would be left during the Ahsung High School practical evaluation as well.
“…Useful.”
In a monotonous voice, the expressionless girl turned and left the room.

chapters.title: Chapter 37.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 37- Rule 18. The Leader Thwarts the Villain’s Plan (1)
The Disciplinary Committee, a large force which plays a crucial role in ensuring student safety during important exams, including practical evaluations. They step in as supervisors when teacher resources are insufficient.
The practical evaluation was only a week away, and I awaited approval of the final proposal outlining the Disciplinary Committee’s supervision plan. It focused on the deployment specifics: when, where, and how to position committee members.
‘I must carefully consider placement, considering the possibility that one of the Six Sinners is among our students….’
It wasn’t a matter to be taken lightly.
We didn’t know exactly when the Six Sinners would appear.
‘…The Necromancer.’
In the game, the Six Sinner who attacked Ahsung High School was known as ‘The Necromancer.’
They concealed their identity behind a skull mask, rendering identification impossible.
Why would they choose the practical evaluation to cause trouble? …I don’t know.
Understanding their motive beforehand would be ideal, but it was difficult to figure out.
‘Anyway, in the game, Ahsung High School failed to apprehend them. We cannot allow that to happen.
The Disciplinary Committee cannot afford failure. The Necromancer’s attack led to the impeachment of the Disciplinary Committee Leader at Ahsung High School.
I had to be extra vigilant.
The practical evaluation takes place over a wide area and is conducted by grade over four days.
The practical evaluation spans a large area and spans four days, organized by grade. Second-year students oversee first-year evaluations, third-year students monitor second-year evaluations, and fourth-year students supervise third-year evaluations. The remaining staff oversee the fourth-year evaluations.
‘It would be easier to handle if we knew which grade’s evaluation they would target….’
But we couldn’t know.
We also couldn’t just deploy strong members for the entire evaluation.
The practical evaluation lasts a long time. They’re only human, so fatigue would set in, and the Necromancer, intending to attack Ahsung High School, wouldn’t overlook any suspicious circumstances.
‘We also need to be prepared for necromancy.’
The Necromancer specializes in controlling undead minions, making them formidable in large-scale battles.
Therefore, we must prepare countermeasures against necromancy discreetly, avoiding any alarm among the students.
First, let’s review the suspects….’
Alone, I reviewed the documents—a list of students with high magical power based on school measurements.
The criterion was ‘power levels that wouldn’t be strange for a 5th Tier or higher.’
The Six Sinners are inherently powerful. While the Necromancer is among the weaker ones, they still rank as a top-tier 5th Tier fighter, indicating significant magical prowess. Under optimal conditions, they could rival even a 6th Tier.
‘There are about 50 suspects.’
Ahsung High School is one of the major academies, so it attracts many geniuses above the 5th Tier. However, the number itself wasn’t very high, narrowing down the candidates to 50.
Among them, the Disciplinary Committee accounted for the highest proportion, comprising 28 members.
This underscores the Disciplinary Committee’s esteemed status, leading in combat prowess. However, it also highlights that even the Committee cannot be fully trusted.
‘It would be good if we could confirm their unique abilities….’
Identifying the suspects’ unique abilities is difficult unless the individuals willingly disclose them. There is a prevalent culture of treating unique abilities as sensitive private matters, and many people hide or lie about them to protect themselves.
Given that very few people manifest unique abilities, the uncertainty about how such rare powers might be used, and the potential risk of being targeted by criminals, this is a complex social phenomenon.
So, those whose unique abilities were clear and unrelated to necromancy were excluded from suspicion.
‘I’m not sure about the physique….’
The Necromancer always wore a hooded robe, so their physique was unknown. At least they weren’t tall, so students with large builds were excluded from suspicion.
Knock, knock.
Just then, a knock sounded on the door of the Disciplinary Committee’s executive office.
“Come in.”
I was the only one in the office.
I raised my voice.
The door opened, and our top-tier expressionless talent walked in. The emotionless junior.
She saluted and stood at ease in front of my desk.
“Good work, Leader.”
Her tone was flat and emotionless.
I looked away from her and resumed reviewing the documents that needed approval.
“Report.”
The intensity of her surveillance on Lee Se-Ah had decreased compared to before. Now, it was more about casually observing her and reporting back.
Although Lee Se-Ah had realized she was being watched, it wasn’t possible to stop surveillance completely.
Additionally, the reason for receiving verbal reports was to avoid leaving records.
“No special incidents. Lee Se-Ah is still leading her group and focusing on good deeds. It’s the same as usual.”
“Alright. Thanks for your effort.”
Normally, the reports ended like this.
The reduced intensity of her mission was a factor, but the main reason was that Lee Se-Ah hadn’t made any significant moves in school.
However, no matter how cautious Lee Se-Ah was, she would inevitably make significant moves by next semester. This was when she would become the leader of the Do-hwa Group and the ruler of the black market, which happened in the second semester of this year. It was also when she would die.
…Besides that.
“I’ll take my leave now….”
“Han Seo-jin.”
“Yes.”
The emotionless junior, Han Seo-jin, responded calmly without any special reaction.
“How is your work with the Disciplinary Committee going? Have you adapted yet?”
Seo-jin was listed among the suspects.
Upon further investigation, it turned out her magic power was higher than expected. She lived up to the potential I saw in her.
So, she naturally caught my attention. She was one of the top suspects, the so-called ‘Number 1 Suspect.’
Top suspects would be monitored closely by the strongest members of the Disciplinary Committee, like me, Oh Baek-seo, and Ha Yesong.
Among them, I decided to personally keep an eye on the expressionless junior since she was the talent I had noticed.
Today was also the last report day before the practical evaluation, so I decided to have a brief conversation.
“……”
Maybe because I attempted to initiate a conversation, which was unusual.
Seo-jin looked at me silently, trying to gauge my intentions before speaking.
“…There are still many areas I need to improve, but I’ve adapted to most tasks. Thanks to the excellent guidance from the seniors.”
“That’s good.”
I looked up from the documents and met Seo-jin’s eyes.
“Come to think of it, you said your reason for joining the Disciplinary Committee was to uphold order, right?”
“Yes.”
As expected.
Even though she had mentioned such a pretentious and embarrassing reason for joining, Seo-jin’s expression didn’t change at all.
“Is there anything else you’d like to do in the future?”
“…I’m not sure I understand.”
“I meant exactly what I said. You don’t strike me as particularly honest.”
“……”
Seo-jin remained silent, not answering. Maybe my words hit the mark.
“Starting with your reason for joining. If you were sincere, I apologize.”
“…Actually, I joined to build my resume. I thought I needed to show enthusiasm during the interview, so I said those things. I’m sorry if I disappointed you….”
“I didn’t say that to hear an apology. Everyone’s the same. Including me.”
“Yes?”
I leaned back in my chair.

chapters.title: Chapter 37.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 37 (Continued)
“My goal is similar to yours. If I complete my term as Leader successfully, I’ll be able to secure a good position after graduation. In other words, my goal is also to build my resume. Most people are like you and me.”
“…I see.”
“That’s what I want. To get a good position and live well. Do you have something like that?”
Seo-jin looked down and thought for a moment before speaking.
“…I want to see the ocean.”
“The ocean?”
“That’s the only thing that comes to mind.”
The ocean….
For a moment, her expressionless face seemed to crack slightly. I realized this was the first time Seo-jin had given an honest answer, always hiding her emotions.
In my previous life and various media in this world, the vast and blue ocean beyond the sandy beach had the power to make people’s hearts flutter. It’s natural to have a longing for the sea.
However, in the current era, going to the sea is forbidden.
There’s no safe route to the sea, to begin with.
To see the sea, you’d have to graduate high school, obtain an explorer’s license, and venture outside, prepared to lose your life more easily than an insect due to the dangerous monsters outside.
“…Are you going to laugh at me?”
“?”
Unexpectedly, Seo-jin’s words caught me off guard.
Seo-jin looked straight into my eyes with her emotionless face.
“Why would I?”
“Because it’s nonsense. Everyone knows it’s dangerous, and I want to see a sea that’s no longer beautiful.”
Was she saying her desire was worthless?
I recalled the images of the sea brought back by explorers.
The sea’s landscape had changed so much that one wouldn’t necessarily want to see it anymore.
But.
“Nonsense? I think it’s cool.”
“Yes?”
I couldn’t understand why Seo-jin felt cynical about her own aspirations.
“Nature always cycles. By now, some parts of the ocean might have regained their old beauty. A lot of time has passed since ‘The Hole’ closed.”
The Hole.
A massive gate that once appeared in the Pacific Ocean.
The Hole unleashed countless monsters, beginning with the Tier 9 Golden Sheep, causing widespread chaos.
Now, the Golden Sheep had closed it.
“In that case, you might be the one to find that beautiful sea.”
“……?”
“Having such a wish, I think that’s cool.”
It was my genuine feeling.
Such desires are what drive progress in the world.
Seo-jin blinked slowly, her expression remaining impassive.
“I see. Thank you,” Seo-jin replied, inclining her head in acknowledgement.
There wasn’t much else to discuss.
I couldn’t just ask, ‘Are you one of the Six Sinners?’
Han Seo-jin was a talent I acknowledged.
A promising prospect.
I just hoped she wouldn’t turn out to be the Necromancer and end up fighting against me.
“You can go now.”
“Yes. Goodbye, Leader.”
Seo-jin saluted and left the office.
***
Walking down the corridor after leaving the office, Han Seo-jin thought.
Seo-jin planned to release the undead and complete her mission during the practical evaluation before leaving Ahsung High School. However, she encountered an unexpected variable after enrolling at Ahsung High School.
The Disciplinary Committee Leader.
When she was assigned the infiltration mission at Ahsung High School by the Head Principal, the Disciplinary Committee Leader wasn’t considered a key figure.
Seo-jin didn’t think much of the Leader’s solo resolution of the Anomia train terror incident either.
However, after joining the Disciplinary Committee as part of her plan, Seo-jin was surprised by the Leader.
─ ‘So, you want me to keep an eye on Lee Se-Ah?’
The Leader had assigned Seo-jin to monitor Lee Se-Ah.
Seo-jin felt uneasy and tense.
Why her, of all people?
Could it be that she had aroused suspicion?
Seo-jin recalled asking the Leader why she was given a personal assignment.
─ ‘Because you’re in the same class as Lee Se-Ah in the first year at Maehwa Hall. You just stood out the most.’
It was a flimsy reason.
A vague response that couldn’t be disputed.
At that time, Seo-jin secretly used one of her necromantic abilities.
The derived ability of the ‘Sixth Sense.’
The sense to discern whether someone is telling the truth or lying.
And she found out.
‘It was a lie.’
Seo-jin determined that the reason given by the Leader was a lie.
There was undoubtedly a hidden agenda behind the Leader’s actions.
‘They must have noticed something suspicious about me.’
The Leader was rumored to know a lot about Anomia.
Seo-jin had dismissed these as mere rumors, but being personally called and assigned a task with a lie made her suspicious.
─ ‘Thank you for trusting me, Leader. I will deliver the best results.’
Thus, Seo-jin did her best to avoid the Leader’s suspicion, diligently performing her tasks and going above and beyond what was asked.
It was an act to show her dedication as a new member of the Disciplinary Committee.
Although the intensity of the surveillance on Lee Se-Ah had lessened, Seo-jin couldn’t afford to be careless.
‘There must be no setbacks in the plan. If the Leader shows signs of suspicion during the practical evaluation….’
Then there was no other choice.
She would have to deal with the Leader first.
As she walked, Seo-jin stopped and looked out the window. The outdoor swimming pool used for swimming classes came into view.
─ ‘I think it’s cool to have such a wish.’
“…….”
The Leader’s words echoed in her mind.
Using her ability, she confirmed that his words were sincere.
She thought back.
Whenever she expressed her desire to see the ocean, others’ responses were always filled with insincere platitudes.
They treated her like a dreamer trapped in her own world or a foolish person chasing meaningless dreams.
The only person who hadn’t laughed at her desire was the Head Principal.
However, she never expected to hear such genuine admiration.
Seo-jin lowered her gaze and whispered to herself.
“He’s a kind person….”
After pondering the Leader’s words for a while, Seo-jin resumed walking.
***
Time passed, and the practical evaluation began.

chapters.title: Chapter 38.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 38 – Rule 18. The Leader Thwarts the Villain’s Plan (2)
Recalling the details of the game was no easy task.
Especially since the attack on Ahsung High School by the Six Sinners wasn’t linked to any storyline or event.
I could only barely remember what the in-game news anchor had said.
So, I considered it remarkable that I remembered the incident would happen at all.
‘I feel uneasy…’
The growing tension was inevitable.
It wasn’t that I knew nothing; rather, it was because I had such incomplete knowledge of future events.
I just hoped everything would go smoothly…
‘Did that guy know the practical evaluation would take place here?’
I was talking about the necromancer.
Even I didn’t know where Ahsung High School’s practical evaluation would take place this semester in advance.
The evaluation proposal I approved only described the structure and features of the location.
As the Disciplinary Committee Leader, I too had to participate in the practical evaluation, so only minimal information was provided to ensure fairness.
It was only today that the students were informed of the location and method of the practical evaluation. It was even a newly developed area this year.
Being a supervisor as part of the Disciplinary Committee didn’t grant me any significant advantage in the test site.
The evaluation mainly focused on assessing magical control abilities. After each evaluation, the targets would automatically move for the next evaluation, and it could be practiced at the academy as well.
