“That’s true. I used it instinctively back then, but now I feel like I’ve forgotten that sensation….”
“That’s unusual.”
“Still, I have a unique ability now. It must be a temporary condition. Since the information is being controlled, it’s unlikely to cause immediate trouble. I should just wait until my magic recovers.”
The information that I had a unique ability was controlled at the academy level.
Like how bad news about a powerful figure quickly disappears from the internet.
There were people who witnessed my ability at the scene.
And there were many who had obtained the information.
However, we judged it shouldn’t spread further, so I sought help from the Student Council President.

chapters.title: Chapter 44.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 44 (Continued)
The reason.
─ ‘Don’t die to the small fry overflowing in this city…!’
Goliath’s warning.
At first, I had no intention of hiding my unique ability once I awakened it.
The problem was that I had awakened a top-tier unique ability that dealt with the concept of space.
The more widely this information spread, the more powerful adversaries would target me.
Proof of this was that Goliath, the one I was most worried about, had already shown interest in me as his top priority.
Of course, it was impossible to completely control the spread of this information.
It might be a futile effort, but it was better than doing nothing.
“There’s a lot to do anyway.”
Indeed, there was much to do.
Besides investigating the incident,
the General Student Council of Hanyang Federal Academy sent a notice that they would investigate the incident to hold Ahsung High School accountable.
One of the General Student Council’s roles was to hold the respective academy responsible when an incident resulted in many student casualties.
Facing the General Student Council head-on was our student council’s responsibility.
However, the Disciplinary Committee also had plenty to do.
Providing requested materials to the student council, attending meetings to give briefings…
‘Well, it’s just a drop in the bucket compared to what the student council has to handle.’
Please let everything go smoothly without any mishaps….
In the game, this incident was one of the landmines that led to the impeachment of the Disciplinary Committee Leader. I just hoped I wouldn’t follow the same path.
Swish. As fatigue suddenly washed over my eyes, I rubbed my eyes once.
“Are you tired?”
“I haven’t been able to sleep lately.”
I didn’t bother denying it.
There was no point in hiding it from Baek-seo since she would find out anyway.
It was difficult to hide my fatigue to begin with.
I was dealing with lethargy from magic depletion on top of my injuries.
The healer had even nagged me to be hospitalized, but a Disciplinary Committee Leader couldn’t just lie comfortably in bed while there was an incident to resolve.
“Um… Aren’t you going to use the card?”
“Card?”
What card?
“…Oh.”
That card.
The Oh Baek-seo usage card.
The card’s effect was cleaning my ears, right?
“Especially for the Leader who worked hard this time, I can even offer a bonus pat on the head as a service.”
Baek-seo whispered in a confidential tone, with one hand shading her mouth, a mischievous smile playing on her lips.
‘She must be worried about me….’
She was being playful to show her concern and encouraging me to use the card lightly.
I waved my hand.
“Later. Not now.”
I didn’t want to use that card right now.
“Later?”
“It doesn’t seem like the right time yet. I have work to do.”
This level of fatigue was bearable.
‘I want to save that card for when I’m truly exhausted.’
Using that card would bring me immense happiness at that moment.
I’d get tremendous motivation and healing.
So, I decided to save it for a crucial moment.
As long as I was the Leader, there was no expiration date on using the card.
“…If you insist.”
Baek-seo smiled and turned her head away from me.
Just then, the door to the Disciplinary Committee’s executive office swung open.
“Wild Ha Yesong has appeared!”
The Wild Ha Yesong, responsible for monitoring public disorder, had arrived.
Both Baek-seo and I turned our gazes toward Yesong.
“Leader! You’re still alive today!”
Yesong pointed at me with both index fingers, raising one knee. Her eyes sparkled brightly.
What kind of pose is that?
“Do I look like someone who would die?”
“Just by looking at you, it seems you could cross the River Styx at any moment. You look like you should be in a hospital bed!”
Well, she had a point.
“I can’t rest with just this. I’m the Leader, after all.”
“Ah, the fighting spirit of the Disciplinary Committee Leader! I, Ha Yesong, am moved…! How about dumpling stew for lunch today?”
“…The place where you need at least two people to order?”
“Exactly, our Leader! Spot on!”
So, she wanted dumpling stew but had no one to go with.
“Today, I, Yesong, will carry you there specially!”
“No, that’s not necessary.”
“No need to refuse!”
“I said no….”
With Baek-seo and Yesong supporting me, I stood up and walked with crutches.
When we arrived at the cafeteria, Yesong chatted cheerfully as if nothing had happened. This, too, seemed to be her way of showing concern for me.
Dumpling stew was served. Yesong praised the greatness of dumplings with exclamations as she saw the stew, which was full of dumplings, rice cakes, vegetables, and meat.
Bubble, bubble.
As I stared at the boiling dumpling stew, a conversation with Seo-jin suddenly came to mind.
─ ‘…I want to see the sea.’
I didn’t expect the broth to remind me of the sea….
Come to think of it.
“How’s the sea these days?”
A sudden question popped out of my mouth.
“Huh? Do you want to go to the artificial beach?”
Artificial beach.
It wasn’t the real sea but a resort designed to resemble the old sea.
It had a sandy shore, a lake, and a large screen displaying the horizon.
I remember it being quite popular.
“No, just the sea.”
“Oh… I think it was two days ago. An explorer who returned this time brought new photos of the sea!”
What?
Really?
I had been so busy dealing with the incident that I hadn’t had time to check the internet.
Photos of the outside world brought back by explorers were rare.
Even trying to view the Earth via satellite was challenging due to the thick magic energy and pollution caused by the beasts.
But this girl….
“You had time for web surfing?”
I narrowed my eyes and glared at Yesong.
We’ve been incredibly busy lately.
I worked despite being injured.
“Hehe.”
“Get back to work, Ha Yesong.”
“I am working! It was just a refresh!”
Yesong laughed awkwardly.
“Anyway, do you want to see?”
“…Show me.”
Yesong showed us the recent photos of the sea brought by the explorer.
“……”
A gloomy sky.
The sea, still unpurified and polluted with nuclear waste and the magic energy of beasts.
Countless skeletons, stripped of flesh and organs, scattered without burial.
The eerie landscape of the coastline resembled hell.
Beyond the horizon, gigantic, grotesque creatures walked bipedally.
Unknown black islands and sacred altars floated in the sea.
The other sea photos were similar.
“It’s fortunate that the Golden Sheep granted us safe lands, right?”
Yesong remarked suddenly.
“…Perhaps.”
According to history,
after the Argonauts challenged the Golden Sheep, the Golden Sheep seemed to appreciate humanity’s challenge and granted a few safe lands.
One of those was the center of the Korean Peninsula.
The current Academy City, Neo Seoul.
Though, the true intentions of the Golden Sheep were unknown.
─ ‘I want to see the sea, which is no longer beautiful, with my own eyes.’
The penalty for necromancy was becoming a revenant, wasn’t it?
If Han Seo-jin was freely roaming the outside world separated from her body,
was she witnessing such sea landscapes?
What kind of scene would the sea show Han Seo-jin?
Had she managed to glimpse the old beauty of the sea even a little?
It was something I couldn’t know.
* * *
Ahn Woo-jin unwrapped his bandages.
Thanks to the healer’s recovery magic, his injuries healed in about a week.
After being informed by the healer that his state of magic depletion would recover by early dawn the next day,
he exercised intensively at home, having rested sufficiently. Fortunately, it was the weekend tomorrow.
“Whew.”
After exercising, showering, and enjoying the pleasant muscle soreness, Woo-jin drifted off to sleep.
In the dark dawn,
as Woo-jin’s magic circuits recovered, the dormant magic began to return.
Crack!
A crack appeared in the air.
From it, a long, white, bare leg extended gracefully.
A girl emerged from the crack, her long golden hair fluttering as she landed barefoot.
Even in the dark night, the girl emitted a soft glow, displaying an elegant figure. Once the crack disappeared, the light flowing through her body faded.
The girl, who had her eyes closed, lifted her eyelids, adorned with light golden eyelashes.
She gazed at the sleeping Woo-jin.
“…He recovers slowly.”
The girl muttered, taking a deep breath of the room’s air.
She slipped under the blanket covering Woo-jin and hugged him as she fell asleep.

chapters.title: Chapter 45.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 45 – Rule 19. The Leader Tests His Unique Ability (2)
Outside the world of Neo Seoul.
Bright lava flowed in the blackened world.
At a certain point,
Goliath was soaking his naked body in the bubbling red lava. It was over ten times hotter than boiling water.
Goliath leaned back, spreading his broad shoulders, savoring the lava. His large teeth showed as he grinned.
[Hey.]
Behind Goliath, a bipedal monster with the head of a goat approached and spoke.
A muscular creature with long golden wool.
It was known as the ‘Other Golden Sheep.’
In a voice similar to a human male, it asked calmly.
[Don’t you get tired of enjoying hot springs here every time? Don’t you want to enjoy hot springs in just plain hot water?]
“Nothing else satisfies me. Hot springs with lava itself are what I like…!”
Instead of enjoying hot springs heated by magma, Goliath’s hobby was to soak directly in the erupting lava.
The sky was covered with volcanic ash.
When he raised his arms above the blackened lava, flames would surge up.
Goliath liked this sensation.
There was the occasional problem of intruders trying to kill him, but he would simply crush them with his magic.
Suddenly, Goliath’s gaze shifted to the volcano’s crater.
A gigantic turtle, whose shell was the volcano itself, stood as a gatekeeper, displaying its overwhelming presence.
From some point on, the volcanic turtle accepted Goliath as a guest enjoying the lava hot springs and allowed him to invade its territory.
[Fine. I’m not interested in your tastes. Can we now talk about ‘that matter’?]
Until recently, Goliath had been living excitedly, running across the sea or defeating monsters.
So the Golden Sheep could finally bring up the topic it had hesitated to discuss.
“Ahn Woo-jin?”
[Yes. What are you planning to do about the one chosen by the ‘Golden Sheep of Space’?]
“…I was getting bored.”
His deep voice, like the growl of a tiger, echoed in the lava hot spring.
“Finally, something interesting has come up! I should have some fun…!”
Goliath grinned widely, pointing his finger upwards at the Golden Sheep.
“I will watch him! And! Wait for the fight until he’s ripe! That is my perfect plan…!”
Goliath’s golden eyes burned with a competitive spirit.
[Perfect plan indeed….]
The Golden Sheep sighed silently.
Goliath was a man who hated using his brain.
Given his exceptional combat abilities, he rarely needed to think. After all, if the body is strong, the mind can be at ease.
However, when it came to a ‘plan,’ Goliath was serious. Serious enough to use his brain.
So the Golden Sheep didn’t want to argue with Goliath’s ‘perfect plan.’
[As expected of you….]
The Other Golden Sheep.
The Golden Sheep of Space had chosen Ahn Woo-jin.
There were entities derived from the Golden Sheep.
One of them was itself.
And another, the Golden Sheep of Space.
It was superior to itself, essentially a true avatar of the Golden Sheep.
Ultimately, Ahn Woo-jin, who received authority from the Golden Sheep of Space, would threaten Goliath’s title of ‘strongest.’
Yet, Goliath had no intention of crushing Ahn Woo-jin’s potential.
The title of strongest meant nothing to Goliath.
He just… like a child growing their first plant, looked forward to Ahn Woo-jin’s growth, hoping he would ‘grow well!’
Despite the Golden Sheep granting its authority to Goliath, it still couldn’t fully understand him.
“My body itches…!”
Goliath eventually left the lava hot spring.
When his bare feet touched the blackened lava, it sizzled, emitting heat and flames.
As he shook off the lava clinging to him, his massive, muscular body was fully revealed.
“Prepare yourself, Golden Sheep!”
Goliath shouted boldly.
“I need trash to alleviate this boredom until Ahn Woo-jin grows stronger…!”
[Put on some clothes first.]
“I don’t need them!”
Goliath ran around the volcano naked, defeating lava monsters with his bare fists.
However, he didn’t touch the volcano’s guardian, the volcanic turtle, as they had become friends.
* * *
In my dream, a girl I’d never seen approached and hugged me. I felt warmth.
At that moment, I realized.
This was a dream.
A wet dream?
No, it felt different.
Suddenly, Oh Baek-seo appeared beside me, exuding a murderous aura, asking who the girl was.
I quickly answered that I didn’t know her.
“Really don’t know…. Oh?”
The constant stream of excuses finally brought my consciousness back from the dream to reality.
Weak sunlight filtered through the window, illuminating the room. The sun had not fully risen yet, leaving a lingering twilight.
Today was the weekend.
Despite that, I woke up quite early.
“Hmm?”
My body felt uncomfortable, as if something was binding me.
Although I woke up from the dream, my body still felt warm.
I felt a soft, embarrassing sensation pressing against my body.
I turned my head to the side.
“…Sss.”
“…….”
For some reason….
A girl with long golden hair and a white dress was hugging me, breathing softly in her sleep.
I stopped breathing for a while.
A storm of intense confusion swept through my mind, causing me to forget how to breathe.
Eventually, I regained my composure.
‘Who is she!?’
Crash!
I quickly got out of bed and warily eyed the golden-haired girl. Fortunately, a black short staff was nearby.
Swish! I swung the staff, extending the rod made of the Iron Dragon’s armor inside. It was the Iron Dragon Rod.
“Who are you?”
I asked in a threatening tone typical of the Disciplinary Committee, keeping a poker face.
“…A noisy teddy bear in the morning.”
The girl spoke in an elegant tone like an old person, despite having a noble voice.
Did she treat me like a teddy bear and sleep while hugging me?
“Yawn.”
The girl sat up and yawned leisurely.
She looked at me with golden eyes.
“…An intruder?”
Our living area was especially monitored by numerous security robots, and in addition, Baek-seo and I had our security drones patrolling.
If an intruder appeared, the alarm would have sounded loudly.
But.
‘The alarm didn’t go off.’
It was quiet.

chapters.title: Chapter 45.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 45 (Continued)
Did the girl use some unique ability?
Moreover… why would an intruder sleep while hugging me?
Questions swirled in my mind.
“Threatening me with a stick? You’re an ungrateful one.”
The girl clicked her tongue, shook her head, and shrugged her shoulders.
I couldn’t understand what favor I owed her.
“Well, let’s talk about that later. I need more sleep. Proper sleep is essential for good skin care, you know?”
“……?”
The girl babbled nonsense and then slipped back under the blanket, taking the spot where I had been lying.
With a unique exclamation reminiscent of a sheep’s bleat, her expression melted with satisfaction.
“Baa… It’s warm since you heated it up…. It’s heavenly….”
…Is she kidding?
“Get up.”
My voice was icy.
Magic stirred.
It seemed my magic circuits had fully recovered while I was asleep.
I decided to deal firmly with the uninvited guest.
Sizzle!
Green-blue lightning magic sparked on the Iron Dragon Rod.
“If you stay put until I count to three, I will consider it a trespass and execute a citizen’s arrest.”
“…….”
“One.”
“…….”
“Two.”
“Grr, you’re a troublesome one! I’ll come out, jeez…!”
Sensing my aggressive magic, the girl hastily got out from under the blanket, her tone becoming childish as she abandoned her elderly speech pattern.
She stood facing me.
“Look.”
With a stern face, the girl extended her index finger upwards.
Then, there was a cracking sound as something that shouldn’t split, split.
Whirr.
An alien-like gate formed in the air above the girl’s index finger.
“What?”
I was stunned.
It was unmistakably my unique ability. The sensation of magic felt the same.
It was undoubtedly the space ability I had used.
“I am a wanderer from another dimension. The owner of your ability. The one who bestowed the power upon you.”
The girl said grandly, stringing together impressive titles, though her golden hair was disheveled, making her look unimpressive.
“And using your terms, I am another ‘Golden Sheep.’”
Sizzle….
The lightning magic on the Iron Dragon Rod faded away.
For now….
“…I’ll ask for confirmation.”
“Go ahead.”
“Are you perhaps delusional?”
“I don’t suffer from delusions…. You! After seeing this, do you still think I’m a fool!?”
The girl’s face turned red with indignation.
……
After listening to the girl’s story,
“To summarize…, you are another Golden Sheep born from the original Golden Sheep.”
“Correct.”
“And while staying in another dimension, you could come to this world because I awakened my unique ability?”
“Precisely.”
By then, the girl was munching on some potato chips she had found somewhere.
“To be exact, your unique ability originates from my authority. I chose you. Originally, unique abilities develop postnatally.”
…What?
“Did I just hear a secret of this world nonchalantly?”
“Don’t be silly. It’s common knowledge, isn’t it?”
The girl answered nonchalantly.
No, seriously.
Was she saying that unique abilities develop postnatally, not innately?
It was a statement that could upend academic theories.
“Well, be happy. I, the great one, chose you.”
With an arrogant tone,
the girl, who hadn’t bothered to tidy her disheveled hair, continued eating potato chips.
Whether unique abilities developed innately or postnatally wasn’t something to dwell on right now.
So, moving on.
“…Why did you choose me?”
I crossed my arms, leaned against the wall, and looked at the girl.
Meanwhile, I tried to evoke the crack she had formed but still felt nothing.
“Because your magic was exceptionally pure. It was the most enchanting among anyone in this world. Only with such pure magic could you use space abilities.”
I had trained in Goliath’s magic cultivation method, practicing even more diligently than he had as a child. Thanks to that, my magic was nearly 100% purified.
“I was drawn to you from the start and chose you.”
The girl pointed at me with her crumb-covered finger, her face full of pride, expecting me to be impressed.
“So, I bestowed my authority upon you, stuck by your side, and waited for you to reach at least a basic level…!”
Her voice held a refined grandiosity that didn’t match her sharp cat-like eyes.
“…Like a stalker?”
“I warn you. If you call me that nonsense title again, it will not end well.”
The girl replied smoothly and eloquently, in a firm tone.
Ignoring her.
“Does that mean the original Golden Sheep could intervene in living beings’ unique abilities?”
“You could think of it that way. Though the original one doesn’t seem interested in such matters.”
“Is there anyone else with a similar case?”
“There’s one more. The one who invaded my space last time.”
She was referring to Goliath.
It was the incident when the Blessing of the Golden Sheep manifested.
“That guy also has another Golden Sheep. We each have our authority and exist individually. Though not as capable as me.”
The girl licked the chip seasoning off her fingers, created a crack in the air, and threw the chip bag inside.
So my unique ability could be used as a trash bin too.
It seemed to have limitless, albeit trivial, uses.
“Anyway, the one who chose that guy has the appearance of a goat monster.”
The girl mimicked goat horns with her hands on either side of her head.
“If I were to be born as a human, why choose such a monstrous appearance? Tsk….”
So, the one who granted Goliath his unique ability was another Golden Sheep derived from the original.
And they existed as separate entities with their own bodies, lives, and souls.
‘Is that why his ability was called the Blessing of the Golden Sheep?’
If Goliath could converse with his unique ability’s owner like I could now,
it made sense how he could explain the Blessing of the Golden Sheep.
‘In the game, I thought it was just a figurative expression.’
I thought it was a term used to elevate the prestige of Goliath, the strongest in the game,
by attributing his ability to the divine Golden Sheep, like ‘Zeus’s Lightning’ or ‘Prometheus’s Fire.’
‘It was a literal blessing from the Golden Sheep.’
It was exactly as stated.
“And just to clarify.”
The girl approached me and looked up at me.
She was much shorter than Baek-seo.
About 140 cm, maybe close to 150 cm.
Her golden hair was still disheveled.
“Don’t ask me about the hole or the Golden Sheep’s will.”
“Why?”
“I was born after the Golden Sheep passed through ‘The Hole,’ and we are now separate entities. I know almost nothing. But I can say this for sure.”
The girl grabbed my wrist and lifted it, opening my palm and supporting my hand.
Sss.
‘Huh?’
A profound sensation washed over me like a tsunami, enveloping my entire body.
The sensation coursed through my magic circuits and eventually surged up to my palm.
Crack!
“!”
Above our palms, a crack appeared in the air.
The crack was dark and mysterious.
It looked dangerous, as if it shouldn’t be touched, yet it radiated an enchanting light.
The girl smiled and said,
“I will grant you the power to control space.”
At that moment, I realized the true nature of my ability.
Unique Ability: Space Domination.
The basic ability was to connect spaces at will.
My eyes widened, and my lips curled up slightly.
I had been unable to use my unique ability and had been frustrated by the lack of sensation, but now I felt pure joy.
“…That’s cool.”
Realizing that I had awakened a new power, a wave of delight finally hit me.

chapters.title: Chapter 46.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 46 – Rule 19. The Leader Tests His Unique Ability (3)
“Good reaction.”
The girl nodded with a satisfied expression.
I couldn’t help but be delighted.
After all, I had finally obtained the unique ability I had long desired.
“What’s your name?”
I asked, looking at the girl.
Her long golden hair fluttered in the gentle breeze created by the crack.
Since it seemed like we would be seeing each other often, it was better to exchange names.
“I don’t have a name.”
“You don’t?”
“Hmm, maybe I should come up with one now….”
The girl stroked her chin thoughtfully, then spoke as if she had an idea.
“Since I’m a Golden Sheep…”
With a flourish, she tossed her hair over her shoulder and placed her thumb and index finger under her chin.
“Call me ‘Geumyang’!”
She said this with a confident smile and a glint of pride in her eyes.
She seemed very pleased with the name, thinking her sense of naming was excellent.
‘Geumyang…’
“Why the face?”
“The name is a bit…”
I couldn’t bring myself to say it was corny.
Geumyang glared at me with sharp eyes.
“You dare not understand the supreme naming sense of mine…?”
“The name feels strong and charismatic. It’s pretty good.”
“Hmm?”
“The more I think about it, the better it sounds.”
“Oh.”
I couldn’t argue with her about a name she liked.
As I uttered a white lie, Geumyang’s face gradually brightened.
She wiped under her nose with her finger, nodding in satisfaction.
“Hmm… You do know something.”
Geumyang puffed up with pride.
It was clear that despite her grandiosity, she carried no real weight.
“Alright, then.”
As Geumyang removed her hand from mine, the crack condensed into a line and vanished.
At the same time, the sensation of activating my unique ability faded away completely.
“Did the sensation disappear…?”
The feeling of having something and then losing it was disconcerting.
“You may have reached the minimum threshold, but you overused your spatial abilities right from the start. That likely caused severe side effects. It’s not surprising the sensation vanished.”
“So I lacked the capacity?”
“Yes, it’s proof that you haven’t yet grown enough to properly use spatial abilities.”
That was something I hadn’t considered.
“Anyway, my unique ability is still intact?”
“Of course.”
Her clear answer eased my concerns.
I could finally be at peace.
“By the way…, kiddo? I have a question.”
‘Kiddo?’
Thinking about it, if Geumyang’s story was true, she was much older than me.
I decided not to argue.
“What is it?”
“Ahem!”
Geumyang covered her mouth with her fist and cleared her throat.
“Well…”
She put a hand to her mouth and cautiously asked,
“Did Luffy become the Pirate King…?”
Luffy?
Oh.
“You mean One Piece?”
“Yes, that’s it!”
One Piece.
The manga about a man named Luffy on his journey to become the Pirate King.
“It was discontinued.”
“What?”
“The world went to hell. The author’s whereabouts are unknown now. It’s an old story.”
I shrugged as I answered.
A brief silence followed.
Thud. Geumyang slumped to the ground.
Her face showed utter despair.
“So this is what despair feels like….”
An existence some called a god.
The Golden Sheep tasted despair for the first time.
……
To test my unique ability, we decided to move to another location.
Geumyang and I headed to a training facility in Neo Seoul. It was a commercial establishment where you could rent a spacious private training room, ensuring privacy.
Originally, Geumyang said she could traverse spaces and move to the training facility instantly.
But she wanted to explore Neo Seoul, so we walked along the roads. Since it had been a while since she set foot in this world, I understood.
Geumyang’s usual attire was a white dress, so I lent her my clothes. Because of our size difference, she ended up wearing an oversized coat, which draped loosely down to her elbows.
She couldn’t even wear my pants as they didn’t fit.
“I wanted to wear a uniform too…”
She muttered wistfully, glancing at me.
Was she asking me to buy her a uniform?
“We can talk about that later.”
I didn’t have the funds for it at the moment. Besides, I was eager to test my unique ability.
We arrived at the training facility and rented a private training room.
It was quite spacious.
It seemed to be worth the price.
Since it was my first time here, I didn’t expect it to be this good.
In the center of the training room.
Geumyang and I stood facing each other closely.
“Come to think of it, you said you’ve been sticking around me?”
“Yes.”
“Have you been watching my every move?”
I asked while checking the state of the Iron Dragon Staff.
If what Geumyang said was true, she might have been spying on my entire private life.
“Yes. From when you were little, being held by a robot. I was watching only you.”
Hmm.
I see.

chapters.title: Chapter 46.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 46 (Continued)
That’s a long time….
“Well, then. If there’s nothing special, let’s quickly test my unique ability….”
“If you’re worried about me finding videos of older women in mating boxes, don’t worry. I’ve long realized that such things cause strong embarrassment when spoken aloud.”
“I want to die.”
Someone please strangle me.
Any image I had built was meaningless in front of Geumyang from the start.
“You mustn’t die. Now, then.”
Geumyang chuckled and extended her hand to me.
“Kiddo, give me your hand.”
“?”
What kind of treatment is this…?
“You’re experiencing side effects now, so you can’t use your unique ability. You need to hold my hand to use it like before.”
She seemed to be referring to the time when she made a crack appear over my hand, saying she would let me control space.
“Any physical contact will do, but hands are the most convenient.”
“When will these side effects go away?”
“Usually within a day. But you’ve been in a state of magic depletion recently, haven’t you?”
“When magic is depleted, does it prevent side effects from recovering too?”
Geumyang nodded.
“Most problems related to magic work that way. The reason I couldn’t appear before was because you were in that state.”
So at least for today, I had to touch her to use my unique ability through her.
I quietly extended my hand and took Geumyang’s hand. It was smooth and small.
A question suddenly came to mind.
“Wait. Then not being able to use my unique ability now isn’t a penalty?”
“That’s already passed. You just couldn’t feel it because you were in a state of magic depletion.”
“?”
It’s already passed?
“Penalties from spatial abilities affect the magic circuits.”
“So if I’m in a state of magic depletion, I won’t experience the penalties?”
“No, the penalties accumulate until you experience them. When your magic returns, you will fully experience the accumulated penalties.”
“Then?”
“I transferred the penalties you were supposed to endure to myself. Do you think I hugged you for no reason?”
Transferred the penalties.
In other words, Geumyang absorbed the penalties I was supposed to experience through the act of hugging.
So, touching Geumyang is the condition for transferring penalties?
“And, the spatial ability is originally my authority! I don’t experience penalties!”
“Then what exactly is my penalty?”
“Well, your unique ability will return tomorrow, so you’ll experience it then. I’m sure you won’t be able to resist seeking my embrace.”
I wasn’t sure what the penalty was exactly, but…
‘Will it hurt terribly?’
A sense of foreboding crept over me.
At that moment,
Sss.
‘Oh, it works.’
Once again, I felt the sensation of my unique ability flowing through me. Raising my hand to control it, a crack formed in the air with a ‘crack.’
Whirr.
A gentle, warm breeze flowed from the crack, ruffling mine and Geumyang’s hair.
“By the way, I should mention.”
“What?”
“I can no longer exert significant power in this world. I have already transferred my authority to you. I can only fully utilize my abilities in my labyrinth, beyond space.”
In short, Geumyang was saying she was weak in this world.
“Keep that in mind. Today’s training is not your full power.”
“Got it.”
After that, Geumyang taught me the first form of the unique ability, Space Control.
‘Spatial Leap.’
It involved creating a crack that linked two points.
By crossing the crack, you could move to the other side.
‘I can’t get the hang of this.’
It was incredibly difficult to precisely set the location where the crack would appear.
‘Geumyang called it ‘coordinate setting.’
As a result, I kept leaping to unintended locations instead of the designated ones.
Sometimes, I even ended up outside the training facility.
Geumyang explained that the feeling of setting coordinates and leaping would become more proficient the more I used the magic formula.
Sweat poured down my body like rain. Setting coordinates, creating cracks, and leaping through them was not just challenging but also painful.
It felt like using muscles I had never used before at the gym for the first time.
Thus, I practiced spatial leaping repeatedly within the training room.
Sweat also flowed from my hand, clasped with Geumyang’s.
However, rather than letting go of the slippery hand, Geumyang interlocked her fingers with mine, ensuring a firmer grip. She didn’t want my concentration to break.
After a day of holding hands and training, the sky beyond the window had turned dark.
“Huff, huff….”
As I collapsed to the floor, panting heavily, Geumyang let go of my hand. The sensation of the spatial ability flowing through my body vanished as if a light had been turned off.
Geumyang sat on my abdomen, her weight providing a moderate sense of pressure.
“Are you exhausted?”
“A little rest should do…”
Under the light, Geumyang’s sharp eyes looked down at me.
Amused by my exhausted state, her face carried a subtle smile.
“Why are you laughing?”
“Because you look quite funny collapsed like that.”
“……”
Was she teasing me?
Geumyang turned her head forward and closed her eyes with a smile.
“Well, that’s enough for today.”
“I could do this all day.”
“Rest for now. You can train properly with your own abilities tomorrow. Excessive use of magic today isn’t a wise choice.”
“…I suppose you’re right.”
Indeed.
Using my abilities directly without relying on Geumyang would yield better results.
So.
‘It’s better to train properly tomorrow. Holding her hand all the time is a bit awkward anyway.’
I propped myself up on my elbows and slowly raised my upper body. As my balance shifted, Geumyang opened her eyes and looked down at me.
“Are you getting up?”
“How about we get some dinner?”
“Dinner… I don’t have any particular cravings. But yes, proper nutrition and energy intake are essential. Let’s go.”
Geumyang replied indifferently.
‘Does she not have much of an appetite?’
That question vanished once we ordered udon at the restaurant.
“What heavenly taste is this…!”
“It’s just regular udon.”
“This is the first time I’ve tasted something so delicious in my life!! How is this flavor so exquisitely savory?”
Geumyang’s eyes sparkled, and her cheeks flushed as she got excited.
When Geumyang arrived in this world, it was after the Pacific Hole had formed and before Neo Seoul was established.
She had likely only had snacks and simple foods.
She had probably never tasted proper cooking.
Hence, her reaction was unexpectedly intense.
‘Thank goodness there are no other customers.’
It was late, so we were the only ones in the restaurant.
Watching Geumyang’s enthusiastic reaction to the udon, I couldn’t help but smile.
Ah, she really is from another world.
“This crispy exterior and juicy inside… What is this fierce dish!?”
“Ah… that is called ‘chicken’.”
“Chicken…!”
The owner, sensing Geumyang’s intense reaction, answered with a smile.
The owner had dropped out of the academy and opened a restaurant, becoming an adult last year. He seemed to think Geumyang’s expression of ‘chicken being delicious’ was her way of complimenting him.
‘Is this her first time eating chicken?’
From our earlier conversation, it seemed Geumyang had never eaten cooked food. Naturally, she had never tasted freshly fried chicken.
Finally, after trying all the side dishes, Geumyang closed her eyes, savoring the pleasant aftertaste.
“This is what happiness feels like…. I am happy to be in this world….”
Leaning back in her chair, patting her stomach contentedly, Geumyang smiled, her body seeming to melt like slime.
In the morning, her prickly personality had been troubling, but now she seemed endearing.
“Let’s head back if you’re done eating.”
“Indeed. I look forward to tomorrow….”
She seemed to be eagerly anticipating what she would eat tomorrow.
We went into an alley, and Geumyang created a crack to transport us directly to my room.
‘These abilities are amazing.’
Geumyang said goodbye and disappeared into space.
Maybe because I was so exhausted,
I fell asleep immediately after washing up.
* * *
The next day.
Training facility.
“Argh!!”
As a result of overusing my spatial control, I experienced excruciating pain as if my magic circuits were burning.
However, when Geumyang slipped into my arms and hugged me, the pain from the penalty miraculously subsided rapidly.
______________

Novel Updates
to motivate me translate more chapters.

chapters.title: Chapter 47.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 47 – Rule 19. The Leader Tests His Unique Ability (4)
A few hours before experiencing the penalty.
We rented the training room again.
“Alright, let’s continue from yesterday!”
Geumyang placed her hands on her hips and puffed out her chest, shouting confidently. She was still wearing the oversized coat she borrowed from me, which hung loosely down to her elbows.
Crack!
Geumyang created a crack in the air.
The gentle breeze from the crack softly ruffled her golden hair.
“This crack only allows inanimate objects to pass through. Only those with the Golden Sheep’s authority can pass through it if they are living beings. If you were thinking of trapping enemies in isolated spaces, it won’t work.”
“I see. That’s unfortunate…”
So, the reason Goliath’s fist passed through the crack was because he had the Golden Sheep’s authority.
It wouldn’t be possible to use this ability for a cheap win against other enemies.
“And as you might have guessed, you’re currently a makeshift ‘Tier 6’.”
Geumyang pointed at me.
“You have the skills to reach Tier 6, but because of your unique ability, it took quite a while.”
I had already realized this during my battle with Han Seo-jin.
At that time, I used both my unique ability and elemental power in synergy.
That was a Tier 6 technique.
“I can feel it.”
Since yesterday, I’ve felt it.
My body now overflowed with more magic than ever before.
It was as if the blockage had been cleared as soon as my unique ability blossomed.
A torrent of magic began to surge through my magic circuits.
At this rate, I could expect faster growth compared to others. Like a cheetah entering a race and overtaking all the other competitors despite a late start.
However,
“I’m still not sure about Tier 6. Shouldn’t I be able to spew elemental power like a fountain at that level?”
By Tier 6, one should be able to release elemental power at will without the need for a magic tool.
But I could only release a small amount of elemental power. It seemed too trivial for a Tier 6.
“That’s why I said you’re a makeshift Tier 6, kid.”
Geumyang folded her arms and smirked arrogantly.
“From ‘kiddo’ to ‘kid’ now, huh…”
“‘Kiddo’ seemed too dismissive. If you put in the effort, your titles might evolve too, so keep striving.”
Obviously, I didn’t have much desire for those titles.
“Anyway, you’re already at the threshold. It means you can use elemental power alongside your spatial ability!”
“I have a question. I once used ‘Spatial Leap’ to amplify my lightning power.”
It was when I blocked Han Seo-jin’s necromancy, Requiem.
At that time, I created a crack in the air and unleashed a powerful lightning bolt.
“I managed to do it instinctively in the heat of the moment… How can I do that again?”
“There’s no need for an explanation. You’ll figure it out when you try it yourself today.”
Geumyang answered nonchalantly.
“Really?”
Well, if she says so.
Let’s try it.
“Alright, let’s get started! Go ahead.”
After a full night’s sleep, the sensation from my battle with Han Seo-jin began to wrap around my magic circuits again.
It was different from simply feeling in good condition. It felt like I had acquired a new body.
‘I feel light.’
To use a common metaphor, it felt like I could fly.
More clearly than yesterday, I realized I had ascended to a higher level.
“Phew.”
I took a deep breath, closed my eyes, and focused on the mystical sensation flowing within me.
My lower abdomen roared fiercely, and my magic circuits carried magic more vigorously than usual.
I channeled the magic according to my will and released it forward, not as lightning magic.
Crack!
A crack appeared before me, forming a mysterious gate.
“Oh.”
An involuntary exclamation escaped my lips.
Unique Ability: Space Domination.
Magic Formula Form 1: Spatial Leap.
Uniquely, Space Domination varied in its usage conditions depending on the magic formula, and Magic Formula Form 1 had no particular trigger.
I could simply create a crack whenever I wanted.
As I stepped into the gate, nothing solid met my foot. I threw myself forward.
My body floated weightlessly, and my vision was filled with an endless corridor of an otherworldly hue.
The surroundings were entirely the color of a dark blue night sky.
I could also see black streams flowing like currents along the strange walls.
─ ‘The space between cracks created by Spatial Leap is a wormhole.’
I recalled what Geumyang said yesterday.
This was the wormhole created by my ability.
─ ‘Never stay there longer than necessary. You will lose your senses first, and then you will lose yourself.’
Geumyang had warned me sternly. This wormhole was quite dangerous.
However,
‘Something feels different from yesterday.’
Perhaps because I was now using my ability entirely on my own.
It felt completely different from the countless times I passed through the wormhole yesterday.
‘I can sense the magic. I couldn’t feel it yesterday.’
The magic circulating in the wormhole felt strangely like my own.
Sizzle!
For an experiment, I extended my finger and conjured lightning magic.
It was a simple technique made possible after reaching Tier 6.
At that moment.
Crack!
“!”
A streak of green-blue current extended and ran along the circular wall of the wormhole, absorbing the black currents like small fish caught in a whirlpool.
However, it gradually grew larger, absorbing the black currents—no, the magic.
Eventually, the green-blue lightning, now containing the black light, grew to the size of my body.
It reached its limit and ceased expanding.
The enlarged lightning magic shot around wildly, imprinting flashes in my vision, and finally condensed into a point, stabilizing.
The lightning magic eventually became a sphere, floating around.
‘So that’s how it was.’
I understood why my lightning magic had amplified during my fight with Han Seo-jin.
Whoooom!
‘Ah.’
Suddenly, a chilling sensation ran down my spine, pulling me into fear.
My survival instinct screamed that I needed to get out of here immediately.
‘Let’s get out.’
I set a coordinate at the desired point (though it wasn’t exactly where I intended), creating another crack.
Crack!
Whirr.
A crack formed somewhere in the wormhole.
Instantly, the lightning magic floating in the air was sucked into the new crack, like air moving from high pressure to low pressure.
Boom!!
A deafening roar echoed as the lightning magic surged through the new crack.
‘Wait…!’
My heart sank. I might have created a crack in the wrong place and caused unintended harm.
I swam swiftly through the air and passed through the new crack.
I arrived at a point in the training room.
However, it was quite high up.
“Whoa!”
Whirr!
My body fell straight to the ground.
Thud!
I had hastily reinforced my body with magic to minimize the impact, but I still felt like my insides had been shaken up.
“Phew…”
I wiped the cold sweat from my brow and raised my upper body.
I looked down.
Right in front of me was a scorch mark on the ground, roughly the size of a person, with smoke rising from it. Luckily, no one was there.
Soon, the crack I had created closed.
So, this is how it feels…
“Kid.”
Geumyang approached and crouched down in front of me, meeting my gaze. Her sharp eyes and haughty expression focused on me.
Given Geumyang’s height, I wasn’t sure who the real “kid” was here…
‘Careless.’
Her smooth legs and surprisingly large chest, pressed against her thighs, made their presence known.
She wore the oversized coat loosely and had no pants on.

chapters.title: Chapter 47.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 47 (Continued)
My eyes, maintaining gentlemanly manners, shifted to the side to avoid staring directly at her.
“Now you understand how to apply elemental magic?”
“Yeah… I can use the magic within the wormhole.”
“Yes, that’s the application of the wormhole. Magic amplification. The lightning strike you performed using the crack is your own technique, so it’s best to name it.”
Huh?
My eyes turned to Geumyang’s golden eyes.
“Is there no established magic formula for this?”
“Well, attaching names is just part of defining the concept systematically. Magic formulas are something humans invented to establish a systematic understanding, aren’t they?”
“That’s true.”
Even Baek-seo attached her own techniques to magic formulas.
In this world, many people share similar unique abilities.
In such cases, they mostly follow already established magic formulas.
But if there’s no such concept, I could create my own magic formula.
‘…This is exciting.’
The idea of naming my new technique myself.
As a man, my heart pulsed with excitement.
“Heh, are you excited over something like this? You really are a kid.”
“What?”
Geumyang glared at me with an odd smile.
Did I fail to keep my expression neutral?
I thought I was being careful.
“Was it obvious on my face?”
I shrugged and asked honestly. There was nothing to hide from Geumyang, who had been watching me all along.
Geumyang shook her head.
“Not really. I’ve just watched you for so long that I can tell. Can you distinguish the expressions of a lizard you see for the first time?”
Geumyang shrugged and answered calmly.
“……”
Now it was my turn to glare at Geumyang.
Why compare herself to a lizard when she had a human body?
Her arrogance was palpable.
“Let’s continue. We’ll review what we did yesterday.”
As Geumyang stood up and extended her hand, I took it and stood up. She then distanced herself from me.
Unlike yesterday, now that I was using my unique ability directly, the sensation of Spatial Leap felt much clearer.
Recalling the lightning strike I had performed earlier fueled my enthusiasm.
‘Alright, let’s do this.’
With an uncontrollable smile at the corners of my mouth, I channeled my bubbling enthusiasm into practice.
A few hours later.
It was evening.
“Uh…?”
Suddenly, I felt screwed.
An urgent sensation like a cramp shot up my spine.
“Urgh!”
The magic I was wielding abruptly subsided, and intense pain erupted in my magic circuits.
It wasn’t a fleeting pain.
It didn’t stop.
“Grrr…!”
I curled up and clenched my teeth.
Instinctively, I knew.
This was the penalty.
Having repeatedly used Spatial Leap, the penalty had finally hit.
The sensation of my insides burning and an unbearable scream escaped me. It felt like I might die from the pain.
Powerful unique abilities come with equally powerful penalties.
If the usage conditions of a unique ability are stringent, the penalties are mitigated, but since my ability had no specific conditions…
“Arghhhh!”
I couldn’t maintain my sanity.
But my consciousness remained sharp, fully registering the pain, as if cheering me on, saying, “You can endure this!” It was infuriating.
As I writhed in agony, unable to speak, Geumyang suddenly approached and hugged me.
Wrapping her arms around my waist, she closed her eyes and held me tight.
“What…?”
The pain subsided dramatically.
As if the hellish torment moments ago had been a lie, the pain vanished completely.
“Are you feeling better?”
Geumyang’s elegant voice echoed from my embrace.
“Yeah… I suddenly feel okay.”
“Remember, that pain is the cost of using your ability.”
With her chin resting on my chest, Geumyang looked up at me and spoke softly. Her squished cheeks made her look like a hamster.
A different kind of cuteness contrasted with her usual arrogant and sharp-eyed demeanor.
“When the magic circuits fail to handle the overload, they rebel. When magic flows through them, it causes excruciating pain, like being stabbed at a cellular level or set on fire. As long as you’re human, you can’t escape this price.”
I finally understood the part of her explanation from yesterday that I hadn’t comprehended.
The favor I owed Geumyang.
It seemed to be her taking on my penalty when my magic circuits recovered.
“When you hug me, the penalty transfers to you?”
I asked, looking down at her to confirm.
“That’s right. Specifically, as long as we’re in close contact, the pain disappears. For minor penalties, simple physical contact is enough to alleviate the pain. So, don’t worry.”
Eventually, Geumyang moved away from me.
The pain had completely disappeared.
‘So, without her, I’d have to endure hellish pain.’
Sweat trickled down my cheek.
The pain earlier wasn’t something I could endure with sheer willpower.
Of course, if I somehow endured it, the penalty might pass safely, but the thought of enduring such pain was unthinkable.
It would undoubtedly take a mental toll.
“Phew…”
Thud.
Although the pain was gone, I felt drained and collapsed onto the floor, lying down to catch my breath.
Geumyang sat on my abdomen. Since she wasn’t heavy, I ignored her and stared at the ceiling.
“You did well, kid. It’s best to rest now. The penalty means you overdid it.”
“Not just eager for dinner?”
“You dare think I value dinner over your training?”
Her response was like reading a textbook.
She was transparent.
I had already informed Baek-seo via messenger that I’d be having dinner out tonight. Time to eat comfortably.
“Fine. I’m hungry too. Let’s go.”
“Well, if you insist, let’s go!”
I took the begrudgingly following Geumyang to a kimchi stew restaurant.
“This is what happiness feels like…”
Predictably, Geumyang reacted as expected.
* * *
In the darkened house of Ahn Woo-jin.
His neighbor, Oh Baek-seo, unlocked the door and entered.
Turning on the lights, she found the house empty and quiet.
Baek-seo placed the pancakes she had made on the kitchen table, covering them with another dish.
[ I made extra, so I brought some. Eat when you’re hungry ^_^ ]
Leaving a note on the table, she put various fruits and milk in the fridge, thinking of Woo-jin’s nutrition.
Woo-jin had mentioned he would be busy this weekend, saying he needed to test his unique ability now that his magic circuits had recovered.
“Hmm.”
Imagining Woo-jin excited about testing his unique ability made Baek-seo smile.
At school this week, Woo-jin had tried to hide his excitement about his unique ability, and seeing that had made Baek-seo smile warmly.
To her, Woo-jin was already an adorable man who had surpassed her limits of cuteness.
“Hmm?”
Just as Baek-seo was about to leave Woo-jin’s house.
She noticed a long hair on the floor and picked it up.
A strand of light golden hair.
It was a woman’s.
“……”
The smile lingering on Baek-seo’s lips slowly faded.

chapters.title: Chapter 48.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 48 – Rule 20. The Leader Relies on the Vice Leader (1)
I rode the rift created by Geumyang to my home.
‘Amazing.’
I was astonished at how such precise coordinate settings were possible.
Teleporting from the training ground to my home was still beyond my capabilities. Even short-range teleportation was not something I could do freely.
“Thank you.”
“You’re welcome. But kid, I need to wash up.”
Huh?
“Didn’t you wash up yesterday?”
“I have a spring in my labyrinth, so I can wash there. But I prefer to wash with warm water here.”
“Don’t undress here.”
“Why not?”
I firmly stopped Geumyang, who was taking off her top, revealing her slender abdomen.
In the end, I had to teach her how to undress and wash in the shower room.
Geumyang claimed she had learned all this by observing my daily life, clicking her tongue and saying, “You’re a fussy one.”
“I’ll emphasize it again: don’t expose yourself in front of others.”
“Ha, you’re something else…”
Geumyang smirked, closed her eyes, and shrugged her shoulders, seemingly more troubled than I was.
“I do have that level of common sense. But kid, aren’t we practically one and the same? It shouldn’t matter if I undress in front of you…”
“Don’t undress in front of me either.”
“?”
“I’ll leave new clothes here. Wash up and come out.”
“Alright, fine. What a bother.”
Perhaps tired of persuading me, Geumyang reluctantly agreed and went into the shower room.
After washing up, Geumyang came out wearing a white T-shirt. Since it was my shirt, it was oversized, covering her groin with the hem.
“Whew…”
She plopped down on the sofa with a wet towel around her neck.
The living room became humid, and the scent of shampoo and body wash wafted from Geumyang.
She smiled contentedly as if melting away.
“I feel refreshed…”
When you look closely, she has her cute moments.
“I’m going to wash up too.”
“Hey, come here for a moment.”
“?”
“Closer.”
I approached Geumyang, leaned forward, and bowed my head. She placed her hand on top of my head.
Ssss.
A gentle magic flowed into me.
The fatigue built up in my magic circuits dissipated, bringing a sense of calm.
It was like receiving a massage that relieved my body’s fatigue.
‘Oh, what’s this?’
With the fatigue in my magic circuits gone, I felt no resistance to using my magic. It felt like the stiffness had eased.
“I feel less tired now…”
I said, rotating my shoulders and expressing my amazement.
A turquoise current flowed along the back of my hand.
The fatigue in my magic circuits was definitely gone.
“It’s similar to a healing spell. I’ll do it occasionally when you overwork yourself during training.”
“Thanks, whatever it is.”
“And.”
Geumyang pointed at me.
“From tomorrow, use teleportation to commute to school.”
A golden glint flashed in her eyes.
“Setting a small goal in your daily life and using your abilities frequently will help a lot. For example.”
Crack.
Geumyang created a small rift in the air and put her arm through it.
A rift appeared near the table, and her arm reached out and grabbed the remote control.
Swish! Geumyang pulled her arm out of the rift and closed it. The remote control was now in her hand.
“Like this. Especially for commuting, setting a destination and using your ability will be very beneficial.”
“That’s really convenient…”
“That’s what controlling space is all about.”
Geumyang answered with a triumphant smile.
“But you shouldn’t rely too much on your abilities.”
“Hmm…”
“Why? Is there a problem?”
Practicing teleportation was good, but…
‘Baek-seo is the issue.’
I often commuted with Baek-seo.
Even though I had been restraining myself lately due to the rumors among the disciplinary committee members, I still occasionally commuted with her.
‘Still… mastering my abilities should come first.’
I didn’t have to commute with her all the time.
I needed to set my priorities straight.
Well, I could show Baek-seo my unique ability and explain it to her.
“I was just thinking about something. I’ll do it.”
“Good.”
“By the way, can I introduce you to someone?”
Geumyang immediately gave me a suspicious look.
“…Are you talking about Oh Baek-seo?”
“You figured it out right away.”
Geumyang was someone I would have to be closely associated with, and she was essentially a ‘female.’ No, fundamentally, she wasn’t an ordinary person, so perhaps I should say a female creature. Anyway.
I wanted to introduce her to Baek-seo in advance to prevent any misunderstandings or conflicts.
“I don’t mind, but…”
“You look like you don’t like it.”
Geumyang made a distasteful face.
“Let’s postpone meeting her. I don’t really want to encounter her.”
“Why?”
“There are reasons.”
Why is that?
Could it be that she also has some shyness?
I nodded. It was important to respect the person’s wishes in such matters.
“Understood. Next time then.”
“Sure. If there’s nothing else, I’ll be going now.”
Feeling burdened by the thought of being introduced to someone, Geumyang quickly stood up from the sofa and looked at me.
“See you tomorrow.”
She waved her hand with a graceful farewell.
“Rest well.”
Crack!
Geumyang created a rift in the air and disappeared through it. The rift vanished right after.
She had returned to her labyrinth, her so-called ‘home.’
Silence returned to the house.
‘Maybe I should drink some water before washing up.’
I headed to the kitchen.
“?”

chapters.title: Chapter 48.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 48 (Continued)
A note was left on the table, along with a stack of plates.
[I made a bit too much, so I brought some over. Eat when you’re hungry ^_^]
Lifting the plate, I found some cold pancakes.
Although I had already eaten a late dinner and was quite full…
I couldn’t just leave the pancakes that Baek-seo had made for me.
Thud!
I put the cup down on the table, took out some milk, and poured it over the pancakes, then drizzled caramel sauce on top.
After that, I munched on the pancakes while chugging the milk.
“Delicious.”
Though cold, they were sweet.
There were also unfamiliar fruits in the fridge, likely brought over by Baek-seo when she visited.
I couldn’t take her kindness for granted, so I immediately took out my smartphone and sent her a text message.
[Ahn Woo-jin: Baek-seo]
[Ahn Woo-jin: Thanks, they’re delicious.]
[Ahn Woo-jin: (Emoticon of a dog giving a solemn thumbs up)]
While admiring Baek-seo’s profile picture in her hanbok, the phone vibrated with an incoming message.
[Oh Baek-seo: You must have had a hard time practicing.]
[Oh Baek-seo: Good job, Leader!]
[Oh Baek-seo: (Emoticon of a cat smiling brightly)]
[Oh Baek-seo: Enjoy the food, hehe.]
‘Ah…’
Just reading her messages was healing.
[Ahn Woo-jin: (Emoticon of a dog giving a solemn double thumbs up)]
[Oh Baek-seo: Hehe]
[Oh Baek-seo: And, Leader]
[Oh Baek-seo: Want to go to school together tomorrow?]
She brought it up at just the right time.
[Ahn Woo-jin: It’s going to be difficult for a while.]
[Oh Baek-seo: Why?]
[Ahn Woo-jin: You know my ability involves space manipulation, right?]
[Ahn Woo-jin: I’m planning to practice it while commuting for a while.]
[Oh Baek-seo: Is that so?]
[Oh Baek-seo: You’re really diligent.]
[Oh Baek-seo: Alright, hehe.]
“…?”
Was it my imagination?
There seemed to be a sudden chill in the message “Alright, hehe.” Maybe it was because the conversation ended so abruptly.
Since I conveyed what I needed to, it shouldn’t matter. Time to wash up…
‘…Maybe I should mention it too.’
Since we were already messaging, it seemed best to tell her ‘that thing’ before washing up.
[Ahn Woo-jin: Baek-seo]
[Oh Baek-seo: ?]
[Ahn Woo-jin: There’s someone I think I should introduce you to soon.]
[Ahn Woo-jin: It’s an important person.]
I was talking about Geumyang.
[Oh Baek-seo: An important person?]
[Oh Baek-seo: Hmm]
[Oh Baek-seo: Is it someone you really need to introduce to me?]
“What?”
What was that?
‘Isn’t the nuance a bit strange…?’
What did she mean?
Was she asking if it was necessary to introduce her to someone she didn’t know, or if it was someone important to her?
Baek-seo’s gentle question had a double meaning.
For example, when a friend insists on introducing someone you’re not particularly curious about, it can feel burdensome.
‘Maybe Baek-seo feels the same.’
Well, Baek-seo wouldn’t be an exception.
However, spending time with Geumyang might eventually cause misunderstandings with Baek-seo. I couldn’t let that happen to a girl I liked.
Strictly speaking, I wasn’t dating Baek-seo, but it was still an important issue for me.
Since Geumyang didn’t want to meet Baek-seo yet, I decided to just give her a heads up.
[Ahn Woo-jin: Probably]
I was firm in my resolve.
[Oh Baek-seo: Okay]
[Oh Baek-seo: I’ll wait then, hehe.]
‘She’s not asking who it is?’
I thought she would ask what kind of relationship it was.
Did she just assume we were friends?
‘Well, whatever. I guess she’s not interested.’
I didn’t overthink it.
It would require a long explanation to describe my relationship with Geumyang, so it was better if she didn’t ask.
…
“Huff…”
I wish someone would kill me.
Teleporting to school was incredibly tough.
I had to create a rift in a secluded place every time, repeat the process over a long distance, and sometimes the coordinates were off, causing me to fall.
The process of teleportation itself was hard enough, but with all the additional concerns, it was exhausting.
‘At least I managed to start from a somewhat convenient point…’
If I hadn’t taken the train and gotten off at a suitable location, it would have taken forever to reach Ahsung High School.
Anyway, I made it to Ahsung High School safely.
‘I did it…’
I felt like collapsing with relief.
Barely maintaining my composure as the Disciplinary Committee Leader, I passed through the school gate and went straight to the committee office, collapsing into a chair.
“Phew…”
I took a deep breath.
I felt like I could finally live again.
Sweat had drenched my back, so I’d have to use the academy’s shower later.
After school, I spent extra time teleporting multiple times to reach the private training ground.
Once there, I summoned Geumyang and trained. When I got home, exhaustion hit me hard, and I leaned against the wall, retching.
“Are you alright? You seem unsteady.”
“I feel like dying…”
It was a long day…
“You’ll get used to it gradually. Here, take my hand.”
Holding Geumyang’s hand, I managed to dispel the remaining penalties. Eventually, Geumyang returned to her labyrinth.
After catching my breath, I regained enough energy to move around.
“Time to wash up…”
I had already showered at the academy, but I was drenched in sweat again.
Now the sweat had dried, making me feel sticky.
It was a bit early, but I should wash up and go to bed.
“…”
I looked towards the shower room.
— ‘Setting small goals in daily life and using your abilities often will help you master them faster.’
Geumyang’s words suddenly came to mind.
“If it’s just the shower room…”
The shorter the distance, the easier it was to set coordinates. The shorter the wormhole, the easier it was to set the coordinates.
Anyway, I was in the living room.
‘At least when moving to another room, I should use teleportation.’
Frequent practice would certainly help improve my skills.
Crack!
I created a rift right in front of me.
The rift turned into a two-dimensional gate with an alien hue. I entered it and teleported.
Boom!
I landed on the desk in my room.
“Just made it…”
I couldn’t help but grin.
This is… fun.
Next.
I created a small rift and put my arm through it.
Coordinate set, inside the wardrobe.
Swish.
I rummaged inside the rift and pulled my arm out.
In my hand was a pair of underwear.
“Oh.”
That was impressive.
This much showed the results of my practice.
‘Next is the shower room.’
Crack!
Feeling confident, I created another rift and jumped in.
Boom!
“Ouch!”
The rift had formed quite a bit off the ground, causing me to fall on my butt.
But then I felt moisture on my skin.
A foggy mist was visible.
The sound of water pouring from the shower echoed.
I hadn’t turned on the water yet?
Swish! The rift closed.
When I looked up, I saw a naked woman’s back, washing under the shower.
Her enchanting and beautiful figure left me momentarily speechless.
“Huh…?”
She looked at me with a wet face.
It was Oh Baek-seo.
“……”
“……”
The sound of water pouring from the shower enveloped the silence.

chapters.title: Chapter 49.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 49 – Rule 20. The Leader Relies on the Vice Leader (2)
When showering, it’s natural for various thoughts to arise. It was the same for Oh Baek-seo.
A few minutes earlier, while showering, Baek-seo recalled the golden hair she found at Ahn Woo-jin’s house.
‘Whose hair is that?’
The thought lingered, questioning her.
As far as she knew, there was no one in Woo-jin’s circle with golden hair.
An intruder? Unlikely.
An intruder who could evade all the security drones and robots wouldn’t be careless enough to leave hair in the middle of the living room. And Woo-jin did mention he would introduce someone soon.
That person must be the owner of the golden hair. So, Baek-seo felt somewhat relieved.
The person wasn’t an intruder nor someone Woo-jin was hiding.
But then, who could it be?
Perhaps it was the ‘master’ Woo-jin had mentioned before.
But thinking that way raised another question.
Woo-jin had already talked about his master. He had no intention of hiding their existence.
Yet, he merely said, ‘I’ll introduce an important person.’
If it were his master, he would have mentioned it explicitly. Therefore, the person with the golden hair was likely a third party Baek-seo didn’t know.
A golden-haired woman who frequents Woo-jin’s house, whom Baek-seo doesn’t know.
‘I guess I have to wait.’
Since Woo-jin said he would introduce the person, she had to trust and wait.
‘Also…’
Baek-seo thought of a significant problem.
The large-scale incident during the practical evaluation.
Han Seo-jin’s massacre attempt.The barrier she couldn’t break through that day still lingered in Baek-seo’s mind, chaining her heart like iron.
If Woo-jin hadn’t awakened his unique ability, the situation would have been catastrophic.
Unthinkable things might have happened.
‘If another person like Han Seo-jin targets Woo-jin, it will be truly dangerous.’
Recently, Baek-seo often had sleepless nights thinking about it.
‘Moreover, the reason Han Seo-jin joined the Disciplinary Committee was because of me.’
She learned this from Woo-jin.
Although she hadn’t figured out why Seo-jin was monitoring her.
But.
‘That means…’
One person came to Baek-seo’s mind.
Someone who could have provided Seo-jin with the information about the magic catalyst underground at the practical evaluation site.
Someone who had a reason to monitor Baek-seo.
The Head Principal, Lee Doo-hee.
“…”
The water from the shower wetted Baek-seo’s hair and flowed down her skin.
She squinted and looked up.
She thought.
The Head Principal would target Woo-jin.
It was only a matter of time.
A free-spirited individual with potential comparable to Goliath, whom the Head Principal desperately wanted in his hands, had appeared.
If the Head Principal decided to target Woo-jin… a situation worse than the recent practical evaluation incident might occur.
‘That won’t happen.’
Baek-seo resolved herself.
In her first year, she had already vowed to protect Woo-jin.
She would somehow prevent anyone from laying a hand on Woo-jin.
Then.
Boom!
“!”
The sudden impact made Baek-seo instinctively turn away from the source of the sound, covering her chest and left shoulder.
“Huh…?”
Baek-seo turned her head slightly and saw a man who had fallen in the shower room.
For some reason, Woo-jin was there.
In an instant, Baek-seo gasped.
“…”
“…”
Woo-jin had failed to set the coordinates and ended up teleporting into the neighboring shower room.
For a while, Woo-jin and Baek-seo just stared at each other. Silence filled the space, but their minds were buzzing with various thoughts.
As they say, even in a tiger’s den, one can survive by keeping their wits about them. Woo-jin narrowed his wide eyes, trying to gather his startled expression.
“Baek-seo.”
Woo-jin spoke first.
“This is a misunderstanding.”
He spoke earnestly, like a criminal caught in the act, choosing sincere explanation over immediate escape.
“…Yeah.”
Baek-seo’s soft voice echoed in the shower room.
“I know.”
Baek-seo quickly deduced the situation.
Woo-jin was strict with himself and valued his dignity.
He wasn’t the type of voyeuristic pervert who would secretly watch a naked woman.
Moreover, he had told Baek-seo that he still couldn’t properly use his ‘space leap’ ability.
In other words, he must have made a mistake while practicing his space ability at home and ended up here.
Understanding this sequence of events, Baek-seo tried to smile gently.
“This is awkward, Leader.”
If she let it go like this, Woo-jin would be extremely troubled.
Baek-seo didn’t want that.
Acting as if it was no big deal.
As if there was no problem at all.
So Woo-jin wouldn’t feel guilty.
Baek-seo decided to lighten the mood with a joke, as usual.
“Were you that eager to see my body?”
Baek-seo tilted her head slightly and gave a sly smile. However, unlike usual, Woo-jin couldn’t take Baek-seo’s joke lightly.
‘What should I… say?’
Woo-jin swallowed nervously, unable to answer immediately. In this situation, a positive response would be tactless and could make him seem like a pervert. On the other hand, a negative response might imply he had no interest in Baek-seo’s body, which could be offensive. He had no intention of conveying such a meaning, even as a joke.
“That’s…”
In the end, Woo-jin covered his mouth and turned his head to the side, his face already turning as red as a ripe apple.
“Leader, your answer…?”
“Sorry…”
Avoiding the question. It was the best, yet the worst choice.
Baek-seo’s playful joke backfired.
“Ah…”
Baek-seo unintentionally let out a small sigh, understanding why Woo-jin avoided the question.
The sound of the shower water couldn’t dispel the awkward atmosphere between them. The usual smile that graced Baek-seo’s face didn’t function properly. A mix of shame and an odd sense of liberation from showing her naked body overwhelmed her. It was hard to take her eyes off Woo-jin. His deeply embarrassed expression was endearing to her, especially because she believed it was due to her body.
This strange, thrilling emotion running down her spine was hard to control. Even someone as adept at hiding their feelings as Baek-seo found this situation extremely stimulating.
‘This is dangerous…’
Baek-seo struggled to turn her head away, deciding not to show her expression to Woo-jin.
Woo-jin was having a similar difficulty controlling his expression. From the moment he saw Baek-seo’s naked body with its beautiful, arching curves, his rational mind stopped functioning properly.
“Leader…”

chapters.title: Chapter 49.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 49 (Continued)
Baek-seo’s voice came out in a whisper.
“Could you please leave?”
Recognizing the gravity of the situation, Woo-jin immediately bowed his head.
“…I’m sorry.”
Whoosh!
Like the wind, Woo-jin exited the shower room in a hurry.
From outside the shower room, the sound of the front door opening and closing indicated that Woo-jin had made a quick escape.
“Haaa…”
Finally, Baek-seo let out a suppressed sigh, touching her cheek with one hand.
The heat in her head felt hotter than the warm water. Her eyes widened, her heart raced, and her lips curled into a smile.
Baek-seo lowered her head slightly.
“This is a problem…”
She felt a sense of urgency.
She already found it difficult to deal with unintended sexual arousal caused by Woo-jin. Ever since she saw Woo-jin naked, this feeling had intensified. The side effect of unfulfilled sexual curiosity lingered strongly.
It was surprising how shy she realized she was.
And now, after facing such a situation again, she couldn’t help but imagine impulsively jumping on Woo-jin.
“Not yet…”
At least for now, that was out of the question.
Baek-seo wanted to help Woo-jin achieve his priorities, marry him, and build a future together.
For now, it was best to be content with this excitement.
After closing her eyes and calming her emotions with deep breaths, Baek-seo removed her hand from her left shoulder.
The magic engraving on her left shoulder was reflected in the mirror, a skull with fangs.
* * *
“Ugh…”
This was a disaster.
As soon as I got home, I sat on the sofa, covered my face, and groaned.
‘I messed up.’
As the Disciplinary Committee Leader, maintaining my honor?
More importantly, I might have traumatized Baek-seo.
‘Why did I try teleporting at home when my skills are still terrible…’
I blamed myself.
How should I face Baek-seo tomorrow?
Should I act as if nothing happened?
Could I even manage my expression?
I felt overwhelmed already.
Crack!
Suddenly, a rift appeared in the air, and a golden-haired girl’s upper body popped out. It was Geumyang.
Geumyang, half out of the rift, supported her head with her hands and looked at me.
“Kid, that was quite entertaining.”
“You watched?”
“Yes.”
This girl…
Geumyang giggled, climbed out of the rift, and started patting my head. Why?
I was curious but too exhausted to lift my head.
“What are you doing?”
“Comforting you.”
“Comforting?”
“According to my extensive knowledge, a male who misses a mating opportunity often falls into despair.”
I wasn’t sure whether to be grateful or not for Geumyang’s bizarre, biology-based comfort. Or was she just teasing me?
“It’s not like that… I’ve never thought that way. Baek-seo is someone I need to cherish…”
Geumyang suddenly leaned forward and looked me in the eyes, startling me into silence.
Her eyes were sharp like a cat’s, mysterious and clear golden eyes staring into mine.
“That statement could be seen as pretentious.”
Geumyang confidently pointed at me.
I furrowed my brows.
“What are you talking about…?”
“Kid, as I’ve said before, I’ve been watching you. I know you like two females.”
Geumyang placed her hands on my knees to steady herself and spoke from a very close distance.
“Do you think I wouldn’t know your feelings?”
“…”
“It’s better to be honest with your feelings.”
She straightened her back and sighed.
Honestly, do I have no privacy in front of Geumyang?
“…I’d be arrested for that.”
“Ha. You’re already confessing?”
Geumyang laughed arrogantly and teasingly.
“Well, whatever.”
I looked up at the ceiling and spoke with a sigh.
“Baek-seo seemed to understand what happened. After she finishes showering, I’ll sincerely apologize and hope the situation gradually improves.”
For now, there seemed to be no better solution.
I just hoped that in the future, we could laugh it off as something that happened.
“…At this moment, I didn’t know that today’s events would lead to such tragedy…”
“Don’t foreshadow ominously.”
I firmly shut down Geumyang’s narration and stood up.
I trudged away.
I was incredibly tired.
Mentally exhausted from the incident in Baek-seo’s shower room.
After sending a sincere apology message to Baek-seo through Kokonotalk, I received a reply that it was okay.
‘Thank goodness she said it’s okay.’
Feeling a bit relieved, I showered and lay down on my bed.
“…”
In the quiet room.
Staring at the dark ceiling, Baek-seo’s naked body, more specifically her enchanting back, flashed in my mind.
I could feel my heartbeat.
Regardless of my will, it felt like my blood was boiling.
Was it simply because I had seen the naked body of the girl I liked?
The problem with a young, vigorous body is this.
But if I include my previous life, I’m an adult.
I could quickly calm down this stirring in my chest.
‘Let’s just sleep…’
I closed my eyes and fell asleep.
That night, in the club room of my dream.
Baek-seo, smiling, suddenly knocked me over. There was a shadow in her eyes.
‘Ba, Baek-seo…?’ I stammered, but Baek-seo climbed on top of me, accusing me, ‘Leader, it’s your fault.’
When I woke up in the morning, I realized.
It was a wet dream.
“This is crazy.”
I had all sorts of dreams.
I was going crazy.
I immediately washed my blanket.
Thankfully, I had plenty of time to hang the laundry.
I was fortunate to wake up early.
‘How can I face Baek-seo today…’
Hoping the day would start normally, I went to school.
I felt something was off after meeting Baek-seo.
