chapters.title: Chapter 50.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 50 – Rule 20. The Leader Relies on the Vice Leader (3)
As usual, I arrived at the Disciplinary Committee office and sipped hot coffee.
However, unlike most mornings, today wasn’t leisurely. Practicing teleportation while commuting had drained my stamina significantly.
‘I’m going to die.’
It felt like my lifespan was being cut short.
Looking back at my past, including my previous life, I realized that nothing ever went well without giving it my all. So, I kept practicing tirelessly, as it was the only way I knew.
“……”
As I stared at my coffee cup, the memory of seeing Baek-seo’s naked body yesterday resurfaced.
‘Putting aside my disgraceful behavior…’
When I fell into Baek-seo’s shower room, I briefly saw her side.
There was some kind of drawing on her left shoulder.
Although Baek-seo quickly covered her left shoulder at the time.
‘That tattoo…’
The location and rough color were enough for me to recognize what it was.
It was a symbol unknown to the general public—a skull with fangs.
‘It wasn’t even a tattoo. It was a magical engraving of a Hound.’
A Hound of the Federal Council, an agent.
The secret tattoo of the elite unit ‘Spartoi,’ which means ‘dragon’s tooth.’
To be precise, it wasn’t a tattoo but a type of magical engraving that served as Spartoi’s proof.
I had seen it in the game.
‘This isn’t a coincidence.’
It was too precise and perfect to be a coincidence.
‘It explains a lot. Why Baek-seo is so skilled in combat.’
If I assumed Baek-seo was once a Hound, it cleared up the questions I had while preparing for the midterm exam with her. Questions like, ‘Why is Baek-seo so proficient in combat techniques?’
Spartoi are essential to Neo Seoul. They perform black ops in the underworld to protect the city.
Their training is known to be intensely rigorous.
It made sense that they focused on teaching combat techniques.
‘Then, why is Baek-seo here?’
Did she infiltrate Ahsung High School with a specific purpose as Spartoi?
Or did she leave Spartoi to lead a normal school life?
‘Probably the latter.’
If Baek-seo had a secret purpose for infiltrating Ahsung High School, she would have kept her distance from people.
But Baek-seo built a close relationship with me and even boldly moved in next door.
There was no way her goal was me.
Until last year, I hadn’t stood out at all.
I was just an extra A, with no reason for anyone to target me.
‘Baek-seo likely has a past as a Spartoi and now wants to hide it.’
Of course, there weren’t enough clues to make a clear judgment.
But.
‘For now… it’s best to pretend I don’t know.’
I didn’t want to dig into a past that Baek-seo might not want to talk about.
Moreover, the reason Han Seo-jin monitored Baek-seo, why Baek-seo might disappear later—all of these could be connected to her past as a Spartoi.
Until I could fully understand the situation, I wanted to cautiously gather clues and approach it carefully.
‘And…’
I leaned back in my chair and looked up at the ceiling.
‘How should I face Baek-seo today?’
The immediate problem was also an issue.
Seeing Baek-seo would undoubtedly remind me of yesterday’s events.
Baek-seo would feel the same.
‘I’m lucky she doesn’t see me as a villain…’
My head was a mess.
‘Maybe I should shower first.’
First period was a participation class, so I had to go to the classroom.
It would be best to shower before going.
As I stood up to leave at the appropriate time, the office door suddenly opened with a clatter.
“Ah.”
Beyond the open door, I met Baek-seo’s eyes.
I held my breath for a moment but quickly composed my expression.
“Good morning.”
“Morning.”
We greeted each other as usual, but there was an awkward atmosphere.
“Are you leaving already?”
Baek-seo wore her usual gentle smile.
“First period is a participation class, so I’m going to shower. I sweat a bit while practicing my unique ability on the way here.”
“I see. Be careful.”
Baek-seo swiftly averted her gaze from me and walked to the sofa. Her quick steps seemed to be avoiding me.
It felt like she was moving as if evacuating from a disaster.
‘What is this distance…?’
My body stiffened, and cold sweat ran down my back.
There was an undeniable distance between us.
…
‘She’s clearly avoiding me…!’
For several days after that, Baek-seo treated me only formally.
No matter how hard I tried to change the mood, it was useless.
Whenever I brought up a slightly personal topic, Baek-seo would respond with a smile but then end the conversation.
No matter what I talked about, it always turned into a formal conversation.
‘Is she still upset?’
My mistake was significant.
It was a situation that could have traumatized her.
Even someone as seemingly perfect as Baek-seo wasn’t superhuman. My mistake might have unknowingly hurt her feelings.
And during the shower incident, I couldn’t even properly respond to Baek-seo’s joke.
I might be the one responsible for creating this awkward atmosphere.
‘What should I do…?’
How could I ease Baek-seo’s heart?
As I processed tasks in the club room on a sunset-filled evening, I agonized over it.
I had already tried giving her snacks she liked, making small compliments I usually didn’t make, and all sorts of things.
But Baek-seo still didn’t treat me as comfortably as before. Instead, she avoided eye contact and kept her distance, as if treating me like a superior at work.
‘Should I use the ‘Ahn Woo-jin use card’… No, that’s not it.’
Shaking my head, I dismissed the idea of the ‘Ahn Woo-jin use license.’
‘That would just be copying Baek-seo.’
If I did that, it would be overly cheesy.
I missed Baek-seo’s occasional naughty jokes. Please, just joke around…
As I struggled with my thoughts.
“Haaa…”
“?”
Suddenly, Baek-seo let out a long, very long sigh.
She placed her hand on her chest and closed her eyes… deeply.
It was a sigh that perfectly fit the expression ‘sighing deeply.’
“It’s done.”
“What is?”
What?
“I finally did it.”
“What do you mean…?”
Baek-seo turned her head towards me and smiled meaningfully. Her face lit up with the glow of the setting sun.
“Leader, could you come here for a moment?”
“Uh?”
Although suspicious, I approached Baek-seo.
I sat down next to her.
“Come here.”
“?”
Gently, Baek-seo placed her hand on my head and pulled me towards her.
My cheek touched Baek-seo’s soft thigh.
“There you go, good boy.”
“…?”
Out of nowhere, Baek-seo started stroking my hair while I lay on her thigh.
‘What is… going on?’
My mind was in chaos.
When I turned my gaze, I saw Baek-seo looking down at me with a satisfied expression.
It was an unexpectedly picturesque view.
“…What are you doing?”
I was bewildered. She had been treating me so formally for days, and now suddenly she was acting this way.
“I’m fulfilling my duties as the Vice Leader.”
A lap pillow?

chapters.title: Chapter 50.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 50 (Continued)
I glared at Baek-seo.
“This is something couples would do. As members of the Disciplinary Committee, we should avoid such behavior… Besides, what if someone walks in suddenly?”
“I don’t mind.”
Of course.
She didn’t care about such things…
Despite my words, I found it difficult to get up. Baek-seo’s lap pillow, her gentle touch, felt like a black hole pulling me in.
‘It’s already past dismissal time, and no one is likely to come now…’
Moreover, Baek-seo, who had been so distant, was finally opening up to me again.
I couldn’t let this moment go to waste.
I justified it to myself and accepted the healing Baek-seo was offering.
“Leader, you haven’t been sleeping much lately, have you?”
“Hmm?”
“You have heavy dark circles under your eyes.”
Baek-seo pointed under her eyes with her free hand.
I had been trying to appear strong, but the dark shadows under my eyes were a natural phenomenon I couldn’t hide.
It was pointless to pretend otherwise in front of the Vice Leader, considering how closely our work was intertwined.
I could be honest about this part.
“Well, there hasn’t been much time to rest. Finals are coming up soon.”
Studying for finals.
Handling Disciplinary Committee duties.
Cleaning up after the Han Seo-jin incident.
Training my unique ability.
I barely had any stamina left, and I hardly got any sleep.
But I had no choice. No matter how tough it was, now was the time to push forward.
I had to deal with the remaining Six Sinners.
I had to stand against the Headmaster if he targeted me.
And on that mysterious day when Baek-seo was supposed to disappear, I had to protect her.
“Yeah, our leader must be having a hard time.”
Baek-seo whispered sweetly and kept stroking my hair.
Maybe because she had been so distant recently, this moment felt extremely dramatic.
It wasn’t just a naughty joke or a prank…
It felt like she was pouring out affection to make up for how she had treated me.
‘Ah… this is healing.’
My heart naturally melted.
It was quite a struggle to manage my expression.
“Still, I’ve finished all the important tasks.”
“What?”
“You’ve been working non-stop all week, haven’t you? And you’ve been very busy… So I tried to ease your burden as much as possible. Did I do well?”
Baek-seo smiled as if asking for praise.
I had been so caught up with the ‘to-do list’ looming over me that I hadn’t paid much attention to the work being done by the other officers.
But considering all the approval documents Baek-seo had submitted to me were perfect…
Her use of the term ‘as much as possible’ wasn’t an exaggeration.
“Did ‘done’ mean you finished all the work?”
Baek-seo shook her head.
“Then?”
“Well… why do you think?”
?
Baek-seo tilted her head and smiled mischievously as if she didn’t know either.
She continued to stroke my hair without stopping.
“……”
I’m quick-witted.
It didn’t take much to figure it out.
It seemed the incident in the shower room had weighed heavily on her.
She needed time to sort out her feelings and return to treating me normally. Baek-seo had been making an effort in her own way.
“Is that so.”
Indeed, I couldn’t live without this girl anymore.
“Baek-seo.”
“Yeah.”
“You really are a support to me.”
I conveyed my honest feelings to Baek-seo.
She smiled brightly.
“I’m glad. I feel like I’m finally someone you can rely on.”
I immediately understood why she said that.
I had never explained the part about my knowledge of the game to Baek-seo.
Maybe she felt she still didn’t have my full trust.
“That’s…”
I couldn’t tell her about that part.
I could only hope that the perceptive Baek-seo understood my true feelings.
“Me too.”
Baek-seo interrupted me.
“You’re a support to me, Leader.”
Her warm and gentle tone filled my ears.
I felt heat rise to my head.
‘This is kind of cringey…’
Let’s stop this conversation here.
It felt like my limbs were cramping up from all this heartfelt sincerity.
‘I’m getting sleepy.’
Maybe because I was relieved.
Drowsiness crept over me.
Having been unable to sleep properly due to recent stress, the sleepiness was hard to resist.
‘Maybe I should take a nap.’
I gently pushed Baek-seo’s hand that was stroking my hair with my fingers.
“Thanks. That’s enough. I need to get some sleep…”
“You can sleep just like this.”
Of course, that was her answer.
As satisfying as this situation was, I couldn’t let myself slack off.
“If I do, I don’t think I’ll be able to get up…”
Clatter!
“A wild Ha Yesong appeared! …Huh?”
The door to the Disciplinary Committee office burst open, and Ha Yesong appeared.
I had already sprung up from Baek-seo’s lap like a spring and was stretching. I had heard footsteps just before the door opened, allowing me to react quickly.
Meanwhile, Baek-seo greeted Yesong with a gentle smile.
“Leader, why are you suddenly stretching?”
“Ah, Yesong. I was feeling stiff, so I thought I’d stretch a bit.”
“Ah, that’s a good habit! Stretching occasionally while sitting and working helps with blood circulation! It’s very good! I, Ha Yesong, do it often too!”
So what?
“But why are you here at this hour?”
“I came to pick up a snack! Here it is. Safe and sound, Double Special Tiramisu Kun!”
Yesong retrieved a box containing two pieces of tiramisu cake from the office fridge and placed it in a paper bag she had brought.
“Well, I’ll be off then! See you tomorrow, Baek-seo!”
“Take care.”
Yesong saluted me and left the office like the wind.
“…I’m wide awake now.”
“Hehe.”
Baek-seo giggled, covering her mouth with her fist.
After that day, thanks to Baek-seo’s efforts, I had more free time during work hours.
In the Disciplinary Committee office.
Secretary Park Minhyuk was working on his laptop hidden in the cabinet, Ha Yesong was chatting about food and eating snacks, and the accountant Yoo Dohyun was napping on the sofa with a book over his face.
And.
“Leader, are you thinking naughty thoughts again?”
“Do you think I would? I was just thinking about the supervision of the final exams.”
Baek-seo, as usual, brought me coffee and subtly joked, smiling warmly.
Normalcy had returned to my life.

chapters.title: Chapter 51.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 51 – Rule 21. The Leader Provides a Real Education (1)
“How is it?”
Hwang Geumyang flicked her long golden hair with her hand, crossed her arms, and looked at me confidently.
“Do I look pretty?”
Her cheeks flushed with excitement. Her fierce eyes were brimming with high self-esteem.
She was showing off her Ahsung High School uniform.
We were at a uniform store. Geumyang had just come out of the fitting room wearing a custom-made uniform.
‘She’s thrilled.’
I was sitting on a customer chair, watching Geumyang.
Seeing her happy made me feel proud as the one paying for it.
“You do look pretty.”
“Your answer is a bit long.”
“Pretty.”
“Hmm, good.”
After spending several weeks with Geumyang, I had noticed something.
‘Her dissatisfaction resolves quickly.’
If you just say what Geumyang wants to hear, she never gets upset.
‘Should I call this simple?’
Or should I say she’s easy to deal with…?
I don’t know if she’s only like this with me. I haven’t introduced Geumyang to anyone else yet.
‘It’s comfortable dealing with her.’
Her personality too.
In front of Geumyang, I don’t need to wear the mask of the Disciplinary Committee Leader. It’s easier to deal with her than with Baek-seo.
Not that Baek-seo is uncomfortable. Recently, I’ve felt more at ease dealing with Baek-seo as well. It felt like we were subtly sharing our feelings.
However, Geumyang, who knows every detail of my computer’s “Zoster” folder, was on a different level.
‘Well, it’s nice to feel like family.’
The problem is that, objectively, Geumyang is not actually family, she has a pretty appearance, and there’s no sense of distance between us.
As a guy, sometimes I felt a bit shy around Geumyang. Well, time will solve that, I guess.
“As expected.”
“What?”
“My uniform look is charming.”
“Do people usually say that about themselves?”
“Don’t they usually?”
“No, they don’t.”
“I will.”
Geumyang looked at me with fierce eyes.
There was a glint in her eyes.
“Do as you please….”
Having high self-esteem isn’t a bad thing.
Geumyang checked herself out in the mirror from various angles. She seemed to be trying to strike poses that might appear in a photo shoot, but they looked awkward.
‘Forget about that.’
I rubbed my chin and carefully observed Geumyang’s uniform.
‘It needs some adjustments.’
Geumyang was short and petite, yet surprisingly had a larger chest. Because of that, the buttons on her shirt were a bit strained, revealing a glimpse of her white skin.
This occasionally happened with Baek-seo too.
For some reason, it only occurred when we were alone, but it was likely an unintended consequence.
‘…I should stop looking.’
I quickly averted my gaze. It was quite an arousing sight, and I shouldn’t look any further.
In the mirror, Geumyang’s eyes turned toward me. She seemed to have noticed my brief glance.
“Hm?”
Geumyang suddenly approached me, squatted down with her knees together, and looked up at me intently.
I was also sitting, so I didn’t understand why she did that.
Maybe she was used to looking up at me due to our height difference.
“What?”
“As a reward for buying me the uniform.”
With a proud expression, Geumyang supported her chin with her hands like a flower.
“Admire my face to your heart’s content.”
Geumyang’s confident eyes sparkled.
“What’s the source of that confidence…?”
Suddenly, Park Minhyuk came to mind.
‘If Minhyuk had half of this confidence.’
He probably wouldn’t have thrown himself into the trash can out of self-loathing.
“I’m already aware that I have a pretty appearance and that males like pretty female faces. You’re a male too, aren’t you?”
Her response was nonchalant.
I couldn’t help but wonder where to start correcting her way of speaking.
“First of all… just call them ‘men’ and ‘women’ normally.”
“You’re nitpicking.”
Geumyang continued to look at me intently.
An AI robot employee tidying clothes glanced at us. A couple of customers who had come in earlier also glanced our way and whispered with a smile.
As mentioned before, it was best to go along with Geumyang in these situations.
If I didn’t, she would keep pushing her face closer until I did. It would certainly become bothersome.
“Hm.”
I leaned forward and looked closely at Geumyang.
Finally.
“…Alright. I’ve got a good look at you.”
“A kid would be happy to be with me. Their eyes get to feast every day.”
“Yeah, thanks to you, I’m living a happy life.”
While pandering to Geumyang.
She relaxed her pose and hugged her knees.
“Kid.”
“Hm?”
“I have a favor to ask.”
There was determination in Geumyang’s voice.
“Don’t ask for something weird.”
“I want to go to school too!”
Geumyang’s eyes sparkled.
I knew this would happen.
…
…
No outsiders are allowed at Ahsung High School.
To gain entry to Ahsung High School, one must apply in advance and be granted permission only after undergoing a thorough security team review.
I intended to persuade Geumyang that she couldn’t enter Ahsung High School, but she ended up disappearing using her space-jumping ability.
No matter how high the security wall, it’s useless against spatial abilities.
‘Where did she go now!?’
I found myself suddenly in a game of hide-and-seek in the middle of the night.
I was also wearing my school uniform. After school, I had trained my spatial abilities under Geumyang and then bought her a uniform.
‘I’m going to end up sweating again….’
“Huh?”

chapters.title: Chapter 51.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 51 (Continued)
Surprisingly, the hide-and-seek ended quickly.
On the rooftop of the Disciplinary Committee building, a girl in a school uniform was sitting on the railing, looking down at the school grounds.
Her golden hair fluttered in the night breeze.
It was Geumyang.
Snap!
Spatial Domination, my unique ability.
First-type magic formula, space jump.
Avoiding the security drones’ sight, I created a crack in the air, entered it, and jumped straight to the Disciplinary Committee building’s rooftop.
I wanted to land directly behind Geumyang, but I couldn’t precisely set the coordinates yet.
I fell below the newly formed crack. It was a position quite far above the building’s rooftop.
However, I wasn’t surprised and naturally landed on the rooftop, having anticipated this situation.
“How could you just leave without saying anything?”
I approached Geumyang, asking in a restrained tone.
“You’re here.”
Geumyang turned her head to look at me. The lights scattered across the school grounds illuminated her face from behind.
“Is this where you gain knowledge?”
“Well, yeah.”
I approached the railing next to Geumyang.
Trying to control Geumyang was impossible anyway. Persuading her to leave now would be useless.
So, I decided to play along with her.
“It’s wonderful.”
Geumyang smiled as she looked at the school grounds again.
“Once, out of curiosity, I visited a school a long time ago. It wasn’t like this back then. Everything was destroyed, broken, and silent.”
Geumyang seemed to be recalling a school shortly after the apocalypse.
“A functioning school is so beautiful…. So is this city. Everything is mysterious and beautiful.”
From my perspective, Geumyang was the mysterious one.
But the reverse also seemed true.
Anyway.
“Do you also want to attend school?”
I asked, sensing that was what she wanted.
Geumyang nodded.
“That’s right. Learning about human culture is fun.”
Unfortunately, that wish was difficult to fulfill.
Geumyang didn’t have an officially registered identity in Neo Seoul.
Passing the GED and directly entering high school was also not an option.
‘That’s the principle.’
However, there might be a legal way.
‘Should I look into it soon?’
It didn’t seem too difficult.
With the connections I had built as the Disciplinary Committee Leader, I might be able to make it happen.
“Are you having a nice thought?”
Huh?
“…Is my expression that obvious?”
Baek-seo often read my mind like a ghost.
Geumyang seemed to do the same.
“As I said before, I’ve been watching you for a long time. I can quickly pick up on such things.”
Geumyang answered confidently, smiling with a ‘hoo-hoo.’
“Even if it’s not other humans, I’m an expert when it comes to you, kid.”
Geumyang answered with her legs swinging in the air, her chin lifted proudly.
“Well, with that, you must have some affection for me.”
I joked, and Geumyang’s eyes widened slightly.
“Oh-ho, affection…?”
What was this? Was she impressed?
Geumyang then crossed her arms and tilted her head thoughtfully.
“Maybe. Is this affection?”
“?”
I couldn’t understand why she was suddenly pondering seriously.
Eventually, Geumyang turned her head sideways as if she had discovered something.
“…Hey, kid. Over there.”
Geumyang pointed with her chin somewhere.
“What is it?”
Leaning forward over the railing and turning my head in the direction she indicated, I saw a building.
“……”
My expression turned cold.
Beyond the building’s windows.
Three students, two male and one female, were abusing a lone female student.
The male student was stepping on the girl, slapping her face, while the other girl was photographing the beaten girl with a smartphone.
A blind spot in Ahsung High School’s security.
Secret bullying among students.
Even the Disciplinary Committee couldn’t control everything. Just as the police couldn’t eradicate crime despite their numbers.
There would always be students who secretly bullied others.
In most cases, the perpetrators would prevent the victim from reporting to the Disciplinary Committee.
“I have work to do.”
I fastened the Disciplinary Committee Leader’s armband to my arm.
“This is perfect timing.”
“What is?”
Geumyang got down from the railing and stood next to me.
“Kid, I’m giving you an assignment.”
“An assignment?”
Geumyang smiled broadly.
“It’s time for real education.”

chapters.title: Chapter 52.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 52 – Rule 21. The Leader Provides a Real Education (2)
Min Hana.
First-year student at Ahsung High School.
Known for her timid personality, lack of presence, and fearfulness.
Despite her significant earnings as a virtual streamer, she has never revealed her identity.
As the first semester was coming to an end, Hana still hadn’t made any proper friends.
Although Lee Se-Ah’s group occasionally hung out with her, Hana never fully integrated with them because she found it difficult to socialize.
The root of her troubles traced back to middle school.
While carrying her lunch tray, she was jostled by a group of girls led by Han So-Jeong. With her small frame and weak strength, Hana was pushed, spilling her kimchi stew all over So-Jeong’s uniform.
From that day, the bullying by So-Jeong’s group began. They started with dirtying her locker and textbooks, gradually escalating their harassment.
Eventually, they began secretly beating her after school. So-Jeong knew all the school’s blind spots, ensuring Hana often bore bruises all over her body.
One day, So-Jeong discovered Hana’s success as a virtual streamer after checking her phone.
─ “What would happen if you reported me? Your identity would be all over the internet, along with those embarrassing photos I took of you. And then, I’d kill you. Got it, Hana?”
So-Jeong’s innocent-seeming threats forced Hana to hand over her earnings.
Hana’s days were a living hell.
Eventually, So-Jeong received a disciplinary transfer to another school after being caught bullying another student.
Though Hana feared So-Jeong might come back for her or expose her identity online, nothing happened.
However, the constant anxiety wore down Hana’s mental state. Unable to maintain even a fake cheerful demeanor, she lost many of her virtual streamer followers.
Despite all her efforts in studying and training to get into Ahsung High School, Hana couldn’t escape the lingering effects.
One day, Hana discovered that So-Jeong had also enrolled at Ahsung High. She had secretly gotten a boyfriend and formed a new clique.
So-Jeong had always been an elite, regardless of her personality. This was another reason why Hana couldn’t fight back against her.
Hana was terrified but decided she couldn’t live like this anymore.
Rather than fearing the exposure of her virtual streamer identity, reclaiming her life became more important.
Hana secretly monitored So-Jeong, discovering that she and her clique might be bullying innocent students again, evading the Disciplinary Committee’s watch.
‘I need to gather evidence.’
Only with evidence could she bring So-Jeong down.
Today, Hana found a student being beaten by So-Jeong’s group in an abandoned classroom.
Despite the enjoyment they seemed to get from their vile actions, they found ways to avoid school security.
‘You haven’t changed at all, you piece of trash.’
So-Jeong hadn’t changed at all, despite being disciplined and transferred.
This realization was somewhat comforting. If So-Jeong was still irredeemable, Hana had no reason to hesitate in standing up to her.
In the dark hallway outside the abandoned classroom, Hana secretly set her smartphone to record and placed it on the window ledge.
‘This is the surest way, considering So-Jeong’s tactics.’
Expecting the currently beaten student to help wasn’t realistic. Hana decided to take matters into her own hands.
Hana barged into the abandoned classroom.
“Who’s she?”
The male student beating the girl looked startled. He was So-Jeong’s boyfriend.
“Oh? You… Hana, right? It’s you!”
So-Jeong was momentarily surprised, then impressed.
“You know her?”
“A middle school classmate. I’ve told you about her, right? The virtual girl.”
“Virtual? Ah.”
Seemed like So-Jeong had already mentioned Hana to her boyfriend, who seemed to understand.
“You go to the same school?”
“I didn’t know either.”
As an instinctive fear surged, cold sweat dripped down Hana’s forehead. Even though she mustered the courage to confront So-Jeong, her legs trembled as she spoke, making her feel pathetic.
The days of bullying flashed before her eyes. Hana closed her eyes and took a deep breath.
“Long time no see, Hana! I didn’t know we’d go to the same school! It’s almost like fate. But have you been following me? You’ve gotten brave!”
“How can you still be doing this…?”
Hana, who usually struggled to speak casually with classmates, couldn’t help but address So-Jeong formally.
“It’s fun.”
So-Jeong grabbed the hair of the trembling girl she was beating and lifted her head.
The girl’s face was unscathed, but her body must have taken the brunt of the abuse, given her pained expression.
Despite her shaking voice, Hana managed to speak with courage.
“A student of Ahsung High School behaving like this… Do you have no intelligence? Don’t you realize that this behavior will ruin your future…?”
“So you’ve grown, Hana. Talking back to me now! I’ve been so busy, I let you off. Now you think I’m easy?”
So-Jeong sneered.
“Of course, I’ve learned. I was too careless. I should’ve had more fun, more meticulously.”
Criminals know they’ll be caught and punished. They know their actions aren’t socially acceptable. Yet, recidivism rates are high.
There are many reasons, but the main issue is the difficulty in breaking away from criminal behavior.
So-Jeong took pleasure in school violence. The process of standing superior to classmates, controlling and tormenting them, brought her satisfaction. Even with Ahsung High’s prestigious status and the Disciplinary Committee Leader’s remarkable efforts, So-Jeong couldn’t suppress this urge.
It was the realm of beasts acting on instinct alone.
Hana’s resolve hardened.
“You really are irredeemable trash.”
Hana’s eyes grew cold.
Having been bullied by So-Jeong before, Hana knew.
So-Jeong must have made countless terrible threats to ensure the beaten girl wouldn’t speak out about their torment.
“Haha! Time really is a healer, huh? You’re actually saying this to me. Hana~, since we’re tied by fate, we should play together again.”
So-Jeong and her boyfriend chuckled, as if they had found a new toy.
“Come here, Hana. This place is the perfect spot we recently discovered as a school security blind spot. It’s great for fun.”
Whack!
“Ah!”
Suddenly, Hana was kicked from behind and rolled across the floor of the abandoned classroom.
“Who’s this kid?”
“Just in time.”
A male student from So-Jeong’s group had just returned from the restroom.
Thud!
“Ugh!”
So-Jeong’s boyfriend stepped on Hana and slapped her with a magic-infused hand.
Slap! Hana screamed.
As the pain hit her, past memories vividly resurfaced. Despite her determination, her body began to tremble defensively.
“You annoying brat. Talking back to our So-Jeong like that.”
Slap!
“Fight back a little. This is boring.”
Whack!
“Don’t hit the face too much. She’s cute. Go for somewhere else.”
“Is she your type?”
The male students chuckled as they kicked Hana’s body as she rolled on the floor.
“Friend, transform into chair mode.”
“C-chair mode…!”
The girl who had initially been beaten quickly crawled behind So-Jeong and lay on the floor. So-Jeong sat on her back.
“Let’s have some fun, babe.”
“Wanna do ‘that’?”
So-Jeong had just taken out her smartphone.
“Look here. Hey, look here.”
Clap! Clap!
So-Jeong’s boyfriend lifted Hana’s head, slapped her cheeks with moderate force, and made her look at the smartphone.
Hana bit her lip.
She had to endure.
Her recording smartphone was hidden out of sight. It would certainly serve as solid evidence.
The girl who had been beaten might not help due to the threats. She might even deny wanting So-Jeong’s group punished or say she was just playing along.
Hana believed that the surest way to socially ruin So-Jeong’s group was to do it herself. It might be a foolish method, but Hana harbored a deep resentment towards So-Jeong.
So, she had to endure.
“Ugh…”

chapters.title: Chapter 52.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 52 (Continued)
Hana’s eyes welled up with tears as she tried hard to hold them back.
“Hey, she’s crying.”
“She’s crying already?”
The male student laughed as he began unbuttoning Hana’s shirt.
“We still have more to do….”
Boom!
“Huh?”
Suddenly, there was a loud noise from a cleaning supply cabinet.
Everyone’s eyes turned to the cabinet.
A moment of silence filled the abandoned classroom.
Then.
Bang!
The cabinet door burst open, and something shot out, lunging at the male student who was unbuttoning Hana’s shirt.
“Gah!”
A gloved fist connected squarely with the male student’s face.
Crunch!!
Boom!!
Unnatural sounds filled the room, followed by near-explosive impacts.
The male student’s body rolled violently across the floor, crashing into the wall.
“Ugh…”
The male student bled profusely from his nose, which was clearly broken.
Everyone present was shocked.
The one who threw the punch was a male student wearing the Disciplinary Committee Leader’s armband.
It was Ahn Woo-jin, the Disciplinary Committee Leader of Ahsung High School.
Woo-jin quickly approached the male student who had been hit and kicked his face.
Crunch!!
A chilling sound echoed through the classroom.
The sole of Woo-jin’s shoe pressed into the male student’s face, causing a crack to form in the wall behind his head.
Immediately, the male student’s arm went limp. Even though he had enhanced his body with magic, he couldn’t withstand the force and fell unconscious.
“Pathetic.”
Woo-jin’s voice was low and calm.
So-Jeong and her boyfriend were frozen in fear. They hadn’t expected such an unexpected presence to burst out from the cabinet. Who could have imagined it?
They were certain they couldn’t escape.
Trying to outrun Woo-jin was like a turtle trying to outrun a cheetah on land.
Still stepping on the male student’s face, Woo-jin’s gaze shifted. From under the brim of his cap, his shadowed eyes glared at So-Jeong like a predator.
She flinched, trembling, and instinctively took a step back.
“Eek!”
Thud!
She tripped over the girl she had been sitting on.
“How… How did you…? Were you hiding in there…? What?”
So-Jeong was bewildered, her mind conjuring impossible scenarios.
Woo-jin, having predicted her actions from the start, had waited with glaring eyes in the narrow cabinet of the abandoned classroom, his face filled with menacing determination like something out of a horror movie.
Why Woo-jin had been in the cabinet and why he had stayed silent until now was beyond understanding.
But now wasn’t the time for such thoughts.
“Disciplinary Committee Leader…?”
So-Jeong’s boyfriend’s face turned pale. He too was clueless about what was happening.
Woo-jin offered no explanation.
He had simply used his space-jumping ability to reach the cabinet.
First, he jumped inside the building, closed the distance to the abandoned classroom, set the coordinates precisely, and executed the jump.
No one in the classroom knew about Woo-jin’s unique ability to jump through space, as no one except Oh Baek-seo had witnessed it during his battle with Han Seo-jin.
Most students had only seen a massive flash of light, so no one in the abandoned classroom realized Woo-jin’s ability allowed him to traverse space.
‘Coordinate setting… This is my first successful attempt.’
The task given by Geumyang.
Creating a crack precisely inside the cabinet and then emerging from it unscathed.
Woo-jin successfully set the coordinates to his desired location for the first time and staged the scene as per Geumyang’s task.
“Executing on-site arrest. Perpetrators will be severely punished.”
Woo-jin declared his intent to enforce school rules, reciting the Disciplinary Committee’s formal statement.
He then drew a baton from his belt and swung it.
*Snap!*
A metal rod extended from the baton. It was a standard three-section staff.
Woo-jin looked at the girl who had been treated as a chair and nodded toward the exit.
“Wait outside.”
The girl quickly bowed and left the classroom.
So-Jeong wasn’t the type to stay still even with the Disciplinary Committee Leader present. She grabbed the dusty teacher’s desk to stand up and shouted in a trembling voice.
“T-That was…! E-Excessive force…!”
She tried to restrain Woo-jin’s actions.
At that moment, pleading or apologizing wasn’t an option for So-Jeong. Her pride wouldn’t allow it, even if her opponent was the Disciplinary Committee Leader.
“Do you think you’ll get away with this…? Guh?”
So-Jeong couldn’t continue her words.
In a blink, Woo-jin was in front of her. His piercing eyes met hers for a moment.
As So-Jeong instinctively swallowed dryly.
Wham!!
“Ooof!!”
The baton struck her torso. The force bent her arm and twisted her body.
Thud!
Her arm bones shattered, and she flew against the wall, screaming as she clutched her broken arm.
“You really thought you’d be safe?”
Woo-jin crouched down next to So-Jeong.
“Do you think you’ll get away with this?”
“Wait…!”
Woo-jin swung the baton three times, striking her neck, shoulder, and legs.
“Ahhh!”
Despite having enhanced her body with magic, it was futile.
Woo-jin wasn’t using even a tenth of his power, but that alone put him on a different level from anyone in the room.
Intense pain overwhelmed So-Jeong, who screamed at the top of her lungs, her eyes bloodshot from the agony.
“So-Jeong!! Nooo!!”
Her boyfriend lost his mind and charged at Woo-jin, desperate to protect her.
It was a reckless and suicidal attempt.
“Get away from So-Jeong…!”
He enhanced his legs with magic and leaped, drawing a dagger imbued with 4th-tier lightning magic.
He felt he had to go all out.
But.
Whoosh!
Smack!
The dagger was swung, but Woo-jin easily deflected it with the baton, striking the boy’s hand.
“Gah!”
The bones in his hand broke, and the dagger fell.
“Unwise.”
Woo-jin calmly muttered, then mercilessly swung the baton at him.
*Thud! Thud! Thud! Thud!*
In an instant, several flashes of light struck his neck, shoulders, arms, and torso.
“Ahhh…!!”
As the boy fell in pain, Woo-jin grabbed his head and slammed it into the floor.
Thud!
The boy’s voice was cut off instantly.
“Carrying a weapon is a special assault crime. Swinging it at me means you’ll receive aggravated punishment.”
Woo-jin’s chilling tone fell over the room. His cold voice made even the skin tingle.
So-Jeong, with a face drenched in tears and fear, and Hana, with a bewildered expression, looked at Woo-jin.
‘That’s right… I saw it on the internet.’
Hana recalled stories she had seen about Ahsung Middle School. One male student was often mentioned.
Ahn Woo-jin’s name was overshadowed only by the city-level figure, Oh Baek-seo.
Even in middle school, Woo-jin was well-known.
A symbol of fear at Ahsung Middle School.
A cold-blooded and eccentric personality with sharp, predatory eyes.
As the Disciplinary Committee Leader, he enforced school rules with excessive violence.
Yet, his exceptional skills earned him respect and trust, securing his position within the committee.
Now, he actively eradicated crime, having defeated the villain organization Anomia early in his tenure as the Disciplinary Committee Leader.
He even captured one of the six notorious criminals, establishing almost legendary status.
Confronting Woo-jin with pride was essentially suicidal for So-Jeong.
Woo-jin’s sharp eyes turned back to So-Jeong.
“Please… Please spare me….”
So-Jeong pleaded, feeling like an idiot for her earlier rage.
This wasn’t the time to accuse Woo-jin of excessive force. That was insanity. She should have been submissive from the start, she realized too late.
Accusing Woo-jin of excessive force and planning to backstab him afterward was also absurd.
Woo-jin had been awarded Platinum Mileage twice for his significant achievements.
In all that time, his excessive force had never been an issue. Ahsung High supported him.
“……”
Woo-jin approached So-Jeong, reaching into her jacket pocket.
“What… What are you doing…?”
He pulled out a dagger.
When he unsheathed it, the blade reflected the moonlight. It was a dagger with an embedded magic circuit.
Despite being thrown, So-Jeong’s jacket had felt stiff on one side, and seeing the male student draw a dagger, Woo-jin had been certain So-Jeong was also armed.
“School violence, group bullying, special crimes. Quite a package.”
“T-That’s…!”
So-Jeong instinctively reached for the dagger.
Thud!
Woo-jin struck her head, and she finally passed out.
A stillness settled over the room.
When Woo-jin’s gaze turned to Hana, she swallowed nervously.
“Are you alright?”
“Yes, yes….”
When Woo-jin approached and offered his hand, Hana took it and stood up.
“I’ll need your statement later.”
“Okay….”
Hana nodded cautiously, feeling a mix of fear and respect towards Woo-jin.
***
“I finally succeeded in setting the coordinates correctly.”
After leaving the cleanup to the Disciplinary Committee lieutenant, who was on duty, Woo-jin took Geumyang to a late-night udon restaurant.
“I expected it to take at least two months. You achieved it faster than I thought.”
Geumyang leaned her chin on her hand, asking.
“Do you have a feel for it now?”
Snap.
Woo-jin created a small crack above his finger, grasped it, and released it.
Having successfully set the coordinates for the first time, he felt a sense of accomplishment.
“…It feels good.”
He nodded.
Thanks to this success, he felt he was finally getting the hang of setting coordinates, just as Geumyang had suggested.

chapters.title: Chapter 53.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 53 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (1)
“Leader, have you heard the rumors?”
It was nearing the end of my first semester as the Disciplinary Committee Leader when Ha Yesong’s words caught my attention.
“What rumors?”
The position of Disciplinary Committee Leader naturally comes with its fair share of gossip. To maintain my authority, it was necessary to stay informed about such rumors.
When I asked Yesong, she opened a cabinet door with a flourish.
“Eeek!! My eyes!!”
Park Minhyuk, who was holed up in the dark cabinet, reacted violently as if he were a vampire exposed to sunlight.
Whether it was the light or seeing Yesong’s face that caused his reaction was unclear.
“A maniacal Disciplinary Committee Leader who hides in cabinets like Park Minhyuk and catches culprits!”
Yesong closed the cabinet and approached me.
“Everywhere and nowhere at once, the Schrödinger’s Disciplinary Committee Leader!”
“Some rumors, huh.”
Starting from the time I had caught the school bullies in the abandoned classroom by jumping out of a cabinet, rumors had started spreading. As I practiced my spatial leap ability and caught offenders in various unexpected places, strange rumors began to circulate.
“You’ve been popping out from all sorts of places to catch kids, right? The ones you’ve caught are all terrified! You’ve been using your unique ability, haven’t you?”
“Well, yes.”
I nodded.
The officers are my closest colleagues. So, I didn’t hide my unique ability from them.
Yesong leaned towards me with a sly smile, covering her mouth with her hand.
“Leader, do you ever use that ability to sneak into girls’ showers or changing rooms…?”
“What do you take me for?”
Of course, there was that one time with Baek-seo’s shower, but…
‘That was out of my control.’
It happened because I was still unskilled with my spatial ability.
“Stop!!!”
Suddenly, the cabinet door swung open, and Minhyuk poked his head out, shouting.
“What kind of slander is that towards our leader! The leader is righteous and flawless! He’s not someone who would indulge in such vulgar fantasies!”
Yesong laughed derisively.
“Minhyuk, you’re so naive.”
“What?”
Yesong looked back at Minhyuk and extended her hand towards me.
“It’s precisely the stern and seemingly flawless leaders who, when they fall into disgraceful acts, create the most dramatic thrill.”
What nonsense.
Both Minhyuk and I scowled.
“The iron-fisted leader who is always dependable, calm, exemplary, and adheres strictly to the rules, accomplishing great feats. Imagine such a leader, unable to control his desires, finally betraying his beliefs and falling into corruption! Or, a leader like that showing a vulnerable side due to ‘unavoidable circumstances’…!”
Yesong was passionately raving.
“That’s the real thrill!”
Her eyes sparkled.
‘She’s serious.’
Was it some psychological desire to tarnish something pure?
It felt like a glimpse into the twisted aspects of modern society.
“…Leader, should I exclude her? There’s no hope for her.”
“Hold on.”
Minhyuk’s forehead veins were bulging in anger at the mere thought of tarnishing my image.
Of course, in terms of actual combat ability, Yesong far outclassed Minhyuk.
“Ha Yesong.”
I sighed and leaned back in my chair.
“Don’t project your perverted fantasies onto me. It’s disrespectful to me as a person, not just as the leader.”
“Leader, there’s always a demand for this kind of stuff, you know? Like muscle-heads binging on instant food to bulk up, or straight-A students going wild. That kind of thing has a catharsis.”
“What are you talking about….”
“Don’t you think so, Baek-seo?”
Yesong glanced at Baek-seo, who was reading documents on the sofa.
Trying to get some agreement, huh?
But she picked the wrong person.
‘Our Vice Leader would never agree with that nonsense.’
Baek-seo was as upright as they come at Ahsung High School.
She was a paragon of perfection, incomparable to someone like me.
Baek-seo agreeing with such twisted imaginings? No way.
“……”
“Baek-seo?”
Baek-seo seemed momentarily lost in thought, as if she had realized something and was deep in contemplation.
Even Yesong was taken aback.
“Um.”
Baek-seo regained her usual smile. However, her lips twitched intermittently.
What could she have been imagining to make her fail at maintaining her expression?
“I don’t think such imaginings are appropriate.”
Yesong narrowed her eyes.
“…Baek-seo, you were tempted for a moment, weren’t you?”
“No, I was not.”
What’s with the tone?
‘Surely she wasn’t actually tempted…?’
Baek-seo?
“See? That’s how it works, Leader. Even if you and Minhyuk-kun don’t get it, when someone seems too perfect, people get curious about when that perfection will break.”
“Huh….”
I hadn’t considered that.
I always tried to show a perfect image.
But does showing only a perfect image make people want to see that perfection crumble…?
What a contradiction.
“Look at Doha. She’s subtly lifting the book covering her face to gauge your reaction!”
“Hmph.”

chapters.title: Chapter 53.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 53 (Continued)
Yoo Doha, who had been lying on the sofa with a book covering her face, reacted. She wasn’t asleep.
Yesong leaned on the sofa’s backrest, looking down at Doha.
“Yoo Doha, aren’t you curious? To see the leader’s perfect image break?”
Doha sat up and put the book down. Her cheeks were slightly flushed.
She glanced at me with half-open eyes, then quickly averted her gaze when our eyes met.
“…I am a little curious.”
It was the first time I’d seen Doha so embarrassed.
‘Even Doha?’
All three female officers were staring at me. It was unnerving.
What was so fascinating about the idea of my meticulously maintained image as the leader shattering?
“……”
An unsettling atmosphere pervaded the room.
It seemed like everyone was having strange thoughts.
Whatever they were thinking, it was necessary to change the mood to preserve my image.
“Ha Yesong, come here.”
“Yes, sir. …Ow!”
I lightly tapped Yesong on the head with a textbook.
Yesong, who hadn’t strengthened her body with magic, let out a short cry.
“Stop making weird comments about me.”
“Heheh.”
Yeseong brushed off the warning with an innocent laugh.
“Anyway, the more perfect someone seems, the more you want to see their flaws. It’s not just the Leader. Our dear Baek-seo is the same!”
Yeseong’s target shifted to Baek-seo.
“Me?”
“Is there anyone as perfect as Baek-seo at Ahsung High?”
I agreed with that.
In my first year, I didn’t really like Baek-seo, or rather, I was closer to disliking her.
But now, I couldn’t think of anyone as perfect and kind as Baek-seo.
“Hehe, not really.”
“Come on, being too modest is also a flaw.”
While Baek-seo and Yeseong chattered away, I suddenly imagined Baek-seo losing her composure.
‘Hmm.’
Baek-seo, with a flushed face, bewildered and flustered.
‘L-Leader…! W-What should I do…!?’, desperately clinging to me….
‘…That’s too cute.’
I must be crazy.
It was shockingly adorable, so much so that I couldn’t understand why I hadn’t imagined it before.
I could easily picture myself confidently shouting, ‘Just trust me!’, and risking my life to help Baek-seo.
‘Wait, hold on…’
I shook my head to clear my mind.
‘If I keep imagining things like this, I’m no different from Ha Yeseong…!’
I didn’t want to have strange thoughts about Baek-seo.
Baek-seo was good just the way she was.
‘Come to think of it, have I ever seen Baek-seo lose her composure?’
At the beginning of the semester, the day Baek-seo burned herself.
That day, well, it didn’t really feel like she lost her composure.
Even on the day I inadvertently showed her my naked body.
‘I’m curious.’
What would it look like for Baek-seo to lose her composure?
Could she even lose her composure in the first place?
……
The evening sky was dark.
I had to cut down on space ability practice to focus on preparing for the final exams. Because of that, I was repeatedly doing space leaps intensely under the idea of ‘short but intense’.
Soon, I returned to the Ahsung High campus and reached the building with my personal study room.
I hid in the shadows of a narrow alley next to the building so that the students wouldn’t see me.
“Huff, huff…. I’m dying….”
Loosening my tie a bit, I breathed heavily.
Repeatedly performing space leaps in one go was like sprinting at full speed without taking a breath. I had been doing that for an hour, so it was exhausting.
Sweat poured from my entire body.
It felt like heat was escaping from me.
“You’ve been doing space leaps quite intensely, kid.”
Geumyang appeared, riding the cracks.
She was wearing the Ahsung High uniform I recently bought her.
I looked at Geumyang, still trying to calm my breathing.
I could feel the backlash of using my unique ability approaching.
“You must be really tired….”
I urgently grabbed Geumyang, hugging her tightly.
“Hold on, kid?”
My legs were weak, and my weight shifted onto Geumyang.
With her small frame, Geumyang staggered backward, forced to retreat, while I followed her unsteady steps.
Thud. My arms encircling Geumyang touched the building’s outer wall. Lowering my head, I hugged her, taking deep breaths.
There was a faint scent, but I didn’t have the time to notice it.
I felt a soft touch on my waist. Geumyang was hugging me back.
“Huff, huff…. Whew….”
As I felt the penalty transferring to Geumyang, my breathing gradually stabilized.
“…Feeling better now?”
Geumyang’s calm voice echoed in my ears.
“Yeah…. Thanks.”
I released Geumyang and looked down at her.
Her face was calm.
Her sharp eyes were fixed on me.
“Don’t overdo it. If you overuse your ability, it’ll be like last time.”
“I’m short on time.”
I replied, wiping the sweat from my forehead.
I had to prepare properly for the final exams too.
I couldn’t lose to Baek-seo.
“Anyway, I’m fine now.”
“I’ll be at your house.”
“Got it.”
Good.
I planned to practice space leaps again diligently after finishing studying in the reading room.
Since the penalty would surely come, I would just hug Geumyang like I did earlier as soon as I got home.
Some of my strength returned. I left the dark alley, waving to Geumyang.
“There should be something to eat in the fridge, so help yourself…. Hm?”
Geumyang had already disappeared.
* * *
While preparing side dishes for Ahn Woo-jin at home, Oh Baek-seo suddenly recalled what Ha Yeseong had said earlier that day.
Woo-jin always tried to maintain a poker face, but his emotions often showed. Other students didn’t seem to notice, but Baek-seo could tell.
But if Woo-jin experienced such a rapid emotional change that he couldn’t maintain his poker face….
─ ‘…I’m sorry.’
For instance, the time Woo-jin fell into Baek-seo’s shower.
The embarrassed face and apology he gave still lingered vividly in Baek-seo’s heart.
“What am I thinking….”
Baek-seo touched her cheek and tried to clear her mind.
“All done.”
She finished cooking.
Imagining Woo-jin enjoying her food made her lips curl into a smile.
She packed each side dish—braised fish cakes, stir-fried anchovies, and bulgogi—into separate containers and left the house.
Currently, Woo-jin was studying in the reading room. So, she decided to put the side dishes in the fridge and leave him a text message. With that in mind, Baek-seo entered the house next door.
At that moment, for some reason, she felt moisture on her skin.
“Huh?”
“Huh?”
In front of the open shower room door.
A naked woman with a towel around her neck, Geumyang, came out of the shower and made eye contact with Baek-seo.
“…….”
A heavy silence filled Woo-jin’s house.

chapters.title: Chapter 54.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 54 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (2)
“Is it the next-door neighbor?”
Geumyang quickly covered her naked body with a towel and greeted calmly.
“Nice to meet you, my name is Geumyang.”
“……”
Baek-seo silently stared into Geumyang’s fierce eyes.
Ahn Woo-jin had never introduced Geumyang to Baek-seo. This was because Geumyang did not want it.
In fact, this moment was essentially their first meeting.
“…Who are you?”
Baek-seo began to speak calmly, exerting superhuman mental strength to keep her usual friendly smile on her face.
However, Baek-seo’s remaining hand was clenched into a tight fist behind her back. A cold shadow also loomed around her eyes.
It was a physical reaction she couldn’t control due to the turmoil in her chest.
“I already told you my name, so I guess you’re asking about something else… Well, I’m someone who’s had no choice but to take shelter in this house.”
Geumyang went into Woo-jin’s room and came out wearing a loose white shirt.
Baek-seo immediately recognized that the shirt belonged to Woo-jin.
Geumyang’s appearance once again shook Baek-seo’s rationality to its core.
“It’s modest, but come in.”
Baek-seo didn’t know why Geumyang, not the homeowner, was saying this, but she took off her shoes and went inside without a word.
Baek-seo had been waiting for Woo-jin to introduce her to the alchemist girl, Geumyang, who was now standing in front of her.
Despite the delay in their introduction, Baek-seo had understood and waited because Woo-jin had promised to introduce them.
Given that he had said he would introduce her, it didn’t seem like their relationship was secretive.
However… Baek-seo had not expected that Woo-jin and Geumyang were so comfortably close.
The fact that they were even living together was a shock.
Not wanting to reveal her emotions, Baek-seo quickly walked to the kitchen and started putting side dishes in the fridge.
Meanwhile, Geumyang sprawled out naturally on the living room sofa, as if it were her own home.
“Are you the Leader’s friend?”
“Not a friend.”
The reply was indifferent.
“You’re not his girlfriend either, right?”
Baek-seo stated with certainty.
“Of course not.”
“……”
“……”
Baek-seo hoped Geumyang would explain her relationship with Woo-jin, but no further answer came.
Silence ensued. Even in the uncomfortable quiet, Geumyang refrained from speaking, looking clearly annoyed.
In the end, Baek-seo had to continue asking questions.
“Are you like adopted siblings? I heard that’s common.”
Adopted brothers, adopted sisters.
In Neo Seoul, many people were without families, so such relationships were common.
The problem was with ‘adopted siblings.’ Especially when similar-aged men and women became adopted siblings, it often led to them becoming a couple.
Moreover, in Neo Seoul, novels, comics, and dramas that featured adopted siblings as a main theme were quite popular.
Many students even romanticized such relationships.
Woo-jin wouldn’t be an exception.
“Hmm. It’s similar, but no.”
Whether she should feel relieved or not….
Baek-seo let out a small sigh.
“Then what is it?”
“Hmmm.”
Geumyang stroked her chin in thought, then answered as if she had just remembered.
“A master-servant relationship?”
Baek-seo’s movements stopped abruptly.
* * *
Bzzzz.
A smartphone vibrated.
“Hmm?”
The caller was ‘Yoon Tae-ho.’
He was a friend and the student council treasurer, also a middle school classmate. He was the one who had previously informed her about the exchange meeting with the Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee.
He stepped into the hallway and answered the call.
“Why are you calling?”
─ Do you have time?
“No. I have to prepare for exams, idiot. What’s up?”
─ I saw the list of transfer students for the second semester and found something strange.
“Why are you looking at the transfer student list?”
─ Because the person in charge is next to me. Does that matter?
To transfer to Ahsung High, one had to pass a high-level transfer exam.
Thus, every semester, about a dozen transfer students came and went.
Unless it was a notorious troublemaker with a history of breaking school rules, the disciplinary committee had no reason to care.
So, the ‘strange student’ Tae-ho mentioned, could it be a troublemaker?
“Don’t just throw work at me. I’m busy.”
─ You really hate it….
Tae-ho clicked his tongue.
“Tell me, what’s the problem?”
─ Transfers are usually to go to a better academy, right? To upgrade their academy.
“Of course.”
“And?”
─ But does it make sense for someone from Hanyang to come to Ahsung?
“……”
There was only one place referred to as ‘Hanyang.’
Hanyang Federal Academy.
Undoubtedly the top academy in Neo Seoul.
Transferring from there to Ahsung would be a downgrade.
It wasn’t incomprehensible, though.
“Why not? They might prefer to be a big fish in a small pond.”
─ It didn’t feel like that. And the fact that they applied for the ‘Disciplinary Committee’ also bothered me.
“……”
─ Maybe I’m just being overly sensitive.
Tae-ho said.
─ Recently, you’ve been making quite a name for yourself. Surely, you’ve made some enemies along the way, and now a transfer student from Hanyang Academy wants to join Ahsung High’s Disciplinary Committee… Doesn’t that sound suspicious?
“It sounds like you’re overanalyzing…”
In matters like this, Tae-ho tends to be quite sensitive.

chapters.title: Chapter 54.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 54 (Continued)
There’s a reason he’s secured a position as an officer in the Ahsung High student council.
To someone who knows nothing, it might just sound like needless fuss.
But having already dealt with a case like Han Seo-jin, it was understandable that his sensitivity would be heightened.
Moreover, with the Head Principal and the problematic students scattered across Neo Seoul targeting her, Tae-ho’s suspicion was worth considering.
“What’s the name?”
─ Kim Yeon-hee.
“Hmm?”
─ Do you know her?
The name was familiar….
‘Ah.’
He quickly remembered.
“I’ve seen the name before. She was with me when we received the Platinum Mileage.”
Indeed.
Just as Tae-ho had said.
If she had received the Platinum Mileage, she wasn’t someone who could be considered the tail of the dragon. She would have been one of the outstanding students at Hanyang Federal Academy.
This was suspicious.
─ So, she’s not an acquaintance.
“No, I’ve never met her in person. Any other suspicious points?”
─ Doesn’t seem like it. Anyway, just keep this in mind. We can’t have another case like Han Seo-jin.
“…Understood.”
He hung up the phone.
Kim Yeon-hee.
He accessed the internet on his smartphone and searched the name.
If she received the Platinum Mileage like himself, there would be news articles about her achievements.
“…A competition?”
Kim Yeon-hee had won first place in a large competition hosted by the Head Principal and the Federal Board, earning the Platinum Mileage as a prize.
‘The Head Principal….’
After learning that the Head Principal was the mastermind, anything related to her seemed suspicious.
But speculating without evidence wouldn’t be meaningful.
It could also be that Tae-ho, having gone through the Han Seo-jin incident, was being overly sensitive. He might be too.
For now, he decided to withhold judgment.
“Huh?”
At that moment, his smartphone vibrated again.
The caller was ‘Vice Leader Oh Baek-seo.’
“Ahem.”
After clearing her throat, he calmly answered the call.
“Hey, Baek-seo?”
─ It’s me.
“?”
Why… did it sound like Geumyang’s voice?
─ I got caught coming out of the shower by your next-door friend.
Suddenly, a cold sweat broke out.
“…Wait. I’ll be right there.”
He returned to his seat, gathered his things, and bolted.
Running to an inconspicuous spot, he then—
Crack!
He created a fissure and used space leap.
‘This is bad.’
Geumyang had asked not to be introduced yet, so he had waited, and with each busy day, he had postponed introducing her to Baek-seo.
‘Is this how it comes back to bite me?’
Caught coming out of the shower?
Who knows what kind of misunderstanding this would cause for Baek-seo, and what Geumyang might have said.
Using space leap several times, he arrived in front of his house.
After catching his breath and composing his expression, he opened the front door and went inside.
“Have you arrived?”
“Welcome.”
Huh?
‘What’s this?’
Why were they sitting across from each other at the living room table…?
And why were there refreshments and steaming tea on the table?
Baek-seo stood up and approached him.
“I didn’t expect you to come so soon. Give me your bag and clothes. I’ll put them in your room.”
“It’s fine, I can do it….”
He declined, finding it burdensome for Baek-seo to act as if she were her wife.
“More importantly, why did you use my phone to call me?”
“She asked to borrow the phone, so I lent it to her.”
Baek-seo answered, glancing at Geumyang.
Geumyang was calmly munching on snacks and watching.
“How much did you two talk?”
He asked Geumyang.
“I told her most of it.”
Most of it?
‘Baek-seo understood and accepted all of that already?’
There must have been a lot to discuss, and some topics wouldn’t have been easy to accept.
“Leader.”
At that moment, Baek-seo called out to him.
“That person you said you’d introduce me to before, it’s her, right?”
“Yes, sorry for the delay.”
“I see….”
Baek-seo smiled kindly and tilted her head slightly.
He realized the significance of Baek-seo’s smile when he heard her next words.
“Do you hug and sleep with Geumyang every day?”
“…Huh?”
What the…?
What exactly did Geumyang explain to make Baek-seo say that?

chapters.title: Chapter 55.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 55 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (3)
“Do you hug and sleep with Geumyang every day?”
“Of course not,” I replied.
For a moment, I felt dizzy and lightheaded, but I barely managed to keep my composure and set the record straight.
I had to figure out what was being said first.
And then…
“My name is Geumyang. My job is a god. My hobbies are reading, watching anime, and movies.”
“Did you introduce yourself like that?”
“Yes.”
I see.
After calming down and listening to the story from both Oh Baek-seo and Geumyang, I realized why Baek-seo quickly understood and dismissed Geumyang’s words.
‘Did she think it was just delusions of grandeur…?’
Who would believe that one was a god-like being derived from the Golden Sheep?
No matter what evidence was shown, it would still seem like the ravings of a pathological liar.
“To reiterate, you look human, don’t you?”
“I’m not human.”
Geumyang sternly corrected Baek-seo.
“I’m a god!”
Geumyang declared triumphantly.
‘Even if you say that….’
Geumyang had an adorably cute appearance.
Seeing her sitting on the sofa, wearing my shirt, arms crossed, looking so self-important… it was hard to find any trace of divine majesty.
From the start, the concept of ‘majesty’ was far from Geumyang.
“Instead, say you’re unemployed.”
“Once again, don’t use such an unworthy term in my presence.”
Needlessly prideful.
“Then… hmm….”
Was Baek-seo looking at Geumyang with pity?
“In summary, the Leader has been ‘taking care’ of this girl?”
“Taking care of me? That child, of me? Ha, absurd!”
Geumyang scoffed and got angry.
“Sorry, I’ll correct myself. This girl has a strange ability that can erase the Leader’s unique power cost, and the Leader has been ‘taking care’ of her, right?”
“The phrase ‘taking care of her’ hasn’t disappeared at all…?”
Did Baek-seo misunderstand?
“Look again, next door. This is my power, Space Domination!”
“Yes, it is.”
“Ugh, why won’t you believe it…?”
Geumyang tried to create a rift as a means of proof.
Even that, Baek-seo seemed to think, was just one of the special magical formulas that happened while removing my penalty.
‘This is absurd.’
I couldn’t help but chuckle.
“Leader, is that why you were late introducing this girl?”
How surprising…
“…Baek-seo.”
“Yes.”
“Let’s talk about that later.”
Baek-seo, who had been smiling kindly, showed doubt in her eyes.
***
It was summer, yet the night wind was still cool.
After roughly finishing the conversation with Geumyang, Baek-seo treated Geumyang comfortably, and Geumyang said she had lost interest and quickly returned to her labyrinth.
‘It ended without any major issues.’
Thankfully, there were no big troubles.
Baek-seo and I stopped by a café to take out a drink and sat on a bench under a streetlight.
A light conversation should be okay.
“Leader, is this a date?”
“…!”
An unexpected attack.
I flinched at Baek-seo’s playful question.
‘She makes my heart flutter at the most unexpected moments….’
Especially after the incident in Baek-seo’s shower room last time, it was even more so.
I didn’t dislike it, but it was still troubling.
“We just came out to talk. Don’t say things like that even here….”
“Just kidding.”
Usually, when Baek-seo suddenly made such jokes, it was to change the atmosphere.
I understood and let it pass.
“Anyway, what I said earlier was a misunderstanding.”
I got straight to the point.
“What was?”
“I’m not taking care of Geumyang. I’m the one being helped.”
If there was a misunderstanding, I wanted to correct it immediately.
Since I would be with Baek-seo for a long time, I didn’t want any weird misunderstandings lingering.
“…Huh?”
Baek-seo’s smile disappeared.
“It might be hard to understand, but everything Geumyang said is true… Why are you looking like that?”
Baek-seo’s expression was gradually hardening.
What could be the problem?
I couldn’t help but worry.
“Leader.”
Baek-seo had an unusually serious expression.
“Yes?”
“Are you really in a master-servant relationship with that girl?”
Crazy.
What is she talking about now?
“I heard that you’re in a master and servant relationship. Geumyang is the master, and you’re the servant or like a dog….”
“…?”
“Is that really true?”
‘This is crazy.’
Geumyang!
It took over ten minutes to explain to Baek-seo.
Fortunately, it didn’t take as long as I expected. Baek-seo just listened without questioning too deeply about the confusing parts.
By the time a third of my lime mojito was left in my hand,
“Well… that’s the story. It might be hard to accept all at once, but just understand that it’s not a relationship to be misunderstood.”
After finishing the explanation, I looked at Baek-seo.
“Yes, I understand what you mean.”
Baek-seo turned towards me, hugging her knees, staring at me intently.
It was a comfortable posture, leaning her shoulders against the backrest, and she had taken off her shoes.
“Thank you for understanding.”
Baek-seo shook her head.
“No, I’m still quite confused.”
“Is it still hard to believe…?”
“Honestly… it might take some time to accept.”
It was a more subdued reaction than I expected.

chapters.title: Chapter 55.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 55 (Continued)
Not that I expected a passionate response in the first place.
This world was full of mysterious forces like The Hole, magical beasts, and magic power.
It wouldn’t be too hard to accept an unknown entity like Geumyang.
But still.
“We’ll have to learn more about it.”
Those words carried a lot of meaning.
It wasn’t something easily believable, so she must have had many questions and doubts.
She was probably just reacting calmly out of consideration for me.
But really.
“…By the way, why are you smiling?”
“Aside from the story, it was funny watching you desperately trying to explain.”
Baek-seo tilted her head to the side, responding with a warm, sincere smile. It was far from her usual fake smile.
“You really didn’t want me to misunderstand you, did you?”
She looked somewhat relieved.
“Of course. You’re my closest ally. I don’t want to hide anything from you.”
A precious close ally and someone I wanted to be with in the future.
I was willing to share everything with Baek-seo, except for my game knowledge and the contents of the Jipbakguri folder.
“That’s a sweet thing to say.”
Baek-seo lowered her gaze and closed her lips for a moment. What was she thinking?
After a moment, as if she had made up her mind, Baek-seo looked into my eyes again.
“Leader.”
“Yes?”
“I still have something I haven’t told you.”
“What is it?”
“I’ll tell you someday when I’m ready.”
“…”
‘I didn’t expect her to say that.’
I thought about it while finishing the remaining lime mojito.
‘It must be about the engraving.’
What came to mind was the magic engraving on Baek-seo’s shoulder.
The symbol of the elite unit, Spartaoi, which performed black ops.
A magical engraving naturally formed through a contract, which remained even after leaving Spartaoi.
However, it would naturally disappear if one expressed their intention to erase the Spartaoi engraving.
Seeing that the engraving was still on Baek-seo’s shoulder, she must have seen some value in keeping it.
‘She must think I don’t know what it means.’
Therefore, Baek-seo had a past she was hiding from me and a purpose she was aiming for.
So, the secret she mentioned she would tell me later was surely about her past as a Spartaoi.
“Take your time. It’s fine with me.”
“Yes… Thank you.”
I would have to wait for Baek-seo to feel comfortable enough to tell me.
As the atmosphere started to feel a bit awkward, I stood up.
“Let’s go back. It’s getting cold.”
“Right. It still doesn’t feel like summer.”
After finishing our light chat, we started heading home.
“But Leader.”
“Yes?”
“Are you going to sleep with that girl, Geumyang, today?”
“No, I told you, I’m not.”
***
“Hey, kid.”
It was dawn.
I was studying at my desk.
Geumyang, who had been lying on the bed reading a manga, spoke to me. She had returned from her labyrinth after Baek-seo left.
“We can’t talk now. I have exams soon.”
“I think I should tell you why I avoided the girl next door. If you’re not interested, then forget it.”
Screeech.
I turned my chair to look at Geumyang.
I had to hear this.
“You respond so quickly. I like that.”
“Go ahead. Why did you avoid her?”
The reason for the delay in introducing Geumyang was that from the start, Geumyang didn’t seem to like Baek-seo very much.
Over time, I realized it wasn’t just because she was shy.
Geumyang closed her manga after putting a bookmark in it and looked at the ceiling.
“Oh Baek-seo, that girl… she smells too much like human blood. She must have had a lot of blood on her hands.”
Geumyang’s mysterious golden eyes glanced at me.
“…Aren’t you surprised? It feels like a sudden twist in a youth comedy turning into a suspense thriller.”
“I’m surprised your nose is that good.”
If she had been a Spartaoi, she would have ‘cleaned up’ many heinous criminals.
It was easy to predict that her hands had been stained with a lot of blood.
It wasn’t a trivial issue, but it wasn’t shocking enough to cause me any real surprise.
“Boring guy. Well, whatever… Anyway.”
Geumyang sat up and looked at me seriously.
“That girl could be on the verge of breaking.”
“What?”
That sudden statement was enough to startle me.
Geumyang raised her right index finger and placed her left palm on top of it.
“She’s like a cheesecake precariously perched on a single chopstick. Right now, she’s holding on because you’re supporting her. If anything happens to you, she’ll undoubtedly resort to rough actions. That’s how desperate she is.”
“Why do you think so?”
“There’s something I can see in people who are on the verge of breaking. What’s the point of explaining metaphysical stuff?”
“…”
Given that Geumyang was a mysterious being who could sense Baek-seo’s bloodstained past, her words didn’t seem out of place.
I suddenly remembered Baek-seo from the game.
Outwardly kind and friendly, but underneath, she seemed like a dark and brooding person. She also had a resolute and ruthless side.
Of course, having a different exterior and interior was a common trait among modern people. However, Baek-seo’s facade was particularly severe, and her true nature seemed as dark as an abyss.
The memories from then and Geumyang’s words overlapped in my mind.
If I weren’t here, in other words, if there weren’t someone to support her.
Would Baek-seo have broken down?
“For some reason, she’s a pitiable girl.”
Geumyang said casually, as if talking about an acquaintance, while lightly shrugging her shoulders.
“That’s why I didn’t really want to see her. She’s bound to be obsessively attached to you.”
Thinking about the original Baek-seo from the game, I fell into deep thought.
“…Did I say something unnecessary?”
Geumyang turned her gaze towards me.
“…Ah.”
Realizing I had taken too long to respond, I shook my head.
“No… It was helpful. Thanks for telling me.”
“I’m glad. I’ll take my payment in the form of a cheesecake.”
Was that why she used cheesecake as a metaphor?
“I’ll buy it in the evening, so eat it.”
“Yay.”
Geumyang lay back down on the bed and resumed reading her manga.
I decided to keep in mind the information she had given me.
It seemed crucial to remember.
And about 30 minutes later,
“Yaaawn…”
Geumyang let out a long yawn.
“Kid, I’m going to sleep…”
“Aren’t you going back today?”
“These days, I like sleeping on this bed… I’ll leave space for you… Good night…”
Geumyang naturally covered herself with the blanket, leaving space for me, and fell asleep.
“…”
Silence fell.
As I returned to studying, Geumyang kicked the blanket away, so I pulled it back up to cover her properly.
Watching her sleep soundly, her words filled my mind again.
This year or next, for some reason, Oh Baek-seo would go missing.
The information I had gathered so far and what Geumyang had told me seemed to be related to Baek-seo’s disappearance.
I had a strong feeling that some unknown events, which I couldn’t know from the protagonist Lee Taesung’s perspective in the game, would soon unfold around me.
I needed to be prepared for that time.
My eyes darkened.
Memories of when Dalbi left my side surfaced.
I never wanted to repeat such an experience.
“….”
I would protect Baek-seo no matter what.
And I would crush anything that got in the way.

chapters.title: Chapter 56.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 56 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (4)
“Disciplinary Committee! You’ve all worked hard throughout the first semester, including the final exams!!”
“Woohoo!”
In the Disciplinary Committee executive office,
Underneath a frame engraved with ‘For the Revival of Humanity,’ Ha Yesong threw a stack of test papers in the air with joy.
Simultaneously, Secretary Park Minhyuk and Treasurer Yoo Doha also tossed their test papers upward.
I sat on the backrest of a sofa, watching them with Vice-Leader Oh Baek-seo. Baek-seo had her usual kind smile on her face beside me.
Shuffling.
Like fluttering petals, the test papers danced and fell to the floor.
The joyful moment was short-lived.
“Whoever has the lowest scores, pick them up.”
Rummaging around.
At my command, Yesong began collecting the fallen test papers without a word. Minhyuk laughed raucously, pointing at Yesong.
‘Finally, the first semester is over.’
So much happened.
‘It was tough, really.’
Final exams are over.
The summer vacation ceremony is tomorrow.
Today, which falls between the final exams and the summer vacation ceremony, ended early with all classes finishing up quickly.
Before I knew it, my first semester as the Disciplinary Committee Leader had ended.
‘Woo-jin, you did well…!’
I comforted myself as I looked out the window.
Puffy clouds drifted leisurely across the blue sky, carried by the wind.
‘But… it’s quiet. Nothing major has happened.’
The feared incidents after awakening my unique ability didn’t occur.
Instead, the subtle tension between Geumyang and Baek-seo was more concerning whenever they met.
Even though information about my unique ability was controlled,
there must be those who gathered information about the anomalies that occurred when I awakened.
‘No strong ones have appeared since Goliath.’
It was unexpected.
After the bomber incident, even the principal remained silent.
‘It’s rather unsettling….’
This tranquility didn’t feel right.
Usually, it’s calmest just before a storm.
‘I wonder if things will go well with Hanyang.’
Meanwhile, Hanyang Federal Academy continued its investigation regarding the responsibility for the practical evaluation incident.
The Ahsung High School Student Council was handling the matter.
According to Yoon Tae-ho, the Student Council Treasurer, I might be held responsible. However, the Student Council President was fiercely opposing this.
The current Ahsung High School Student Council President is not someone of noble character but rather an ordinary person who pursues practicality. It’s all based on self-interest.
“Are we having a staff dinner today?”
“Yoo Doha, don’t bail out again.”
“Hmph. I have a sense of duty, Leader. Isn’t it natural to spend the end of the semester together?”
Sense of duty… That would be the farthest emotion from Doha.
“Surprising? Doha-ssi participating in all executive events? I thought you’d skip again to prove something.”
“Right. Surprising.”
As Yesong looked up at Doha in admiration while picking up the test papers, Minhyuk agreed.
Doha squinted.
“What did you think of me until now…?”
“A cold, antisocial Treasurer.”
“A reclusive loner.”
Doha laughed, saying “Ha, ridiculous” at Yesong and Minhyuk’s blunt replies.
“More importantly!”
After organizing the picked-up test papers,
Yesong slammed a calendar on the table with vigor.
“This time, let’s properly plan a summer retreat!”
Summer retreat.
An activity for the Disciplinary Committee’s unity, where everyone goes for a 1-night, 2-day trip during the summer vacation.
Due to the large number of Disciplinary Committee members, the retreats are handled by each squad, while the executives have a free retreat among themselves.
“Based on our brief discussion last time, the date seems settled. Now that it’s vacation, let’s forget about exam scores and decide where to go!”
“You’re the only one who wants to forget the scores.”
“Leader, you’re being harsh. Do you want me to feel depressed?”
The total exam score is determined by combining midterms, assignments, and final exams.
As a result, Oh Baek-seo and I shared the top spot in the second-year rankings.
Park Minhyuk and Yoo Doha also achieved decent scores.
The one who recorded the lowest score among us, failing to maintain the regret from the midterms, was none other than Ha Yesong.
She said she couldn’t study well because she ate too much and failed to manage her blood sugar.
“Anyway, let’s discuss it.”
We shared and scouted the ‘places worth visiting’ we had researched in advance.
“Right. Leader, didn’t you mention an artificial beach last time?”
“I didn’t say I wanted to go.”
“Summer means the sea! It’s a life etiquette to shout ‘It’s the sea!’ once during summer!”
An artificial beach is a place designed to resemble the sea from the old days. There are several such places, and they are popular vacation spots in summer.
I didn’t particularly have a desire to go.
“Artificial beach is fine, but as I said before, I prefer a camp.”
Although I hadn’t gone on trips after being reborn, I had roamed around various places in games.
While the artificial beach felt disheartening compared to the sea in my previous life, the camp was fine, so if I were to have fun, I’d rather go camping.
‘The problem would be the bugs.’
When going on a summer camp, one inevitably faces enemies.
Ferocious creatures with blood-sucking tendencies, mosquitoes.
And various mountain bugs that evoke disgust.
While these were not an issue in games, they were not to be ignored in reality.
‘Insect repellent should suffice.’
Tools to defend the camp from insects, such as proper insect repellents, should make for a pleasant camping experience.
It’s not that I had a great desire for camping. If the other executives wanted to go to the beach, I was willing to vote for that as well.
“I will follow wherever you decide, Leader. Even to the depths of hell…!”
“Hell is fine…. Don’t do that in the first place. It’s burdensome.”
Minhyuk, full of resolve.
He seemed determined to go wherever I wanted.
“Hehe, Leader?”
Yesong slyly approached me and whispered.
“If we go to the beach, we might get to see Baek-seo-ssi in a bikini?”
“!”

chapters.title: Chapter 56.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 17 (Continued)
I almost shivered reflexively but maintained my composure and managed my expression.
“Ow.”
I flicked Yesong’s forehead lightly.
“If you say weird things like that again, I won’t let it slide.”
“Hehe, I was just joking.”
“Besides, why do you still talk about that….”
“Because it’s fun?”
Yesong rubbed her forehead and continued to smile, whispering again.
“But Leader, you seem quite resistant? You must have imagined something quite stimulating.
Like someone who has seen something even more….”
“You really….”
She had an unnecessary sharp intuition.
