The other executives seemed uninterested in whatever Yesong was saying. It was common for her to spout strange things.
“I’m fine with anywhere I can spend time quietly.”
Doha seemed okay with anywhere.
“I have a suggestion.”
Suddenly, Baek-seo spoke, drawing our attention.
With her kind smile, Baek-seo said,
“I found a camp without bugs. How about that?”
“Show me, Baek-seo-ssi.”
Seeing the screen on Baek-seo’s smartphone, Yesong gasped and exclaimed in shock.
“Unlimited meat supply…?”
Was that the reason?
***
Neo Seoul is located in the center of the Korean Peninsula.
The four seasons rotate smoothly here.
The air polluted by the magical beasts outside clears as it passes over this land.
Radiation too is naturally blocked as if an excessive amount of harmful elements is filtered out.
This was thanks to the blessing of the Golden Sheep bestowed on this land and a few other places on Earth.
‘Why is it so hot….’
Thus, summers here were as scorching as in my previous life.
On the day of the retreat.
The cries of cicadas longing to breed filled the air, and the heat of August made the roads shimmer with heatwaves.
It was a full-fledged summer.
“Phew.”
Thankfully, there was a portable mini air conditioner.
Pressing the power button.
A cool breeze quietly flowed out, cooling my face.
‘Feels amazing every year.’
Although the high-performance battery drained quickly, requiring careful selection of when and how long to use the mini air conditioner,
the cool breeze during the hottest moments brought about a sense of happiness.
“Hmm?”
Soon, a cool breeze also blew from the side.
Baek-seo, who was walking with me, had directed her mini air conditioner towards me.
Turning my head, I saw Baek-seo’s considerate smile.
“What are you doing?”
“You looked hot.”
“I’m fine. You use it.”
I turned Baek-seo’s mini air conditioner back towards her.
Her thoughtfulness was godly.
Due to summer, Baek-seo’s attire had also become lighter. Her fluttering skirt was shorter than usual.
The problem was… occasionally, guys would sneak glances at her.
‘Where are you looking.’
If anyone stared at her, captivated by her appearance, I would make them look away by giving them a look.
When climbing stairs, I subtly walked behind Baek-seo, using the bags in my hands to cover her hips and thighs.
On the subway, I sat next to Baek-seo. The interior of the subway was bathed in the silver sunlight streaming through the windows.
“It’s the first retreat since the first year?”
“How was it back then?”
I remember where we went for the retreat and
what we did.
However, last year, I was focused on becoming the Disciplinary Committee Leader.
Like a politician running for office, I was busy trying to impress the seniors.
The retreat didn’t leave any memorable impressions.
“I’ve never been, so I wouldn’t know.”
?
“Why did you talk as if you had been?”
“I was just basing it on the fact that there was a retreat. Actually, this is my first time. I’m looking forward to it.”
“Well… Let’s have fun then.”
“Yes.”
Since it was her first time, I should ensure it’s a great day for Baek-seo.
***
[Park Minhyuk: I’m sorry ㅠㅠ… I suddenly caught a cold…! I’ll atone by committing seppuku…!]
[Yoo Doha: Suddenly, something important came up that I need to prove.]
[Ha Yesong: My friend is suddenly very sick…]
[Ha Yesong: (Crying emoji)]
[Ha Yesong: I’ll come later!!]
“……”
We arrived at the camp location, a log cabin.
Seeing my smartphone, I frowned.
‘What are they saying…?’
The three executives collectively pulled a no-show, giving excuses as if they were part of a group project.
It didn’t upset me.
It was clearly suspicious.
Even if they were strange, they weren’t devoid of common sense.
So, the sense of discomfort was even stronger.
‘Are they planning something?’
They must have secretly planned something behind my back.
Today isn’t my birthday, nor is it any special anniversary for the Disciplinary Committee, so there must be some hidden motive.
I couldn’t just say ‘Still, come anyway.’ There was no way to prove their excuses were lies.
“Leader, what’s wrong?”
After setting down the luggage, Baek-seo approached me.
“They said they couldn’t come.”
Seeing my smartphone, Baek-seo pondered without a hint of surprise.
“Hmm….”
“Today is the reservation day, so we can’t cancel the stay. We already bought camping supplies, and it would be a waste to leave….”
She was true to her role as Vice-Leader.
Instead of being swayed by emotions, she immediately sought a solution.
What’s this?
Is she trusting them as colleagues?
We turned on the air conditioner and sat against the wall.
Baek-seo was still thinking.
“Baek-seo.”
Feeling sorry for her, I decided to speak directly.
“Those guys clearly….”
“Then it can’t be helped.”
“What?”
Baek-seo, who seemed to have concluded something in her mind, said,
“Let’s have the retreat just the two of us?”
“?”
She gave me a gentle smile.
“I don’t mind at all.”

chapters.title: Chapter 57.1
chapters.content:
Chapter 57 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (5)
“I’m telling you, Leader and Baek-seo are definitely dating!”
Near the campsite, in a café.
It was located along a mountain road, a place that repurposed an old train, decorating its exterior and interior beautifully.
There, two Ahsung High School Disciplinary Committee executives sat together.
“Hooh.”
Treasurer Yoo Doha sipped his iced Americano, reacting nonchalantly.
“They might not be officially dating, but they’re definitely in a romantic phase…!”
Ha Yesong spoke earnestly.
“Don’t you think you’re a little too interested in their love life?”
“What are you saying, human? You’re interested too, that’s why you’re part of this plan.”
“I just didn’t want to interfere with them.”
Doha calmly stared at the CoconutTalk chat window on his smartphone.
Secretary Park Minhyuk, Yesong, and Doha had all made excuses to skip the camp at the last minute.
Vice-Leader Oh Baek-seo, known as the saint of Ahsung High School, would have likely noticed their true intentions and remained composed, but what about Leader Ahn Woo-jin’s mood?
It probably wouldn’t be good, no matter how you look at it.
“Worried?”
“Skipping the camp on the day itself isn’t a great stance to take.”
“Hey, Doha? This is a golden opportunity! It’s an inevitable risk. The two of them will probably be thrilled with this chance.”
Yesong was excited.
After all, it was the romance of her close colleague Leader Ahn Woo-jin and Vice-Leader Oh Baek-seo. Naturally, she couldn’t help but be intensely curious.
“Hmph… Do as you please.”
Doha turned away, snickering.
He felt resigned.
“Oh, here he is.”
When the phone on the table vibrated, Yesong answered the call.
Yesong and Doha leaned closer to the phone.
“Minhyuk-ssi. How’s it going?”
─ A variable has emerged.
“?”
─ The Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee Leader is here…!
Why is he here?
Yesong and Doha both showed identical expressions of confusion.
***
“Ahem….”
I couldn’t help but make an awkward cough.
Since Baek-seo accepted the suggestion to have the retreat just the two of us with a “It can’t be helped.”
‘Suddenly, it’s not a retreat but a date….’
I wasn’t sure about Baek-seo’s thoughts, but to me, it was definitely a date.
“Baek-seo, I’m going to the bathroom for a bit.”
“Okay. I’ll look around here.”
As soon as I entered the bathroom, I immediately accessed the internet on my smartphone.
I posted a question on Speedy Knowledge.
Q. What do a man and a woman usually do when they go on a 1-night, 2-day trip together?
A. They engage in intercourse.
I clicked the dislike button on the answer.
Then, after thinking about it, it seemed like a reasonable answer, so I also clicked the like button.
A2. Seems like you’re single. They usually visit beautiful places or enjoy various experiences. They generally take a lot of photos, to create memories and to show off on social media.
Photos!
‘That makes sense.’
Couples usually take all kinds of photos when they travel.
‘The tutorial on how to take profile pictures for a girlfriend might come in handy.’
I had randomly watched a YouTube video titled ‘How to Take Profile Pictures for Your Girlfriend’ out of boredom before.
Back then, I imagined Kim Dalbi would be my girlfriend, not Baek-seo.
‘That makes me a bit sad.’
But no time for such thoughts now.
Feeling annoyed at being labeled single, I disliked the second answer as well before leaving the bathroom.
“Baek-seo?”
Coming out of the bathroom, I looked for Baek-seo.
‘It’s quiet. Did she go out?’
I stepped out of the log cabin.
I immediately noticed Secretary Park Minhyuk hiding in a tree but pretended not to see him.
He was trying to act like a spy movie protagonist, and it would be rude to disturb him. I was just glad he wasn’t actually sick with a summer cold.
“Hmm?”
I found Baek-seo.
She was talking to a familiar man and woman.
“Ah, Leader.”
“!”
When Baek-seo called me, the two looked startled.
Glasses guy.
The one from the exchange meeting with the Ahsung High School Disciplinary Committee….
‘Lee Jae-ho?’
It was Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee Leader Lee Jae-ho and Vice-Leader Shin Ga-yeon.
“Ahn Woo-jin…?”
Jae-ho was surprised.
Ga-yeon quickly composed herself and bowed to me.
“Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee, why are you here…?”
I asked as I approached Baek-seo.
Jae-ho and Ga-yeon were in perfect vacation attire. It was clear they had come here to relax.
“They said they’re here for a retreat like us, but their other members couldn’t make it due to circumstances.”
Baek-seo answered on their behalf.
‘For a retreat, the cabin seems small?’
The log cabin behind them.
It looked just right for two people.
“Never expected to run into Ahsung High School in a place like this….”
Jae-ho adjusted his glasses with his usual seriousness.
“Don’t tell me you’re here to spy on Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee? Did you use informants for this too?”
“No way….”
Maybe because of the arm-wrestling match we had during the exchange meeting, his suspicion seemed heightened.
“Leader, please stop imagining things. It’s obviously a coincidence.”
Vice-Leader Shin Ga-yeon rebuked with an annoyed expression.
“Vice-Leader, why would I meet this guy by coincidence? What’s so special about coincidences!?”
“There’s no way to answer if you blame coincidences….”
Ga-yeon sighed softly.
“This place has good conditions, great views, unlimited meat, and high ratings as a campsite.”
“But…!”
“We booked late, so this was the only time we could get. Ahsung High School might have booked late too, given the amount of incidents they’ve been dealing with. It’s quite possible.”
“I know that!”
Jae-ho flared up.
‘Why don’t you just ask us directly?’
I didn’t understand why he was making deductions in front of us.
Even if they were correct deductions.
“Leader.”
While Jae-ho and Ga-yeon were bickering, Baek-seo whispered to me, covering her mouth with her hand.
“Let’s pretend we don’t know.”
“Of course.”
Interesting.
From the game, I knew Lee Jae-ho had a sister complex.
He adored and admired his sister.
But did that emotion have nothing to do with romantic feelings?
Or was Shin Ga-yeon attractive enough to surpass even that?
Well, the result was right in front of me.
‘We’re in the same boat.’
Mayeon High School also forbids dating on campus.
However, the Disciplinary Committee, which is supposed to enforce the rules, having its Leader and Vice-Leader break the rules….
‘I’m not in a position to criticize.’
I felt a sense of kinship rather than contempt.
Of course, I still strictly followed the rules.
“That’s it. I’m heading back first!”
Jae-ho stomped off back to the log cabin.
“Rest well, Ahsung High School.”
“You too.”
Ga-yeon greeted us politely before following Jae-ho.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 57.2
chapters.content:
Chapter 57 (Continued)
There was a small private pool in front of the log cabin.
It was shaded under a canopy, blocking the sunlight, and lit by lights.
It felt cool.
In winter, it was used as an open-air bath.
Wearing a black rash guard, I soaked in the pool, taking in the view of the forest below the mountain.
If this were a normal retreat, I’d be enjoying the scenery and relaxing….
‘This is bad…. I’m getting more nervous.’
My heart was beating aggressively.
The retreat with Baek-seo felt more like a date, which I was trying to ignore.
‘Because of Mayeon High School….’
The presence of the Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee brought the date-like feeling to the surface, making it undeniable.
My heart felt like it was going to explode.
‘This is crazy.’
Still, a vigorous body.
The freedom of the trip + being alone with the girl I like. The two combined made me feel extremely excited.
‘Can I get through today without breaking my image…?’
I had no confidence.
“Leader, did you wait long?”
“Oh, you’re….”
When I turned to the direction of Baek-seo’s voice, my time stopped.
Baek-seo in a swimsuit that accentuated her figure.
It was close to a rash guard, but the short hem of the top exposed her slender waist and smooth abdomen.
The bottom was very short, almost like underwear, showing off her legs.
‘Ugh…!’
I clutched my chest internally.
My heart hurt.
Baek-seo usually dressed in a modest and fluttery manner.
Perhaps that’s why her bold attire today was a strong stimulus to my heart.
Even though she wore long sleeves to cover the magic engraving on her shoulder, it didn’t matter.
“What’s wrong? Is this outfit weird?”
“No way….”
I was just grateful….
“Come in.”
“Okay. I’m coming in.”
Speaking in a soft tone, Baek-seo smiled like an angel as she entered the small pool.
She placed a tube and a tray on the pool, floating them.
On the tray were drinks.
Meanwhile, I pretended to look at the view, avoiding giving Baek-seo a proper glance.
‘I’m going to die…. Why is she so pretty?’
It was overwhelming.
The fact that it was just the two of us in a date-like situation made my heart pound even more.
“What are you looking at?”
Suddenly, Baek-seo came up beside me. She leaned her arms on the pool edge like I did, looking at the view together.
It was hard to maintain my expression.
“Just enjoying the scenery. Should I take a picture for you?”
Trying to change the topic naturally, I met Baek-seo’s eyes.
She shook her head and smiled.
“I’d rather just stay like this for now.”
“…We can take pictures later then.”
I didn’t expect that.
Don’t people usually like taking pictures? Not me, but generally.
“…It’s hard to do something fun with just the two of us. Retreats are meant to be enjoyed with many people. This is too quiet, isn’t it?”
I said whatever came to mind in the quietness.
If the other executives were here,
it would have been noisy even in this small pool, and the atmosphere would have been quite lively.
‘It’s a shame Baek-seo’s first retreat turned out like this.’
I didn’t know the exact intentions of the three executives, but it was a shame I couldn’t make it more enjoyable for Baek-seo.
“I’m already having plenty of fun.”
Baek-seo answered with a confused expression.
“Huh? Isn’t this the same as usual with just the two of us?”
“No, it’s different. I’m excited.”
Baek-seo smiled.
“It’s not a common opportunity, is it?”
…?
“It’s rare, yes?”
I thought it was just a polite response.
But seeing Baek-seo’s genuinely happy face, I was surprised.
“Hmm…. But it’s not just about me having fun, should we play a game?”
“Sure. What game?”
“Let’s do a duck walk race underwater to the other side, but with our eyes closed.”
An unexpected game.
“What kind of game is that? It’s unique.”
“Duck race?”
Why did she sound unsure of the game’s name?
“…Did you just make it up?”
“Caught me.”
Baek-seo laughed playfully.
Cute.
“Well, sounds fun.”
It was something active and not too difficult since it was in the water.
The pool was small, so it would be a quick round trip.
Even if we collided, it wouldn’t hurt, and it might create some funny moments.
“Let’s bet something. Like a light request?”
“Got it.”
After moving the tray with drinks and the tube out of the pool,
Baek-seo and I positioned ourselves at one end of the pool.
“Ready, go.”
At Baek-seo’s word, we squatted and submerged, and I started the duck walk with my eyes closed.
A few seconds later.
In the darkness, my hand touched the opposite wall.
‘Reached the other side.’
Turning around, I extended my hand and started to return to the original spot.
Squishy.
‘Huh?’
I felt a smooth sensation that shouldn’t have been there and opened my eyes in surprise.
Rising quickly, I saw Baek-seo’s smooth abs right in front of me.
As I lifted my gaze, I saw Baek-seo, her hair soaked, looking down at me.
I realized then that my hand had touched Baek-seo’s thigh.
“Pervert.”
Her gentle voice whispered in my ear.
Though not a serious accusation, Baek-seo was smiling softly.
“……”
Before I could feel embarrassed, I was momentarily dazed.
They say extreme surprise can make you calm?
That’s how I felt.
“Sorry…. As a leader, I made a mistake….”
Finally, an apology slipped out of my mouth.
Baek-seo shook her head playfully.
“It’s okay. I know it wasn’t intentional.”
“Of course, it wasn’t intentional.”
“Yes, that’s right. Anyway, you lost, Leader.”
“It seems so.”
But did Baek-seo really do the duck walk?
‘Come to think of it, I didn’t feel anything beside me while walking.’
Did she plan this from the start….
No way.
That’s too far-fetched.
In any case, I felt like I had lost to Baek-seo in more ways than one.
“Let’s get the drinks….”
Trying to act natural, I quickly moved away from Baek-seo and turned my head.
Swallowing my dry throat, I felt an intense thirst.
‘Can’t keep my expression neutral….’
Despite the cool water, my head felt hot.
I felt like I was losing my composure.
I needed to drink something to manage my emotions.
As I moved towards the drinks,
“?”
I suddenly noticed the log cabin where the Mayeon High School Disciplinary Committee was staying.
Jae-ho and Ga-yeon were in the small pool in front of their cabin, holding each other’s shoulders, gazing into each other’s eyes, lost in their own world.
“Leader? Ah.”
Baek-seo approached me and saw the same scene.
We both froze.
“……!”
Jae-ho and Ga-yeon noticed our gaze and quickly separated. The sound of splashing water echoed to us.
With flushed faces, they both looked down. It was a pure moment of youthful romance.
‘Please, don’t make me conscious of this….’
Seeing others in love makes you want to experience it too.
Because of them, the atmosphere between Baek-seo and me grew awkward.

chapters.title: Chapter 58
chapters.content:
Chapter 58 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (6)
Last year, on the day of the induction ceremony for new disciplinary committee members.
That’s when I first met Baek Seo.
There were so many new members that the welcome ceremony was divided into groups.
Naturally, even among the freshmen, Baek Seo received an extraordinary amount of attention.
Many seniors praised her, saying, "You are the future of our disciplinary committee," and showered her with all sorts of compliments.
Her peers admired Baek Seo's abilities, calling her a genius, and were eager to win her favor.
The quiet competition among the male students, who felt romantic emotions towards Baek Seo and approached her, was quite interesting.
With a gentle smile, Baek Seo kindly accepted each approach. Many male students were delighted just by the fact that she didn’t shy away from them, as burning youth often does.
However, there was one fact that Baek Seo couldn't hide from me.
"They're all being avoided."
Baek Seo was displaying her high-level boundary-drawing skills.
Thanks to my past social experiences and the character traits I saw in her from the game, it was easy to understand.
I wasn't particularly interested.
I wasn't in a hurry to fill the emptiness in my heart after Kim Dalbi left.
Moreover, the characters I could call my favorite in the game were only the heroines attending Saeing High School, the female leads of the protagonist, Lee Taeseong.
In the game, the impression I had of Baek Seo was just of a "pretty female character."
Of course, it was important to gather information about Baek Seo, who would become the vice president, but that was a secondary task.
What was more important was to score points with the seniors from the start. I had to become the next president of the disciplinary committee.
There was no better opportunity than the induction ceremony for new members.
So I lost interest in Baek Seo and was busy trying to win the favor of the senior members by showing a disciplined attitude.
The seniors enjoyed my strict demeanor and seriousness, and they nodded with satisfaction every time they heard my ambition to become the president.
Of course, every senior subtly hinted that Baek Seo would become the next president, showing their concern.
I didn't care.
Baek Seo wouldn't become the president.
The welcome ceremony continued late into the night.
When I went out for some fresh air.
On my way to the convenience store, a female student approached me.
"Hey, where are you going?"
It was Baek Seo.
"?"
Why is she talking to me outside?
A girl I hadn’t even greeted before.
The character Baek Seo I knew didn’t have a particularly good personality.
A hypocritical smile, secretly looking down on others.
That’s how she was depicted in the game.
In a way, it was a personality I didn’t like. An uncharacteristic adult-like sullenness for her age.
Of course, later on, my opinion changed, and I recognized that there was no one as kind as Baek Seo.
But at that time, it was so.
That’s why it was strange that Baek Seo, who was unfamiliar to me, talked to me.
"I’m going to the convenience store."
"Me too. Shall we go together?"
"Hmm? I don’t mind."
I really didn’t mind.
She wouldn’t have any malicious intent.
At the nearby convenience store, I looked for banana milk.
"1+1 event. The event period is until today."
One would satisfy my need, but it felt like a loss to buy just one, so I chose two.
My thrifty saving spirit, Ahn Woojin, played a part in that.
Baek Seo chose chocolate, and we each paid for our own.
On the way back to the party venue.
"Will you drink both of those?"
"I picked two because of the one-plus-one event. Want one?"
I actually only wanted to drink one.
I didn’t mind giving the other one.
"No. It's okay…."
Baek Seo glanced at the party venue and then changed her mind.
"Actually, could I have one?"
I handed her one banana milk and a straw, and she inserted the straw into the milk.
Sluuuurp. She took a sip and started talking.
"I overheard earlier. Did you say you’re going to become the president…?"
It was a cautious question.
That’s when I realized why Baek Seo had followed me.
‘Did she follow me to ask about this?’
She must have been a little curious after hearing my ambition.
Which made sense because everyone in the disciplinary committee had already decided that Baek Seo would be the next president.
Baek Seo couldn’t have been unaware of that atmosphere.
Even if I were someone else, I would have thought, ‘Is Ahn Woojin an idiot?’
‘Well, other students also couldn’t say they wanted to be the president.’
Other students aiming to become the next president were also not revealing their ambitions because of Baek Seo’s presence.
Even the one who became the president in the original story was keeping quiet.
It’s natural for people to shrink back in the face of a high-level competitor.
So, even if I were Baek Seo, I would have been curious.
How clueless and foolish must one be to declare, "I will be the president of the disciplinary committee!" with a genius like Baek Seo as the competition.
"That's right."
I answered nonchalantly.
Anyway, you’re not going to be the president.
You’ll reveal that intention later when the candidates are selected.
So, there was no reason for me to worry about Baek Seo.
"I will be the president. Sorry if you were planning to be."
"You're quite confident."
Was she testing me?
Or mocking me?
"I’ll pay you back for the milk later."
Baek Seo said, lightly shaking the banana milk.
"No need. It’s not a favor that would create a sense of debt."
"Is that so?"
She threw the empty banana milk container into a nearby trash can.
There was Park Minhyuk crammed into the leaf collection trash can next to it, but I ignored him, thinking he was a madman.
"Take care."
I entered the party venue first.
Baek Seo was receiving the affection of many male students, and many members were gathered at the venue at that time.
To become the next president, it was crucial not to earn their disfavor, so I wanted to distance myself from Baek Seo for the time being.
For some reason, Baek Seo quietly watched my retreating figure.
After returning to the party venue, I occasionally glanced out the window. For some reason, Baek Seo stayed outside the building instead of entering the venue.
For a while, she leaned against the outer wall of the building, drinking banana milk and spending time, probably on her smartphone.
‘…Seems boring.’
It looked like the welcome ceremony was boring to her.
I must have been part of that ‘boring’ category too.
Then I understood why she took the banana milk from me. She probably wanted something to drink while spending time outside.
Ignoring Baek Seo, I focused on the welcome ceremony.
Eventually, Baek Seo returned to the venue, greeted the seniors, and then left.
"What's on your mind?"
Baek Seo's subtle voice cut off my flashback.
It was after spending time at the pool and taking a shower. The banana milk in my hand reminded me of last year.
"I just suddenly remembered last year's welcome ceremony."
Poke. I inserted a straw into the banana milk and drank it. It was sweet.
"President, you gave me banana milk back then, right?"
"Yes. At that time, Park Minhyuk was also stuck in the trash can."
"Was he? I don’t remember that."
It should have been quite noticeable.
It was a pretty impressive scene.
…Well, maybe not.
That’s right. It was the welcome ceremony that seemed boring to Baek Seo back then. She probably wasn’t interested in the antics of the students.
Come to think of it.
"…Suddenly, I’m curious."
"Hmm?"
I realized I could ask now.
"How did I seem to you back then? When I was going around declaring I would be president."
While sipping banana milk, Baek Seo paused and then answered after some thought.
"Honestly, I don’t think I had a very good impression."
As expected, it wasn’t a good impression.
"But I think I was a bit interested. To see if it was just an empty desire."
"Really…."
So, at least you were curious.
"In hindsight, I think it was fortunate."
"What?"
"I had a reason to talk to you, the president."
"…Was it?"
Baek Seo smiled softly.
"Let's go have dinner."
It was getting close to sunset.
Park Minhyuk was walking along the mountain road, following the guardrail.
─ Report, secretary. Did the president and vice president engage in any affectionate behavior? "Strategic retreat." ─ What? Why!? "Handling the president and vice president is tough enough. How can I monitor them with the Myunghyeon High School president too?" Minhyuk replied to Ha Yesong, who was role-playing on the other end of the smartphone.
─ Were you always this weak? Show your full stealth skills that you developed being stuck in trash cans! "That sounds a bit offensive… Anyway, I’m not confident. What if I get caught and something bad happens?"
Ahn Woojin, Oh Baek Seo.
And the president and vice president of Myunghyeon High School.
It was practically impossible to monitor them closely and secretly.
Unless some special method was used.
─ Well…. Can’t be helped.
Yesong agreed and changed the plan.
─ We’ll go with Plan B!
The people who came to the campsite were preparing dinner at the outdoor tables.
The food was provided by the campsite. We just had to bring ourselves to the table.
‘Though there’s no romanticism of grilling barbecue ourselves. This is good for just the two of us.’
Barbecue is romanticized, but the process of grilling meat is hot and tiring.
In the current situation, it was better to enjoy delicious meat comfortably.
‘Those guys….’
The president and vice president of Myunghyeon High School seemed to be eating meat amicably.
The president, Lee Jaehho, and I made eye contact. We narrowed our eyes and stared at each other for a while, then turned our gazes away.
‘Pretending not to know each other is for the best.’
Nothing happened. It was best for us to pass it off like that today. We silently agreed.
I had dinner with Baek Seo, taking pictures of each other. Then I turned my head towards the direction where Park Minhyuk was before.
‘He’s been gone for a while.’
I didn’t know where he went.
‘What on earth are they doing…?’
Ha Yesong was eyeing unlimited meat. I didn’t know what her plan was, but I didn’t want to skip a meal….
"Hmm?"
Towards the direction of another log cabin.
I briefly saw a familiar face through the window.
The face of a female student with cheeks puffed up like a hamster, stuffed with something.
When she noticed my head turning, she made an ‘Oh no’ expression and quickly ducked.
‘Why are you there…?’
It was obviously Ha Yesong.

chapters.title: Chapter 59
chapters.content:
Chapter 58 – Rule 22. The Leader Stays Composed (7)
Those guys….’
I hadn’t been mistaken. I was sure I saw Ha Yesong staring at me with a mouth full of pork belly from the log cabin.
‘First it was Park Minhyuk. Now it’s Ha Yesong….’
It seemed the committee members were watching us from the other log cabin.
I began to understand why they didn’t join us at the camp.
‘Is it to leave Baek Seo and me alone?’
They had a history of such behavior.
‘What a pointless effort….’
Just as I was about to get up and bring them over, Baek Seo’s gentle voice caught my attention.
“What are you looking at?”
“Baek Seo, it seems like the others….”
“Hmm?”
She tilted her head, listening intently to what I was saying.
“Uh….”
Suddenly, her face glowed with a radiance one might only find in a romance manga.
They say that when you see a celebrity in person, they actually seem to shine.
Being next to Baek Seo, I could experience that phenomenon firsthand.
My bottom reattached to the chair. It was irresistible.
“Why didn’t they all come? The meat is delicious. It’s a shame.”
“Right.”
Well….
Wouldn’t it be okay?
After all, it seemed their unanimous goal was for Baek Seo and me to be alone.
‘I’ll respect their intentions.’
It seemed better to delay questioning until it was impossible to pretend ignorance, or until they revealed themselves.
That’s how I persuaded myself.
“Let’s find another time to meet up again.”
Baek Seo let out a kind laugh.
Relieved that Yesong had her fill of unlimited meat, I chatted with Baek Seo.
……
The pros and cons of a retreat: playing with several people in one house.
If you’re with close friends, the pros stand out.
While it was fun being alone with Baek Seo, it wasn’t the kind of fun you get from a retreat.
“I think those two will end up together.”
Baek Seo shared her thoughts while watching a dating program on TV.
The show featured high school students, attractive like celebrities, who had retreats and got into romantic antics. As usual with dating programs, it was quite entertaining.
“It does look like that.”
“It’s called mirroring when someone unconsciously mimics the other’s actions.”
“Mirroring?”
“A symptom that appears when you have feelings for someone.”
Baek Seo gave me a look as if I had exhibited mirroring behavior.
‘What should we do now?’
We had done everything there was to do together until it got dark.
We had talked so much over food that we had run out of topics.
‘We’re both not very talkative people….’
In the end, even during a retreat, we ended up talking while watching TV.
Playing silly pranks was also difficult. Neither of our personalities suited that.
‘It also affects my image.’
After all, Baek Seo was the kind of person who suited spending leisurely time talking to flowers in a garden.
‘It doesn’t seem right to call Geumyang over either.’
I had told her in advance that I wouldn’t see her today because of the committee retreat.
Though it didn’t feel like a committee retreat, calling Geumyang over today felt wrong.
‘Should I drag the committee members over? No, that’s also not right.’
After all, this quiet time was filling my heart with excitement.
Unintentionally, I was spending a peaceful day at the campsite with Baek Seo. How could that not be happy?
Moreover, their goal was for Baek Seo and me to spend time alone. Forcing them to come over would be a problem.
“President.”
Lost in thought, I heard Baek Seo’s voice.
“How are we going to sleep tonight?”
“We’ll split the rooms. We need to decide who sleeps where. I don’t mind sleeping anywhere.”
“Hmm…. I’ll take a last look around.”
“Go ahead.”
Baek Seo inspected the rooms and went upstairs. She then looked down at me from the second-floor railing.
“President, come up here?”
“Why?”
“Just come up.”
Okay.
I got up from the sofa and headed for the stairs.
“Turn off the lights.”
“Why?”
“You’ll understand when you get here.”
Turning off the lights made the house pitch dark.
Still, the lamps on the walls emitted a soft glow, allowing me to see around.
I climbed the stairs to the second floor.
Baek Seo was standing by the window, bathed in moonlight. She beckoned me over.
A gentle breeze blew through the wide-open window. Since it was in the mountains, it was cool despite being summer.
Standing beside her, I looked out the window.
“Oh, quite….”
A sky dotted with stars came into view. It was a sight rarely seen in the city.
It wasn’t dramatically beautiful, but the sheer number of stars was enough to excite anyone.
“There are a lot of stars.”
“Yeah. They’re pretty.”
“The mountains make them more visible. It’s a shame they don’t photograph well.”
“Why did you tell me to turn off the lights?”
“Just because? It’s more atmospheric.”
Baek Seo smiled contentedly.
“…You’re excited.”
“Not really.”
After a while, we silently gazed at the starry sky.
Then it hit me.
“Come to think of it, we haven’t taken many pictures.”
Maybe because it had been a while since such a situation, I had forgotten.
Also, Baek Seo wasn’t fond of taking pictures.
“Should we take some now…?”
“I’m ready.”
“That was quick.”
Before I could suggest it, she had already taken out her smartphone and activated the camera.
“Want to look here?”
She extended her arm holding the smartphone, capturing both of us and the view outside in the frame.
Besides the moonlight, the charming lights unique to the campsite made it quite bright.
Finding the right angle of reflection for the light, she subtly moved closer to me.
‘Hmm.’
A pleasant scent wafted from her neck.
Click. Click.
We took a few photos with light gestures.
‘The perfect subject.’
Not me, but Baek Seo.
She seemed destined to be a commercial model.
But….
“…Is it okay for us to take pictures alone? It’s a committee retreat, after all.”
I asked out of nervousness from being so close to her.
“Leaving such evidence might put us in a disadvantageous situation later for some reason.”
“Because we look like a couple?”
“Did you have to say it so bluntly…?”
She shattered my roundabout way of saying it out of embarrassment.
“As I said before, I don’t mind.”
I expected that answer.
“Well… I was just saying.”
What should I call this?
‘It feels rebellious….’
We’re the president and vice president, supposed to lead by example.
Yet here we are at the committee retreat, taking cozy pictures together.
Would we be treated as a couple?
‘Disgraceful.’
Even if we weren’t actually a couple.
Leaving such circumstantial evidence would mean setting a bad example.
Of course, it might just be a concern similar to a sense of professional ethics. Maybe even an obsession.
Moreover, it’s a common cliché in various media that the disciplinary committee members are more morally corrupt than other students or frequently break the rules secretly.
…No, that’s only in fiction.
In reality, a large and responsible disciplinary committee would feel guilty about such things.
‘That’s probably why the Myunghyeon High School kids sneaked off to date.’
The result of committee members who couldn’t resist their romantic desires was right next door.
Thinking of them, my gaze naturally turned towards the other log cabin.
It came into view.
“?” “?”
…We made eye contact.
‘Huh?’
Shin Ga-yeon, the vice president of Myunghyeon High School, sitting by the window.
And… President Lee Jae-ho, who was engaging in affectionate behavior with Ga-yeon, met my eyes.
We were both ranked above 5th dan.
Being sensitive sometimes had its drawbacks.
“…….” “…….”
We exchanged determined looks.
It was automatic.
‘Let’s pretend nothing happened today.’
My intention seemed to get through, as Jae-ho nodded and slowly drew the curtain.
I turned away from him.
‘They’ve gone all the way….’
My facial muscles twitched.
Were they aiming to fulfill their ultimate desires tonight?
Were the president and vice president planning to completely disregard the rules?
Were they planning to blatantly break the rules if they were going to?
‘Should I take solace in not being at that stage yet?’
The thought that something would happen next door tonight filled my head. My vibrant imagination fueled by my youthful vigor caused heat to rise in my head.
Trying to push the thought away, I looked at the back of Baek Seo’s head.
“……?”
She was silently looking out the window.
Her gaze was directed at the window of the next log cabin.
“Did you see?”
“…….”
She nodded without a word.
Her face was as calm as a still lake. She looked like a sage who had attained enlightenment.
“President, were we rivals with Myunghyeon High School?”
“I think so…. You knew, right?”
“Yeah?”
“Hmm…?”
Thud.
Suddenly, Baek Seo turned and pushed me against the window.
“Baek Seo?”
My bottom hit the window sill, and my hands grabbed the window frame to keep from falling.
“Stay still?”
She whispered softly in a private tone.
Then she stretched her arms out on either side of me, gripping the window frame and looking up at me from a close distance. As if to prevent me from escaping sideways.
A strange silence filled the air.
Bathed in moonlight, she stared into my eyes with that graceful face and then smiled slightly.
“…What are you doing?”
I half-closed my eyes.
“Seeing the rival suddenly filled me with a sense of competition.”
“In what way?”
No matter how I thought about it, it wasn’t in a healthy way.
Of course, it was probably just a usual joke. That was my conscious thought.
It might just be a little stronger joke because we were alone.
However…, in the current situation of being alone in a dark house, Baek Seo’s proactive attitude.
The mere thought of 'what if' deeply ingrained in my mind was enough to raise the heat in my body.
“You know.”
She spoke.
“I’m a girl too?”
It was a meaningful tone.

chapters.title: Chapter 60
chapters.content:
The circumstances and Baek Seo’s sultry whisper were making my heart race.
“Wa-wait a minute….”
My words stumbled out, unbidden.
‘Why is she being so aggressive?’
I had occasionally fantasized about taking charge and kissing Baek Seo passionately.
But in reality, doing so without being in a relationship was out of the question.
If I acted impulsively, I, the president of the disciplinary committee, could end up being accused of a crime.
Moreover, I still had responsibilities as a reincarnator and the president. I didn’t want to create a distracting element (a romantic relationship) at this point.
Relationships should be built step by step for the excitement to last.
‘What am I even thinking right now?’
I was lost in sudden turmoil, my usual poker face on the verge of breaking in this intense atmosphere.
Had I always been this weak…?
“Is the president weaker than me?”
Her unexpected question, as if reading my mind, made me swallow my breath.
Of course, I didn’t show it.
“Of course not….”
“Then the choice lies with the stronger one, which is me, right?”
What nonsense was this?
Seeing her predatory, relaxed smile, my heart pounded wildly for various reasons.
‘This is driving me crazy….’
No matter how much I controlled my expression, I couldn’t stop my face from flushing.
Pushing Baek Seo away or escaping wasn’t an option. I was still just a man.
In the end, I covered my mouth with my hand and looked away, not wanting to show my discomposed face.
For some reason, Baek Seo stopped moving as if she was holding her breath, her lips twitching.
‘Calm down….’
Clear mind.
I organized my jumbled thoughts and tried to calm my raging emotions, managing to compose my expression again. Then I looked at Baek Seo, trying to appear natural.
“Vice President.”
To maintain my authority, I used her official title. My voice trembled slightly.
“You’re not planning to engage in any behavior that would undermine our discipline, right?”
“Like what?”
What a sly fox.
Was she trying to make me say it directly?
“Things like… those behaviors between a man and a woman.”
“Hmm.”
“Such things should be done at least after you get a boyfriend, don’t you think?”
“A boyfriend….”
“It’s natural to feel desires as a human, and it’s also natural to feel strong urges after seeing those Myunghyeon guys. But it wouldn’t be wise to let that ruin our relationship.”
‘Once’ is a harsh rule.
If my relationship with Baek Seo reached the point of fulfilling our desires even once, the psychological barriers would collapse. Then I wouldn’t trust myself to restrain anymore.
That’s why I desperately suppressed my desires, not falling for Baek Seo’s suggestive jokes.
‘I don’t have the luxury.’
To capture all the six criminals and lead a peaceful life.
At least during my term as president, it was best to eliminate any factors that might cause me to lose focus.
‘Am I rambling right now?’
But the structure of my words made sense, so I should consider myself fortunate.
Yeah, it’s still okay.
Calm down.
I won’t falter.
I am the president of the disciplinary committee.
Besides, Baek Seo had her usual playful expression, just like when she was joking.
I could push her away like this.
“We’re the president and vice president of the disciplinary committee. We shouldn’t behave like this.”
“What would you do if I got a boyfriend?”
“……!”
Suddenly, an unpleasant image flashed in my mind, making my eyes widen.
“Yes, that’s it.”
Baek Seo, seeing my reaction, smiled contentedly and began to rise on her toes.
She closed her eyes and leaned her head towards me.
Time seemed to slow down, and a whirlwind of thoughts spun in my head.
My body froze like a malfunctioning machine.
And then.
Baek Seo’s head veered to the side of mine.
“Huh?”
Crack!
Suddenly, I heard a crackling sound. I turned my head towards it.
“Sorry, President.”
Baek Seo, with her head beside mine, extended her finger out the window. A trace of electricity lingered at her fingertip.
It was the power of her unique elemental magic, different from basic elemental mana.
She had lightly swung it, so there was no need to worry about penalties.
I quickly turned my head in the direction she was looking and enhanced my vision with magic.
The other log cabin.
The place where I had seen Ha Yesong earlier, near the window.
There was a hole in the fluttering curtain caused by the wind.
It sizzled and cooled off in the breeze. It seemed to have been damaged by Baek Seo’s lightning strike.
Ha Yesong, who had fallen, looked at us in surprise. Soon, Park Minhyuk and Yoo Do-ha, who came to her aid, entered my view.
“They were watching us closely. I set a trap for them. And I played a little prank. Though… it might have been a bit much.”
Baek Seo said as she stood beside me.
The cold splash of reality brought clarity. Then came the rush of shame.
At that moment when Baek Seo approached, I had nearly lost myself in a flood of thoughts. I almost leaned in to kiss her.
The atmosphere Baek Seo created just now was that lethal.
Ahem.
Clearing my throat, I silently collected myself.
“Yeah…. I had a feeling that was the case.”
“Did you?”
At least you could have given me a heads-up….
Don’t make me feel so embarrassed.
“?”
Baek Seo, who had tucked her hair behind her ear, let it fall back, covering her ear again.
She seemed to show a hint of disappointment on her face.
‘Was it just a joke…?’
I couldn’t bring myself to ask.
Anyway, the sultry atmosphere dissipated, and naturally, the air became awkward.
“…Shall we go fetch them?”
“Yes, let’s.”
As I led the way down the stairs.
“President.”
“Yes?”
“Don’t worry about me getting a boyfriend.”
“?”
I stopped in my tracks.
I turned to look at Baek Seo, puzzled. She smiled her usual gentle smile.
“As the vice president of the disciplinary committee, I wouldn’t date anyone else while you’re around.”
Her response carried a double meaning.
“…Is that so.”
I decided to respond as the president of the disciplinary committee.
“Then that’s a relief for me.”
I was relieved.
When the thought of Baek Seo getting a boyfriend crossed my mind, it felt like my insides were twisting.
I narrowed my eyes and glared at her.
Since she said it was a joke, as the president, I needed to scold her properly.
“And don’t do that again. I’m a guy too.”
Embarrassment crept in, almost making me stutter. In the end, my tone remained calm, unlike when I scolded her.
There was a sense of incongruity, so I couldn’t even get angry.
“Yeah…. I’m sorry. Will you forgive me?”
Baek Seo’s eyebrows drooped.
A humble smile spread across her face.
She seemed genuinely sorry. Understandably so, given that she had used her beauty to create a situation that would shake my heart greatly.
Of course, I had to apologize too.
“…I’m sorry too. I didn’t handle it well. I’ll be more careful next time.”
“There’s no need for you to apologize….”
She trailed off and chuckled.
I couldn’t bear to look at her face any longer and quickly turned my head forward.
“Yes.”
She responded with a voice tinged with laughter.
“I’ll be more careful next time.”
“Alright.”
“About the surroundings….”
“Yes?”
“Nothing.”
……
“President, we’re sorry!! We were just worried about your relationship with Baek Seo and…!!”
“We committed a grave sin!!”
Ha Yesong and Park Minhyuk bowed deeply and begged.
Meanwhile, Yoo Do-ha stood with her arms crossed, looking at them disdainfully.
“…It’s fine. It’s good we’re all together like this.”
I sighed and sat on Yesong’s back, crossing my legs.
“President, you’re heavy…. This is school violence….”
“Park Minhyuk, Yoo Do-ha. Who’s the ringleader?”
Minhyuk and Do-ha pointed at Yesong.
“You traitors! Don’t you have any camaraderie!?”
Yesong screamed.
“Enough. Prepare some snacks.”
Minhyuk jumped up and saluted, “Yes, sir!” while Do-ha asked, “What kind?”
“You make bibim noodles with whelks.”
“Right away.”
Do-ha licked her lips.
She was crazy about ramen. Eating cool whelk bibim noodles on a summer day would put her in a good mood.
“What about me, President…?”
“The ringleader stays put.”
Yesong let out a small sound of resignation.
“Heeey…. Baek Seo, help me…!”
“Hang in there.”
Baek Seo’s smile was firm.
“The night is long. Since we’re all here, let’s start a proper committee retreat.”
The committee members responded positively.
That night, we played games similar to drinking games I’d only done in college in my past life.
We took many pictures, vented, and shared funny stories.
I tried to maintain my image by holding back laughter, but occasionally my lips twitched up. Every time that happened, Yesong reacted excessively, as if seeking revenge.
It was quite enjoyable.
The forest at night was pitch dark.
As a result, the orange lights illuminating the campsite stood out even more.
Kim Dalbi couldn’t stand in the light. Her current relationship with Ahn Woojin was like the stark contrast between the brightly lit campsite and the dark forest.
She could only watch Woojin’s daily life while leaning against a tree in the darkness.
“……”
Dalbi watched as Woojin and Baek Seo spent time together.
Whether they realized it or not, the two were already feeling tender emotions towards each other.
It was a dazzling sight to Dalbi.
She couldn’t tell if the sensation of being pricked in the chest by needles came from a sense of loss or jealousy.
She could only watch their happiness, unable to do anything else.
She could hear the raucous voices of the Aseong High School disciplinary committee members from the log cabin. She didn’t know what they were saying, but it wasn’t important.
“President, you laughed, didn’t you!? You laughed!? Wow! Park Minhyuk, take a picture!! It’s a chance to capture the president’s relaxed face!!”
A female student’s loud voice rang out clearly. They seemed to be having fun.
Dalbi looked at the moon shining between the trees and imagined Woojin’s smiling face. The only smile she remembered was from their childhood.
It was a lovely smile.
“Today seems fine.”
Dalbi quietly muttered to herself and walked deeper into the forest.
……
Late at night.
“Cough…!”
Principal Lee Doo-hee covered his mouth and repeated a phlegmy cough.
He looked down at his hand.
There was blood on it.
“Shall I call a doctor?”
A female student, Son Ye-seo, wearing a nun’s habit over her school uniform, asked with a bright smile.
“What day is it today…?”
“Today is….”
“No, don’t tell me. I’ll remember….”
His ailing brain often lost track of time.
“Never mind…. Put me in the wheelchair.”
“Yes.”
Ye-seo helped Doo-hee into the wheelchair.
Whirr. The wheelchair moved with a mechanical sound and stopped in front of the glass wall.
Doo-hee took a quiet breath as he looked out at the view of Neo Seoul.
He had an IV in his arm.
His already frail body struggled with breathing.
For a while, he organized his thoughts.
As his lips, dry like a parched land, barely parted, he let out a labored breath and slowly spoke.
“The more I think about it, the stranger it seems….”
“What do you mean?”
Ye-seo responded from behind Doo-hee.
“Kim Dalbi, Oh Baek Seo, and… ‘that girl’ are all intertwined with one boy.”
Ye-seo clapped her hands lightly.
“You mean the president of Aseong High School?”
“Yes…. All those kids are snarling over Ahn Woojin. Do you think this is just a coincidence?”
“He must be a man of many sins. I saw him before; he was quite handsome.”
Ye-seo answered nonchalantly.
“By the way, do you know you’ve said that five times now?”
“…I see.”
Doo-hee stopped speaking and took a deep breath.
Looking at Neo Seoul, his thoughts finally came together.
“Bring me Ahn Woojin.”
“What?”
Ye-seo was startled by the unexpected order.
“‘The Elder’ told us not to touch him, remember? You’ll get in trouble.”
“The priorities have changed. Ahn Woojin, that boy… is no ordinary person. This kind of feeling is rarely wrong.”
Doo-hee tapped the armrest of his wheelchair with his finger.
“So we need to confirm it.”
Ye-seo nodded.
“Then who should we send? If he’s the president, we’ll need to handle quite a bit of trouble.”
“There’s a saying, ‘Use the right tool for the job.’”
“Then I’ll choose someone appropriate.”
“Exclude Kim Dalbi. She’ll only get in the way.”
“Understood.”
Kim Dalbi would surely protect Ahn Woojin.
“I don’t have much time left….”
Doo-hee looked up at the ceiling, closed his eyes, and took a deep breath.
“I need to do what I can before I go. Understanding Ahn Woojin is part of that.”
“I know.”
The night deepened.

chapters.title: Chapter 63
chapters.content:
An Woo-jin recalled Moon Chae-yeon's ability.
"The power to create machines using electromagnetic waves."
Her inherent ability, Electromagnetic Wave Shaping.
The ability to gather electromagnetic waves and shape them into mechanical structures, materializing them.
Initially, it was the ability to create iron substances, but it evolved into the power of mechanical creation upon meeting Moon Chae-yeon.
Electromagnetic waves acted as an energy source, channeling through Chae-yeon to power the machines she created.
"To interfere with electromagnetic waves, use Magic Formula Type 1, Wave Synthesis."
The power to attract and gather surrounding electromagnetic waves.
Because of this, Woo-jin's smartphone and the student council's call device had malfunctioned.
"Creating machines is Magic Formula Type 2, Cyber Kinetics."
The power to materialize electromagnetic waves into machines.
This was why it was never a good idea to fight a technomancer in the middle of the city.
Chae-yeon needed a significant amount of electromagnetic waves to fully utilize her abilities, and the city provided an ample supply.
"You can't come up here, can you?"
Chae-yeon taunted from above with a mocking tone.
It was as if a bird, free to fly the vast sky, was mocking an ostrich.
Without replying, Woo-jin moved to uproot a roadside tree.
"Wow..."
Chae-yeon admired.
"Hoo."
Woo-jin took a deep breath.
He took a pitcher's stance, ready to throw the tree.
Then, he hurled the tree towards Chae-yeon.
Whoosh!!
The tree aimed precisely at Chae-yeon with rapid speed. Her board spewed fire and swiftly dodged the tree.
Chae-yeon's eyes followed the tree that passed her. It was a natural reaction.
"You can't hit me like... huh?"
While Chae-yeon was momentarily distracted, Woo-jin disappeared.
Crack.
An unknown sound came from above. Chae-yeon quickly looked up.
A figure wrapped in turquoise lightning was descending like a thunderbolt.
It was Woo-jin.
One hand held the Iron Dragon Staff, and the other gripped the Wall Crushing Rod.
For a brief moment, their eyes met.
"How? Teleportation...?"
Finally, Chae-yeon understood how Woo-jin had disappeared from the bathroom.
His inherent ability was undoubtedly related to teleportation.
Chae-yeon raised her arms and formed a shield in front of her. She converted and condensed the electromagnetic waves into energy, spreading it across the shield's surface.
The moment the shield took the impact, Woo-jin would be caught in an explosion.
However, Woo-jin did not hesitate at all.
The lightning rods on the shield dispersed the electrical magic flowing from the Iron Dragon Staff, but Woo-jin swung the Wall Crushing Rod regardless.
Boom!!!
A ruthless explosion of electricity.
The deafening roar spread outwards.
The shockwave pushed away vehicles stuck in traffic congestion.
Crash!!
The windows of the buildings shattered.
"Ugh...!"
Whoosh!
Chae-yeon's body was swept by the electric explosion, flying through the air. She crashed into the pavement, creating a crater.
The shield had already been destroyed.
"Handling the Wall Crushing Rod like this... Interesting!"
Chae-yeon had known Woo-jin wielded the Wall Crushing Rod and that its power was unrivaled.
But she hadn't expected this level of power.
It surpassed the limits of the Wall Crushing Rod.
"Huh?"
Then, Chae-yeon noticed the turquoise glow hadn't disappeared.
She looked up.
In the air, Woo-jin, enveloped in strong electric magic, was descending. His hair and clothes fluttered violently.
The electric explosion from the Wall Crushing Rod had compressed back into a bizarre scene.
The magic flowed like a dragon, forming a stream of electricity.
Zzt!!
All the magic followed the movements of the Iron Dragon Staff, as if Woo-jin were conducting an orchestra.
It was perfectly controlled by Woo-jin.
Another effect of Iron Dragon Staff Technique No. 1.
The reuse of electric magic flowing in the air.
Chae-yeon smiled broadly and tried to create an insulating shield.
"Huh?"
But it was difficult to fully utilize the gathered electromagnetic waves. The flow of magic was disrupted. She quickly understood why.
"An EMP. This is why I dislike dealing with electricity users."
Woo-jin had swung the Wall Crushing Rod first.
To disrupt the flow of electromagnetic waves gathering towards Chae-yeon with an electromagnetic pulse caused by the electric explosion.
In a city where electromagnetic waves flowed continuously, the effect was temporary.
But the brief gap was enough for Woo-jin to launch an effective attack.
It was clear that Woo-jin's subsequent barrage of attacks was deliberate.
However, Chae-yeon was a formidable opponent.
Her response speed and countermeasures were swift.
Her flying board rose immediately to protect her. It was a temporary measure, but its high magic concentration made it very durable.
Whoosh!
A large lightning rod suddenly protruded from the board. It had been designed that way from the beginning.
Chae-yeon had prepared her countermeasures in advance.
Woo-jin spun his body and swung the Iron Dragon Staff.
Boom!!!
The rotating stream of electricity followed the movement and shot towards Chae-yeon like a spear.
The thick electric spear carved a streak of light in the air, targeting the lightning rod.
Bang!!
It collided with Chae-yeon's defensive measure, causing a fierce explosion of magic.
The impact sent Chae-yeon's body flying like a ball. She crashed through a nearby building and tumbled into the first-floor hall.
"Ahhh!" "Ah!"
The employees in the hall were shocked. The AI robots sounded alarms.
"Whew."
Chae-yeon stood up and brushed off the dirt from her clothes. Her internal organs and bones were injured, but it wasn't unbearable.
"This is unexpected."
Chae-yeon realized Woo-jin hadn't used his full strength yet.
And yet, this much power.
"If he awakened his inherent ability not long ago, he must be at least Fifth Rank... This power is at least Sixth Rank."
Until a moment ago.
Chae-yeon had thought Woo-jin used his wits and creative means to handle Han Seo-jin.
She assumed Han Seo-jin had let his guard down, which led to Woo-jin's victory.
That's why he won, she thought.
But after directly clashing with Woo-jin, her perception changed.
"Can't take him lightly."
Chae-yeon had underestimated Woo-jin, but no more.
She couldn't let her guard down.
"Oh, this is fun..."
Click!
Chae-yeon created mechanical armor over her body with her now-normalized inherent ability. A new flying board formed at her feet.
Snap!
She snapped her fingers.
Meanwhile, Woo-jin landed on the road.
The citizens and drivers, realizing the battle situation, were urgently fleeing.
Security robots, having lost their signal, autonomously assessed the situation and began controlling the roads.
While Woo-jin was yelling and gesturing for the remaining citizens to evacuate quickly.
"……!"
Whoosh!
Robots burst out through the shattered windows of a large shopping mall. They were the robots Chae-yeon had brought and stationed.
They each switched to flight mode and aimed their guns.
Ratatatatat!!!
A barrage of magic bullets rained down on Woo-jin.
There was no place to escape.
It was too late to flee by creating a crack.
Woo-jin quickly stomped the ground.
Crackle!!
Then, using the Iron Dragon Staff, he deflected some of the magic bullets and escaped to the lower part of a nearby building.
At that moment.
Whoosh!!
"Where are you going!?"
Chae-yeon, clad in mechanical armor, instantly flew towards Woo-jin.
It was in the blink of an eye.
She had enhanced her flight speed to the extreme by bursting wind magic.
"!"
Woo-jin was shocked; he hadn't expected her to be that fast. It was completely different from what he'd seen in the game.
Chae-yeon aimed at Woo-jin with a mechanical spear in her hand. Strong energy and condensed wind magic swirled around the spear.
The energy released was so immense that the trees and asphalt along her path were crushed.
Even a Sixth Rank expert wouldn't survive the spear's blow.
Before Woo-jin could make any judgment, he turned his body and swung the Iron Dragon Staff filled with electric magic.
Crash!!!
The two weapons didn't collide.
Only the densely packed magic and powerful energy of the Sixth Rank experts clashed in the air.
The Iron Dragon Staff shattered the mechanical armor and penetrated Chae-yeon's torso.
The mechanical spear pierced Woo-jin's oblique muscle.
The compressed wind magic in the spear was about to explode. It would inflict a fatal wound on Woo-jin in an instant.
There was no time to think.
Instinctively, Woo-jin channeled magic into his oblique muscle.
Boom!!!
A shockwave erupted.
Both of them were sent flying in opposite directions. Crash! Woo-jin slammed into the building's exterior wall, and Chae-yeon tumbled across the road.
"Ugh...!"
Chae-yeon spat blood.
Her abdomen was in excruciating pain.
She realized she had been electrocuted as well.
Her body didn't move as she wanted.
Without the mechanical armor, she couldn't imagine the state she'd be in... The thought was terrifying.
"Seriously, what is he...?"
With blood flowing from her mouth, Chae-yeon smirked. She looked towards Woo-jin.
"Ugh..."
Woo-jin groaned in pain, clutching his pierced oblique muscle. The impact of hitting against the wall had taken its full toll on him.
At the moment the spear pierced him, he poured all his magical power into reinforcing his oblique muscle.
His seasoned battle instincts had saved him. Without them, he would have already been on his way to the afterlife.
"As expected, this isn't enough to kill him."
Chae-yeon had suspected that Woo-jin wouldn't die from such an attack.
That's why she had used an attack capable of killing a person.
"Oh, how it hurts..."
How long had it been since she felt such pain?
Chae-yeon laughed quietly.
Holding her injured abdomen, she staggered and stood up.
"Still, all that's left is to capture him..."
She had been constantly interfering with the electromagnetic waves.
Reporting the incident in this area was impossible.
Moreover, the police and the academy wouldn't be able to promptly assess the situation.
Chae-yeon walked towards Woo-jin to capture him.
"What?"
Suddenly, Chae-yeon felt a strange sense of unease and stopped.
At that moment.
Pew!
From a distance, arrows imbued with magic rained down.
Bang!
Each arrow precisely pierced and exploded Chae-yeon's robots.
"What...?"
The tall buildings had obstructed her view, causing her to realize too late. She was astonished.
An inherent ability, Laplace's Demon.
Magic Formula Type 1, Precision Equation.
The ability of Yoo Do-ha, the treasurer of the Asong High student council.
All the arrows boasted incredible accuracy thanks to the archer's calculations.
"W-Woo-jin sunbaenim...!"
Suddenly, a boy in a plaid shirt and glasses, looking like an otaku, appeared.
He ran to Woo-jin and began healing him with magic.
It was Park Min-hyuk, the secretary of the Asong High student council.
"Thank you..." "Don't speak, just stay still! The wound will reopen..."
Rat-tat-tat-tat!
Several student council vehicles arrived, firing magical bullets at Chae-yeon.
She flew into the air, using the fire from the board beneath her feet.
The vehicles stopped, and members of the second platoon of Asong High disembarked. They were armed and ready for battle.
"How did the Asong High student council arrive so quickly?"
Chae-yeon was confused.
They couldn't have arrived this fast.
Boom!
The student council's long-range attacks continued. Arrows rained down again, destroying Chae-yeon's robots.
The physically enhanced student council members jumped from buildings and attacked Chae-yeon. Combat machines on the vehicles also fired at her.
Chae-yeon smirked, dodging or blocking the attacks with her shield.
"What a nuisance."
Each attack was precise. Chae-yeon bit her lip. She couldn't get close to Woo-jin.
The pain in her abdomen constantly reminded her of Woo-jin's strike with the Iron Dragon Staff. This made it difficult to quickly respond to the concentrated attacks from the student council.
"...So that's it."
Chae-yeon finally understood.
While she didn't know exactly what Woo-jin's special ability was, she was sure it was something related to teleportation.
So, when Woo-jin had entered the men's restroom.
He could have teleported outside the mall, called the student council from a zone without interference, and then returned.
This explained the sequence of events.
"Of course... He knew about my ability from the beginning."
If he hadn't known about her ability, such a swift response would have been highly unnatural.
"I knew they had good intelligence, but I didn't expect it to be this good."
Chae-yeon felt intrigued by Woo-jin.
However, this interest was tinged with hidden anger.
"How dare you."
Veins bulged on Chae-yeon's forehead.
At first, she hadn't thought much of Woo-jin.
But now, she had a strong desire to crush him.
"Haa!"
Meanwhile, a girl leaped out of a student council vehicle and stood before Woo-jin and Min-hyuk.
"In a moment of crisis, Ha Ye-song enters the fray!"
It was Ha Ye-song, the student council leader.
She turned to Woo-jin and pointed at herself with her thumb.
"Woo-jin sunbaenim! Leave it to me from here!"
She proclaimed with confidence.
Woo-jin and Min-hyuk's eyes widened for a moment.
"She doesn't inspire confidence at all..." "Yeah, shut up, Park Min-hyuk."
Woo-jin smirked at their conversation.
He patted Min-hyuk on the shoulder.
"Sunbaenim?"
The first aid was successfully completed. Now he wouldn't die from blood loss.
He still had strength left to fight.
"You saved my life."
Woo-jin gripped the Iron Dragon Staff and moved forward again. He met Chae-yeon's gaze and used electric magic once more.
"This isn't going to work..."
Chae-yeon realized she couldn't defeat her opponents in the current situation. The difference in power was significant.
She acknowledged her mistake.
She had underestimated Woo-jin.
"...I admit it."
Chae-yeon mentally addressed Woo-jin.
"You are strong. Much stronger than I thought."
Acknowledging Woo-jin's strength, Chae-yeon raised her mechanically armored right arm.
Suddenly, something hidden behind the clouds began to fall rapidly.
"……!"
Woo-jin's eyes widened.
"Prepare for defense!! Everyone else, fall back!!"
The student council obeyed his command without question.
Some members of the student council brought out large shields and enveloped them in magic. The others quickly retreated. Their movements were practiced.
Woo-jin grabbed Ye-song and Min-hyuk and urgently fled.
"Oh, Woo-jin sunbaenim!!"
Ye-song screamed, feeling the approaching threat from the sky.
In the meantime, Woo-jin turned his head and locked eyes with Chae-yeon.
"See you again," her lip movements said.
A flying object, like a meteorite engulfed in flames, descended from the sky.
Boom!!!
A massive explosion reverberated through the area.
The ground shook, and the powerful wind destroyed the exterior walls of nearby buildings.
"Ahhh!!"
Ye-song screamed as she was thrown back. Woo-jin hugged Min-hyuk and Ye-song, rolling across the ground.
Finally, when everything calmed down.
"Are you okay!?" "Yes...!"
Woo-jin checked Ye-song and Min-hyuk's condition and turned his head towards where Chae-yeon had been.
The settling dust.
Chae-yeon had already disappeared.

chapters.title: Chapter 64
chapters.content:
The injured were urgently transported to the hospital.
I was among them.
What I received from Park Min-hyuk was merely first aid.
I needed to receive professional treatment quickly.
Soon, Deputy Chief Oh Baek-seo arrived at the scene.
As soon as he saw me, his face turned pale.
It seemed he had difficulty hiding his emotions, unlike usual.
I left the cleanup of the scene to Ha Ye-song and instructed Baek-seo to track down Moon Chae-yeon. I was taken to the hospital with Min-hyuk as my guardian.
There was no need to worry about Yoo Do-ha.
Due to the penalty of his inherent ability, he would suffer from severe dry eyes and become a fool, but each time that happened, he would hide in a safe place. As a side note, I had never seen Do-ha in his foolish state.
Anyway, the student council split into two teams.
A team led by Baek-seo went to track down the villain Moon Chae-yeon, while another team handled the cleanup and investigation at the scene.
And time passed.
We received a report that Moon Chae-yeon had completely escaped.
In the end, the pursuit was terminated.
……
I was told it would take at least two weeks to fully recover. That was considering my recovery abilities.
Typically, the stronger one's magic, the faster they healed.
However, I also heard that without the first aid, I might have died or taken much longer to recover.
I didn't even want to imagine what would have happened if I had faced Chae-yeon alone without any help.
More importantly...
“……”
“……”
How should I deal with this awkward atmosphere...
In a private hospital room.
Baek-seo was silently peeling fruit, sitting in the guardian's seat.
I hadn't done anything wrong.
Baek-seo just seemed deep in thought, making it difficult to start a conversation.
Besides,
'We lost the Sixth Criminal...'
It wasn't something to be proud of...
“I'm sorry.”
Baek-seo suddenly spoke.
“What are you talking about?”
“I should have arrived sooner. At least if I had been there, you wouldn't have ended up like this, right?”
“Don't say that.”
“Huh?”
‘You make it sound like I'm incapable of catching villains without you...’
It was a blow to my pride as the chief.
I couldn't depend on the deputy chief.
Failing to capture Chae-yeon with the forces on site was purely my fault.
“You were far away. What could you do?”
While I was at the shopping mall, Baek-seo was quite a distance away.
Baek-seo could move very quickly, but there were limits. He had to cover most of the distance on foot.
Given that, he arrived incredibly fast.
Wherever he had been, it seemed to be a private matter.
“The important thing is what happens next.”
I tried to move my upper body, but intense pain in my side made me stop.
It felt like I was going to die from the pain.
Without showing it, I lay back down and stared at the hospital ceiling.
“The Sixth Criminal targeted me for some reason and will definitely come after me again. We need to be prepared.”
If I met Chae-yeon again and failed to capture her, it would be a disgrace to my position as the student council president.
My reputation would be damaged, and my future would be threatened.
I had to capture Chae-yeon no matter what.
‘Why does nothing go according to plan...’
In my life,
I've worked hard, so can things go my way just once...
It's not like I can blame anyone else.
‘At least I can take solace in the fact that I can fight Chae-yeon at this level.’
In the past, I couldn't even imagine that.
Now, I could fight on equal footing with Chae-yeon. I was stronger than I had expected.
But there was a problem.
Chae-yeon hadn't shown her full power yet.
‘In the second round, she’ll definitely bring out Chimera...’
It was clear that in the future, Chae-yeon would deploy her combat weapon, Chimera.
We needed a thorough countermeasure.
We had to prepare for the worst-case scenario.
‘If only we could find her hideout.’
We didn't know where Chae-yeon's hideout was.
In the game, meeting the Six Criminals was only possible during predetermined events.
But we couldn't just sit around and wait. We needed to start searching.
“Chief.”
“Huh?”
Baek-seo suddenly leaned closer.
His shadow fell over me. A gentle smile spread across his face.
“Rest for now. Don’t think about anything else. You're a patient, after all.”
His voice was soothing, calming my mind.
I appreciated the concern, but I couldn't just rest aimlessly.
“I'm not in a position to do that, am I?”
“Rest.”
“……”
Despite the gentle tone, it felt somewhat forceful.
……
I calmed my breathing and focused on circulating my internal magic. Like meditating.
When I closed my eyes, a vivid scene played out on the dark canvas of my mind like a movie screen. The cityscape where I had fought Moon Chae-yeon.
‘If I had set the coordinates correctly...’
When Chae-yeon dropped the aircraft, if I could have created a crack at the exact location...
‘If I could have made a large crack at once...’
If I could have created one huge crack.
I could have prevented the explosion and Chae-yeon's escape.
Setting coordinates accurately and creating a wide-radius crack in one go was still difficult for me.
There was also the option of using Spatial Lightning Strike to destroy the aircraft.
But that method had high risks.
If the aircraft was destroyed, debris would rain down like a storm.
Blocking each piece of debris would require immense skill in setting coordinates. It was a level far beyond my current capabilities.
So, prioritizing escape on foot was the best option.
The more I thought about it, the more I regretted not being fully trained in my inherent ability.
‘If I could have stopped it.’
In my imagination,
I reached out towards the aircraft Chae-yeon had dropped.
I repeatedly visualized creating a crack and sending the aircraft to a different location in my mind.
My internal magic reacted to my desire, surging within me.
My whole body was drenched in sweat.
The vivid setting, the intense emotions, and the honed senses guided me into a singular focus.
The pain in the spot where Chae-yeon had stabbed me surged, but I could endure it.
‘Just a little more.’
Relying on my senses, I drew the scene in my mind over and over.
Eventually, my stamina would deplete, and I would lose consciousness.
Though there was no penalty to bear, the repeated practice alone left me exhausted.
But I couldn't stop.
In a situation where Chae-yeon had gauged my strength and would bring out Chimera, my chances of winning would drastically decrease.
I couldn't help but become impatient to grow stronger.
‘Ah.’
How many hours had passed?
I unintentionally drifted off to sleep.
Late at night.
The dark hospital room.
Baek-seo entered the room. He saw An Woo-jin sleeping.
He turned off the bedside lamp, leaving only the faint moonlight filtering in.
Baek-seo carefully brushed Woo-jin's hair, as if handling something precious.
Though worried about the sweat pouring off Woo-jin, he decided not to worry, knowing it was part of training his inherent ability.
After a while.
Baek-seo left the hospital room and headed to the bathroom.
The bathroom at midnight was dimly lit.
It was quiet and lonely.
Baek-seo washed his hands at the sink and looked into the mirror.
A girl with long hair and wearing black clothes with an emotionless expression reflected in the mirror.
She wore dark clothes to blend into the night.
It was the appearance of Baek-seo from the days of Sparta.
Perhaps due to the penalty of her inherent ability, Baek-seo's eyes sometimes grew cold, reflecting her past.
The girl in the mirror seemed to say.
You are this kind of person.
“……”
Baek-seo bowed her head.
The flowing tap water reflected in her view.
She recalled the enemies targeting Woo-jin.
Baek-seo knew they were all subordinates of the Grand Principal.
When she faced Kim Dal-bi on Shin Yongsan Street, she had somehow managed to fend her off.
But while Han Seo-jin and Moon Chae-yeon were pushing Woo-jin to the brink of death, what had she done?
“Ugh…”
She hadn't protected Woo-jin.
There were times she might not have been able to act in time, and Woo-jin could have died. Multiple times.
“Haa.”
Baek-seo let out a small sigh.
“I didn't come next door for this…”
During the practical evaluation.
When Han Seo-jin deployed the barrier, when she couldn't defeat the monster she summoned, the helplessness she felt...
The image of Woo-jin being carried away in an ambulance, bleeding profusely from being stabbed by Moon Chae-yeon, came rushing back to her mind.
‘Why are you so indifferent?’
She recalled Woo-jin, who remained calm despite those incidents.
As if it was natural to experience such things.
It wasn't natural.
Even for a student council president, it didn't make sense to go through such events repeatedly.
Why was this?
Because the opponent was Grand Principal Lee Doo-hee.
Because he was the mayor of Neo Seoul.
Because the threats, like wild dogs, were constantly targeting Woo-jin.
Woo-jin couldn't possibly know this.
“……”
A string in Baek-seo's mind seemed about to snap.
She entrusted the guardian role to Ha Ye-song and Park Min-hyuk and went home.
Baek-seo's home.
Inside, it appeared ordinary, but there was a hidden place.
If Woo-jin had deliberately searched the house, he would have found it. He had a keen eye.
That's why she had insisted he not help with moving the furniture.
Moreover, when Woo-jin had seen her naked in the shower and fled, he hadn't had time to inspect the house.
Creak.
She moved the bookshelf aside, revealing a door. She unlocked it and entered.
The place Baek-seo had hidden was a small weapons cache.
The walls were filled with information about her investigative process and the Grand Principal.
Hidden treasures of information she had secretly collected from distant areas filled the room.
The reason she hadn't arrived quickly at the scene of Woo-jin's fight with Chae-yeon was due to her investigation.
Baek-seo took out a pistol that handled magic bullets from the weapons storage.
The cold touch and heavy weight felt in her hand.
She brought the pistol close to her ear and checked the loading sound.
Click.
It was fine.
Baek-seo gathered her sword 'Baekryun-do', lethal weapons, top-quality magic bullets from black mermaids outside the city, extra magazines, a silencer, and combat magical tools.
After that, she sat at her desk.
On the desk was a piece of paper with simple personal information about Oh Baek-seo.
[Resignation Form]
Name: Oh Baek-seo
Affiliation: Student Council
Position: Deputy Chief
...
It was a resignation form she had prepared since last time.
Baek-seo caressed the resignation form and whispered softly.
“I have to protect Woo-jin…”
There was something she had to do.
It might take some time.
Baek-seo couldn't give up on that task.
That task was.
‘I have to eliminate the Grand Principal.’
Her goal was to kill the current Grand Principal, Lee Doo-hee.
Originally, she had planned to gather more solid information and act in the second semester.
But since the Grand Principal was targeting Woo-jin for some reason, Baek-seo felt the urgency.
‘Woo-jin can't know about this.’
If Woo-jin found out about Baek-seo's plan, he would either stop her or join her.
Neither option was good for Baek-seo.
Woo-jin would be continuously exposed to life-threatening situations.
So, this resignation form meant she would return after completing the task and share a future with Woo-jin.
It was Baek-seo's resolution.
However.
“……”
Baek-seo lowered her head.
“No, I guess I don't need this…”
Clunk.
She opened the trash can and discarded the resignation form.
As if nothing had happened, she would return while Woo-jin was still hospitalized.
Baek-seo armed herself and left the house.
The darkness of the night enveloped her.

chapters.title: Chapter 65
chapters.content:
Zone Zero. Neo Seoul's 'Zone Zero' was called that.
Beyond the beautiful flower fields. In stark contrast.
Quiet, dark, foggy, and eerie ghost towns were the landscape of Zone Zero that people knew.
It was a strictly closed-off area, officially known to be uninhabited.
This was because of the pervasive miasma from monsters and radiation that contaminated living organisms.
Neo Seoul is a safe land.
A few places in the world are safe from monster attacks, thanks to the mercy and blessing of the Golden Sheep, and Neo Seoul was one of them.
However, Zone Zero was officially outside the boundaries of that safe land, a common knowledge widely spread in society.
It was said that the boundary of the Golden Sheep's blessing was unclear, and such a mistake occurred during urban development.
…This was a false common knowledge.
Zone Zero was also a land blessed by the Golden Sheep.
Only a few people in the city knew this fact.
“Ah…, it hurts….”
The medical facility was located in the middle of the desolate city center.
It was an abandoned hospital, and only the subordinates of the Grand Principal resided there.
Moon Chae-yeon lay in bed, chuckling to herself.
She was receiving treatment and resting. However, the continuous pain was unavoidable for the time being.
'That guy is ridiculously strong...'
Chae-yeon recalled An Woo-jin, the head of the student council at Asong High.
She couldn’t forget the moment the Iron Dragon Staff hit her abdomen squarely.
It had been a long time since she experienced a warning in her head saying 'dangerous.'
'He's definitely not just a Fifth Rank. At least a Sixth Rank.'
To inflict effective damage on her, at least upper Fifth Rank level magic was needed.
With this level of powerful force, it had to be at least Sixth Rank or higher.
She turned her head and looked out the window.
The dull gray city landscape came into view.
