'Is this the result of being careless...?'
Chae-yeon chuckled to herself.
“I didn’t want to come to such a dreary place again.”
The sky was also gloomy as if it was about to rain.
It could be described as an ashen city.
“How unpleasant...”
The lack of electromagnetic waves made it difficult for her to fully utilize her abilities.
The scenery itself was chilling and filled her with repulsion.
Moreover, being here inevitably reminded her of her childhood.
Babies classified as top-grade after being measured for innate magic were sent to facilities in Zone Zero. Chae-yeon was no exception.
She could never forget the things she experienced afterward, even if she wanted to.
'Still, I like the quiet and the lack of surveillance.'
Zone Zero, being an abandoned area, rarely had security robots.
If someone found security robots in Zone Zero, they would undoubtedly be suspicious.
While she was lost in her thoughts.
“You shouldn’t be here...!”
Whack! Thud!
The guards outside the hallway who were protecting Chae-yeon seemed to be caught up in some commotion, but she didn’t care.
Click. Creak.
“What’s happening?”
Chae-yeon asked without turning her head.
“Huff, huff…”
The person who entered the hospital room was a woman with cherry blossom-colored hair.
She was panting heavily and bleeding profusely.
Blood was smeared on her fresh-colored hair.
It was Kim Dal-bi, one of the Six Criminals.
“Judging by the look of you, you must have defied the Grand Principal?”
Chae-yeon spoke, looking at Dal-bi’s reflection in the window.
“What’s the reason? Because you messed with the Asong High student council president?”
Chae-yeon asked nonchalantly.
Dal-bi approached Chae-yeon without answering. The sword in her hand faintly reflected the dim light of the room.
Chae-yeon turned her head towards Dal-bi and smirked.
“You came here to deal with me because you couldn’t have a proper conversation? Then you should have killed the guys outside first. Don’t tell me… you’re still holding onto that ridiculous non-killing principle?”
Chae-yeon shrugged provocatively.
Dal-bi’s eyes had a murderous coldness.
“I’m not going to kill you. I just want to make sure you can’t fight anymore.”
“What’s your plan? Touching me now is a clear act of treason, isn’t it?”
“If it comes to this, I have to commit treason.”
Sring.
Dal-bi raised her sword.
“You broke your promise.”
She swung the sword.
Swish!
At that moment, black particles rose up and formed an arched mechanical shield to protect Chae-yeon.
It was a defensive measure shaped by the reserved electromagnetic waves.
Clang!
The sword and the shield collided with a clear metallic sound. A strong wind blew around due to the clash of magic.
As if she expected it, Dal-bi tried to launch another attack.
Then Chae-yeon swiftly got off the bed and engaged in a brief but skillful exchange of blows with Dal-bi.
After a short scuffle, they ended up in a deadlock, their arms locked together.
“Ah, it hurts...”
Chae-yeon groaned.
The harsh movements made her abdomen feel like it was about to burst. She openly showed her pain.
It was clear that if the fight continued here, Chae-yeon would lose.
However, Chae-yeon provocatively glared at Dal-bi.
“Hey, don’t you think it’s too much to target a patient?”
“……”
“You always have this problem. You’re like a beagle. Selfish and an expert at causing trouble for others, right?”
Dal-bi snorted.
“I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
“You’d be the type to cling and obsess over everything in a relationship. Doesn’t the Asong High student council president hate you too? Oh, yeah. I heard you guys had a big fight last time? You keep getting close to someone who already avoids you? What? You’re just protecting someone you like? You’re the one who dealt with all the idiots approaching An Woo-jin, right? Wow! Amazing, Kim Dal-bi!”
“What do you know?”
Dal-bi’s face, covered in blood, showed a mocking smile. But her eyes were far from smiling.
“Don’t you get it? That’s stalking, stalking. You’re just a criminal, a pathetic stalker.”
This time, Chae-yeon laughed.
“Dal-bi? Do you think only you want to pursue love and dream of a happy life? We were out of place from the moment we were dragged to the Grand Principal, no, from the moment we were born.”
“…I can’t listen to this anymore.”
Dal-bi snorted and tried to push Chae-yeon and swing her sword.
Whoosh!
“!”
In an instant, a man entered the hospital room and kicked Dal-bi in the head.
Already exhausted and solely focused on Chae-yeon, Dal-bi couldn’t react in time.
Bang!!
Dal-bi’s body flew and crashed through the hospital wall, falling outside the building.
The man who kicked Dal-bi jumped out through the broken wall and flew towards her.
In midair, Dal-bi barely held onto her fading consciousness and gripped her sword again.
“Safe, aren’t you?”
Shortly after, a girl in a nun’s habit entered the hospital room. It was Spartoi Son Ye-seo.
“Sigh…”
Chae-yeon sighed deeply and leaned against the wall. Ye-seo bent down and looked at her.
“Are you okay?”
“Almost died. My ability is highly dependent on the situation. Here, I’m practically the weakest.”
Chae-yeon grumbled.
The wind crawled in through the broken wall. Outside, the howls of goblins and the sounds of battle could be heard.
“Why don’t you just get rid of that beagle?”
“I heard she’s a top-grade. Unfortunately, Dal-bi is more valuable than you, Chae-yeon.”
Chae-yeon fell silent at the mention of top-grade.
“Chae-yeon?”
Ye-seo called out in suspicion, and Chae-yeon looked nonchalant, gazing at the broken wall.
“She’s not even using her ability? Look. Tsk. She’s already beaten. She looked exhausted from the start.”
“That’s understandable. She was chased by Hong-gyu and had a fight with our strongest member before that.”
“Seo Gang-jin?”
“Yes.”
A man known to be the second strongest in Neo Seoul after Goliath.
It was Spartoi Seo Gang-jin.
“No wonder she’s in that state.”
Just knowing she fought Seo Gang-jin explained why Dal-bi ended up in such a mess.
“He wouldn’t have let anyone go…. Right after leaving it to Hong-gyu, Dal-bi must have escaped?”
“Exactly. But she can’t run away anymore.”
Outside the building.
The ground and buildings around were disjointed.
Several goblins were pinned against rocks, covered in blood.
In the midst of it, Dal-bi was shackled to a rock structure, in tatters.
A red-haired man glared at Dal-bi with furious eyes.
One of Neo Seoul’s Six Criminals.
One of the twin glutton siblings, Hong-gyu.
“Kim Dal-bi.”
Hong-gyu stared at Dal-bi.
Dal-bi hung her head, blood dripping down. All she could do was cling to her consciousness.
“Do you think I’m a pushover?”
Hong-gyu spoke irritably, raising his trembling hand.
“If you’re going to resist, you should give it your all, right? You haven’t given up just because you’re weaker than me, have you? Huh? Right now! Transform into a goblin!”
“I... won’t.”
“……”
Thud!
Hong-gyu punched Dal-bi’s abdomen.
Then, he grabbed her hair and lifted her to meet her eyes.
“Cough...!”
“Still afraid of the penalty? Just for such a trivial reason?”
Hong-gyu’s fiery rage turned icy cold.
“I’m wasting time that I could spend with my sister on someone like you…? Because of your stubbornness. Shouldn’t you at least show some sincerity?”
“……”
“Hah.”
As if tired of it, Hong-gyu released the magic that formed the rock structure and kicked Dal-bi.
Thud!
It sounded like kicking a soccer ball.
Crash!
Dal-bi’s body flew and crashed into an abandoned building.
Dal-bi, already exhausted after confronting the Grand Principal, had no strength left to resist Hong-gyu.
“The Grand Principal has a message for you, despite everything. You’re not being abandoned. Your mission remains. Merciful, isn’t it?”
Hong-gyu scoffed and pointed at Dal-bi.
In the rising dust, Dal-bi leaned her head against the building’s exterior wall, coughing and gasping for air.
“Tch. Reflect on your actions. I’m leaving now.”
Hong-gyu spat on the ground in disgust and walked away.
Meanwhile.
“Is there a need to leave her like that?”
Chae-yeon spoke as she lay down on the new bed Ye-seo had arranged.
“No matter how good her ability is, it’s useless if she doesn’t use it, right? And she keeps defying the Grand Principal, so is it worth keeping her alive? She’s not even a double-edged sword.”
“Dal-bi will eventually use her ability.”
“How?”
Ye-seo clapped her hands lightly and put the back of her hand to her cheek.
“The Grand Principal has plans. Especially for someone as emotional as Dal-bi, she’s easy to handle.”
“Huh…”
There was nothing more to say about the Grand Principal.
Chae-yeon stared at the new hospital ceiling.
“…But what kind of penalty does Kim Dal-bi have that she restricts her ability so much?”
“Well, you see.”
Ye-seo briefly explained the penalty of Dal-bi’s inherent ability.
“Ah…, if it’s her, that makes sense.”
Chae-yeon responded indifferently, turning her head toward the window.
Raindrops began to fall on the window one by one.
……
Heavy rain pounded the pavement.
Kim Dal-bi clutched her broken arm and dragged herself forward. Blood and dirt were washed away by the rain.
It was already dark.
The ashen city was enveloped in darkness, and Dal-bi relied on her adapted vision and senses as she walked.
“Huff, huff…”
She had lost a lot of blood.
After fighting the strongest among the Grand Principal’s subordinates, she had exhausted almost all her magic.
Yet her heart still beat.
Her nose and mouth still breathed.
Thinking that all these life activities were maintained by the Grand Principal’s mercy, Dal-bi felt humiliated.
But she had to survive now. Only then could she achieve her plan.
So she just kept walking.
While passing through an alley, the shortest route to escape Zone Zero.
Thud.
Her legs gave out.

chapters.content:
Zone Zero. Neo Seoul's 'Zone Zero' was called that.
Beyond the beautiful flower fields. In stark contrast.
Quiet, dark, foggy, and eerie ghost towns were the landscape of Zone Zero that people knew.
It was a strictly closed-off area, officially known to be uninhabited.
This was because of the pervasive miasma from monsters and radiation that contaminated living organisms.
Neo Seoul is a safe land.
A few places in the world are safe from monster attacks, thanks to the mercy and blessing of the Golden Sheep, and Neo Seoul was one of them.
However, Zone Zero was officially outside the boundaries of that safe land, a common knowledge widely spread in society.
It was said that the boundary of the Golden Sheep's blessing was unclear, and such a mistake occurred during urban development.
…This was a false common knowledge.
Zone Zero was also a land blessed by the Golden Sheep.
Only a few people in the city knew this fact.
“Ah…, it hurts….”
The medical facility was located in the middle of the desolate city center.
It was an abandoned hospital, and only the subordinates of the Grand Principal resided there.
Moon Chae-yeon lay in bed, chuckling to herself.
She was receiving treatment and resting. However, the continuous pain was unavoidable for the time being.
'That guy is ridiculously strong...'
Chae-yeon recalled An Woo-jin, the head of the student council at Asong High.
She couldn’t forget the moment the Iron Dragon Staff hit her abdomen squarely.
It had been a long time since she experienced a warning in her head saying 'dangerous.'
'He's definitely not just a Fifth Rank. At least a Sixth Rank.'
To inflict effective damage on her, at least upper Fifth Rank level magic was needed.
With this level of powerful force, it had to be at least Sixth Rank or higher.
She turned her head and looked out the window.
The dull gray city landscape came into view.
'Is this the result of being careless...?'
Chae-yeon chuckled to herself.
“I didn’t want to come to such a dreary place again.”
The sky was also gloomy as if it was about to rain.
It could be described as an ashen city.
“How unpleasant...”
The lack of electromagnetic waves made it difficult for her to fully utilize her abilities.
The scenery itself was chilling and filled her with repulsion.
Moreover, being here inevitably reminded her of her childhood.
Babies classified as top-grade after being measured for innate magic were sent to facilities in Zone Zero. Chae-yeon was no exception.
She could never forget the things she experienced afterward, even if she wanted to.
'Still, I like the quiet and the lack of surveillance.'
Zone Zero, being an abandoned area, rarely had security robots.
If someone found security robots in Zone Zero, they would undoubtedly be suspicious.
While she was lost in her thoughts.
“You shouldn’t be here...!”
Whack! Thud!
The guards outside the hallway who were protecting Chae-yeon seemed to be caught up in some commotion, but she didn’t care.
Click. Creak.
“What’s happening?”
Chae-yeon asked without turning her head.
“Huff, huff…”
The person who entered the hospital room was a woman with cherry blossom-colored hair.
She was panting heavily and bleeding profusely.
Blood was smeared on her fresh-colored hair.
It was Kim Dal-bi, one of the Six Criminals.
“Judging by the look of you, you must have defied the Grand Principal?”
Chae-yeon spoke, looking at Dal-bi’s reflection in the window.
“What’s the reason? Because you messed with the Asong High student council president?”
Chae-yeon asked nonchalantly.
Dal-bi approached Chae-yeon without answering. The sword in her hand faintly reflected the dim light of the room.
Chae-yeon turned her head towards Dal-bi and smirked.
“You came here to deal with me because you couldn’t have a proper conversation? Then you should have killed the guys outside first. Don’t tell me… you’re still holding onto that ridiculous non-killing principle?”
Chae-yeon shrugged provocatively.
Dal-bi’s eyes had a murderous coldness.
“I’m not going to kill you. I just want to make sure you can’t fight anymore.”
“What’s your plan? Touching me now is a clear act of treason, isn’t it?”
“If it comes to this, I have to commit treason.”
Sring.
Dal-bi raised her sword.
“You broke your promise.”
She swung the sword.
Swish!
At that moment, black particles rose up and formed an arched mechanical shield to protect Chae-yeon.
It was a defensive measure shaped by the reserved electromagnetic waves.
Clang!
The sword and the shield collided with a clear metallic sound. A strong wind blew around due to the clash of magic.
As if she expected it, Dal-bi tried to launch another attack.
Then Chae-yeon swiftly got off the bed and engaged in a brief but skillful exchange of blows with Dal-bi.
After a short scuffle, they ended up in a deadlock, their arms locked together.
“Ah, it hurts...”
Chae-yeon groaned.
The harsh movements made her abdomen feel like it was about to burst. She openly showed her pain.
It was clear that if the fight continued here, Chae-yeon would lose.
However, Chae-yeon provocatively glared at Dal-bi.
“Hey, don’t you think it’s too much to target a patient?”
“……”
“You always have this problem. You’re like a beagle. Selfish and an expert at causing trouble for others, right?”
Dal-bi snorted.
“I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
“You’d be the type to cling and obsess over everything in a relationship. Doesn’t the Asong High student council president hate you too? Oh, yeah. I heard you guys had a big fight last time? You keep getting close to someone who already avoids you? What? You’re just protecting someone you like? You’re the one who dealt with all the idiots approaching An Woo-jin, right? Wow! Amazing, Kim Dal-bi!”
“What do you know?”
Dal-bi’s face, covered in blood, showed a mocking smile. But her eyes were far from smiling.

Whoosh!
“!”

Already exhausted and solely focused on Chae-yeon, Dal-bi couldn’t react in time.
Bang!!
Dal-bi’s body flew and crashed through the hospital wall, falling outside the building.
The man who kicked Dal-bi jumped out through the broken wall and flew towards her.
In midair, Dal-bi barely held onto her fading consciousness and gripped her sword again.
“Safe, aren’t you?”
Shortly after, a girl in a nun’s habit entered the hospital room. It was Spartoi Son Ye-seo.
“Sigh…”
Chae-yeon sighed deeply and leaned against the wall. Ye-seo bent down and looked at her.
“Are you okay?”
“Almost died. My ability is highly dependent on the situation. Here, I’m practically the weakest.”
Chae-yeon grumbled.
The wind crawled in through the broken wall. Outside, the howls of goblins and the sounds of battle could be heard.
“Why don’t you just get rid of that beagle?”
“I heard she’s a top-grade. Unfortunately, Dal-bi is more valuable than you, Chae-yeon.”
Chae-yeon fell silent at the mention of top-grade.
“Chae-yeon?”
Ye-seo called out in suspicion, and Chae-yeon looked nonchalant, gazing at the broken wall.

“That’s understandable. She was chased by Hong-gyu and had a fight with our strongest member before that.”
“Seo Gang-jin?”
“Yes.”
A man known to be the second strongest in Neo Seoul after Goliath.
It was Spartoi Seo Gang-jin.
“No wonder she’s in that state.”
Just knowing she fought Seo Gang-jin explained why Dal-bi ended up in such a mess.
“He wouldn’t have let anyone go…. Right after leaving it to Hong-gyu, Dal-bi must have escaped?”
“Exactly. But she can’t run away anymore.”
Outside the building.
The ground and buildings around were disjointed.
Several goblins were pinned against rocks, covered in blood.
In the midst of it, Dal-bi was shackled to a rock structure, in tatters.
A red-haired man glared at Dal-bi with furious eyes.
One of Neo Seoul’s Six Criminals.
One of the twin glutton siblings, Hong-gyu.
“Kim Dal-bi.”
Hong-gyu stared at Dal-bi.
Dal-bi hung her head, blood dripping down. All she could do was cling to her consciousness.
“Do you think I’m a pushover?”
Hong-gyu spoke irritably, raising his trembling hand.
“If you’re going to resist, you should give it your all, right? You haven’t given up just because you’re weaker than me, have you? Huh? Right now! Transform into a goblin!”
“I... won’t.”
“……”
Thud!
Hong-gyu punched Dal-bi’s abdomen.

“Cough...!”
“Still afraid of the penalty? Just for such a trivial reason?”
Hong-gyu’s fiery rage turned icy cold.
“I’m wasting time that I could spend with my sister on someone like you…? Because of your stubbornness. Shouldn’t you at least show some sincerity?”
“……”
“Hah.”
As if tired of it, Hong-gyu released the magic that formed the rock structure and kicked Dal-bi.
Thud!
It sounded like kicking a soccer ball.
Crash!
Dal-bi’s body flew and crashed into an abandoned building.
Dal-bi, already exhausted after confronting the Grand Principal, had no strength left to resist Hong-gyu.
“The Grand Principal has a message for you, despite everything. You’re not being abandoned. Your mission remains. Merciful, isn’t it?”
Hong-gyu scoffed and pointed at Dal-bi.
In the rising dust, Dal-bi leaned her head against the building’s exterior wall, coughing and gasping for air.
“Tch. Reflect on your actions. I’m leaving now.”
Hong-gyu spat on the ground in disgust and walked away.

“How?”
Ye-seo clapped her hands lightly and put the back of her hand to her cheek.

chapters.title: Chapter 67
chapters.content:
I knew well the reason why Baek Seo moved next door.
It was to protect me.
No matter how much I thought about it, I couldn’t shake off the feeling of overprotection.
It felt as if he knew exactly what threat was targeting me.
Despite his intense desire to protect me, Baek Seo left without telling me, even though he would be away for several days.
It was a suspicious move.
At that time, I was seriously injured after fighting with Moon Chae-yeon, following fights with Kim Dal-bi and Han Seo-jin among the six sinners.
It was easy to guess what kind of worries Baek Seo might have had at this timing.
In other words.
What if Baek Seo decided to take down Moon Chae-yeon, or remove a greater threat? What if he intended to act alone?
‘He probably thought I would definitely stop him if he told me in advance.’
I could guess the reason why Baek Seo left without a word.
Of course, there was no solid evidence. It was purely a hunch.
‘The question of why Baek Seo is trying to act alone without borrowing the power of the disciplinary committee remains unresolved.’
So... I could only hope that my guess was wrong.
I tried to contact Baek Seo two more times, but the call did not go through.
[ An Woo-jin : Where are you? ]
There was no reply.
“Hoo….”
After several space leaps.
As I emerged from the rift created in the air, a dark house came into view. It was Baek Seo’s house.
Not knowing where Baek Seo had gone, I came here grasping at straws.
‘He strongly opposed me coming here, didn’t he?’
It felt inappropriate to invade his privacy, but I could apologize later.
For now, there were other priorities.
Click.
I turned on the light and looked around.
‘... It’s clean.’
It was a neat and ordinary room, to the point where I couldn’t understand why he was reluctant to let me in.
It might be an excessive thought, but I even glimpsed an obsessive cleaning habit.
“?”
A flower on the desk caught my eye.
A peony in a water bottle. It was withered.
The flower had dried and become a dry flower.
─ ‘Do you know the language of the purple peony?’
Last semester, while preparing for the midterm exam.
Baek Seo’s question about my peony amulet came to mind.
‘I thought the question felt unnatural.’
Now I seemed to understand why Baek Seo asked about the language of the purple peony.
Perhaps this withered peony was also originally purple.
‘The language of the purple peony is… anger.’
I couldn’t understand why he kept the peony like this.
I looked around again.
“Hmm?”
A strange sense of emptiness emanated from the direction of the bookshelf.
Upon closer inspection, there was an unnatural finishing line on the flooring under the bookshelf.
I used my unique ability to set coordinates on the opposite side of the bookshelf.
Crack.
A rift was created.
‘The coordinates are set...? It usually doesn’t work if there’s no space on the other side?’
This meant there was space behind the bookshelf.
I immediately leaped through the space.
“......?”
I lightly generated electricity with my fingers and looked around. When I saw the light switch, I turned it on.
The light flickered weakly before illuminating fully.
My eyes widened.
“What…?”
Neatly stored lethal weapons. A row of combat magical tools.
As I moved my head along the weapons, something even more surprising filled my view.
“......”
A mind map and all sorts of information covering one wall.
It was all about Principal Lee Doo-hee.
I stood in front of the information-covered wall and quietly examined the contents.
My emotions gradually cooled down over time.
‘I expected it…, but it was true.’
My brows furrowed.
Eventually, my speculation turned into certainty.
Recalling the magical engraving on Baek Seo’s arm.
She had been an elite agent, a Spartoi, a hunting dog of the Principal.
Although she seemed to have gained freedom from the Principal for some reason, the cause was unknown.
Also, judging by the mind map, I was sure. Baek Seo’s current goal was to assassinate the Principal.
The motive seemed to be... revenge.
‘So that’s why.’
I seemed to understand why Baek Seo had been overly protective of me, and why she disappeared in the original work.
It all made sense.
If Baek Seo had left alone, I could understand why she didn’t need the power of the disciplinary committee.
Because the opponent was the Principal.
It was better to move alone discreetly rather than attracting attention with the insufficient power of the disciplinary committee.
In the original work, Baek Seo would have carried out her plan.
And judging by the fact that Baek Seo could not be found after the Principal’s suicide, it seemed she had met an unfortunate event during the execution of her plan.
She likely didn’t leave Neo Seoul. It would only lead to a hellish place where survival was difficult.
Moving to another place blessed by the Golden Sheep was also impractical.
Surviving until then… it was nearly impossible unless you were a Goliath.
‘One gun is missing.’
Among the slots where firearms were fitted according to their shapes, one slot was empty. Baek Seo must have taken it.
Looking around further, I noticed a trash can. The end of a piece of paper was sticking out from under the lid.
I opened the trash can and saw a crumpled piece of paper. I took it out and checked it.
“……!”
I gasped.
The paper was Baek Seo’s withdrawal application.
[ Reason for withdrawal ] ─ Due to personal reasons, I am withdrawing, but I will return soon.
The phrase ‘I will return soon’ was written.
Baek Seo could have taken a short leave of absence.
It seemed she was planning to leave the school for a while for reasons unrelated to the disciplinary committee or the academy curriculum.
However, seeing that she had not submitted the withdrawal application and threw it away in the trash.
She might have experienced some change of mind and resolved to come back soon.
Moreover, if I had seen the withdrawal application, the outcome would have been obvious.
I would have definitely tried to find out what was wrong and naturally set out to help Baek Seo.
Baek Seo probably expected that too.
“......”
The approval section for the disciplinary committee head and the student council was empty.
Anyway, even if this withdrawal application had been submitted, I would have rejected it.
It wasn’t that she wanted to withdraw; she had no choice.
I put the paper back in the trash can.
I had no intention of feeling disheartened. I immediately began to carefully examine the mind map Baek Seo had organized.
“Kid.”
Eventually, I heard a woman’s voice from behind.
It was Golden Sheep.
“…You knew from the beginning, didn’t you?” “Roughly.”
I didn’t question why she didn’t tell me. It was obvious I would be in danger.
To Golden Sheep, the priority was me. There was no reason to protect Baek Seo.
“I told you, didn’t I?”
Golden Sheep said.
“Baek Seo is like a cheesecake precariously balanced on a pair of chopsticks. It was all fine because you were supporting her. But with you being targeted by the Principal’s henchmen, could she have stayed sane?”
Golden Sheep clicked her tongue.
“Besides, she’s a kid who’s stained her hands with a lot of human blood. It’s more comfortable for her to move alone.” “Yeah, I know. I think so too….” “Don’t look for Baek Seo.”
Golden Sheep cut off my answer and spoke firmly.
There was frost in her voice.
“You’re not in a position to do anything right now. If you don’t want to die in vain, stay still.”
I knew it was a warning.
Facing the Principal with my current state was absurd.
The reason I aimed to become the head of the disciplinary committee was to deal with the six sinners one by one.
Given the possibility that the six sinners, except Goliath, were on the Principal’s side, and that even the strongest Spartoi was the Principal’s subordinate.
It was easy to foresee a future where not only I but the entire disciplinary committee would be buried if we all stepped forward.
But…, it was too harsh a sight before my eyes to stay still.
I had fully grasped the contents of the mind map.
I speculated about Baek Seo’s potential actions and thought together with my game knowledge.
Suddenly, the memory of tirelessly searching for the missing Kim Dal-bi, wearing out the soles of my shoes, overlapped with this moment.
I couldn’t just sit still.
“If I don’t die, it’s fine.”
I turned around and started walking.
My heart had cooled astonishingly.
At this moment, I felt like I wouldn’t be afraid of anyone.
Shoo-shaa.
A dark alley. The rain was soaking Baek Seo and Kim Dal-bi.
Dal-bi leaned against the wall, looking at the grim reaper before her.
A person holding a white wheel sword in one hand and a silenced pistol in the other. Dressed in black to blend into the darkness. It was Baek Seo.
Baek Seo looked the same as in her past hunting dog days. There was no trace of mercy in her eyes.
Dal-bi spoke with a struggling smile.
“You know….”
Puh-sook!
The blade of the white wheel sword, imbued with magical power, pierced Dal-bi’s thigh.
“Ugh…!”
As sudden, excruciating pain surged, Dal-bi bit her lip to stifle her scream. Blood trickled down her bitten lips, mixing with the rain.
Baek Seo put weight on the white wheel sword that pierced Dal-bi’s thigh and stepped on Dal-bi’s ankle.
If Dal-bi resisted even slightly, the white wheel sword would cut through her body.
If she made any loud noise, a bullet would pierce her neck.
“You annoyed me.”
Baek Seo’s cold voice flowed with the sound of rain.
“It seems unforgivable that you tried to touch Woo-jin.” “Really…? That’s good….”
Dal-bi’s body trembled from the cold as her body temperature dropped.
Having lost a lot of blood and being soaked by the cold rain.
Even so, a faint smile curved on Dal-bi’s lips.
“Me too. I guess you’ve been bothering me too….”
Dal-bi honestly expressed her feelings.
But she didn’t say why.

chapters.title: Chapter 68
chapters.content:
A+.
That was the grade given to Baek Seo.
Children born in the factory were graded based on their innate magical power.
Children who received an A+ grade were separately classified and transported to facilities in the forbidden Zero Zone.
Baek Seo was no exception.
In the Zero Zone facility, Baek Seo was held by mechanical devices and forced to repeatedly undergo special training methods.
Later, it was revealed that this was a form of training to awaken their talents, a deteriorated version of the magical power cultivation method designed to enhance the quality of magical power indirectly.
The mechanical devices poured magical power into the children every day.
Every single rough and thorny magical molecule relentlessly enveloped Baek Seo.
Baek Seo screamed every time, but no one came to help.
The children had no freedom.
Neo Seoul's Principal, Lee Doo-hee, knew that performing magical power cultivation in infancy was essential to creating the best talents.
She called it the 'Golden Time.'
If an infant could instinctively grasp the magical power cultivation method during the Golden Time, they could achieve growth unmatched by anyone else.
This was the secret of the so-called new humanity.
Furthermore, this process boasted the highest efficiency and stability.
However, it was impossible to teach infants, who couldn't even speak, the efficient magical power cultivation method in a conventional way.
Only one person had instinctively grasped the magical power cultivation method during the Golden Time.
A man considered the greatest genius in human history, expected to reach Argonaut at an early age—Goliath.
Therefore, the method devised by Principal Lee Doo-hee was to achieve a similar effect to the magical power cultivation method.
This involved forcibly enveloping the children in dense magical power and letting it seep into their bodies.
Considering the survival rate, the subjects were children born with at least A+ grade magical power.
It was tantamount to torture.
To achieve higher efficiency, strong stimuli were necessary.
In the process, many children whose magical circuits were destroyed and whose blood flowed backward were discarded.
To Principal Lee Doo-hee, it was no more psychologically impactful than drinking plain water.
Creating one good talent was overwhelmingly more efficient than raising all the A+ grade children.
To her, it was just an opportunity cost.
Baek Seo survived the Golden Time.
However, what the Principal desired was a talent at the level of Goliath.
Baek Seo didn't come close, but she met half of the Principal's criteria. Thus, she was considered a semi-success.
No more forced training was necessary.
However, Baek Seo's mind was already broken.
In the middle of the facility, she spent her time repeatedly clashing the same toys together, wrapped in bandages and staring lifelessly at the floor, suffering from aphasia.
Then she met Kim Dal-bi.
Baek Seo would look at Dal-bi whenever she heard her voice.
When their eyes met by chance, Dal-bi would smile brightly.
Feeling awkward, Baek Seo would avoid her gaze.
Each time, Dal-bi's smile would seep into Baek Seo's heart.
‘Hello!’
One day, Dal-bi greeted Baek Seo cutely with a smile.
This was after all the other children they had been with were discarded.
‘We know each other, right?’
The two children quickly became close, perhaps because they had survived the same ordeal.
Dal-bi frequently hugged Baek Seo.
That warmth restored the light in Baek Seo's eyes.
The Principal allowed Baek Seo and Dal-bi to play like ordinary children, just like other semi-successful children.
Baek Seo and Dal-bi, for the first time, saw the small but beautiful flower garden outside the prison-like facility.
The desolate area near the Zero Zone.
A place always seen through the window but never experienced.
The blue sky and the view of the flower garden excited the two children for the first time.
That day, Dal-bi picked up a purple peony and said,
According to the book, the flower's meaning was ‘anger.’
Proud of her knowledge, Dal-bi confidently put her hands on her hips.
The reason this moment stood out in Baek Seo's memory was that she realized something.
Like a misaligned gear, something had been wrong since birth.
Being born couldn’t be this painful.
There were so many beautiful things in the world.
‘Ah.’
Baek Seo finally understood the unknown emotion that had been rising within her.
Soon, Baek Seo picked up a purple peony.
Shoo-shaa.
The sound of rain washed away the memories of the past.
Present time. A dark alley.
“Honestly, you really annoyed me….”
Dal-bi's voice, soaked with blood, mingled with the sound of rain.
Despite the aggressive words, Baek Seo remained indifferent.
“Me too. We’re similar.” “Hehe…, we really have no affection for each other….”
Dal-bi stared intently at Baek Seo.
The same kind face that exchanged affectionate glances with Woo-jin overlapped.
Whether in the past or now, Baek Seo always shone brightly in Dal-bi's eyes.
The sense of incongruity Dal-bi felt when looking at Baek Seo became clear.
Suddenly, a new question arose in Dal-bi's mind.
‘That's right….’
Did it really have to be her protecting An Woo-jin?
There was someone strong, bright, and fond of Woo-jin right beside him.
Baek Seo’s bold actions must be to protect Woo-jin’s daily life.
‘What am I… in this mess….’
Compared to that, what about herself?
As Moon Chae-yeon said, Dal-bi was just a stumbling block for Woo-jin.
She had become a woman clinging to the past like mud.
Dal-bi's lips curved into a faint smile.
Her intelligent eyes and cunning smile faced Baek Seo’s ruthless face.
Her thoughts had been organized.
“Why are you here…? No, let me guess. You’re here to deal with the disciplinary committee head's followers this time, right…?”
Coming all the way to the Zero Zone, it was clear she intended to deal with Moon Chae-yeon.
Baek Seo did not deny it.
“You, you picked the wrong time…? Today, it would be better to do nothing…?”
You should leave here now.
“By looking at your ragged state, I can tell. There must be several people of the Principal around.”
Baek Seo spoke.
The Zero Zone had minimal surveillance by the Principal.
That’s why Baek Seo and Dal-bi could talk freely.
“You seem to have been beaten like a dog for defying the Principal.” “Hey, that’s too harsh…. There are better comparisons….”
Dal-bi laughed, “Hehe.”
“I have something to ask you.”
Baek Seo spoke firmly.
“What is it…?” “Why did you leave me? I haven’t heard your reason yet.” “Oh.”
Dal-bi thought for a moment before smiling.
“You mean that time? When we were asked to decide who would leave between us….”
Baek Seo nodded.
During their childhood, a Spartoi, a subordinate of the Principal, proposed to Baek Seo and Dal-bi.
─ ‘One of you become my dog. In return, I will let the other go outside.’
The decision was left to the two children.
The one who spoke first would be given the choice.
Baek Seo and Dal-bi promised not to betray each other.
But after Baek Seo woke up,
─ ‘Kim Dal-bi chose first. She left at dawn.’
Hearing this from an AI robot, Baek Seo’s mind went blank.
She confirmed Dal-bi's empty room. Her eyes darkened.
It was a memory Baek Seo could never forget.
“I told you before…. It would be meaningless to tell.” “It’s important to me.”
Baek Seo couldn’t shake off the words that Dal-bi had left her.
She didn’t resent Dal-bi for it.
All the blame was on the Principal.
Only the question of ‘why?’ repeated in her mind.
Why did Dal-bi leave first without saying a word? Baek Seo wanted to know.
“…Let me ask again. Did you want to escape here so badly that you left me?”
“……?”
After a moment, doubt filled Dal-bi’s eyes.
“What do you mean…? That I escaped here?” “What?” “I was the one who decided to become the dog…?”
A sense of dissonance.
A peculiar feeling of incongruity hung in the air as their conversation diverged. Both realized their conversation had gone awry.
In her childhood, Dal-bi recalled secretly visiting the Principal at dawn and saying,
─ ‘We won’t follow your orders. We know you intend to keep us here anyway.’
─ ‘I see…. You’re clever. So, what do you want?’
─ ‘Please set Baek Seo free.’
Dal-bi bowed.
─ ‘Please.’
After a while, the Principal remained silent, so Dal-bi raised her head.
The Principal was laughing.
It was an extremely unpleasant and grotesque smile, like seeing a ridiculous scene.
Deep wrinkles folded as he laughed.
At dawn, the Principal’s subordinate took Dal-bi away.
Thus, Dal-bi and Baek Seo parted without even saying goodbye.
“……?”
Dal-bi’s expression of confusion left Baek Seo puzzled.
With her trained ability, Baek Seo read the subtle changes in Dal-bi’s expression. There was no unconscious change in expression indicative of lying.
Finally, an alarm went off in Baek Seo's mind.
The sound of realization.
She understood the vague suspicion she had vaguely guessed.
“Haa….”
A deep sigh escaped from Baek Seo's lips.
Dal-bi tilted her head, still looking at Baek Seo with puzzled eyes, as if unaware of Baek Seo’s activity as a hunting dog.
It was definitely.
‘It was a ruse.’
The Principal wanted obedient children.
Thus, he made the two children his dogs with a simple and cowardly trick.
The Principal had no intention of giving up either Baek Seo or Dal-bi. Both were precious experiment subjects and semi-successes.
The two children in their youth couldn’t possibly know that.
Baek Seo's thoughts were organized.
The remaining questions too.
The sense of loss that had haunted her thinking Dal-bi had abandoned her was also cleared.
Swoosh!
The blade of the white wheel sword was pulled out from Dal-bi’s thigh.
“Ugh…!”
Dal-bi bit back a scream.
Baek Seo immediately attached a medical magical tool to Dal-bi’s thigh. The pierced area was sealed, compressing and stopping the bleeding.
It was for emergency treatment.
“Why suddenly…?” “I heard that you left me.”
“What…?”
By now, Dal-bi couldn’t help but understand.
She had always thought Baek Seo was living freely.
But it seemed the person in question had perceived it differently.
“It was strange. Even after you left my side, you became a terrorist. So, I had to confirm with you directly….”
While Baek Seo was speaking.
Suddenly, the air became heavy, and a wave of powerful magic brushed past Baek Seo and Dal-bi’s skin.
“!” “!”
Their eyes widened.
Crash!!
Suddenly, between the rooftops of the buildings, an arch-shaped ice barrier formed, covering the night sky.
Beautiful and large snowflake-shaped patterns floated on the magical ice chunks.
At the same time, the path leading to the opposite side of the alley was completely frozen, blocking their way.
Baek Seo and Dal-bi looked up simultaneously, guessing the situation.
For some reason, someone they shouldn’t meet had appeared here.
Click-clack.
The sound of high heels echoed clearly.
Baek Seo and Dal-bi turned their heads in the same direction.
Flowing with hazy cold air like a melody, a silver-haired male student in a white uniform approached.
An eerie sensation enveloped Baek Seo and Dal-bi.
The man's cold eyes seemed to freeze everything.
“Why…? I thought he had left for something…?”
Dal-bi looked at the white-haired man in disbelief.
The man who had subdued Dal-bi as a consequence of defying the Principal.
Thinking he had assigned the task to Hong Kyu, one of the six sinners, and left, but he had unexpectedly appeared.
“…….”
Baek Seo composed herself and assumed a combat stance.
There was no way her movements had been detected.
In other words,
“You knew I would come here….”
The Principal must have known that Baek Seo would act.
The reason why Han Seo-jin, one of the six sinners, had been monitoring Baek Seo.
The aftermath that would follow if An Woo-jin was taken through Moon Chae-yeon.
The Principal had anticipated everything and set the trap.
“It’s been a while, Baek Seo.”
The person known to be the strongest after Goliath in Neo Seoul.
The strongest among the Principal’s subordinates.
Spartoi of the 7th rank.
Cold air flowed from the lips of the white man, Seo Kang-jin.
It was highly unnatural for him to be here after releasing Dal-bi and withdrawing.
Even Baek Seo had been more vigilant about Kang-jin’s movements than anyone, like a landmine.
Kang-jin’s appearance here could only be seen as the Principal’s ploy.
It was hasty. She moved too hastily.
However, Baek Seo showed no signs of bewilderment on her face.
She only refined the magic circulating within her body.
“…Hello.”
Baek Seo gathered her magic.
Even though the future ahead was clear.
Meanwhile, An Woo-jin was running around, repeatedly making space leaps.
He had searched every place, including Aseong High School, where Baek Seo might be, but her whereabouts were nowhere to be found.
The past of running frantically to find Kim Dal-bi filled Woo-jin's mind repeatedly.
The helplessness from back then gripped Woo-jin's mind and drove him to run madly.
Woo-jin gasped for breath and struggled with penalties, unable to even contact Golden Sheep. Pain couldn’t stop his steps.
Before long, the rain clouds receded, and the sun began to rise over the horizon. The dim sunlight cast over the gray city.
The Zero Zone. On the debris of several collapsed buildings.
“Ke…ugh….”
Baek Seo was frostbitten all over her body and covered in blood.
Baek Seo barely lifted her heavy eyelids and looked at Kang-jin with thinly opened eyes.
In her blurred vision, she couldn’t make out anything properly.
Dal-bi had already been knocked unconscious by Kang-jin.
Seeing Dal-bi trying to help Baek Seo, he had made her lose consciousness beforehand.
“The Principal was wary of you too, Baek Seo. Knowing you would target him someday.”
A female student in a nun’s outfit, Spartoi Son Ye-seo, said while supporting the unconscious Dal-bi.
“But… you were too hasty, Baek Seo. Did you think the Principal would only target Woo-jin?”
“…….” “Kang-jin. Dal-bi should be locked up until she calms down. I’ll take her with me.”
Kang-jin gave no response.
Ye-seo nodded lightly and left with Dal-bi.
Kang-jin quietly observed the defeated Baek Seo. She struggled to move her body. However, her already battered body did not respond to her will.
Soon, the light faded from Baek Seo’s eyes. Her consciousness went black.
Drip.
Cold blood trickled down Kang-jin’s cheek. It was from the wound Baek Seo had inflicted.
Wiping his cheek with his gloved hand, the red blood smeared on the glove.
Kang-jin took off the glove and threw it at Baek Seo before turning around and walking away.
Heading in the direction where Moon Chae-yeon was standing, looking indifferently at Baek Seo.
“The Principal ordered me to. Extract Unsa’s ability. Starting today.”
Moon Chae-yeon asked Kang-jin.
“I’m struggling with penalties right now, so it’ll take about a week.” “Do it as soon as possible.” “So, Baek Seo is to be disposed of?”
Kang-jin walked away without answering.
He showed he didn’t want to talk.
Chae-yeon let out a bitter laugh and shook her head.
[…….]
The small goblin hiding in the alley turned to smoke and disappeared.

chapters.title: Chapter 69
chapters.content:
"Leader?"
The window opened.
Ha Ye-song stuck her head out and looked up at me.
The other executives were also at the window with Ye-song.
"Leader, is that...?"
The executives seemed surprised to see the lower-grade goblin in my hand.
I continued talking to the goblin without minding them.
"Moon Chae-yeon's hideout?" [Yes! Got caught! By the white man!]
The lower-grade goblin flailed its small arms.
'The white man... it must be him.'
I couldn't help but know who it was.
If it was someone connected to the Principal, capable of defeating Baek Seo, and referred to as the 'white man,' there was only one person it could be.
The strongest among the Spartoi, Seo Kang-jin.
According to the mind map, Baek Seo had been closely watching Kang-jin.
The moment Kang-jin got involved, it was clear the plan would go awry.
In a game analogy, Kang-jin was like the grim reaper who would inevitably defeat the player or the landmine that would result in game over upon contact.
In other words, if Baek Seo had been defeated by Kang-jin,
It meant my bad premonition had come true.
"Tell me where the hideout is." [Moon Chae-yeon's hideout is in Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction!] "Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction?" [Yes! I don't know the exact location!] "......"
Min-hyuk stuck his head out of the window.
His face was filled with fear.
"No matter how you look at it, it seems like a trap...! That's a goblin, right!? One of the six sinners! You can't trust it, Leader!"
Could it be a trap?
"I don't think so."
I leaned towards the side that it wasn't.
Just like any major academy's jurisdiction, Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction was very broad.
If they were trying to lure me into a trap, would they have answered so vaguely?
In the first place, why would Kim Dal-bi go to the trouble of sending a lower-grade goblin to tell such a lie?
It was a highly unnatural situation.
It meant there was an interest I didn't know about behind this incident.
‘Even if it’s a trap, there's no choice.’
There was no way to find out Baek Seo's whereabouts immediately.
I couldn't refuse even if it was a trap.
After all, I had the ability to teleport. I could escape if necessary.
[Good! Mission accomplished since I told everything!]
Having said everything, the lower-grade goblin shouted joyfully, stretching its arms upwards.
Soon, its body started turning into smoke from the toes up. It was leaving because it had completed Kim Dal-bi's order.
"One more question. Why did Kim Dal-bi send you?" [I don't know...! She said to take Baek Seo.] "What? Wait...!"
The lower-grade goblin completely turned to smoke and slipped out of my hand.
A goblin whose purpose isn't combat cannot be caught anyway. How could I stop it from disappearing?
The night breeze brushed my skin.
Soon, a question surfaced in my mind.
‘Does Kim Dal-bi... wish for Baek Seo to be safe?’
Whether with good intentions or bad,
It seemed that Dal-bi didn't want Baek Seo to face any misfortune.
‘I don't know.’
I couldn't guess the reason at all.
Let's set aside the question that I can't find an answer to.
"Did you hear?"
Squatting on the windowsill, I asked the executives.
“Yes…. Can we trust that?”
Ye-song asked, looking bewildered.
"I’ll go even if it’s a trap. I can escape if something happens.... Hm?"
At that moment, I sensed movement below.
The executives and I looked down.
We saw students setting up an air cushion.
"Hey, Senior!"
A female student cheerfully waved at me. It was Lee Se-ah, squinting her eyes as usual.
On closer look, the students setting up the air cushion seemed to be from the Volunteer Club.
“Hey! Are you planning to make an extreme choice as the discipline committee head?”
“Haha…! If you’re having a hard time, we’ll kindly counsel you…!”
“Hehe…! Jump, senior! If you’re confident in going to the afterlife, then jump! Let’s see who wins!”
What the heck...? What are they doing here...?
Bzzz.
Suddenly, my smartphone vibrated.
Seeing Se-ah fiddling with her smartphone, it seemed she had sent the message.
I checked immediately.
[Lee Se-ah: Senior~ I came to stop your suicide!] [Lee Se-ah: But I think I saw something strange]
[An Woo-jin: It's nothing]
[Lee Se-ah: It seemed like something though?] [Lee Se-ah: Anyway, let's talk about it later] [Lee Se-ah: Are you looking for Baek Seo?]
My whole body tensed.
‘What…?’
How did she know?
‘Did she guess by looking at my state?’
I recalled that Se-ah had found me and informed the executives.
Though I didn't know how she found me, anyway.
I had been a mess earlier, and Baek Seo hadn't been with me for days. Se-ah could have easily guessed.
Se-ah had enough information-gathering ability to find me.
[An Woo-jin: So you’ve been watching me all along]
[Lee Se-ah: Of courseㅋㅋㅋ] [Lee Se-ah: We're stalkers to each other, aren’t we?] [Lee Se-ah: I really like this relationship ㅎㅎ]
[An Woo-jin: …]
[Lee Se-ah: I'll send the kids back] [Lee Se-ah: Should we discuss it?]
......
"Emergency air cushion~. It boasts excellent performance. I often carry anti-suicide tools. You never know when you’ll encounter someone with strange thoughts on the street, right? Though I didn't expect it to be you, senior. It’s really good to be alive!"
"......" "Are you perhaps moved by the junior who cared for your life?"
"No."
The discipline committee's office.
I brought Se-ah and served her tea. She sent the other Volunteer Club students back.
The discipline committee members watched Se-ah quietly. Except for Yoo Do-ha, no one seemed wary.
"She looks like a doll.... No wonder the leader is so into her.... Ouch!"
Ye-song's nonsense was interrupted by Min-hyuk's chop to the back of her head.
"Be considerate...!" "What did I do...!"
Ye-song and Min-hyuk bickered in low voices.
Se-ah watched them with a bright smile.
"Thank you. You are beautiful too, senior." "Me?" "Yes. You're lovely." "Hmm..., hehe. You're saying the obvious...!"
Embarrassed, Ye-song giggled at Se-ah's flattery. She was weak to compliments.
She looked stupid to me.
"......" "......"
Min-hyuk and Do-ha silently glared at Ye-song as if they were dumbfounded.
"So, you ran over when you saw me by the window?"
I asked while sitting across from Se-ah.
I leaned back and crossed my arms.
“Yes. We were having a gathering after finishing our night volunteer work. Our room is right across, so we saw it well.” “I see…. Did I look like I was about to jump?” “You’ve been a mess lately, haven’t you? Someone as perfect as you suddenly falling apart like that, of course, it raises suspicions.”
It was convincing...
“Moreover, I didn’t see Vice Leader Baek Seo, who’s always with you. So, I wondered if there was a serious issue between you two.” “Leader.”
Do-ha called out to me.
It wasn't a nuance of wanting to talk.
Baek Seo's disappearance was the discipline committee's issue.
It wasn't good to inform people outside the committee.
Once you speak out, you can't take it back. Moreover, this incident was very sensitive.
In short, it was prudent not to blab to outsiders.
It could cause unexpected problems.
So, Do-ha was signaling me not to talk about it.
Besides, Do-ha seemed not to trust Se-ah.
From my experience, Do-ha's intuition was never wrong.
It could be correct this time too.
Se-ah was destined to become the villain controlling the Black Market in the future.
‘But….’
Reflecting on past events.
In terms of helping each other, I thought positively of Se-ah.
I also owed her a great debt.
I lightly raised my hand, showing the back of it to Do-ha. It meant I would handle it.
Even if things went wrong, I would take full responsibility.
Se-ah smiled meaningfully and gave Do-ha a glance, then looked back at me.
"Senior, I can help you too." "What?"
That one sentence from Se-ah instantly grabbed my and the executives' attention.
"Let me lightly guess the situation first. It’s just my imagination, and it might be groundless."
Se-ah rested her arms on the table and spoke. Then she raised her right hand and pointed her index finger upwards, starting her explanation.
"Vice Leader Baek Seo couldn't stand it anymore because of the constant involvement of Leader An Woo-jin with the six sinners. She left targeting someone. The first target would be the technomancer you recently fought. The problem is, she left without saying a word, and now the discipline committee is in the dark. Right?"
"That is…."
As Do-ha tried to respond.
"That's right."
“Leader? Wait…!”
I confirmed.
Do-ha was surprised, and Se-ah smiled brightly.
"And the entity you caught by the window was a goblin, right?" "Did you know that too?" "Of course. It's the ability of the six sinners. Continuing my guess, Vice Leader Baek Seo must have had trouble with the six sinners. The goblin must have revealed Baek Seo's whereabouts. Is that correct?"
I nodded.
"But we know little too. We don't know why the goblin revealed Baek Seo's situation. It might be a trap." "Where did it say?" "The technomancer's hideout in Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction." "How do you plan to find it?" "Technomancer's ability requires a lot of electromagnetic waves. So, there should be an abnormal amount of electromagnetic waves near the hideout. Or a place where there shouldn't be many electromagnetic waves but there are. I'm thinking of looking for such a place."
Se-ah grinned.
"Sounds good. Senior, as I said before, I'm good at finding people. You can trust me."
“Okay….”
Thud.
Suddenly, Do-ha put his hand on my shoulder.
"Hey, leader.... Why did you reveal everything?"
His tone was filled with annoyance.
Of course, Se-ah was an outsider, not a discipline committee member. It was natural for Do-ha to express dissatisfaction.
However, Se-ah had considerable useful capabilities.
As I mentioned before, she had been a great help to me.
If Se-ah had intended to harm me from the start, she wouldn't have made me feel indebted to her this much.
That's why I thought I could ask for her help this time.
Moreover,
“I trust Se-ah.”
To be honest, I just wanted to believe her.
It seemed the psychological barrier between Se-ah and me had broken down significantly.
Of course, it wasn't absolute trust.
I had no intention of lowering my guard towards Se-ah.
She was destined to become a major villain in the Black Market in the future.
If Se-ah ever committed inhumane acts, I was prepared to put a knife to her throat at any time.
"What…?"
Do-ha was startled by my firm response.
“Oh….”
Se-ah opened her mouth in admiration.
It wasn’t just for emotional reasons.
I continued speaking.
“And if Ma Hyun High School’s jurisdiction is the enemy's territory, it’s difficult to use only the discipline committee members. The discipline committee or the student council invading another jurisdiction is a clear violation of sovereignty. We’ll be immediately restrained, and security drones will easily catch us. If we involve Ma Hyun High School in finding Baek Seo, it’ll be complicated.”
“So, you want to ask for help from non-discipline committee members to avoid detection?” “Right. We need to minimize the use of discipline committee members. Just take the core and leave the rest.”
While we were talking, Min-hyuk interrupted.
“What about cooperating with Ma Hyun High School...?” “Min-hyuk, think a little?” “What?”
Ye-song scolded Min-hyuk.
“There’s an urgent situation where Baek Seo might be in danger, and if we ask Ma Hyun High School for help, do you think they’ll respond quickly? We don’t even have proof to request support. What can we say? ‘We heard from a sinner that our Baek Seo is in your territory. So, we want to rampage there.’ Is there anything else to say? If I were Ma Hyun High School, I’d be dumbfounded. It’s not like a child’s tantrum….”
“That’s…”
“Moreover, to request Ma Hyun High School’s cooperation, we need to get approval from the student council here and go through procedures…. It’s very leisurely, isn’t it?” “…….” “Even if things go well and Ma Hyun High School listens to us. They’re the ones we’ve been fighting over jurisdiction issues, remember? At the exchange meeting, we growled at each other showing our teeth. This time, they’ll be the absolute authority. Who knows what attitude they’ll take? We’ll be in agony, and the risk is too high.”
…!
Unbelievable….
“Leader, Do-ha? Why are you so surprised?” “Ha Ye-song thought…?” “I do have a brain, Leader…. Please treat me like a human.”
Even in a serious situation, it was astonishing.
...Let's set that aside for now.
Moon Chae-yeon's hideout would be filled with all sorts of weapons, including chimeras.
It would be dangerous to operate the discipline committee with minimal personnel, but with Se-ah's organization Dohwa Group or at least the Volunteer Club’s help, the situation would improve.
I looked at Do-ha again. He was still seriously staring at me.
“Anyway, I’ll take full responsibility. So don’t oppose it.” “…Tsk.”
In the end, Do-ha clicked his tongue and stepped back.
“Does this mean you need my help?”
Se-ah tilted her head and asked. She still had a sly smile on her face.
“Yes. But, we might end up fighting a sinner.” “It’s okay. You’ll win, won’t you?”
“…….”
I didn’t deny it.
I had to win anyway.
Because I couldn’t afford to lose.
“Got it. Then tell me what you want.”
“Pardon?”
I put my hand on the table and looked at the edge.
I decided to probe her.
“You’re offering to help because you want something from me, right?”
Like a businessman smelling money.
“Oh…, do I have such a bad impression? I need to work harder.”
Se-ah let out a small laugh.
“Finding out that an acquaintance is in danger, how could a volunteer like me stay still? Also, I owe you a big debt. That’s essentially a life debt.” “If you’re talking about that subway incident at the beginning of the semester, forget it.”
Although it was just a feeling, Se-ah seemed to want something from me.
If there was such a thing, it would be good for me.
I could certainly get help.
I also wanted to clear the debt with Se-ah properly in the future.
“Anyway, if you want something later, tell me. I owe you a lot too. I’ll help if I can.” “Really, really~. So that’s what it was?”
Se-ah nodded contentedly.
Her eyes slightly opened, revealing her red pupils.
It was a meaningful look, as if she was trying to see through my intentions.
“How heartwarming.”
Se-ah returned to her squinted eyes and smiled slyly.
“Then, shall we postpone the debt settlement for later?” “Okay.”
Se-ah extended her hand.
“Let’s do this, senior. Cooperation.” “…I’m counting on you.”
I shook hands with Se-ah.
......
The next day.
We finished our preparations.

chapters.title: Chapter 70
chapters.content:
Only a small number of members from the Dohwa Group joined us.
Since it was an incident that could raise sensitive jurisdictional issues among major academies, we couldn't deeply involve the entire organization.
Se-ah asked for my understanding on this, but I was rather grateful.
I was relieved enough.
Moreover, one of the strongest members in Aseong High School, the head of the Volunteer Club, had joined us. It seemed she had agreed to Se-ah's request.
First, we equipped a Dohwa Group vehicle with radio wave detection equipment and formed a search team.
The discipline committee members Park Min-hyuk and Yoo Do-ha accompanied us.
I repeatedly told them to stay in the vehicle as much as possible.
If the discipline committee members, especially executives, showed their faces in Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction, there was a high risk of being caught by the security drones. It would definitely be reported to Ma Hyun High School, and things would go awry.
The search team headed towards Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction.
Meanwhile, the remaining members prepared for battle by equipping the discipline committee's gear on the Dohwa Group's vehicles and checking the equipment.
Crack!
I practiced my unique ability alone in the training ground.
'It's going pretty well.'
Setting coordinates had become much easier than before.
Although it was still difficult to move to distant locations like Golden Sheep, I could almost accurately create a rift at the desired location if the distance was close enough.
At least, the mishap of trying to go to my shower but ending up in Baek Seo's shower wouldn't happen again.
'Is it because I've been replaying battles in my mind?'
In my experience,
I felt like the result was thanks to repeatedly replaying my battles with Moon Chae-yeon and mentally rehearsing the parts that needed improvement.
No wonder my space leaps had been going well while searching for Baek Seo.
Of course, the accumulated practice so far had laid a solid foundation.
Bzzz.
Suddenly, my smartphone vibrated.
I clenched my fist and dissipated the rift, then answered the call.
─ Senior, we found it.
It was Se-ah's voice.
─ We detected a place with a lot of electromagnetic waves that didn't make sense. We also detected some unnatural heat. We wouldn't have noticed if we hadn't specifically been looking for it. "Where is it?" ─ Let's see.... It's on the outskirts. We didn't approach it as you ordered, so we don't know the exact origin.
The outskirts of Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction were empty plains.
There was no way Moon Chae-yeon's hideout was blatantly there.
In other words,
'Underground.'
The hideout seemed to be underground.
─ By the way, you know that guy you had with his head in the toilet? Can't we extract information about the hideout from him?
She was referring to the man I dealt with the day I met Moon Chae-yeon.
"Where did you get that information? The investigation records should be confidential." ─ Ye-song told me. Was it sensitive information? “…That guy is a contractor. He doesn't know anything."
It was something I had already found out before.
If the guy with his head in the toilet had known anything important about Chae-yeon, she wouldn't have left him alone.
─ I see.... That's unfortunate. I was a bit curious. "Don't get any funny ideas." ─ Of course~. I'll withdraw for now! "Okay."
If we approached the hideout, there was a risk of a fight breaking out.
We couldn't afford to let our eagerness ruin things.
Of course, the place could be a trap set by the six sinners. Even so, we couldn't give up on going there.
Click. I hung up the phone.
We shouldn't delay, but charging in recklessly was a foolish move.
So, thorough preparation was needed.
Checking equipment and assembling forces, the operation would start this evening.
In the evening, as the sky turned red with the sunset,
‘Everyone's gathered.’
Only the executives of the Aseong High School discipline committee, including myself, were to move.
As mentioned earlier, discipline committee members like us, who were well-known externally, could be easily spotted and identified in another academy's jurisdiction.
However, just in case, we established a reserve grenade launcher unit.
The command role was assigned to Yoo Do-ha. In other words, Do-ha would remain here.
Also, it was obvious we couldn't take the discipline committee vehicles. They would definitely be detected by Ma Hyun High School in advance.
So, the discipline committee's combat gear was installed in the vehicles provided by the Dohwa Group.
The Dohwa Group members who joined the team were the drivers and a sniper named Lee Jung-mi.
In addition, the Volunteer Club joined. Se-ah's friends and the head of the Volunteer Club.
The most noticeable person was Lee Jung-mi.
She exuded the elegance of an elite and had a refined magical aura.
However, she made it clear that she was only there to protect Se-ah. She wouldn't get involved in anything else.
I was grateful for any kind of cooperation.
“You seem deep in thought.”
While everyone was checking their equipment or getting ready,
A muscular female student, the head of the Volunteer Club, Kang Hee-yoon, approached me.
She stood next to me.
“…Thank you for stepping up to help.” “Don't mention it. As the Volunteer Club, it's natural to help those in need. And... I owe a lot to Se-ah. I couldn't refuse her request.”
I looked at Se-ah, who was talking with the Dohwa Group members while checking the equipment.
Se-ah noticed my gaze and smiled brightly like a fox.
“Again, it might be dangerous.” “I don't mind.”
The Volunteer Club head, Hee-yoon, spoke in a serious tone.
“'We're saving Baek Seo.' That's our only task, right? How could we leave such a good person because of danger?” “…I'll repay this debt later.”
Hee-yoon scoffed.
“No need. Don't you think I know you've always helped our Volunteer Club members and the needy? You're already an honorary member of the Volunteer Club. Helping each other is what members do. That's loyalty…!”
Hee-yoon gave a thumbs-up and winked.
Sparkle. Hee-yoon's eyes shone brightly for a moment.
“Okay…, thank you.”
When I extended my arm, Hee-yoon bumped her arm against mine.
Soon, all preparations were complete.
Four executives of the discipline committee.
One of them, Yoo Do-ha, stayed with the reserve grenade launcher unit.
So, it was me, Ha Ye-song, and Park Min-hyuk—three in total.
Five members of the Dohwa Group, including Lee Se-ah, and four from the Volunteer Club.
A total of twelve people formed the task force.
The task force members all looked at me simultaneously. They were waiting to hear from me before departing.
Suddenly, I recalled the time when I searched for Kim Dal-bi alone in my childhood.
Unlike then, now I had people to help find Baek Seo.
It felt reassuring.
I took a deep breath and solemnly spoke.
“Thank you for gathering. As I said before, I will take all responsibility for anything that happens.”
Today, surely many troubles would arise.
We planned to engage in combat with a sinner in another academy's jurisdiction without following legal procedures.
I hadn't reported to the student council.
It was all solely my decision.
No matter how hard we tried, it would only delay being hindered by Ma Hyun High School.
Getting caught by the Aseong High School student council or Ma Hyun High School's discipline committee was just a matter of time.
After today, a disciplinary committee would likely be convened.
But no matter what happened,
I was determined to bring back Baek Seo.
I cursed the fact that I was born again into this world.
I hated this detestable place that had tormented me so much from the factory.
Even if being born wasn't my choice,
At least I would change the future as I wished.
And Baek Seo had to be there.
I had already decided.
“Get ready to raise hell.”
I said, putting on my black gloves.
“Let's go.”
The discipline committee executives responded with a firm “Yes!” and the Volunteer Club members laughed wickedly and cheerfully.
Se-ah smiled like a fox, and the Dohwa Group members nodded.
The next discipline committee head. A genius without equal. The youngest to reach the 6th rank. A possessor of top-tier magical power.
Whenever Baek Seo was praised for her abilities, she would only smile gently.
Baek Seo's abilities were recognized everywhere, and everyone wanted to win her favor.
Compliments that felt burdensome always followed Baek Seo.
Since she was good-looking and kind-hearted, it was natural that she was highly regarded.
However, to Baek Seo,
All of it was just detestable.
Outstanding ability. Amazing. A genius. No one can catch up to Baek Seo. Heaven bestowed her with unparalleled blessings. She might even rival the great Goliath.
‘...Annoying.’
Baek Seo's gentle smile concealed a fierce disgust that churned in her stomach.
All her exceptional abilities were cultivated by the Principal's will.
The praise towards Baek Seo only revived memories of her cursed past.
Having endured the torturous training during the Golden Time, becoming the Principal's hunting dog and Spartoi, killing many human scumbags,
The wretched human that was cultivated was herself.
That’s why, whenever people praised her abilities, it made her nauseous.
In the end, unable to bear it, Baek Seo often vomited with her head in the toilet.
It wasn't about blaming those who praised her abilities.
Baek Seo simply hated herself.
She found herself detestable.
‘I will become the next discipline committee head.’
Then, a man caught her eye.
Everyone believed without a doubt that Baek Seo would become the next discipline committee head of Aseong High School.
Yet, An Woo-jin confidently proclaimed without hesitation that he would be the next discipline committee head, as if he didn't see Baek Seo as a competitor.
Baek Seo felt a faint curiosity towards Woo-jin.
So, she talked to him.
Just to find out if he knew who she was.
However, Woo-jin naturally knew Baek Seo's stature.
But he didn't show any signs of being wary of her or trying to flatter her abilities.
He simply treated her as an equal and ordinary peer.
Baek Seo passed it off without much thought, but she felt no disgust towards Woo-jin and started talking to him again.
As expected, Woo-jin continued to treat her as an ordinary peer.
Baek Seo felt strangely comfortable.
Her curiosity towards Woo-jin gradually grew stronger.
One day, while working with Woo-jin, Baek Seo brought up an honest question.
‘Have you ever seen me as a competitor?’ ‘What?’ ‘Everyone thinks I’ll be the next discipline committee head. Don’t you have any sense of competition?’
She deliberately asked with subtle aggression and mockery.
To test Woo-jin's sincerity.
‘What are you talking about.’
Woo-jin answered indifferently.
‘I just find you comfortable.’ ‘...What?’
Unexpectedly, Baek Seo's eyes widened.
She immediately controlled her expression.
‘That’s all.’
After hearing that, Baek Seo stopped testing Woo-jin.
She simply stayed by Woo-jin’s side, feeling at ease.
Then one day, as she was about to go to bed,
Baek Seo felt a sudden stir in her chest.
At some point, Woo-jin had seeped into her heart.
Drip.
“…….”
Baek Seo regained consciousness, tears of blood flowing.
She slowly opened her eyes, feeling the cold sensation of metal.
It seemed she had lost consciousness and wandered through her past.
“You're awake?”
A faint voice made Baek Seo look up.
Moon Chae-yeon greeted Baek Seo.
Chae-yeon was checking a mechanical device, dressed in a tank top and shorts. She wiped her sweat while brushing up her brown hair.
“Are you in a lot of pain? How many times have you fainted now? Well, extracting your unique ability is quite painful, right? It should be better now, though.”
Chae-yeon tapped her neck lightly with a monkey wrench as she approached Baek Seo.
The machine restraining Baek Seo displayed ‘95%’.
The device had patches of strange flesh and skin attached to it. It was hard to see it as purely a human creation.
“Almost done. It’ll be over in two hours. As you know, when your unique ability is taken, you'll be dead. It's essentially euthanasia.”
Chae-yeon spread her legs and sat backward on a chair.
Baek Seo's eyes were blurry. She barely held onto consciousness.
The lingering pain felt like blades stabbing into every corner of her skin. She didn’t even have the strength to make a sound.
Chae-yeon smirked at Baek Seo’s pathetic state.
“So, why did you go against the Principal? No matter the reason, you received freedom from the Principal, didn’t you? You should have lived quietly instead of acting out. Tsk, how pathetic.” “…….” “…Before you die, let me ask you one thing. How did you get your freedom? The Principal wouldn’t have let you go easily. The Principal's side surpasses you in every aspect except raw power…. Ah, did you catch some kind of weakness and make a deal? Is that it?”
Baek Seo's head remained down.
Chae-yeon sighed, then stood up and approached Baek Seo.
Swish. Chae-yeon grabbed Baek Seo's chin and lifted her head.
A strange indigo pattern, glowing with magical light, had crept up Baek Seo's neck. When the pattern covered her face, it would be the end for Baek Seo.
“What should I call this? Awake yet mentally gone...?” “…….”
Chae-yeon's eyes darkened.
“…Baek Seo. I think you were foolish. Surviving is the most important thing. If you throw away your life so easily…. We can’t find any hope.”
“…….” “I'll survive. I won’t act foolishly like you. Even if I have to lick the Principal’s shoes like a dog, I'll survive. So in the afterlife, blame me if you want….”
At that moment,
A loud alarm rang from Chae-yeon’s wristwatch.
“……!”
Chae-yeon looked down at her wristwatch.
The slot in the watch was glowing red.
“How…?”
Chae-yeon was surprised, then smiled with admiration.
“Someone found me…. Your boyfriend is impressive.”
Chae-yeon chuckled bitterly and released Baek Seo’s chin.
Screech. Click.
Particles newly formed around Chae-yeon's body, densely clumping together to form mechanical armor.
“Kim Dal-bi or you..., I think I understand a little why you both like the Aseong High School discipline committee head so much. Well, I won’t let you go alone.”
Chae-yeon turned her back on Baek Seo with a smiling face, then her expression hardened.
“…That’s my minimal mercy.”
She spoke quietly and walked away.
Swish.
Mechanical eye shields began to form around Chae-yeon's eyes. They were called protectors.
At the same time, she swiped her fingers across her lips, smearing lipstick.
It was time to face the Aseong High School discipline committee head.

chapters.title: Chapter 73
chapters.content:
"Thunk…!"
As a heavy impact landed on the cockpit, Chae-yeon let out a scream.
However, the barrage of spatial strikes couldn't penetrate Chimera's outer shell. It only caused some damage.
This hardness was not only due to its inherent durability but also because Chae-yeon had equipped Chimera with a large lightning rod as soon as she noticed Woo-jin's intrusion.
But still.
'The lightning rod…!'
The lightning rod drew the spatial strikes to itself as intended, but it was insufficient to handle the overwhelming high-voltage electrical energy.
In the end, it managed to channel only part of the massive strike to the grounding line, eventually exploding from overload. Fortunately for Chae-yeon, this reduced the damage she faced.
The residual electricity spread out, engulfing the mechanical soldiers. It was like shrimp caught in a whale fight.
Chimera was a weapon for the future.
Using Chimera to defeat Woo-jin was like using a sledgehammer to crack a nut, and Chae-yeon had never considered modifying it for the head of the Student Council.
Moreover, the magic composing Chimera was extremely heavy, requiring a substantial amount of magic to control.
Therefore, forming an immediate insulator to cover Chimera against Woo-jin's intrusion was challenging both time-wise and in terms of magic consumption.
Responding with a grounding design was the best option.
However, this ultimately led to Chae-yeon's regret.
'I said I'd never let my guard down again…!'
It was the first time experiencing Woo-jin's spatial strike.
She hadn't anticipated such a powerful attack and was unprepared, leading to the current situation.
Once again, she had let her guard down against Woo-jin.
The head of the Ah-seong High School Council was an opponent who couldn't be underestimated.
Beep! Beep!
"!"
The screen in front of her displayed a red warning, reporting Chimera's damage status. It was a system Chae-yeon had implemented.
Thanks to the lightning rod, Chimera endured the spatial strike, but its condition wasn't intact.
Even formidable warriors couldn't leave a scratch on Chimera's body.
Chae-yeon sensed something was wrong.
And then.
Thud!
A sound of impact right in front of her.
It seemed like someone had landed.
Feeling instinctive unease, Chae-yeon quickly switched perspectives. The screen in front of her showed the front view.
In front of Chimera's head, at a very close distance.
A man stood, with one foot on Chimera's mouth and holding onto protruding mechanical parts, glaring menacingly at Chae-yeon in the cockpit.
It was Ahn Woo-jin, head of the Ah-seong High School Council.
"Long time no see."
"...Ahn Woo-jin."
Chae-yeon's voice came through Chimera's speakers.
All the surrounding mechanical soldiers were destroyed and scorched from the previous strike, emitting smoke.
Only Chimera remained.
Chae-yeon gauged her remaining strength and spoke.
"You... That wasn't your full power back then?"
'Back then' referred to their first meeting and battle.
A hollow laugh escaped Chae-yeon's voice.
There was a tremble in that laugh. Her tone rose higher. It was absurd.
She had thought Woo-jin fought skillfully even then.
Now she realized that even then, he hadn't shown his full strength. She had been too complacent.
"Think what you want."
Woo-jin drew a baton from his belt.
"I'll execute immediate arrest and severe punishment for the offender."
Snap!
As he swung the baton sideways, an iron rod sprung out from within.
It was a three-section staff made from the outer shell of an armored dragon, boasting the highest hardness.
It was the Iron Dragon Staff.
"I will subdue you."
"Hah, interesting...!"
Chae-yeon laughed provocatively and harnessed her magic.
'No matter how strong he is, he can't destroy Chimera.'
To destroy Chimera, one would need at least a 7th rank warrior, someone like Spartoi Seo Kang-jin or Goliath among the Six Sinners.
Judging this, Chae-yeon regained her composure.
"Did you forget? The ones outside are still within my attack range. Are you going to let them die?"
"No problem."
Woo-jin's eyes were full of confidence.
"Do you think we wouldn't have prepared for that?"
"...?"
Part of the screen in Chimera's cockpit still displayed the ground situation.
The serpent tails, temporarily disabled by the spatial strike, began to move again, gathering energy in their mouths.
But then.
Boom!
"!"
Cruise missiles flew in from somewhere and hit each serpent tail accurately.
Explosions turned the serpent heads, scattering the energy gathered in their mouths.
The TV screens attached to the mechanical serpent bodies displayed grotesque, horrified expressions and screamed.
The grenade unit of the Ah-seong High School Council.
They had received preemptive orders from Woo-jin.
To bombard when the mechanical serpents emerged on the ground and prepared for a second attack.
'Cruise missiles!? How...?'
It was unbelievable.
The timing was too perfect.
Ah-seong High School Council equipment couldn't be used in Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction. The involvement of Ah-seong High School Council would have been easily detected by surveillance drones.
Therefore, the bombardment must have come from a long distance, even invisible through regular telescopes.
The area was covered with Chae-yeon's unique ability like the sea.
It was impossible for the Ah-seong High School detachment on the ground to communicate with the grenade unit via voice or video to provide information.
Moreover, Chimera wasn't visible from outside Ma Hyun High School's jurisdiction.
How could it be?
'...Don't think about it. There must be someone in the Council with that capability.'
In reality, accountant Yoo Do-ha used her unique ability, Laplace's Demon, to execute Woo-jin's orders. Chae-yeon couldn't know the specifics.
So, she stopped thinking and focused on Woo-jin in front of her.
"Yeah, really impressive. You were prepared, huh? But why are you doing all this? It's going to be reeeaaally troublesome, isn't it? Are you doing this to find Oh Baek-seo?"
"......"
Woo-jin didn't answer.
As expected.
If he didn't know Chae-yeon had custody of Oh Baek-seo, he wouldn't have taken such drastic actions.
"I could tell you weren't bringing the Council forces and coming here recklessly with just a few. I don't know how you found out I had Oh Baek-seo, but that's something to investigate later."
Chimera's beast-like face heated up.
It happened in an instant.
"Take her if you can."
Whirr! Clank!
Chimera's head opened, and a large emitter protruded.
Several main cannons and emitters also emerged, pointing in various directions around the head.
Woo-jin narrowed his eyes.
"If you can!"
Chimera.
A monster mentioned in Homer's epics, the Classic of Mountains and Seas, and other mythological texts.
Known for its appearance, with a lion's head, a goat's body, and a serpent's tail.
Chimera is a vicious beast that brings disasters and breathes out fierce flames.
Whoosh! Fwoosh!
Blue flames poured towards Woo-jin.
