Ha Ye-song, who had read the notice belatedly, couldn’t contain her shock.
"Until the issue of excessive self-defense is resolved? Baek-seo is to be treated as the acting Student Council President in the meantime? Does this mean the President can’t be the Student Council President anymore!?"
"Since there’s a time limit, it just means he can’t perform his duties for a while. He’s still holding the position."
"But... For how long!?"
Park Min-hyuk, with a trembling voice, answered as he rubbed his forehead.
"I don’t know... Once the Police Academy completes their investigation, they’ll hand the case over to the Prosecution Department of the Trial Academy. Given the seriousness of the incident, it’s almost certain he’ll be indicted, and then the President will remain a defendant until a final verdict is reached... Even without that notice, he wouldn’t be able to act. He’s already been detained. It seems like this notice is just a warning for us not to do anything rash."
"Great, that’s really encouraging!"
Ye-song snapped back, her tone dripping with sarcasm.
"But that’s the reality..."
"Shut up! What did the President do wrong!? The Gluttonous Twin was the one who tried to kill him first, and the President only fought back!"
"But it’s still considered homicide..."
An Woo-jin was facing charges of murder in connection with the recent incident involving the Gluttonous Twin.
However, given that the Gluttonous Twin had first attempted to kill Woo-jin, and that Woo-jin had retaliated in his capacity as the Student Council President, the primary issue was whether the act constituted excessive self-defense.
"If we can prove that the Gluttonous Twin was too strong and that Woo-jin had no choice, we might be fine... But in the worst case, the charges could be changed to murder or manslaughter. That would be dangerous."
"Ugh! Stop saying such ominous things! Don’t you know what self-defense is!? Are you trying to argue with me?"
Min-hyuk shook his head.
"If they determine that he could have subdued him without lethal force, then it won’t be recognized as self-defense. You know how hard it is to get self-defense recognized."
"I don’t care! No way... The Gluttonous Twin was planning to kill the President with an immensely powerful magical technique, right? The President had no choice but to kill him in self-defense! How could this not be considered self-defense...!"
"And that’s why self-defense is so controversial... The precedents left by judges before they were replaced by AI have made it that way..."
"The law is a mess! Were the judges planning to learn this lesson only after experiencing it themselves? Wait a minute. What have you been looking at this whole time?"
Min-hyuk was wearing glasses and intently reading through some documents.
"Just some legal texts and precedents. I pulled out everything I could find. I’m trying to see if there’s any way to help the President."
"Isn’t that the Defense Department’s job? The Chairman already hired a top firm."
Each academy had its own Defense Department, a specialized club of students who studied law and acted as defense attorneys.
These clubs usually operated like businesses, and because the major academies were so large, it was easy to set up offices, often located near the Trial Academy.
"I just want to see if there’s anything we can do... I feel so anxious. I’m trying to memorize what I can in case it helps with this or any future cases."
"Min-hyuk, you must have been really pissed off yesterday..."
Min-hyuk appeared calm, but he was deeply frustrated.
It was because of what had happened the previous night when the Police Academy suddenly blocked the Student Council’s vehicle and demanded that Woo-jin be handed over, leading to a heated argument.
Min-hyuk had threatened the Police Academy.
He argued that the President wasn’t at risk of destroying evidence or fleeing, so there was no reason for an emergency arrest. Without an arrest warrant, they had no grounds to take him. He insisted they needed to go to the hospital first.
Yet in the end, Woo-jin had patted Min-hyuk on the shoulder and surrendered to the Police Academy on his own.
Clearly, Woo-jin had made that choice out of concern for Min-hyuk and the rest of the Student Council, but Min-hyuk was left feeling powerless and frustrated.
"What are you reading? Want to take a look?"
Min-hyuk waved the documents towards Ye-song, who quickly shook her head and backed away.
"Just looking at legal jargon gives me hives and makes me nauseous. It’s like an allergy..."
"That’s a strange allergy..."
"Anyway, does this mean the President has to stay locked up until the trial?"
"Yes."
At that moment, Oh Baek-seo emerged from the pantry and answered in his place. She handed tea to both Min-hyuk and Ye-song.
"Oh, thank you."
"Thanks. So, Baek-seo, does this mean we have to apply for visitation to see the President now?"
Baek-seo sat down gently on the sofa.
"I think so. I plan to apply as soon as visits are allowed."
"Can’t we do it now?"
"Only the Defense Department student handling the case can visit for now. He’s being held in a special management prison."
"This is insane... The President didn’t do anything wrong..."
"By the way, I have something to tell you."
"Huh?"
For the first time since becoming an officer, Baek-seo’s expression was solemn.
Min-hyuk and Ye-song exchanged worried glances.
"What’s wrong, Baek-seo? You look really serious..."
"Can you call Do-ha? There’s something I need to say."
"Do-ha? Sure, but what do you need to say...?"
"I think it’s time to reveal it. For the President’s sake, I have to say it now. It’s about me and the President."
Min-hyuk and Ye-song exchanged puzzled looks.
Ahseong High Underground Detention Center.
In the underground where Moon Chae-yeon was confined.
"I want pizza! Pizza! What if I die from stress here?!"
Chae-yeon was causing a commotion in a playful voice.
The Student Council members on guard duty scowled and gritted their teeth, doing their best to ignore her.
"Pizza, pizza! Special Shrimp Cheese Pizza! Garlic Steak Cheese Fondue Pizza! Basil Cheese Cube Pizza! Gorgonzola Pizza!"
As Chae-yeon listed off various pizzas, testing the patience of the Student Council members on duty.
Bzzzzz.
The door beyond the barrier opened, and a student appeared.
"Huh?"
Chae-yeon stopped her antics and looked at the newcomer. Her eyes soon widened in surprise.
The visitor was none other than Oh Baek-seo.

chapters.title: Chapter 103
chapters.content:
Police Academy, Special Management Detention Center.
Considering the danger posed by An Woo-jin, he was being held under the highest level of restraint.
His treatment had already been completed. Despite being in a state of mana depletion, Woo-jin’s monstrous recovery speed meant that he didn’t require an extensive treatment process.
Since it was presumed that he had already reached the 7th-tier, he was now treated like a ticking time bomb that could go off at any moment.
The Police Academy hoped that, just as Woo-jin had cooperated with the investigation, he would continue to comply with the system and quietly await his trial.
In the control room, the special detention center was being monitored via CCTV. The cell where Woo-jin was being held was under particular scrutiny.
To the Police Academy students watching, Woo-jin seemed to be quietly passing the time.
However, the CCTV couldn’t capture sound, which was a drawback.
"Yes."
Inside the highest-level special prison, Woo-jin, dressed in a full-body restraint suit, spoke with his head bowed so that his lips wouldn’t be visible on the CCTV.
He was using a tiny crack in his ear to communicate with Geumyang.
Normally, when mana is depleted, it takes a significant amount of time to recover.
But Woo-jin had already recovered enough mana that even repeated spatial leaps by Geumyang wouldn’t be a problem. Thanks to reaching the 7th-tier, his mana recovery speed had greatly increased.
"So, they’re framing me, right?"
─
That’s right. The situation is turning against you. Are you really planning to stay here until your mana is fully recovered?
"They’ve already made their move."
Woo-jin recalled the Gluttonous Twin’s ultimate magic.
"From now on, they’ll target me at a level far beyond anything I’ve faced before. I defeated the Gluttonous Twin and became much stronger than they anticipated. So... at the very least, I need to make sure they don’t target my people."
Woo-jin had voluntarily allowed himself to be captured by the Police Academy, hoping that the Principal wouldn’t harm the Ahseong High Student Council.
─
Is that camaraderie I hear? You once said you became the Student Council President because you needed the power of the Council, but now you’re trying to protect them... What an irony.
Protecting the Student Council.
Because within that group were his lover, his friends, and his subordinates.
"Didn’t I tell you before? I didn’t know the Principal would be such an irritating opponent, nor did I expect to gain so much power."
─
I know, I know. You little rascal. But does your opinion really matter? It seems the Student Council is planning to fight for you.
"What?"
Woo-jin narrowed his eyes and looked to the left, where the crack in his left ear was.
─
I checked with Ahseong High. It seems they’re planning to come here. And from what I can tell, they’re quite serious. Their goal is obviously you.
"Are you out of your mind? Are they planning to start a war with the academy?"
─
They requested that the Police Academy conduct your investigation without detaining you, but they were refused. So now Ahseong High is prepared to use force, and the Police Academy is on high alert. The public is in an uproar. It’s going to be a mess.
......
Woo-jin pondered this.
It was an unexpected turn of events.
─
What are you going to do? Things are about to get out of hand. Are you planning to escape?
"I’ll have to. ...But first."
Woo-jin lifted his head.
His teal eyes glowed with a chilling light.
"Someone’s here."
Having reached the 7th-tier, his ability to sense mana had become even more refined.
At this moment, he began to sense the presence of a powerful individual he had never felt before.
"I’ll have to move up my plans."
Woo-jin could roughly guess what was about to happen.
He decided to prepare.
Meanwhile, in front of the Police Academy’s detention campus.
The Police Academy’s detention facilities were located far from the campus for management and efficiency.
This was the detention campus, where they sought to balance punishment and reform, focusing on the education of criminals. A detention center was also located here.
"It’s the Spartoi...."
A lethargic voice.
Eyes half-open as if everything was a chore.
A man with deep eye shadows and a turtle-like neck sat in a car entering the detention center. The driver was another Spartoi.
Both were dressed in white uniforms. Spartoi wore this uniform whenever they carried out public activities.
Only a few knew this fact.
The information was tightly controlled.
So to the public, it just looked like the uniform of one of the many academies in the city.
A senior student was waiting to greet the Spartoi. He was the warden.
"You’ve arrived. I’ve been informed of the situation. Please, come inside."
The warden had received instructions directly from the Principal.
Currently, with all the criminal allegations surrounding Woo-jin coming to light, it seemed the Principal was concerned, or so the warden believed.
‘A chance to get in the Principal’s good graces...!’
He saw a path to promotion.
"It’s just a favor, secretly allowing a visit... Why would you bring the warden into this? This is quite overboard... It’s burdensome."
"Haha...."
The Spartoi parked the vehicle in the parking lot. Then, only the man with dark circles under his eyes got out. He wore a long coat over his uniform.
He and the warden headed toward the special prison.
"So, the Ahseong High Student Council President is here...? The facility is pretty nice...."
"Yes. This is a facility equipped with the most advanced restraint functions. Given how strong the Ahseong High Student Council President is, we had no choice but to keep him under the highest level of security. He understood this as well."
"Indeed. If I were thoroughly restrained in a place like this, I’d find it hard to use my strength...."
"This is the finest restraint facility where no criminal can escape! The escape rate is zero! It’s one of the Police Academy’s proudest achievements."
The warden rubbed his hands together, promoting the facility’s advantages like a salesman. But the Spartoi remained unresponsive.
They arrived at a long corridor.
"If you go straight ahead, you’ll find the Ahseong High Student Council President. Unfortunately, due to his special restraint, we cannot bring him to the visitation room. I hope you understand."
"By the way, how many personnel do you have here?"
"What? There are about six staff members here...."
Thud!
"Huh?"
The warden felt a searing pain in his abdomen. When he looked down, his vision was filled with an unbelievable sight.
The Spartoi’s hand held a knife that had pierced his stomach.
"Wh-why...?"
"Today, a blemish will be made on your precious zero escape rate...."
The Spartoi whispered in the warden’s ear, who was now in a state of confusion.
"You were killed by the escapee An Woo-jin. Understand...? Remember it well...?"
Thud!
Thud!
Another quick slash from the knife deeply cut the warden’s throat. He fell lifeless to the ground.
Shhhh!
The Spartoi’s uniform vibrated briefly, shaking off the bloodstains into the air. This was one of the features of the Spartoi’s uniform.
The Spartoi then quickly pushed off the ground several times and disappeared from the spot.
He arrived at the control room.
"Huh?"
The Spartoi was surprised.
The staff inside were all collapsed.
‘What happened...? They seem to have been knocked out... Someone else must have secretly infiltrated the control room before me.’
After confirming the condition of the staff, the Spartoi looked up. Multiple CCTV screens were transmitting images in the control room.
‘The purpose is obvious.’
On the CCTV screen.
The face that should have been there was missing.
"Haha...."
The Spartoi let out a chuckle.
"The Ahseong High Student Council President... I came to help you escape, but it seems you’ve already made your move."
There was no sign of An Woo-jin on the screen.
Only the broken pieces of his restraint suit scattered across the floor of the empty cell.
"Knocking them out was likely to buy time and delay the alert...."
The Spartoi stroked his chin thoughtfully, then smiled.
And then.
Thud!
Thud!
He quickly moved, half-severing the throats of the unconscious staff members. With that, the knocked-out staff members were now all dead.
Shhhh!
His uniform vibrated, shaking off the bloodstains.
The Spartoi skillfully twirled the bloodied dagger and manipulated the control room’s equipment, erasing the CCTV recordings from Woo-jin’s cell.
Since the time stamps on the footage didn’t match the deaths of the Police Academy students, he erased the evidence.
"This should be enough to frame him.... Should I be grateful that my work got easier... Or maybe not...."
"This should be enough to frame him... Should I be grateful that my work got easier... Or maybe not..."
The Spartoi scratched his head.
"They say he's really strong... I was hoping to have a chance to fight someone who just reached the 7th-tier. What a shame... Well then."
Whip!
The Spartoi quickly propelled himself forward, moving at an astonishing speed, as if teleporting, until he reached the corridor where he had been just moments before.
The warden's corpse lay sprawled on the ground.
The Spartoi pulled out a communicator from his coat pocket.
"A variable has occurred. The target has already escaped. However, I judge that there will be no impact on the overall plan. Continuing with the operation."
─
Acknowledged.
After completing his report, the Spartoi cut himself with a knife, then repeatedly struck his own face with his mana-infused fists.
Thud! Thud!
"Ouch... Alright, I'm ready... Now, I just need to wait about ten minutes before reporting the situation..."
Hiss...
The dagger used to kill the Police Academy students dissolved into smoke and disappeared.
The Spartoi planned to wait for ten minutes and then pretend to have "regained consciousness" as he used the warden's radio to report the current situation.
He would report that the Ahseong High Student Council President had killed the Police Academy students and escaped.
That he was lucky to have survived.
The Spartoi sneered as he leaned back against the wall.
"So anticlimactic..."
At that moment.
"What have you done?"
"!?"
A voice he hadn’t expected echoed through the corridor.
The overwhelming mana pressure that accompanied it caused the Spartoi’s eyes to widen in shock.
Instinctively, the Spartoi generated a pair of daggers in his hands, gripping them tightly.
In that instant, a pair of teal eyes locked onto him. The sheer terror they exuded sent his instincts into overdrive.
The man who had suddenly appeared right in front of him, dressed in a tattered black uniform, was none other than An Woo-jin, the Ahseong High Student Council President.
Wham!!
At that moment, something sliced through the air.
It was a black, three-section staff wrapped in teal-colored lightning—Cheolryonggon.
A weapon that had been confiscated and stored in the warehouse.
Woo-jin had secretly retrieved it.
The Spartoi couldn’t choose the option to "counterattack." The overwhelming pressure had paralyzed him.
In the end, the Spartoi’s instincts opted for "defense."
As he crossed his twin daggers to block, the Cheolryonggon infused with Woo-jin's mana shattered them both at the blades.
The weapon then struck the Spartoi directly in the middle of his face.

chapters.title: Chapter 104
chapters.content:
Boom!!
Crash!!!
A devastating blow.
Lightning surged outwards like chains, spreading Woo-jin's overwhelming mana in all directions along with a gust of wind. The sheer force of it caused the walls to crumble.
Blood splattered, and the wall the Spartoi had leaned against formed a deep crater. His nose was shattered, and the center of his face caved in, bleeding profusely.
His hand groped the air in front of his deformed, unrecognizable face.
"Urgh, ugh...!"
The Spartoi groaned in pain.
Woo-jin’s cold gaze bore into him.
Without a moment’s pause, another series of blows rained down.
In a desperate attempt to escape, the Spartoi pushed off the ground rapidly several times, moving as if teleporting away from the spot.
He fled in terror.
‘No, no, no!! I can’t win, I can’t win...!’
The Spartoi had completely lost his will to fight.
He had already realized it the moment he locked eyes with Woo-jin, or perhaps even earlier, when Woo-jin's mana touched his skin.
He was now fully aware of just how monstrously powerful the Student Council President was.
He had underestimated him, thinking he was just someone who had only recently reached the 7th-tier.
The Spartoi himself was a 6th-tier, considered a strong figure in Neo Seoul, and had undergone countless combat training as a Spartoi.
But no matter how he used his unique ability, no matter how much mana he poured into it, he knew he wouldn’t be able to match this monster’s power—not even by a fraction.
Crack!
"Ugh!"
Even though he was fleeing at a speed that was impossible to follow with the naked eye, a crack suddenly appeared in the air, and in the blink of an eye, a heavy blow struck his torso.
His entire body was electrified, the shockwave spreading throughout him.
Boom!!
With a sound like a cannon blast, the Spartoi’s body was hurled in the opposite direction, bouncing down the corridor like a skipping stone.
"Ah, ah...!"
No matter how fast he was, it was meaningless in front of Woo-jin, who could traverse space as he wished.
Click, click.
Woo-jin was walking toward him.
The distance between them closed in an instant.
The 7th-tier.
A walking disaster.
That title wasn’t just for show.
The Spartoi couldn’t believe that Woo-jin had reached the 7th-tier in such a short time, starting from the 4th-tier.
Even if it were true, he had thought that someone who had only just reached the 7th-tier might still be manageable in a fight.
But that wasn’t the case. The difference in basic physical enhancement alone was overwhelming.
Moreover...
‘He went from the 4th-tier to the 7th-tier in just a few months... I should’ve thought more conservatively about how insane this guy is...!’
Even the legendary powerhouse, Goliath, hadn’t grown stronger this quickly.
What on earth was this man?
‘I have to report this...!’
The Spartoi used his remaining strength to try and pull out his communicator.
‘The Ahseong High Student Council President... We might not even stand a chance against him, even if we bring in White...!’
Woo-jin soon reached the Spartoi.
Crack!
Without hesitation, a flurry of strikes shattered the Spartoi’s limbs and destroyed his sensory organs.
It was damage that no healer could reverse.
"Urgh, ugh...."
The Spartoi lost consciousness in excruciating pain.
Hoping he would spend the rest of his life in torment, Woo-jin calmly walked out of the detention center.
─ Ahseong High Student Council President escapes from the special detention center...! 7 Police Academy students, including the warden, dead; 1 civilian student critically injured...!
─ The 7th-tier ‘Walking Disaster’ escapes...! Principal Lee Doo-hee declares martial law.
─ Martial law declared, citizens advised to stay indoors... Citizens in confusion.
─ Principal Lee Doo-hee: ‘Martial law will be lifted only upon the execution of the Ahseong High Student Council President...’
─ Central Tower activates magic-flow jammers in conjunction with martial law. No magic can pass through...
The alarms blared throughout Neo Seoul.
Citizens received emergency text alerts on their smartphones, notifying them of the declaration of martial law.
"An Woo-jin escaped, and now martial law...!? They’re saying martial law will only end if An Woo-jin is killed—what is this...?"
Ahseong High Student Council President Han Baek-hyeon felt dizzy.
"It was an emergency declaration made under the Principal’s authority! The situation has escalated too far...! Until further notice, all activities are suspended... From now on, only the Principal, the Hanyang forces under the Federation Council, and the Spartoi will be recognized as legitimate armed forces in Neo Seoul. They will be targeting the Student Council President... We can’t operate the Student Council under these circumstances, not unless we’re prepared to face the full force of Hanyang and the Spartoi."
The secretary, sweating profusely, read from a tablet PC.
The news that a man now considered a heinous criminal had killed Police Academy students and a civilian student before escaping had spread.
On top of that, he was a 7th-tier. A single person with power comparable to a natural disaster.
The emergency declaration of martial law by the Principal’s authority was seen as a logical step.
As a result, the public, now fearful, had no choice but to turn their backs on the Ahseong High Student Council President.
And from now on, if the Student Council acted without authorization, it would be considered a violation of martial law, and they would have to engage in a battle they had no chance of winning.
Baek-hyeon squeezed his eyes shut. It felt like he was trapped in a no-win situation.
Out of habit, he tried to tug at his tie, but the tie he had already thrown away was no longer there.
Baek-hyeon let out a sigh and muttered to himself.
"An Woo-jin, what are you thinking...?"
He couldn’t believe that Woo-jin had killed innocent Police Academy students.
It was likely the work of higher-ups who were enemies of Woo-jin.
But regardless, the fact that Woo-jin had escaped was undeniable. This only made the situation more dire.
Baek-hyeon couldn’t shake off his unease.
"Could that bastard be planning a coup all by himself...?"
What cannot be controlled by law operates on the logic of power.
His opponent was already someone who couldn’t be dealt with through legal means.
Baek-hyeon had a foreboding feeling that Woo-jin might be planning to overturn the entire academy city.
At that moment, there was a frantic knock on the Student Council President’s office door.
"Come in."
The door burst open, and a student from the Student Council entered, bowing hastily. He shouted urgently.
"P-President! The Central Student Council Audit Division has suddenly arrived! They’re conducting a raid on the Student Council...!"
"What...!?"
Baek-hyeon was stunned.
A few minutes earlier.
Ahseong High Student Council meeting point.
"The President escaped!?"
With the sudden declaration of martial law, the Student Council’s plan to forcibly retrieve Woo-jin lost all meaning.
Afterward, as Oh Baek-seo relayed the information she had received from Han Baek-hyeon’s secretary to the officers, Ha Ye-song exclaimed in shock.
"There are 8 victims. 7 dead, 1 critically injured... 7 had their throats slashed, and 1 was beaten so badly they’re beyond recovery...?"
Park Min-hyuk, his face pale with fear, said as he checked the news on his smartphone.
"No, no, the President isn’t like that! Even if he acts cold, he’s a good person! He’s mentally strong, and...!"
"Everyone here knows that."
As Ye-song passionately defended Woo-jin, Yoo Do-ha, arms crossed, responded with a serious expression.
"But the situation is clear."
"I know! It’s just so frustrating! It’s like this city is trying to kill the President no matter what...! Is there nothing we can do?"
The Student Council officers understood that all of this was likely orchestrated by the Principal.
The problem was,
"How can we possibly turn the tide?"
"There’s no immediate solution. Trying to change public opinion without any weapons is pointless, and we don’t have the power to overturn the situation. No matter what the President does, this city will see him as an enemy. That’s why he... probably escaped. He must have thought that resolving this through the logic of power was the only option."
"Argh! But that’s practically a coup! Whether he succeeds or fails, it’ll be a disaster! He’ll be branded as a traitor, with no hope of clearing his name! He’ll become a complete criminal! And yet, I can’t think of any other option, which is driving me crazy...!"
"But if they’re pushing the President into a corner this desperately, it means they’re scared. There are a lot of unnatural elements in this situation. In fact, some people are already questioning what’s happening."
Do-ha replied, checking the online reactions on his smartphone.
"Let’s stop worrying about things that don’t matter right now and focus on what we need to do."
Baek-seo drew the attention of the other officers to herself.
"The President has escaped, and now the entire city is hunting him. So, what should we do?"
"...We need to find him first."
"Yes. Right now, the President is probably trying to recover his mana. So, he’ll likely hide somewhere and focus on resting, right?"
"Yes, probably."
"Where exactly?"
"......"
The Student Council officers pondered.
"What about the underground hideout we used when we fought the Technomancer last time... But that might not work since there’s an investigation record."
"Anywhere is fine. We just need to search everywhere..."
At that moment, the door suddenly burst open, and students dressed in white uniforms walked in quickly. Except for the lead student, the others were carrying large boxes.
The Student Council’s attention turned toward them.
They were wearing the uniforms of the Hanyang Federation Academy.
And then...
"The Central Student Council...?"
The highest authority among all academies.
The badge of the Central Student Council was clearly visible.

chapters.title: Chapter 105
chapters.content:
“Begin.”
Rumble!
At the command of the student at the forefront, the students from Hanyang Academy spread out in unison, beginning to search the Discipline Committee’s territory.
They stormed into the Discipline Committee room, the offices of the committee officers, and other areas, indiscriminately shoving documents and items into boxes. The members of the Discipline Committee looked around in confusion.
Baek-seo, her face now void of any smile, walked up to one of the Student Council members who was standing still and stopped in front of him.
“What do you think you’re doing right now?”
“Are you Deputy Head Baek-seo of Ahseong High School’s Discipline Committee? We are the audit team from the Hanyang Federal Academy Student Council. We’re here to conduct a search and seizure and to take custody of the Six Sinners.”
“What...?”
“Here are the search warrant and transfer authorization.”
The male student from Hanyang Academy handed an envelope containing the documents to Baek-seo. She immediately pulled out the papers and began reading them with the committee officers.
Search warrant. An official document outlining the authority to operate under martial law. Authorization for the transfer of the Six Sinners.
All the documents were finalized and signed by the Principal.
The basis for the warrant was fabricated evidence spread by the media, along with circumstances of serial murders and prison breaks.
Given the charges against An Woo-jin, it was determined that the Discipline Committee might destroy evidence to protect their own.
The documents showed that all locations associated with An Woo-jin were targets for search and seizure, and an emergency warrant was issued.
However, Baek-seo read the documents differently.
Ahseong High School’s Discipline Committee, you better sit quietly and do nothing.
You are absolutely not allowed to abuse your power during martial law.
The pressure from the Principal... was palpable to Baek-seo.
And now, even the transfer of the Six Sinners.
If this goes on, the only weapon Ahseong High has will be lost.
It was clear that the Principal was determined to prevent Ahseong High from helping An Woo-jin in any way.
“A search and seizure... and now you want the Six Sinners too?”
Ye-song clicked her tongue in disbelief.
“This is to investigate the case involving Discipline Committee Head An Woo-jin. The transfer of the Six Sinners is a forced measure, as it has been deemed that the Discipline Committee, which An Woo-jin belonged to, cannot be entrusted with the case. We ask for your cooperation.”
“I... I can’t accept this...! This is too much...!”
As Ye-song tried to protest, the male student from Hanyang spoke in a stern tone.
“If you resist, we will consider it an illegal riot under martial law. You will then have to face the martial law security forces, a combined organization of Hanyang Academy’s military and Spartoi.”
“Gasp...!”
Ye-song shut her mouth tightly.
No matter how powerful Ahseong High’s Discipline Committee was, even they couldn’t stand against Hanyang Academy’s forces combined with Spartoi.
At that moment, Baek-seo’s smartphone vibrated. The caller was the Student Council President, Han Baek-hyun.
“Excuse me, I need to take this.”
Baek-seo stepped aside to take the call.
“President. They’re conducting a search and seizure...”
─ I know. I just heard.
“What should we do?”
─ The city is determined to bury An Woo-jin with fabricated evidence. There’s nothing we can do. We lack the authority, the power—everything. We’re objectively outmatched.
“But we can’t just sit back and take this...”
─ You think I want to do nothing? For now... endure it.
Baek-seo closed her eyes, lowered her head, and took a deep breath.
In the end, the Hanyang Federal Academy Student Council completed their search and seizure of the Discipline Committee.
They also took Han Seo-jin and Moon Chae-yeon into custody and left Ahseong High.
However, some of Hanyang’s students were left behind, under the pretext of monitoring the situation during martial law. All the necessary documents had been prepared to justify their presence.
They were under the protection of martial law.
The Discipline Committee of Ahseong High School was inevitably oppressed by this.
...
Drip, drip.
Water was leaking from the ceiling.
Inside the Grey Star building, where Anomia had once kidnapped Park Min-hyuk.
An Woo-jin sat with his back against the wall in a room where the sunset poured in through a broken window.
He was still in his school uniform, covered in dust and dirt, with parts torn from the battle with the Gluttonous Twins, having had no time to regroup after being captured.
The city was swarming with a massive number of surveillance drones and androids.
All were martial law robots, and their target was Woo-jin.
Even Hanyang Federal Academy and Spartoi had combined their forces to form the martial law security team, and they, too, were searching for Woo-jin.
Woo-jin surveyed his surroundings.
The place was a wreck, practically a ruined building.
No, it was essentially a ruin.
After being ravaged by Woo-jin and then raided by the investigation agencies, it hadn’t been maintained at all.
“Life sure does have a way of turning things upside down, doesn’t it?”
A girl with long golden hair, Geum-yang, dressed in the Ahseong High School uniform, approached and sat next to Woo-jin.
“How does it feel to be treated like a villain, constantly hunted down, when you used to be the one chasing and capturing them?”
“Not great. And since I’m being framed, there’s also the frustration of being wrongly accused.”
“Are you planning to stay hidden until your magic recovers?”
Woo-jin nodded.
“I have to. One of the Spartoi members is at the 7th tier, and even if the others gang up on me, it would be hard to deal with. There are too many variables to consider. Acting recklessly in this state would be too risky.”
Woo-jin gazed at the dim sunlight filtering through the broken window.
“The city is crawling with Spartoi. If I run into just one of them, I’ll have to be prepared to fight the entire martial law security team. No matter how much I run, there’ll be a limit. If I overuse my magic, I’ll be stuck in a state of magical depletion for a long time.”
“Are you planning to stay here until then?”
“This place won’t hold out for long either. Martial law has just been declared, so I can buy some time now, but once Spartoi and the martial law robots spread out, it’ll be hard to hide anywhere.”
It was essentially a game of hide-and-seek in Neo Seoul.
Until his magic recovered, he couldn’t afford to make any reckless moves.
“As a word of caution, you do have the ability to travel through space.”
“They probably have magic-tracking devices. If they detect and measure my magic, they can pinpoint its location anywhere, anytime. And their coverage extends across the entire city. If I get caught, relying on space jumps alone to escape will quickly reach its limit. Anyway, I need to rest up and replenish my magic before things get worse.”
“Hmm... Then even contacting the Discipline Committee would be dangerous. There’s no way they’re not monitoring them.”
“Exactly.”
The conversation lapsed into silence.
“But still, I’m glad you’re here with me.”
Woo-jin spoke in a calm voice.
Geum-yang gave him a mischievous look before smiling triumphantly.
“Hmph. It’s only natural for me to stay by my subordinate’s side when they’re in danger.”
“Don’t get too full of yourself.”
“By the way, kid, how do you plan to prove your innocence? That guy in the central tower seems dead set on finishing you off. It’s probably impossible to sway public opinion. This city itself has practically become your enemy. Did you foresee this situation?”
“I knew they’d use the most powerful means available. I expected they might declare martial law using their authority, but I didn’t think they’d go this far just to capture me. I didn’t expect to realize the weight of being at the 7th tier like this.”
Woo-jin looked down at his hands.
“...Kid.”
“Yeah?”
“What are you going to do once your magic recovers?”
“I’m going to destroy everything.”
“What exactly?”
“Everything that prevents me from being free.”
“What does freedom mean to you?”
Woo-jin answered calmly.
“A life where happiness is not permitted.”
He recalled Goliath’s words.
The struggle for rights is born from conflict.
If you don’t fight, you can’t win.
To gain freedom in this damned academy city, he had to fight.
“Yeah... As long as your standards are clear.”
Geum-yang said this as she leaned back against the wall, just like Woo-jin.
For a while, the two remained silent. Eventually, Woo-jin held his breath.
He sensed magic.
Geum-yang noticed it too, and they exchanged glances. She put a finger to her lips, and Woo-jin nodded.
He quietly stood up and hid behind a pillar. Geum-yang created a rift in the air and returned to her labyrinth.
Click, clack.
The sound of high heels grew closer, the footsteps confident, as if they had no intention of hiding their presence.
The magic was also approaching.
Not bothering to conceal the flow of magic was almost an invitation for Woo-jin to lower his guard. So, he chose to hide and observe the situation.
Of course, given the circumstances, Woo-jin had to remain on high alert instinctively.
Finally, someone appeared.
Woo-jin’s eyes widened in surprise.
“Woo-jin-sunbae, are you there~?”
Woo-jin narrowed his eyes and stepped out from behind the pillar.
“Oh, I found you! Wow~. So this is where you were, sunbae!”
A girl with long straight hair and narrow eyes.
“Tada! It’s your beloved junior, Lee Se-ah, here to save the day!”
Lee Se-ah spread her hands out to the sides of her head, flashing a sly smile.
“You... Why are you here? More importantly, how?”
“Huh? Didn’t I tell you before? Finding people is my specialty. Anyway! It looked like you were in trouble, so I came. Aren’t you in a bit of a pinch?”
“But...”
“Didn’t I tell you before? I’m going to make you mine, sunbae.”
The setting sun that filtered through the broken window cast a line between Woo-jin and Se-ah.
Se-ah tilted her head to the side.
“So, I’ve come to help you. Better take my offer before I change my mind, okay?”

chapters.title: Chapter 106
chapters.content:
"Where is this...?"
"Tada! This is the secret bunker of our organization, Dohwa Group! Wow~, you’re the first outsider I’ve ever shown this to, Sunbae! Haha."
An Woo-jin arrived at a well-furnished bunker after riding in a vehicle belonging to the Dohwa Group. The bunker was cleverly concealed with camouflage on the mountainside.
There were two reasons Woo-jin had decided to ride in the Dohwa Group's vehicle.
First, using space jumps repeatedly could expose him due to the magic energy that would be detected.
Second, the vehicle was equipped with a well-installed magic barrier, which prevented any magic from leaking out of the vehicle. Although it was far less sophisticated than the jammer at Central Tower, it effectively prevented Woo-jin’s magic from being detected.
"Welcome, Miss Se-ah!"
"Miss Se-ah! And... welcome to you too, Head of the Discipline Committee at Ahseong High School."
As if they had been waiting, five members of the Dohwa Group greeted Woo-jin and Se-ah. They were all dressed in suits.
"You can trust these people. I brought them along because I needed security personnel. They all have a good opinion of you, Sunbae."
"I see..."
However, Woo-jin had no intention of trusting anyone. The only reason he had followed Se-ah was because of the help she had provided him in the past.
He simply needed a place to rest until he was back in top condition, and this location seemed perfect for that purpose.
Of course, if the situation became dangerous, he planned to escape through a space jump.
'But what does she mean by good opinion?'
Woo-jin was aware that Se-ah harbored a desire to make him her subordinate, which she had hinted at in a previous conversation.
It seemed that Se-ah had been talking about him to her subordinates, like someone drinking the kimchi soup before the meal.
"Please follow me."
Se-ah led Woo-jin through the bunker.
It was quite spacious.
"Sunbae, you need rest, don’t you?"
"How did you know?"
"You fought a major battle even before you were captured by the Police Academy, didn’t you? Also, the fact that you’ve reached the 7th tier has been revealed to everyone. For someone as strong as you, if you’ve just fought a big battle and aren’t doing anything, it’s obvious~. You need time to recover your magic, but with martial law declared and all sorts of forces targeting you, it’s hard to rest properly, right?"
"So?"
"I’m going to help you get some rest."
The two arrived at a bedroom.
"Feel free to make yourself comfortable. You can sleep if you like. I’ll wake you if anything happens."
If it were Baek-seo, Woo-jin might have considered it, but he thought it was too dangerous to trust someone else and fall asleep in the current situation.
"I appreciate the thought. But I got plenty of sleep while I was in the cell, so I’m fine."
"No need to refuse. Oh, are you hungry? Should I prepare a meal for you? We also have fresh clothes."
"No, it’s fine. Just providing a place to rest is enough."
Woo-jin sat down on a chair, while Se-ah took a seat on the bed, creating a setting conducive to conversation.
After a brief silence, Se-ah spoke first.
"Um... I won’t ask what’s going on. It seems you’re involved in something very complicated."
"Do you trust me?"
"Yes. I know what kind of person you are, Sunbae. After all, we’re mutual stalkers, aren’t we?"
"Mutual stalkers...? Well, whatever, that’s fine."
"You’re straightforward. If I were in your position, I’d probably be suspicious of everything in the world right now."
Woo-jin stared intently at Se-ah.
"Well... let’s forget I asked for a response to that!"
Se-ah switched to a playful tone, avoiding the topic.
After all, if she admitted to being suspicious, it would justify Woo-jin's own doubts about her.
"More importantly, Sunbae, what are you planning to do now? It seems like you’ve been falsely accused of quite a few things."
"You figured that out, huh?"
"Of course. That’s why I’m helping you. Oh, by the way, did you know that they’re conducting a search and seizure at the Discipline Committee?"
"A search and seizure? I expected as much..."
It wasn’t surprising.
Given the circumstances, it was something that was bound to happen.
"Even if you recover your magic and cause a scene, it’ll only add to the charges against you."
"My comrades will handle that. I’ll do my part too, of course."
"Oh, camaraderie and trust? I like that! So, who are these comrades...?"
Woo-jin leaned back against the chair.
"The members of the Discipline Committee. It’s our duty to uncover the truth without falling victim to the tricks of criminals. We’re also the investigative agency of Ahseong High School."
"Right now, you’re being treated as the villain of this academy city, you know? The most dangerous one, considering martial law was declared just to deal with you."
"But you said you trust me."
"Of course."
"Then I should at least try to trust those who believe in me."
"...Why are you smiling?"
Se-ah was grinning from ear to ear, her reaction unusual enough to make Woo-jin frown.
"I like people who try to trust others. It makes you even more desirable, Sunbae~."
"Enough... Why did I even ask that...?"
"By the way, Sunbae. Are you planning to go after the Principal once your magic is recovered?"
Se-ah’s question flowed naturally, but Woo-jin immediately sensed something off and paused.
"...?"
Woo-jin’s eyes narrowed. It wasn’t the kind of question one would ask so casually.
Se-ah was still smiling slyly, which only heightened the sense of unease.
Woo-jin spread his senses, trying to detect if there was anything hidden in the room. Enhancing his physical senses with 7th-tier magic allowed him to do so.
However, there didn’t seem to be any hidden cameras or bugs.
"Is this room soundproof?"
"Yes, it’s well soundproofed. After all, it’s a secret base."
...Was he being too suspicious because of the situation?
Woo-jin sighed, trying to calm his nerves.
"What kind of answer are you expecting from me?"
"I’m just curious. Oh, you don’t have to answer if you don’t want to."
This conversational tactic—the way she shifted topics after sensing his discomfort—made Woo-jin uncertain.
Was she being considerate, or was she harboring some intention and then retreating?
Woo-jin found it difficult to fully trust Se-ah, even though he liked her.
'In that case...'
Woo-jin decided to ask a straightforward question.
"It feels odd to ask this now, but there’s something I’ve been meaning to ask."
"To me?"
"Yeah."
"Wow~, I’m honored that you’re curious about something! Feel free to ask anything. I’m always on your side, Sunbae."
Se-ah pointed to herself with her index finger, clearly pleased.
Woo-jin leaned forward slightly, closing the distance between them.
"Why are you trying to take over the Black Market?"
It was a question he had kept to himself until now.
Se-ah’s stated goal was to become a “necessary evil” to create a “better world.”
That was likely her reason for trying to dominate the Black Market.
Woo-jin had once secretly investigated the matter but had been unable to uncover any concrete evidence, such as transaction records. It seemed Se-ah was thoroughly prepared to avoid leaving any trace.
He had always wondered how the Dohwa Group could even attempt to take over the vast market of the Black Market. But if Se-ah’s intentions were good, Woo-jin didn’t intend to interfere.
However, he was asking this now to determine whether Se-ah was truly someone he could trust.
"Um... Wow. That’s a pretty intense question... I wasn’t expecting that at all..."
Se-ah laughed awkwardly, scratching her cheek.
"I didn’t think you’d ask something like that. Although it’s not strange for you to know... How did you find out?"
"There are ways to know."
It was knowledge from the original work.
Something that couldn’t be revealed through a simple investigation.
"Are you trying to avoid the question?"
Se-ah fell silent, her voice lowering slightly.
"Then why didn’t you arrest me?"
"The Black Market is a neutral zone. It’s not under Ahseong High’s jurisdiction."
"But whatever I do in the Black Market would still violate Ahseong High’s rules, right? You have more than enough reason to take me in."
"Yeah... I could turn a blind eye to that. You’ve helped me a lot in the past. Besides, I don’t have any solid evidence against you. I’m not that inflexible. Just don’t commit any serious crimes like the Six Sinners."
Woo-jin’s goal was to prevent the rise of a dystopia.
He didn’t intend to regard Se-ah as a clear enemy unless he was certain she would bring about such a future. He had simply been wary of the possibility that she might become a great evil.
Given her sincere dream and the actions she had taken, Woo-jin couldn’t help but want to believe in Se-ah.
"Wow... That’s not something I expected the Head of the Discipline Committee to say."
Se-ah chuckled, placing her hand on the bed.
"But I’m relieved! To be honest, I was worried you might be too rigid, but this means we might see eye to eye someday, right?"
"I’m not interested in the Black Market. As long as you don’t do anything foolish, I’m fine with you taking control of it. Someone’s going to dominate it anyway. It might as well be you."
"Sunbae, you’re making me want you even more. It’s like you’re getting more attractive by the minute."
Se-ah said playfully.
"So? You still haven’t answered my question."
"I’ll tell you if you agree to join me."
"..."
"Don’t look at me like that. It’s scary. But don’t worry. I have only good reasons. I just want to make a better world, and I don’t want to be at odds with you."
Se-ah smiled.
"As I’ve said many times, I really like you, Sunbae. Why wouldn’t I like our Head of the Discipline Committee, who’s working to create a better world? Isn’t this just a case of like-minded people getting close?"
"Is that so..."
"...Oh, I’ve been keeping you for too long, haven’t I? I should go do some breathing exercises. Feel free to call me anytime you’re bored. Since martial law’s in effect, I have plenty of free time."
"Yeah, thanks."
"Make sure to use the shower if you want to freshen up."
Se-ah smiled brightly and left the room.
Soon, the room fell into silence.
After a while, Woo-jin heard a faint crackling sound in his ear, forming a tiny fracture.
─ Finally, she’s gone.
From the fracture, Geum-yang’s voice echoed in Woo-jin’s ear.
"Geum-yang."
─ What?
"Do you think that girl is trustworthy?"
─ No.
"Why not?"
─ She’s hiding too much. She seems sly as a snake.
"Hiding things..."
Woo-jin stared at the ceiling.
"Isn’t that true for both of us?"
─ True enough.
"By the way, I need a favor. Can you secretly keep an eye on this place and see if it’s trustworthy?"
─ Why should I bother with something so tedious?
"I’ll treat you to as much curry as you can eat when it’s all over."
─ Surveillance is my specialty. Leave it to me! Hehe!
The crack disappeared, and silence returned.
Woo-jin went to the bathroom to wash his face, then returned to his seat. He let out a long breath, settled into a comfortable position, and closed his eyes, allowing himself to drift into a light sleep.
He had a feeling this might be his last chance to rest.
So, he decided to take full advantage of it.
As he was resting, Se-ah reentered the room. It had been about two hours.
Curious about what she would do, Woo-jin pretended to be asleep.
"Sleep well, Sunbae."
Se-ah covered him with a blanket, adjusted his position for comfort, and then left the room again.
...
─ Kid, wake up.
A few hours later.
Still half-asleep, Woo-jin heard Geum-yang’s voice in his ear.
"I’m not asleep. What’s up?"
His body felt more refreshed than before, but there was still a hint of drowsiness in his voice.
─ Enemies are coming.

chapters.title: Chapter 107
chapters.content:
"Enemies are coming."
It was no surprise.
He had anticipated this.
Focusing on his ability to sense magic, Woo-jin could faintly detect a dense magical presence beyond the secret base.
They were still some distance away.
"Sunbae."
The door opened, and Se-ah entered. Though she tried to appear calm, her urgency was evident.
"Is it the martial law security forces?"
"Yes? Yes... Did you sense the magic from here? Impressive."
Woo-jin stood up from the chair, rolling his shoulders as he did a light stretch.
"I wanted to let you rest for at least a day, but it seems I failed. You should escape now, Sunbae."
He could easily escape with a space jump.
The problem was...
"What about you?"
If the martial law security forces were coming this way, it meant they had figured out that the Dohwa Group was hiding Woo-jin.
Under martial law, the security forces were permitted to use all manner of violent measures in the name of maintaining order.
In other words, it was clear what would happen to Se-ah and the members of the Dohwa Group.
"This magical energy is likely from Spartoi. Your group can't win against them."
"I know. But what can we do? We'll have to escape when we see an opening. We prepared an escape route just in case."
Escape when they see an opening?
Against Spartoi?
"......"
Memories from the original work flashed through Woo-jin's mind.
Se-ah, after becoming the ruler of the Black Market and a major villain, met an untimely death under mysterious circumstances.
Given that the Dohwa Group was also wiped out, it was highly likely she had been assassinated by someone.
Who exactly was responsible for Se-ah's and the Dohwa Group's demise was unclear.
It seemed most likely that rival criminal organizations, who were displeased with Se-ah's dominance over the Black Market, had joined forces against her... but something about that didn’t sit right.
Could someone as meticulous as Se-ah really be taken down so easily?
Especially considering the magical power possessed by the members of the Dohwa Group, they were far from being weak.
This suggested that in the original work, Se-ah was likely defeated by a strong opponent who was unpredictable and highly skilled.
Assassination seemed the most probable cause.
'This situation is no exception.'
Woo-jin had no way of knowing what kind of danger Se-ah might face as a result of hiding him.
Especially since the opponent was Spartoi.
If Se-ah died and the Dohwa Group was destroyed as in the original work, it would be a natural outcome.
Even if he didn’t fully trust her, Se-ah was still a junior he liked. Woo-jin didn’t want to see her get hurt.
Moreover, she had provided him with a place to rest, and now she was caught up in this crisis because of it.
Leaving without doing anything would weigh heavily on his conscience.
'Fortunately, my magic has almost fully recovered.'
That’s the 7th tier for you.
He hadn’t expected his magic to recover so quickly, even after being completely drained.
At this rate, he’d soon be at full strength.
He could afford to go head-to-head in a battle.
Woo-jin approached Se-ah and stood in front of her. He then asked,
"Do you regret hiding me?"
Se-ah smiled mischievously and answered with innocent confidence.
"I’ve never regretted anything in my life!"
"Good to hear."
Woo-jin tried to pass by her.
"Sunbae."
He stopped.
"Are you planning to fight?"
"......"
"Don’t do anything strange."
"What do you mean?"
"Don’t say anything weird to the enemies, like you threatened our group to provide you a place to stay by using your relationship with me."
Se-ah looked directly at Woo-jin, her expression firm, almost like a warning.
Woo-jin chuckled softly.
"My junior really isn’t afraid to speak her mind. Let’s meet again. Stay safe."
Woo-jin lightly tapped Se-ah on the shoulder as he walked past her.
As soon as he left the room, he created a rift in the air and jumped through it.
He intended to take out all the enemies before they could clash with the Dohwa Group and Spartoi.
Meanwhile, in the forest, a squad of Spartoi was moving swiftly toward the secret base.
They held their breath and maintained a state of high alert.
Their target was An Woo-jin, a formidable opponent who had reached the 7th tier.
"Is this the place?"
"Yes, it’s close."
They had identified a secret base somewhere in the mountains where Woo-jin might be hiding.
As Woo-jin's magic gradually recovered, the massive magic detection system spread throughout Neo Seoul had managed to pick up his energy.
The Spartoi dispatched for this mission knew they had little chance of defeating a 7th-tier powerhouse like Woo-jin.
There was no point in even thinking about how to counter his devastating lightning and spatial abilities—the gap in strength was simply too vast.
Their mission was to measure Woo-jin's magic accurately and relay that information to the martial law security forces.
However...
"!"
A powerful wave of magic rippled through the trees, enveloping the Spartoi. They all stopped in their tracks, startled.
Something was coming.
Crack!
At that moment, a rift formed among the Spartoi, and Woo-jin calmly stepped out of it.
They found themselves suddenly face-to-face with one of the most powerful figures in the world.
As black-ops specialists, the Spartoi were trained not to show emotion, but the fear on their faces was unmistakable.
"An Woo—!"
Crack!
Rifts formed around each Spartoi, surrounding them like a prison, giving them no time to counterattack.
Boom!
High-voltage lightning magic poured through the rifts, efficiently striking the enemies.
This was Woo-jin’s unique ability, spatial domination.
Magical formula Type 2: Spatial Thunderclap.
Without even a chance to scream, the Spartoi fell to the ground, their bodies charred and smoking as the smell of burnt flesh filled the air.
However, for new humans as strong as Spartoi, this wasn’t a fatal blow. They’d be out of commission for days, at most.
Unless they were like the murderous Spartoi Woo-jin had encountered in prison, he had no desire to take their lives. He had the power to avoid doing so.
"Guh...!"
He had left one of them conscious, attacking with just enough force to keep him awake. Woo-jin approached him, then pulled the magic detector attached to his belt and stood up.
It was a device that functioned like a phone, capable of transmitting information.
"So this is it. The device that measures my magic and sends it to the magic detector system."
"W-what are you going to do...?"
The Spartoi rasped through blood-flecked coughs as Woo-jin infused his magic into the device. It beeped as his magic information was recorded.
Then, Woo-jin pressed the send button.
"What...!?"
The Spartoi’s eyes widened in shock.
"You...! What are you doing...!? By doing that, you’ve transmitted your magic information to the entire martial law security force. Now there’s nowhere left for you to hide...! Are you out of your mind...?"
For the Spartoi, it was a stroke of luck, but the situation made no sense.
No matter where Woo-jin fled or hid, Neo Seoul would be able to find and attack him easily.
"I don’t know."
At that moment, the communication function on the device activated. Woo-jin looked at the screen.
─ ...Ahseong High’s Discipline Committee Head.
A cold voice, like ice, filled the air.
Woo-jin recognized that voice.
─ Was it you who sent this magic information?
Judging by the tone, it seemed the other person, being a 7th-tier as well, had guessed what was happening and reached out.
It seemed they had been skeptical about whether the Spartoi squad would succeed.
A faint smile tugged at the corners of Woo-jin’s lips.
The main reason he needed to recover his magic was now on the other end of this call.
"Suh Kang-jin, right? The top Spartoi. Codename 'White,' correct?"
In this city, he was said to be the strongest after Goliath.
The Principal’s ultimate weapon.
The strongest among the Spartoi.
Suh Kang-jin.
There was a brief silence after Woo-jin spoke, as if Kang-jin was processing the surprise.
─ ...You know me.
It was astonishing that Woo-jin knew this top-secret information.
There was a hint of admiration in Kang-jin’s voice.
"Judging by your call, you must have figured out the situation. Am I right?"
─ …….
"I’ll take that as a yes. I’m not hiding anymore. I don’t need to..."
A clear sense of rage welled up within Woo-jin.
He bared his teeth, growling.
A twisted, menacing expression crossed his face.
The Spartoi felt a shiver run down their spines, as if they could hear a beast growling in the distance.
'Goliath...?'
It was reminiscent of the overwhelming pressure that always accompanied Goliath’s presence.
And then, Woo-jin declared.
"I’m going to bring down the Principal."
It was a declaration of war.
The Spartoi’s eyes widened in shock.
"I’ll destroy anything that gets in my way, even if it’s this entire academy city. Stop me if you can."
Pure anger and hostility.
A sigh, filled with disdain, came from Kang-jin.
─ Then you’ll learn the hard way what arrogance brings. And... don’t expect any courtesy from me. Whatever fate befalls you, consider it well deserved. The price for defying the order of Neo Seoul will not be light.
His words made it clear that he intended to make Woo-jin's death as painful as possible.
Woo-jin recalled the mind map he had seen at Baek-seo’s house. To her, Kang-jin was akin to a landmine, a powerful adversary.
He also remembered what the doctor had said during Baek-seo's treatment after the Moon Chae-yeon suppression operation. The doctor had noted several frostbite scars.
For Baek-seo, Kang-jin was not just a landmine; he was one of the few Spartoi who could easily overpower her.
The only person who could have caused such severe frostbite on Baek-seo was Suh Kang-jin.
Moreover, he was the Principal's most loyal enforcer, someone who had faithfully carried out the Principal’s dirty work.
In a way, it was convenient.
Woo-jin felt an intense desire to smash his fist into Kang-jin's face.
"You’re no different," Woo-jin replied.
─ What?
"Whatever happens to you, consider it well deserved."
Before Kang-jin could respond, Woo-jin crushed the magic detector in his hand.
Crack!
The device shattered, its fragments scattering to the ground. The sight was reflected in the widened eyes of the Spartoi.
Thud!
Woo-jin's foot came crashing down on the head of the Spartoi, delivering a heavy blow that knocked him out cold, his face crumpling under the force.
With a cold expression, Woo-jin walked away.
By now, twilight had begun to settle over the land.

chapters.title: Chapter 108
chapters.content:
Principal Lee Doo-hee
was gazing out at the panorama of Neo Seoul from the Central Tower. The only difference from the usual scene was the faintly visible translucent barrier created by the jammer.
This was the pinnacle of Neo Seoul's technological prowess.
The barrier, charged with immense energy, blocked all forms of magic-based technology.
In other words,
Woo-jin
couldn't leap through space to reach the Central Tower in an instant.
Moreover, any magic-based technology would find it nearly impossible to damage the Central Tower.
Though the tower was vulnerable to physical attacks, the waiting Spartoi and the air defense system would handle those.
Even in the event of a crisis, there were plenty of emergency technologies prepared to bolster the tower's defenses.
The problem was...
"
An Woo-jin...
"
The Principal had just received a report from
Suh Kang-jin
.
"He's broken... that boy... he’s finally broken."
The Principal closed his eyes and sank into thought for a moment.
"
Ahyeya.
"
"Yes, sir."
Son Ye-seo
, the Spartoi standing behind the Principal, answered.
"An Woo-jin will eventually come to kill me. He will crush everything that stands in his way and finally reach me."
"Come on, all of Neo Seoul's top forces are on standby, including Kang-jin. Even those useless old men from the Federal Council have holed up somewhere safe, protecting their own skins. There are no obstacles left. No matter how formidable An Woo-jin may be, it’ll be hard for him to take on everything we’ve got. The damage will be significant, but still..."
"No... he will come. I know his type."
The Principal opened his eyes again, his brow furrowed. His arm, resting on the wheelchair's armrest, trembled slightly.
"We may have poked a monster even more dangerous than Goliath..."
"Hmm... but won’t it be okay?"
Ye-seo said with a smile.
"You have your daughter, ‘1215.’"
"But she..."
"She'll come."
Ye-seo spoke with conviction.
"When the worst moment arrives, that person will definitely come. To protect you."
The Principal pressed his dry lips together tightly.
"So, don’t worry, Principal. Somehow, things will work out. Think of what’s happening today as just the labor pains for the future."
"...I hope the pain isn't too great."
Things were not looking good.
The Disciplinary Committee had been subjected to a search and seizure, had their leader taken away, and all organizational activities had been completely suspended.
Attempting to act under martial law would only make them a target for the most powerful forces of Neo Seoul, treated as an unauthorized armed group.
The Disciplinary Committee was like a fish caught in a strong current.
"What do we do, what do we do..."
The Disciplinary Committee’s office was a mess after being raided by the Student Council.
Ha Ye-song
was pacing the same spot repeatedly, her head bowed as she bit her thumbnail. Her expression was unusually serious.
"Everything's screwed up...! There's got to be a way, a way...!"
"You're making my head spin. Could you calm down...?"
"Aaah!
Min-hyuk
! What are we going to do!? The media and public opinion are united in slamming the Captain! The internet is in an uproar! If it weren’t for martial law, there’d be massive protests by now! The Student Council President is telling us to stay put! And the Martial Law Guards are out to take down the Captain...!"
"This is why I didn’t want to get involved..."
Park Min-hyuk
let out a deep sigh.
Everyone was frustrated.
Yoo Do-ha
was seriously contemplating, while
Oh Baek-seo
just stared at the floor, barely moving.
"By the way."
When Do-ha spoke, Ye-song and Min-hyuk turned their attention to her.
"The Han Yang guys, their surveillance is weak."
"But they’re stationed outside, Do-ha..."
"What I mean is, there might still be an opportunity."
"Hmm..."
Ye-song fell into thought before speaking again.
"What if we become rebels?"
"Are you crazy? We’re in this mess because we don’t have enough power to win. That’s why we’re even considering this."
Min-hyuk responded immediately.
"No, no.
Ma-hyeon High
is on our side too. What if we form some sort of rebel alliance...?"
"There’s no chance. I’ve already dismissed that idea as futile."
Do-ha replied.
"I know! That’s not what I meant..."
Ye-song fought back her irritation and collected herself.
"If the fight comes down to a battle of power, then maybe we should focus on building up our own forces!"
"Then who could we recruit?"
"That... I need to think about."
"Wouldn’t it be more important to find the Captain first? It’s obvious he’s trying to keep us out of danger by going off alone. He probably expected to get caught by the Martial Law Guards if he came back to us."
Bzzzt.
"Hmm?"
At that moment, Baek-seo’s smartphone vibrated. She took it out and checked the message.
Dal:You′reinatoughspotrightnow,aren′tyou?Dal: You're in a tough spot right now, aren't you?Dal:You′reinatoughspotrightnow,aren′tyou?
‘Dal’ was
Kim Dal-bi
. That’s how Baek-seo had saved her in her contacts.
What could she want?
As Baek-seo pondered over the message, another one quickly followed.
Dal:I’vegotsomethingpreparedthatmighthelp.Dal: I’ve got something prepared that might help.Dal:I’vegotsomethingpreparedthatmighthelp.
Baek-seo narrowed her eyes.
Dal:Canyoucomebyforabit?Dal: Can you come by for a bit?Dal:Canyoucomebyforabit?
Even though Dal-bi had lost many of her memories, she would have held onto her resentment towards the Principal.
And given the current situation, Dal-bi had no reason to side with the Principal.
In other words, Dal-bi might have prepared something to use against him.
Besides, there was no benefit for Dal-bi in leading Baek-seo into a trap.
Thus, Baek-seo decided it was better to meet her.
"Hey, guys."
Baek-seo stood up.
"What’s up, Baek-seo?"
"I’m stepping out for a bit."
"Bathroom? Go ahead."
Baek-seo left the office.
Ye-song and Min-hyuk didn’t suspect a thing, but Do-ha watched the door Baek-seo had exited through with a meaningful glance.
"You’re here?"
Baek-seo arrived at the place Dal-bi had asked her to meet. It was an office inside an abandoned building.
"You avoided surveillance well."
"That’s easy for me."
For someone who had once been an assassin in Spartoi, evading surveillance was hardly a challenge.
"And for some reason, the surveillance around here has weakened too."
Because Woo-jin had shared his magical information with Spartoi, a lot of forces were on the move. As a result, the number of Martial Law Guards and robots patrolling the Ahseong High School district had significantly decreased.
"So, what are you doing?"
Dal-bi was sitting in front of an old but large monitor. The computer was running.
Baek-seo moved closer to see the screen.
Multiple windows were open. Despite its appearance, the computer boasted impressive performance, judging by its processing speed.
"I’m getting ready to drop a bomb."
"A bomb?"
"I’ve been preparing something. I think I need to help Woo-jin."
Dal-bi had been preparing to bring down the Principal.
Though she had lost many memories, her preparation to take down the Principal remained intact.
"I found a place on the Deep Web. A place even the Principal’s reach can’t touch. I’ve gathered a lot of data from there."
"Is it okay to talk about this so openly?"
"The place is well soundproofed. There’s nothing to worry about around here. I’ve hidden this place thoroughly."
"Really...? But isn’t the Deep Web like... the dark side of the internet? Full of illegal activities and impossible to control."
"There are a lot of shady areas, but there are also some useful places."
Baek-seo’s eyes scanned the information protected by the Deep Web’s security features.
"What’s this...?"
"All the illegal activities the Principal has been involved in, and the evidence of it. I’ve been collecting everything I could as an Enforcer. I’m going to expose it all."
"Hold on."
Baek-seo gently pushed Dal-bi’s hand aside and moved the mouse. As she scrolled through the documents, she found evidence related to the false accusations against Woo-jin.
The Principal had tried to pin some of his own crimes on Woo-jin.
"Because of the martial law, everyone’s glued to the internet and TV. This is our chance."
Dal-bi said.
"This is... really impressive."
If Baek-seo had been planning to assassinate the Principal by exploiting his weaknesses...
Dal-bi had been gathering evidence to corner him.
Baek-seo could only imagine the effort Dal-bi must have put in.
"Really...?"
Dal-bi blushed, scratching her nose sheepishly.
But Baek-seo wasn’t entirely at ease.
"This is good stuff, but... if we feed this information to the media bit by bit, it could be dangerous. There’s a high chance the Principal would find out before it goes public. He’ll definitely take action."
"I’ve already prepared for that."
"How?"
"We’ll drop it all in one big hit. But it’s tough to do it alone... I have something prepared, but I need your help to make it more secure and impactful."
Dal-bi looked at Baek-seo with determination.
"If we’re really in this fight together, help me. I need you."
Baek-seo smiled warmly and answered without hesitation.
"Tell me what you need."

chapters.title: Chapter 109
chapters.content:
Two escort vehicles from Han-Yang Federal Academy
were speeding down the road.
Inside these vehicles were the two Six Criminals they had taken from Ahseong High School’s Disciplinary Committee:
Han Seo-jin
and
Moon Chae-yeon
, each in a separate vehicle.
Han Seo-jin was still crystallized and bound. There were no signs of change yet.
But change often comes suddenly.
Crack.
“Huh?”
At the sudden, unnatural sound, one of the Spartoi looked up.
Somehow, a large crack had formed in the crystal that encased Han Seo-jin’s body.
And then, in an instant...
Shatter!
“!”
The crystals that had covered Han Seo-jin shattered and scattered in all directions. Since the restraints were over the crystallized skin, they had become loose.
Seo-jin immediately utilized his magic to strengthen his body and escaped his confines.
“Emergency—!”
The Spartoi was about to report when—
Smash!
The surveillance wall was destroyed, and Seo-jin’s hand was already gripping the Spartoi’s head. In the next moment, dark purple magic surged into Seo-jin’s hand.
A sinister aura seeped into the Spartoi’s entire body, and his eyes turned bloodshot.
‘This magic… it’s different from before…!’
The Spartoi was an aide to the Principal.
So, he knew about Seo-jin, one of the Six Criminals.
But for some reason, Seo-jin’s magical density was on a completely different level than before.
So much so that the Spartoi couldn’t even hope to match it.
Thud.
The Spartoi finally collapsed like a puppet with its strings cut and breathed his last.
“What was that noise?! Huff...!”
Hearing the loud noise, the other Spartoi rushed into the surveillance compartment, startled, but they quickly assessed the situation and prepared for battle.
Seo-jin’s cold, emotionless eyes locked onto them.
It took less than 30 seconds for them to become corpses.
“Ugh, I’m stiff…”
Seo-jin stretched, placing one hand on his shoulder and tilting his neck from side to side.
He was still wearing the same hooded robe he had on when he crystallized right after losing to An Woo-jin.
Seo-jin reached into his robe and pulled out a half-shattered skull mask, which he placed on his face. At that moment, the Necromancer, one of the Six Criminals, had returned.
In the transport compartment, everyone except the driver had been killed.
All at the hands of just one person, Han Seo-jin.
The operation was so silent that the driver was completely unaware of what had transpired.
Seo-jin started walking. Soon, dark purple magic emanated from the floor, and his body sank beneath it.
Only the corpses remained in the transport compartment.
Inside the other escort vehicle that was traveling alongside.
Moon Chae-yeon
was spending her time with her eyes closed, clad in a special restraint suit.
Since the vehicle was designed for the transportation and confinement of criminals, the transport compartment was well-equipped with restraining facilities.
Chae-yeon clicked her tongue, feeling more uncomfortable than she did back at Ahseong High School.
“What the hell is going on... Huh?”
Suddenly, Chae-yeon sensed something off and opened her eyes wide.
For some reason, the presence of the people in the surveillance compartment beyond the mirror had disappeared. Or more accurately... had they collapsed?
Soon, she felt a chilling presence behind her. In the reflection on the surveillance wall, she could see a dark purple magic circle forming on the floor, and something was being summoned.
Chae-yeon turned her head back and caught sight of a familiar face.
“Ohhh...!”
Chae-yeon exclaimed in awe.
The person who appeared behind her was the expressionless schoolgirl,
Han Seo-jin
.
“When did you wake up!? Did you come to rescue me?”
Seo-jin didn’t respond and instead summoned a spectral beast. The summoned creature swung its sharp claws and tore through Chae-yeon’s special restraint suit.
“Whoa~.”
Chae-yeon whistled as she stood up.
“Oops.”
It had been so long since she last stood that her legs wobbled, struggling to support her weight.
Once she regained her balance, Chae-yeon grinned and stared at Seo-jin.
“Wow, this is amazing! Is this what freedom feels like? It’s been so long since I stood up that it’s hard to stay on my feet. Hehe...!”
“Spartoi will soon realize this escort has been compromised and deploy reinforcements. The ones here were weak, but if proper support arrives, things will get tough.”
“Spartoi? Even if they show up, I don’t think I’ll lose. Unless Suh Kang-jin comes, that is~. But you, you’ve gotten stronger, haven’t you?”
“A lot has happened.”
Seo-jin extended his magic-infused hand and placed it against the surveillance wall.
Boom!
The surveillance wall shattered effortlessly.
Chae-yeon rolled her wrists, stretching her body. The smile on her face gradually faded.
“You know...”
“?”
Seo-jin stopped in her tracks.
“When I briefly died, it was you I met, wasn’t it?”
“...Yes.”
Chae-yeon let out a small laugh.
“Why? Is there something that happens when we die? Like, does the sky suddenly turn red...? I felt really scared back then.”
“I’ll tell you while we’re on the move.”
Screech.
“......”
In an instant, Chae-yeon generated mechanical blades from her arms and held them to Seo-jin’s neck.
Seo-jin calmly turned to face Chae-yeon.
A bright smile hung on Chae-yeon’s lips.
“I don’t remember agreeing to follow you. And I don’t get why someone with no sense of camaraderie would go out of their way to save me~? You’re really suspicious, you know that?”
“I learned the truth. That’s why I want you to help me.”
“The truth? Out of nowhere, the truth? What, did you have a chat with the Grim Reaper or something? Heaven or Hell? Did you see some sort of afterlife? What truth?”
Seo-jin fully turned toward Chae-yeon. Seeing the seriousness in her face, Chae-yeon lowered her mechanical blades. She hadn’t intended to attack Seo-jin in the first place.
Chae-yeon raised both hands and shrugged.
“Well, whatever. I’ve already made up my mind about what I’m going to do.”
“About what...?”
“Everything’s annoying. Everything just pisses me off.”
Chae-yeon smiled brightly, extended her arm, and pointed her thumb downward.
“So I’m going to destroy this city, along with the Principal, and make a real mess of things.”
“...Like the Disciplinary Committee President?”
“Eh?” Chae-yeon was taken aback.
“The Disciplinary Committee President? You mean An Woo-jin?”
“Yes.”
“No way, why would that guy...?”
The idea that the Disciplinary Committee President, someone who upheld the law and order, wanted to destroy the Academy City.
Understanding how dire the situation must be for him to consider such a thing, Chae-yeon couldn’t help but be shocked.
“Aha, aha! Hehe...! So that’s it. Our Disciplinary Committee President~, he’s finally decided to go all the way to hell, huh?”
Chae-yeon clasped her hands together and reacted playfully. The thought of the situation alone was enough to amuse her.
Suddenly, thoughts of Woo-jin’s girls,
Kim Dal-bi
and
Oh Baek-seo
, flashed through Chae-yeon’s mind. They had endured all kinds of suffering while resisting the Principal.
“Well, I guess that makes sense. He’s been through so much because of the Principal. I bet it’s absolute chaos now.”
“Probably.”
Chae-yeon walked past Seo-jin.
“...So, what will you do?”
“What do you think? I’m going to do whatever I want!”
“Whatever you want?”
Chae-yeon stopped and looked back at Seo-jin.
With an expression that said it was only natural.
“If the Disciplinary Committee President is trying to destroy this city along with the Principal, then our interests perfectly align, don’t they?”
A smirk crept across Chae-yeon’s face.
“I don’t like the Disciplinary Committee President, but I like this. I’m sure of it! I can finally get rid of this suffocating feeling that’s been weighing on my chest!”
“......”
“And you?”
“I think my path is the same as yours.”
“Because of that truth or whatever?”
“Yes.”
“You mentioned before that you needed to help An Woo-jin. Is that related to what you discovered?”
“Yes.”
“Tell me on the way. I’m curious.”
“Yes.”
“Is ‘yes’ the only thing you can say?”
“Yes...?”
Chae-yeon and Seo-jin opened the transport compartment door and stepped out of the vehicle.
Under the darkened sky.
They landed on the road.
At that moment, a swarm of security drones patrolling Neo Seoul spotted them.
And the androids of the Martial Law Guards on patrol raised an alarm.
“The city’s looking really bleak. Even near the Central Area. And those tin cans... they’re not your average ones, are they? Ah, the martial law has been declared, hasn’t it?”
Chae-yeon clicked her tongue and formed a mechanical spear, gripping it firmly.
[Switching to combat mode.]
The androids, sensing magic, all shifted into combat mode.
“There are a lot of them. Conserve your magic and focus on escaping.”
“Han Seo-jin, you know, it’s been a really long time since I last moved? Can you imagine how much my body has been itching? Could you at least consider that?”
“Hah... Fine, do as you please...”
Then, it happened.
Koooooooom!
A deafening sound brushed past their ears like a hallucination.
Before they realized it, something heavy had covered the world, making them feel as if their bodies were being crushed flat.
For a moment, they thought they were dead.
But when they looked down in shock, they found their bodies were unharmed.
All the lights illuminating the city went out simultaneously, plunging everything into darkness. Silence fell over the world, and then the city’s lights returned.
Chae-yeon and Seo-jin instinctively turned their heads in the same direction, cold sweat trickling down their backs.
Craaaack!!!
Something that shouldn’t be torn was tearing apart.
The sky itself split open, creating a massive and mystical rift. The overwhelming pressure felt as though a god was declaring the city’s destruction.
This was the heart of Neo Seoul.
The Central Tower stood at the center, the hub of administration.
Above it, a magical formula, crafted by someone’s magic, had formed.
Boom!
With each step the figure took, the surrounding buildings collapsed, and the ground caved in. The noise was not that of explosions but rather of everything succumbing to an incomprehensible force.
At the center of it all, a man walked forward, his eyes glowing teal.
With each step, the world around him knelt in submission.
The approaching androids and drones were sucked into the rift like a black hole, disintegrating as they went.
