Goliath, for his part, had anticipated that Woo-jin would support him, so he moved confidently, seemingly ignoring Woo-jin’s warning but, in truth, fully trusting him.
Crack!
Behind Se-ah and to her left, new rifts suddenly opened. Woo-jin and Goliath shot out of them like bullets.
Se-ah’s powers, which sent opponents to the Otherworld, faltered in the face of their swift and coordinated assault.
Crackle!
Woo-jin’s Cheolryong-gon, crackling with teal lightning, and Goliath’s enormous fist, wrapped in a powerful gravitational field, simultaneously struck.
Boom!
The explosive impact of the electric shockwave and the gravitational force shattered Se-ah’s body, sending her flying like a ragdoll.
The destructive arc of Goliath’s punch created a powerful gravitational shockwave that dented and pierced the thick walls of the Central Tower.
Se-ah was thrown out of the building, sent hurtling far into the distance.
'Even with that kind of power, you’re not invincible,' Woo-jin thought, recalling the original storyline.
In the original story, Se-ah had died. If her death had been at Baek-seo’s hands, it was likely that Se-ah had been assassinated without even realizing it.
No matter how powerful Se-ah’s abilities were, they were not truly hers.
Se-ah was still human.
That meant she could be defeated.
Besides, with both Woo-jin and Goliath able to teleport at will, even Se-ah wouldn’t be able to handle them easily.
Whoosh!
As Se-ah’s body flew through the air, crimson mana suddenly wrapped around her.
Then, something unnatural happened.
Her body, which had been flying away, abruptly stopped and began to reverse course, like a video playing in reverse.
Swish!
Crimson mana filled Se-ah’s form once again, rapidly healing the fatal injuries she had sustained.
"……!"
Boom!
At the same time, a sudden shockwave erupted from the spot where Se-ah had been moments before she was struck.
Woo-jin and Goliath, caught off guard, raised their arms to shield their faces as the shockwave slammed them into the walls of the Central Tower.
The force was relatively weak. It merely knocked them back without causing significant harm.
In other words, it wasn’t an attack.
'I see...,' Woo-jin thought.
It was an extremely unnatural phenomenon.
He recalled what Geumyang had explained about Se-ah’s powers and began to understand the basic principle behind them.
'She erased the fact that we hit her, altering reality so that she merely leaped out of the building.'
Her unique ability,
Destiny Recalibration
.
Magic Formula Type 1:
Causal Replacement
.
'She’s outright ignoring the laws of the world.'
It was truly a power beyond reason.
Even in a world filled with fantastical abilities, Woo-jin now understood why Geumyang had said that Se-ah’s power defied all common sense.
To defeat Se-ah, they would need to either knock her unconscious in one strike or kill her instantly.
The recent surprise attack by Woo-jin and Goliath had been effective but had not completely overwhelmed Se-ah. The Otherworld’s power had protected her.
"Hah...!"
Se-ah frowned, her body now fully healed.
"You two are strong, as expected…."
It had taken a coordinated assault by the two strongest fighters in Neo Seoul, and even then, Se-ah couldn’t avoid injury completely.
"I guess I’ll have to go all out, then."
Se-ah smiled slyly, spreading her arms wide.
Behind her, a crimson ring of mana appeared, and numerous human-shaped figures made of red energy extended outward, forming wings.
Whoosh!
As her wings flapped, powerful gusts of wind rippled out.
An eerie, radiant glow began to emanate from Se-ah.
"What... is that?"
"Freakish…"
Se-ah floated in the center of the Central Area, drawing the attention of everyone nearby.
Journalists, who had been capturing footage from a distance, zoomed in with their cameras to record the eerie light radiating from Se-ah.
Civilians, watching from their windows or via live streams, gawked in shock at the unearthly spectacle.
"It’s like… that’s not the power of one person. It feels like the energy of a multitude…," the president of Saein High’s student council muttered.
The mana surrounding Se-ah carried the life force of many people.
A terrifying aura spread across Neo Seoul.
Anyone ranked 5th tier or higher could immediately sense how grotesque and unnatural that red mana was.
Something that should never have existed had revealed itself to the world.
Bam! Bam!
In response, Dohwa’s brainwashed soldiers, who had been lying in wait, leaped into action. Their eyes glowed red, a sign of their enslavement to Se-ah’s will.
Crimson rings and wings, smaller in size but similar to Se-ah’s, manifested behind the soldiers.
They formed a defensive perimeter around Se-ah. A sickening aura crawled up Woo-jin’s spine.
"So, she brought fifty soldiers, huh…!"
Standing in front of the gaping hole in the wall, Woo-jin and Goliath stared at Se-ah and her soldiers.
"You think you can take me on with just that?! You pathetic trash, don’t underestimate me…!"
"Watch out for their eyes. They might all have the same power as Se-ah."
"Hmph! No need to explain…! I’m already aware…!"
"Good, then."
Woo-jin extended his right arm toward Se-ah, while Goliath stretched out his left. Mana infused with their respective abilities surged from their hands.
Crack!
"……!"
A massive rift appeared in the sky once more.
Another crack formed in the ground below. Debris, rubble, and soil from the destroyed structures flowed into the crack.
Everything fell toward the sky.
Boom!
But that wasn’t all.
A powerful gravitational force emerged from the rift Woo-jin had created in the sky. As a result, the falling debris accelerated, and the smaller fragments became as deadly as bullets.
At the same time, Goliath skillfully infused the debris with intense gravity. Anything that touched those fragments would be crushed and destroyed.
Each falling piece of debris had become a lethal weapon.
Anyone within Woo-jin’s
Heaven’s Subjugation
field was guaranteed instant death.
But Se-ah wasn’t going down that easily.
"Are you trying to wipe me out all at once because I might be dangerous?"
Despite the overwhelming gravitational force trying to pull her down, Se-ah floated effortlessly in the air. Her crimson mana created a force that countered the pull of gravity.
Her unique ability,
Destiny Recalibration
.
Magic Formula Type 2:
Law Reconfiguration
.
Se-ah had rewritten the natural laws to oppose the gravitational force generated by Goliath’s magic.
"That attack is beyond my reach…."
Se-ah couldn’t manipulate the gravity that Goliath had unleashed on such a massive scale. No matter how powerful her authority was, her body couldn’t handle the density of the mana Goliath was wielding.
It was a testament to how overwhelmingly strong Goliath was.
The soldiers, though protected by Se-ah, couldn’t completely avoid the effects of Goliath’s gravity. Their movements were hindered.
Crack!
Boom!
Dozens of cracks formed around Se-ah, and from them, gigantic lightning bolts shot toward her.
Se-ah sensed the cracks’ angles and positions in advance and managed to dodge, but the lightning relentlessly pursued her, zigzagging through the rifts.
Eventually, Se-ah extended her hand toward the oncoming lightning.
Swish!
Suddenly, the spatial lightning reversed direction, fizzling out soon after. Its path had been altered.
Once again, Magic Formula Type 2:
Law Reconfiguration
.
'Her recalibration ability… What’s the condition?' Woo-jin thought as he teleported through the falling debris.
'In the first semester, she used it on people who had died to manipulate the fact that they had been killed. Now, she’s using it to counter my lightning and the debris. She hasn’t done anything to me or Goliath directly, though, so contact isn’t a requirement.'
Woo-jin quickly arrived at a conclusion.
'She can’t use it on living beings.'
It seemed unlikely that she would be able to manipulate either him or Goliath anytime soon.
'She can’t touch my spatial jumps either… Maybe it’s because she can’t handle the mana within the wormhole?'
The wormhole he traveled through for teleportation, as Geumyang had once explained, was a realm densely packed with an extraordinary amount of mana.
Even Se-ah’s powers likely couldn’t cope with it.
Crack!
Woo-jin and Goliath teleported through new cracks, instantly closing the distance between themselves and Se-ah.
From both sides, they aimed their Cheolryong-gon and fists at her.
The moment they closed in, Dohwa’s soldiers rushed in to shield Se-ah, taking the blows in her place.
Boom!
The soldiers were flung backward with incredible force, crashing into various parts of the Central Tower.
Meanwhile, Se-ah extended her arms toward Woo-jin and Goliath. Crimson mana surged forward, silently creeping toward them like an assassin.
A sense of danger pricked at Woo-jin’s spine.
Reacting swiftly, he activated a rift he had prepared for emergencies, escaping into the subspace along with Goliath.
"Hmm…. I hate to say this to you, Senior, but you’re like a rat. I could’ve finished this just now."
The power of the Otherworld.
Genetic manipulation.
Had they been caught by that, both Woo-jin and Goliath’s bodies would have twisted into grotesque shapes.
Dohwa’s soldiers, their crimson wings spread wide, swarmed after Woo-jin and Goliath whenever they reappeared from the cracks, engaging them in fierce combat.
Every time Se-ah flew toward Woo-jin, another intense battle would break out.
Se-ah, now fully enveloped in crimson mana, had greatly enhanced her physical abilities. Even a light swing of her arm caused a violent tearing sound, sending shockwaves that struck Woo-jin with crushing force.
Her power far exceeded the 7th tier. Woo-jin felt the bones in his body breaking from the sheer impact.
But whenever Woo-jin was in danger, Goliath would leap in, his gravity-infused punches sending Se-ah flying away.
Debris rained down on Se-ah, infused with even more mana and speed, making it impossible for her to deflect them using her law-rewriting ability.
Each time, Se-ah flapped her wings, dodging swiftly.
Conversely, whenever Goliath was in trouble, Woo-jin would create a rift to pull him out or unleash several spatial lightning bolts to strike Se-ah.
"You two are really in sync, aren’t you?"
Amid the fierce and destructive battle, Se-ah scoffed in frustration.
Meanwhile, Dohwa’s soldiers relentlessly attacked Woo-jin and Goliath.
'All of them have physical abilities similar to Se-ah’s.'
Se-ah, using the power of the Otherworld, possessed physical capabilities far beyond the 7th tier.
The soldiers she controlled were no different. While not as strong as Se-ah herself, they posed a significant threat with physical abilities comparable to the 7th tier.
Splurt!
However, as the battle dragged on, the soldiers’ bodies began to split and bleed, unable to fully handle the power they wielded.
Their expressions remained emotionless.
They showed no signs of pain or hesitation.
They were nothing more than marionettes.
Fighting off a horde of such opponents was proving to be overwhelming for Woo-jin.
Crack!
Woo-jin and Goliath slipped into another rift, entering the same wormhole.
Woo-jin had intentionally brought Goliath along with him.
"Huff, huff…."
Woo-jin clutched his broken ribs, gasping for breath.
"Fighting while avoiding eye contact is harder than I thought."
There’s a saying that the eyes are the windows to the soul.
In all his previous battles, Woo-jin had relied on subtle changes in his opponent’s eyes and facial expressions to predict their movements.
But now, against Se-ah and her soldiers, he couldn’t afford to make eye contact.
On top of that, Se-ah’s physical strength was so overwhelming that even a simple swing of her arm generated winds strong enough to crush bones.
Without even trying, she could deliver devastating blows, making it difficult for Woo-jin to keep up with her movements.
Se-ah’s attacks were too much for even someone with 7th-tier abilities to withstand.
"Hehehe…!"
Goliath, though injured as well, grinned, thoroughly enjoying the fight.
"Isn’t this fun? When will you ever get to experience something like this again? This is a refreshing challenge! Hahaha!!"
"You’re such an annoying bastard, but I guess it’s good you’re staying positive."
Woo-jin chuckled.
"If we don’t stop Se-ah, it’s over. She’s revealed her power, and there’s no way she won’t make her move. She’s definitely planning something."
"I know…! I have no intention of losing. I will personally take down that trash…!"
Goliath grinned, cracking his knuckles. His fighting spirit was burning brighter than ever.
"They said they’d try to do something about Se-ah’s power source on the other side. I don’t know if they’ll succeed, but we have to hope for the best."
"If all else fails, I’ll use my trump card…!"
"Yeah, go ahead and go wild. I’ll cover you."
"You’ll cover
me
?"
Goliath raised an eyebrow, intrigued by Woo-jin’s words.
"And you cover
me
."
"Hehehe! You cheeky brat… You say interesting things…!"
"Let’s go."
Woo-jin and Goliath charged through the wormhole, emerging once again to confront Se-ah.

chapters.title: Chapter 120
chapters.content:
Central Tower, deep underground.
Including Lee Jung-mi, the remaining members of the Dohwa faction were fleeing, carrying the pained Principal and the unconscious Song Ye-seo.
‘We need to regroup as soon as possible to support Se-ah.’
The Principal was desperate.
‘If we don’t make it through here soon, the escape route might collapse… Or we’ll have to wait until the battle ends and cross the center area torn open like the wastelands. If that happens, we won’t be able to shake off Ahn Woo-jin…!’
They had to pass through the escape route quickly.
It wasn’t that the Principal lacked confidence in escaping from Woo-jin; it was that avoiding him was an impossible task.
As they rushed with the help of the Dohwa faction members,
“Where do you think you’re rushing off to?”
Inside the escape route.
A female student, freed from her restraints, stood in their way.
Behind her, an unfamiliar mechanical wall blocked the entire exit.
The Principal furrowed his brows fiercely when he recognized the familiar face of the student.
“Moon Chae-yeon… Why are you here…?” “The head of the discipline committee from Ahseong High swept away all the dangerous people here, didn’t he? So I came in comfortably~.”
The girl blocking the exit, Moon Chae-yeon, chuckled with a mischievous smile.
“But wow…! Principal, what’s with this sorry state!? You really got beaten up, didn’t you? In the end, even you ended up like this! Oh wow, our master must be thrilled! Ah~, Ahn Woo-jin is growing on me more and more!”
“Moon Chae-yeon….”
“This is the underground escape route, right? Geez, I was really impressed by how deep it was down here. If Ahn Woo-jin sucked you in all the way down here, that would’ve been a total disaster, huh?”
“…Step aside.”
“Oh, don’t you get it? Can’t you see the wall blocking the way behind me?”
“You… you’re just trash that was discarded like a worthless piece…!”
Kagakakakak!
Suddenly, all of the Dohwa faction members except for Lee Jung-mi began to swell.
Red magical armor appeared, enveloping their bodies.
They glared at Chae-yeon with feral eyes, growling like beasts.
“Please stay calm, Principal. We will protect you.”
Jung-mi stepped forward and spoke.
“Moon Chae-yeon, if you don’t move, we will kill you.”
“So… you weren’t ordinary humans after all. And that magic isn’t even yours, is it?”
Chae-yeon sneered.
“The ones fighting outside were completely controlled by that black-haired girl, right? They became strong but turned into mere puppets. You’re not quite at that level, huh? That means you’re weak, aren’t you?”
“Even so, you cannot defeat us.”
“Yeah, yeah. No more words needed then. So….”
Swish.
As Chae-yeon swept her hand in front of her face, a protector covered her eyes.
Magic surged around her, forming mechanical armor around her body, and in one hand, a mechanical spear appeared.
“Let’s have some fun.”
Chae-yeon’s constantly smiling face twisted.
“I’ve been waiting for this moment for so long.”
She recalled the time she nearly died at Woo-jin’s hands and the burning desire that had consumed her ever since.
─ ‘You want revenge, don’t you?’
Just as Woo-jin had said.
The desire to brutally kill the Principal.
That unspoken wish was what had kept her going.
‘How pathetic… my life is truly worthless.’
Chae-yeon let out a self-mocking laugh.
Unconsciously, Woo-jin’s face flashed through her mind.
She didn’t like him, maybe even hated him.
But he was the strange man who made her heart flutter.
Now, she fully understood why Kim Dal-bi and Oh Baek-seo had fallen for Woo-jin so hard.
Maybe if she had loved someone, her dirty, miserable life could have been a little more beautiful.
‘What am I even thinking?’
She brushed aside the foolish thoughts and reminded herself of why she was here.
The Principal could not be allowed to pass.
The Principal’s destination was where Woo-jin was.
‘Hey, Ahn Woo-jin. I won’t let the Principal pass, so you can relax.’
Chae-yeon decided to stake her life and her desire on Woo-jin.
“Moon Chae-yeon!!!”
The Principal, his face flushed with anger, screamed.
“Hehe!”
Chae-yeon laughed brightly as she charged toward the Dohwa faction members.
Meanwhile, in the Reversed World.
“Hah… Hah….”
Geumyang and the Golden Sheep of Gravity stood before the massive human tree that fueled Se-ah’s power.
“That thing’s damn sturdy!”
Geumyang cursed in frustration.
No matter how much power they used, the massive tree wouldn’t budge.
Only the human-like shapes forming the tree’s trunk could be harmed, which only added to their frustration.
[There must be a core somewhere. Something that sustains this tree.]
“Don’t you think I know that? But I can’t figure out where it is…!”
Monstrous creatures began to interfere with Geumyang and the Golden Sheep of Gravity.
But with a single gesture from the Golden Sheep, gravity pressed down, smashing the creatures into the ground.
As the gravity intensified, the ground warped, and the creatures were pulverized into pieces.
“There’s no time. We have to do something…!”
At that moment.
Step. Step.
A figure in a hooded robe began to approach.
Geumyang and the Golden Sheep were shocked to see an intact human figure coming closer.
“You…?”
The girl wearing a shattered skull mask.
Geumyang recognized her.
It was the one Woo-jin had defeated in the first semester.
“I greet the avatars of the Golden Sheep.”
It was Han Seo-jin, the Hexagons’ sinner.
She bowed respectfully to the two avatars.
[Who is this?] “She’s the one my servant defeated last time.”
Seo-jin’s face was as expressionless as ever.
“You. How did you come here?” “I learned the art of necromancy. My ability lends itself to such things.”
Seo-jin looked up at the massive human tree.
“After I was defeated by Director Woo-jin, I became a spirit. And I came to understand the truth of this world. I also learned that Director Woo-jin bears the mark of the Golden Sheep. Well…, I did meet the Golden Sheep while we fought.”
“…….”
“So now I know that Director Woo-jin came from another world. Maybe everything that happened to me was predetermined.”
Seo-jin stepped forward, facing the human tree.
“What are you planning?” “Ever since I learned the truth, I’ve been investigating this tree.”
“…Is that why you were gone for so long?” “Yes.”
Seo-jin stopped and pointed to the human tree, glancing at Geumyang.
“I know the way to reach the core of this tree.”
“What…?”
Geumyang’s eyes widened.
“I discovered a path to the core during my investigations. I’ve worked quite hard on this, you know.”
“Why? What’s your reason for doing this…?” “Well, just…”
Seo-jin looked at the tree again.
“After fighting with Director Woo-jin, I realized something. I just wanted to live. So I found a reason to keep living. It had become seeing the ocean. But I knew long ago that there was no longer a beautiful blue ocean. I just needed a reason to keep going.”
“And now you don’t want to live anymore?” “I’m not sure. But some of the people in this tree… I know their faces. At least I had a reason to live. But these people, they died without even that.”
Seo-jin spoke in a flat, emotionless tone.
“I’ve finally accepted that my reason for living will never come true. And then, I saw something new. It was these people. I realized I could help them. And for the first time, my life felt like it had purpose.”
Seo-jin’s body began to dissolve into a dark purple mist, starting from her feet.
“Life is so tragically fleeting.”
Seo-jin turned her head to look at Geumyang, a faint smile forming on her usually emotionless face.
“Tell Director Woo-jin for me. I was really grateful that he called me awesome. Thanks for giving me good memories to carry with me.”
Seo-jin turned back to the human tree.
“I’ll atone for my sins this way.”
Swish.
Finally, Seo-jin’s body completely transformed into a serene, dark purple energy and took the shape of a graceful deer, racing through the air.
The magical deer shot toward the human tree, disappearing into its depths.
Boom!
Moments later, the spot where Seo-jin’s energy penetrated exploded, creating a path.
“You fool… Was that your choice…?”
Geumyang clicked his tongue in pity.
There was no time to just stand and watch.
The magical path Seo-jin had carved was already beginning to fade, unable to withstand the overwhelming pressure within the tree.
“…Let’s go.” [Indeed.]
Geumyang used spatial teleportation, and the Golden Sheep of Gravity floated up, entering the path Seo-jin had created.
They moved swiftly down the magical passage.
Meanwhile, in a dark alley somewhere in Neo Seoul.
Seo-jin’s physical body sat slumped against a wall, her eyes gently closed. Her body, starting from her feet, slowly dissolved into dark purple energy, turning into glowing dust.
It was the last of her magical power.
Like a child dreaming a peaceful dream, the corners of her mouth lifted into a slight smile.
Gradually, her head drooped, and her hair slid down in a soft cascade.
Eventually, the last of her magical energy consumed her, scattering her into the wind.
Like petals.

chapters.title: Chapter 123
chapters.content:
Lee Se-ah let out a bitter laugh.
“Wow…! When did everyone go from baring their fangs at each other to now coming together so harmoniously? It’s so fake that I can’t help but laugh.”
Gwoooarrrr!
The numerous lives contained within the magical wings on Se-ah’s back screamed, growing in size.
“Even if all of you join forces, you won’t be able to defeat me.”
Se-ah’s wings, now large enough to cover part of the sky, sprouted countless eyes. Each red pupil scanned the surroundings.
The red ring that had formed behind Se-ah also grew larger, slowly ascending into the sky, emitting a sacred light.
The ring, like a mosquito coil, gradually disintegrated, flickering and glitching like a broken TV screen or a bugged video game, a foreboding sign.
The soft glow that had been emanating from Se-ah intensified, forming a halo of light.
All the students in the center area could sense that the disappearing red ring was some sort of countdown.
Goooohhh!
The ominous magic, accompanied by countless screams, engulfed the area.
“What is that?”
“It’s a power that can ignore the laws of the world and rewrite everything without limit. If you get directly hit by it, you’ll be close to death.”
Se-ah responded to Woo-jin’s question with a sly smile.
“You…”
“At this rate, things won’t work out. I need to change everything. Care to try and stop me, senior?”
Her unique ability:
Fate Recalibration
. Secret technique:
Magical Formula Type 5, Paradox Creation
.
No one knew exactly what would happen, but it was clear that immense chaos would descend upon the world.
Paaahhh!
An overwhelming amount of magic surged, sweeping across the area like a powerful wind. However, Woo-jin and Goliath didn’t budge.
“I want to end this fight, too. I’ve already become a villain, but… oh?”
Se-ah looked down at her hand, noticing it trembling as if it had been strained.
“Why isn’t my magic replenishing?”
She muttered quietly to herself.
It felt as if she were scraping the last bits of water from a dried-up well, or driving a car that had run out of fuel.
Her magic, which had been replenishing slowly, had finally reached its limit. The magic she was expelling now seemed to be the last of it.
“…No way.”
Feeling a sense of dread, Se-ah glared at Woo-jin.
For some reason, Woo-jin had emerged from the Reversed World to face her. It was a mystery she couldn’t quite grasp.
But now, she could guess the answer to that mystery.
“You did something, didn’t you, senior?”
Se-ah smirked coldly.
“That’s why I can’t help but like you, senior….”
Her voice carried a sigh, a mix of frustration and amusement, as she realized she had fallen into Woo-jin’s trap. Her emotions were conflicted.
There was no choice now.
She would have to end it with her final magical formula.
At that moment, Se-ah sensed a chilling magic from behind her. She quickly turned her head.
Far off in the distance, Goliath hovered in mid-air, preparing to throw a punch. His fist, wrapped in black magic that distorted space and time, swirled with golden energy.
Falling debris warped and stretched unnaturally, as if being sucked into his fist.
Thump.
Thump!
Thump!
The magic swirling around Goliath’s fist grew larger in stages, gaining mass.
The power of a black hole, manifesting in magical form. Although not a true black hole, its destructive force was undeniable.
That fist would distort and destroy everything, even space and time.
Se-ah’s confident smile cracked. She glared at Goliath with her crimson eyes, her face filled with fury.
“Goliath, are you seriously going that far?! If you unleash a destructive force like that, Neo Seoul… all the people…!”
The city would be destroyed, and all the citizens would lose their lives.
“Shut up…!”
Goliath laughed boisterously as he shouted.
“This is the blow that will defeat you…!”
His unique ability:
Graviton Mastery
. Secret technique:
Magical Formula Type 5, Event Horizon
.
The pinnacle of destructive power. There was no one in Neo Seoul who could withstand it.
Se-ah narrowed her eyes.
What she envisioned was the future. The development of Neo Seoul, and the happiness of countless people.
Her desires and hopes were all genuine.
To achieve that, she had used the Principal’s love. She had accepted the sacrifices the Principal made for the future, embracing them for the sake of her utopia.
In other words, her "twisted altruism" was Se-ah’s fatal flaw.
Her
Paradox Creation
ability, the secret technique of
Fate Recalibration
, was also nothing more than a means to suppress the current chaos and bring order by defeating Woo-jin and Goliath.
Goliath had figured out her intentions and made his move.
He knew that she would not be able to fully block his blow and would be destroyed.
“Ahaha…”
Her long, dark hair cast a shadow over her face.
A hollow laugh escaped her lips.
And then.
“Hahahahahaha!!! Hahahahahaha!!!”
Se-ah alternated her gaze between Woo-jin and Goliath, pressing her forehead with one hand and laughing maniacally.
“This is fun…! So much fun…! To think that this might be my final trial…!”
Se-ah lifted her head.
Despite her laughter just moments ago, her face had turned cold and expressionless.
Her sharp gaze fixed on Woo-jin.
“Come at me.”
Whooosh!
Se-ah’s entire body became engulfed in red magic. Soon, her form transformed into that of a massive monster.
A demonic figure shaped like a female.
[Let’s settle this once and for all, everyone.]
Her voice echoed eerily.
This was the signal.
“This is what I’ve been waiting for!!!”
Goliath’s booming voice echoed across the battlefield.
And then.
BOOOOOM!
A deafening explosion and a sonic boom tore through the air.
Goliath, unleashing a powerful shockwave, flew through the air like a jet toward Se-ah.
He drove his fist, infused with the power of
Event Horizon
, straight at her.
Se-ah’s magical wings glowed with a brilliant light.
Kwoooom!
The red magic from the Reversed World clashed with Goliath’s fist.
The black hole-like swirling magic attempted to tear apart Se-ah’s red magic, but the sheer power contained in her fist resisted it, resulting in a deadlock.
The immense shockwave rippled across the center area, sweeping everything in its path.
The students braced themselves, deploying defensive formations, but the collapsing ground and powerful wind forced them to be blown out of the center area.
“Hahahahaha!!!”
Amidst the fierce clash, Goliath’s thunderous laughter echoed. Meanwhile, the red ring continued to shrink and fade away.
And then, as the red magic began to be absorbed into Goliath’s
Event Horizon
,
Goliath shouted at the top of his lungs.
“This is it, Ahn Woo-jin!!!”
A massive explosion reverberated.
A barrage of cracks, filled with the collective power and weapons of the students, converged on Se-ah in a single, focused strike.
At the same time, Woo-jin, surrounded by fierce lightning and the flames of the goblin club, charged toward Se-ah.
Se-ah, having saved some of her strength for Woo-jin, extended her red magic-infused arm toward him, spreading her hand wide.
The numerous eyes embedded in the arm flashed, emitting a crimson light aimed at Woo-jin.
However.
Kwooooom!!!
Suddenly, multiple bolts of spatial lightning filled the air, illuminating the battlefield and converging on Se-ah’s arm from all sides.
Se-ah, struggling to withstand Goliath’s
Event Horizon
, couldn’t defend against the onslaught of lightning strikes. Her massive red-armored arm was burned and torn away.
Woo-jin, accompanied by the power of the students, dove straight toward Se-ah.
“Let’s end this.”
With a cold statement, he swung the sword and the goblin club in a powerful horizontal strike.
Kwagagagak!!!!
The combined might of Baek-seo’s magic, the goblins’ fire, and the students’ power erupted in a massive explosion, engulfing Se-ah.
A brilliant flash of light enveloped the world.
The magical energy from Woo-jin’s sword and the goblin club consumed Se-ah’s magic, eventually obliterating it.
The power of
Event Horizon
also annihilated itself along with
Paradox Creation
.
Woo-jin’s weapon and Goliath’s fist pierced through Se-ah’s massive form, launching her downward.
BOOOOOM!
A massive magical explosion swept across the center area.
The ominous magic that had grown Se-ah’s form scattered into pieces, and her body was sent flying into the abyss below.
Her entire body was shattered. The armor she had constructed from the Reversed World’s magic had barely saved her from instant death.
But she had no magic left to reshape reality.
As Se-ah’s broken body plummeted toward the ground, staring death in the face, she gauged the extent of the explosion’s damage.
It seemed to have been contained within the center area.
At least, that was a relief, Se-ah thought.
‘I’ve lost, senior… How foolish. But I guess there’s no helping it now.’
A self-mocking smile spread across Se-ah’s lips.
‘It’s time for the villain to exit the stage.’
Se-ah disappeared beyond the cliff, and the magic from the Reversed World turned to ash, scattering like smoke in the wind.
The cracks that Woo-jin had formed in the ground vanished, and the falling debris from the buildings filled the remaining gaps in the earth.
Finally, Woo-jin and Goliath dispelled their magical techniques, and the ruined center area returned to a peaceful night sky.

chapters.title: Chapter 124
chapters.content:
The hidden underground escape route beneath the Central Tower.
Principal Lee Doo-hee was desperately clawing at the mechanical wall, her nails torn and bleeding. Despite Chae-yeon’s death, the exit remained firmly sealed.
This indicated that it wasn’t simply something created with magic, but an invention of pure ingenuity.
It had clearly been prepared beforehand.
There had never been a need to inspect this underground escape route.
From the beginning, Chae-yeon had planned to obstruct the principal in secret.
"Grrr...! Grrraaa..."
The principal’s face twisted as she scratched at the solid mechanical wall, eventually turning to look toward Chae-yeon.
Blood-soaked and lifeless.
Though her head hung low, there was a faint smile of satisfaction on her resentful face.
As if to say,
Serves you right.
The members of the Do-hwa faction assisting in the escape, along with Lee Jeong-mi, all met their end at Chae-yeon’s hands. It was the result of her risking everything in battle.
And then—
Rumble!
“Ugh...!”
The escape route shook violently, a tremendous roar echoing from above. The principal was thrown to the ground.
She realized it must be Woo-jin’s magical formula—
Heaven’s Reversal
—unraveling.
Had Se-ah won?
No.
Lee Se-ah’s magic, which had been felt so vividly even here, had vanished like a ghost.
"Se-ah’s magic...?"
The principal’s face paled. She slumped to the ground, staring blankly at her injured leg.
"My daughter... Se-ah..."
Se-ah had lost.
Se-ah... was dead.
She looked down at her own hands.
Everything she had worked to build...
Had ended with her daughter’s death.
Cough!
“Principal... ma’am...”
At that moment, Song Ye-seo of Spartoi came to, coughing up blood as she surveyed the surroundings.
“This... can’t be... is this...?”
Ye-seo pieced the situation together.
"...My dear."
"Principal...?"
Ye-seo looked at the principal’s face and swallowed nervously.
It was an expression of someone who had given up everything.
“There’s somewhere I must go... And I’ll give you one last order...”
Ye-seo, with great difficulty, stood up and forced a smile.
“Yes... Whatever order you give...”
Thud.
Goliath landed on the ground, his clothes tattered.
Crack.
Woo-jin returned as well, gracefully warping through space to arrive. His school uniform was also reduced to rags.
“Hah... Hah...”
Woo-jin caught his breath, struggling for air.
Dust and debris swirled around them. It was easy to infer that the Central Area had been reduced to ruins.
Crackle...
Heaven’s Sword
had reached its limit and crumbled to dust.
It had absorbed the full force of Baek-seo’s ultimate technique combined with Woo-jin’s maximum magical output. A weapon incapable of handling such immense power had met a spectacular end.
Baek-seo must have anticipated this outcome.
Woo-jin decided to think about the broken
Heaven’s Sword
later.
Immediately after, the goblin club also shattered and burst into flames before disappearing. Now, Woo-jin was left empty-handed.
Nothing remained of the Central Tower’s location. It appeared to have collapsed under the strain of the battle.
Woo-jin looked around once more, concerned about Goliath’s condition. But the explosion’s aftermath and the dust clouded his vision, making it impossible to see where Goliath was.
Thump.
"...!"
Suddenly, his heart pounded, and excruciating pain began to spread through his body.
It was the penalty of his
Territory Domination
ability.
Just before Woo-jin succumbed to the pain—
Wham.
A golden-haired girl appeared out of nowhere and threw herself into Woo-jin’s arms.
It was Geumyang.
Instantly, the pain subsided.
Only the soreness from his battle with Se-ah remained.
“You’ve done well.”
“...You too.”
After absorbing Woo-jin’s penalty, Geumyang gently pulled away from his embrace.
“Is the task done?”
Geumyang nodded.
“What about the King of the Reversed World?”
“Thanks to you and Goliath defeating Lee Se-ah, the contract-holder has vanished. It seems the principal had bound her to the contract. So, with Se-ah’s death, the contract was nullified. The Reversed World has decided to withdraw, the trapped souls are freed... In other words, they’ve ascended.”
Geumyang shrugged.
“That’s it?”
“No, it’s only natural for there to be anger after losing something they invested so much effort into. But that’s all. The resources the King had been using were destroyed, so now he has to search for something new.”
Geumyang made a circle with her thumb and forefinger, signaling money.
“So, at that moment, I offered him something else.”
“Something else?”
“A meticulous deity like myself always has something good prepared.”
Geumyang grinned smugly.
“What did you offer?”
“I introduced him to the Goblin King.”
“The Goblin King?”
“Yes, it’s from our world. The Goblin World has the energy resources that the Reversed World needs, similar to human souls but consisting of memories and emotions, though they aren’t truly alive.”
The penalty imposed on Kim Dal-bi through her contract with the Goblin King.
It involved precious memories and the accompanying emotions.
Such concepts, gathered from various creatures, could be used as energy resources in the Goblin World.
And the Reversed World could use them as power.
“Furthermore, the Reversed World amplifies those memories and emotions to generate new strength. That was the source of Lee Se-ah’s power. If provided to the Goblin World, it would create substantial added value. Heh heh...”
To Woo-jin, the explanation was incomprehensible.
However, it seemed that the King of the Reversed World and the Goblin King had found a mutually beneficial relationship.
“So it’s a business deal.”
“In this world, things aren’t that different. Anyway, I dangled the carrot, and the King took the offer. And with that, the situation was resolved.”
Geumyang puffed out her chest with pride.
“It was all thanks to me, warping through space and hopping between worlds as I pleased. Truly, this was my grand achievement!”
Her eyes sparkled, seeking praise.
“Yeah... Thanks. You did well. Things worked out thanks to you.”
“Hmph, yes. Now, keep praising—... No, never mind.”
“Why?”
Geumyang’s expression turned uneasy as something crossed her mind. She thought of Han Seo-jin.
“There’s something I need to tell you. That man, Na-mu... hmm?”
Geumyang suddenly stopped speaking and looked off into the distance. Woo-jin turned his head in the same direction.
Through the slowly settling dust, an elderly woman in a wheelchair appeared. It was Principal Lee Doo-hee.
The wheelchair was new, but the principal herself looked like she could collapse and die at any moment.
Behind her, pushing the wheelchair through the dust and blood, was the barely-conscious, battered Song Ye-seo.
“Finish it. We’ll talk later.”
“Mm.”
Geumyang warped through the cracks and disappeared.
Woo-jin observed as Principal Lee Doo-hee approached. The wheelchair came to a stop at a respectful distance from him.
“Principal... I’ve brought you here...”
“You’ve done well...”
Thud.
At last, Ye-seo collapsed to her knees, her strength spent.
“You... killed my daughter...”
The principal bowed her head.
Her shoulders trembled.
Her wrinkled face contorted as tears welled in her eyes.
“My daughter... I’m the one who drove her to this... I killed my own daughter...”
Her voice was filled with grief.
The principal’s hands, resting on the armrest of her wheelchair, trembled violently.
“Say what you came to say. Stop rambling.”
Woo-jin’s tone was firm.
Even the principal’s sorrow over her daughter’s death couldn’t stir any sympathy from Woo-jin.
He didn’t care about the principal’s past. The atrocities she had committed were unforgivable.
After a moment, the principal wiped her eyes with her broken hand, composed herself, and looked directly at Woo-jin again.
“I’ve lost. You’ve won. I was too arrogant, it seems...”
“...”
“When The Hole appeared in the Pacific and released the Golden Sheep and numerous monsters... the world became hell. I lost my parents to the monsters... I lost my sister.”
The principal’s voice was calm as she continued.
“This city was built as an academy for the new humanity, prioritizing knowledge and education. But I didn’t believe it was the right choice for humanity. I wanted to take back the world, to reshape this city into something better. Or maybe... I just couldn’t let go of my anger...”
“And so?”
“But in the end, I couldn’t change this city. Neither my body nor time was enough to transform it... So I created my daughter using my own DNA. I entrusted her with everything...”
The principal lowered her head.
“I was supposed to pass everything to her... slowly... In the end, I would give my life so that my daughter could succeed in the revolution, becoming the true ruler of Neo Seoul... That’s why I kept myself alive at the bare minimum...”

chapters.title: Chapter 125
chapters.content:
The principal turned her head towards the collapsed Central Tower.
"But human emotions are so insignificant... Over time, as I grew older, my memories faded and my intelligence deteriorated... and eventually, my daughter was all that remained. Desires fade as the years pile up..."
"So, you decided to live for Lee Se-ah? Without even realizing you were being used?"
"I knew I was being used..."
The principal looked back at Woo-jin.
"I believed my daughter could accomplish anything. I trusted that she would create something far better than I ever could... So, I gave her power. At the cost of dead children and the dark underbelly of this city, I gave her immense authority."
The "dead children" likely referred to the ones discarded in the process of raising her own personal soldiers.
"And even though that meant those children would suffer forever?"
"The sacrifice of the few for the benefit of the many. I accepted that... At first, it was difficult. I vomited every day and was plagued by nightmares. But eventually, I adapted. In time, it became routine, something I accepted without question."
The principal smiled bitterly, her eyes brimming with tears.
"Yes... I became the villain so that my daughter could inherit everything. I wanted her to lead this city the right way!"
"...."
"And now, this is my reward...! You were the price I had to pay...! I was a fool! I was... I was...! Ahh...!"
The principal grabbed her head and rocked back and forth, her wide, bloodshot eyes darting about as her hands tugged at her hair.
Losing her daughter—who had been everything to her—had shattered her sanity.
"I'm sorry... I'm so sorry... My daughter... Ah, my daughter... What was her name...? My daughter’s name... My daughter... My..."
"...."
"My... what was... it again..."
Perhaps the painful memories of Se-ah were too much to bear, and the principal’s mind slowly began to erase her.
Already suffering from dementia, the rapid deterioration wasn’t surprising.
And then—
Thunk!
"....!"
Suddenly, a blade shot out from behind the wheelchair, piercing the principal's chest.
Woo-jin was shocked.
It was Ye-seo, who had used her last bit of strength to stab the principal.
The principal looked down in disbelief at the blade embedded in her torso.
Ye-seo managed to speak, her voice strained.
"Lee Se-ah... your daughter."
"Ah...."
"Do you remember now?"
The principal's face gradually softened, as if finding peace.
"...Thanks to you."
Ye-seo smiled faintly.
"I've carried out your final order... You asked me to end your life before you forgot your daughter completely... It was an honor to serve you, Principal. I'm only sorry I couldn’t see you realize your dream."
The principal’s head slowly drooped.
Her labored breaths grew fainter.
At last, she slumped lifelessly in her wheelchair.
Thud.
Ye-seo collapsed to the ground and looked up at Woo-jin.
"Disciplinary Director..."
"Why did you follow the principal?"
"Why? Now of all times...?"
Ye-seo smiled broadly.
"I hated this academy city... That's why I thought standing with the one in power was better... It was like walking a tightrope... Heh heh... How worldly of me..."
For the first time, Woo-jin noticed the scars.
Between the torn pieces of her nun’s habit and uniform, scars were visible. Scars too old for healing magic to repair.
"This city was hell for some people..."
Without her saying it, Woo-jin understood why Ye-seo always wore a nun’s habit that covered her entire body.
"That’s all I can offer you..."
"...."
"Now, I’ll return to my Lord’s side... I pray that your path is filled with peace and happiness, Director."
With the blood-stained knife that had pierced the principal, Ye-seo stabbed her own heart and died instantly.
She had already been close to death; the fact that she’d held on this long was a testament to her willpower.
Now that she had finished her last task, she allowed herself to fall into the eternal sleep she had resisted for so long.
"...Pathetic, even to the end."
Woo-jin muttered softly as he looked at the two bodies. He turned away from the principal and Ye-seo, walking through the ruins of the devastated street.
They were left behind, in the ruins.
"?"
At that moment, Goliath appeared in Woo-jin's sight. He stopped walking and looked at him.
Goliath’s clothes were in tatters, and his right arm—the one that had clashed with Se-ah’s power—was completely ruined.
‘Wait, his body...?’
It wasn’t just damaged; red energy was pulsing through his skin, even seeping into his neck.
It was the energy of the Reversed World.
"You..."
Woo-jin's eyes widened.
He recalled Se-ah’s words.
That taking a direct hit from her technique would bring death closer.
The power had left its mark on Goliath, much like radiation poisoning from a distant nuclear explosion. It seemed the aftermath of the battle had successfully infiltrated his body.
Yet Goliath grinned, baring his large teeth, completely unfazed, as he walked forward.
As if he had expected this outcome.
Rumble!
Suddenly, a fierce wind of energy erupted from Goliath’s body.
It was clear battle intent.
Woo-jin narrowed his eyes.
Though they had fought the same enemy just moments ago, Woo-jin knew what kind of man Goliath was.
Goliath had only one thrill left—Woo-jin.
Boom!
As Goliath planted his foot, the ground beneath him cracked.
Whip!
Woo-jin pulled his iron rod from his belt, extending it with a swift motion.
Crackle!
Electric blue lightning surged along the iron rod.
Thud!!
Goliath launched himself at Woo-jin, his fist cloaked in a gravitational wave.
Woo-jin met the path of Goliath’s fist with a spatial rift, swinging his iron rod at the same time.
"!"
Goliath’s fist broke through the rift, but Woo-jin’s iron rod struck him square in the torso.
Crackle!!
Boom!!
The shockwave of electricity sent Goliath flying. Yet, as he landed, he casually crossed his arms, standing tall.
Rumble!
Despite the powerful impact, Goliath’s body skidded along the ground, but he used his gravitational control to stop himself from being knocked over.
Eventually, he came to a stop.
Woo-jin remained on guard, while Goliath, still smiling, stared back at him.
Crack.
"You two!! What do you think you're doing!?"
A crack appeared in the air, and from it, Geumyang emerged, shouting.
"Heh heh... Isn’t it obvious?"
"Of course it’s obvious! And look at your body—!"
Goliath ignored Geumyang’s warning and laughed, taking a fighting stance.
"All that’s left is you, Ahn Woo-jin. Do you know how long I’ve waited for you to get stronger? Now it’s time to entertain me...!"
"We were temporary allies. Isn’t it polite to at least build up to this properly?"
"Hahahaha! I don’t care about that!"
Goliath’s golden eyes flashed.
"I figured you were ‘the right one,’ better than that boring trash like the principal! That means this ends with me!"
Woo-jin’s eyes widened slightly.
Only now did he understand Goliath’s intent.
"You little brats, what kind of—"
"Geumyang, go."
"What?"
Woo-jin threw off his jacket and rolled up his sleeves, revealing his muscular arms.
He approached Goliath.
"I also thought this journey would end with you. Finally, we’ve reached this point..."
Woo-jin’s cold eyes burned with fighting spirit.
He recalled their conversations and his knowledge of the original story.
What was Goliath’s real purpose?
He had been watching to see what true justice for Neo Seoul looked like.
And he had decided to stand against the side he thought represented it, making himself the villain.
Thus, Goliath became the most notorious villain in the city.
He had terrorized Neo Seoul, primarily causing property damage and taking down the city's strongest figures.
But he had never actually killed anyone.
Goliath had chosen to play the villain.
In his mind, if justice couldn’t defeat him, it wasn’t worth being called justice. He had planned to cultivate his own version of a new world.
And in that world, he had been waiting for a true hero to rise up and defeat him.
—
“What I want is a hero. A hero for this city...”
Woo-jin remembered Goliath’s words.
That was it.
Goliath had been waiting for a hero to defeat him.
"It wasn’t you who waited for me."
Goliath tore off the remains of his tattered shirt, laughing boldly.
"I’ve been waiting for you!"
Goliath had chosen Woo-jin.
Now he intended to fight Woo-jin to confirm if he was the hero he had been waiting for.
Looking at Goliath’s body, consumed by Se-ah’s magic, it was clear he didn’t have much time left.
Goliath was burning through the last of his life.
Woo-jin accepted his sincerity.
Whip!
Woo-jin drew another rod from his belt and swung it. As it extended into a three-section staff, the
Wall Breaker
revealed itself.
Woo-jin’s turquoise eyes locked with Goliath’s golden ones.
"I’ll enforce justice and punish the criminal."
Crackle!
The blue lightning surged from both the iron rod and the three-section staff in Woo-jin’s hands. He took his stance.
"...Let’s finish this."
The final showdown between the strongest in Neo Seoul, the culmination of Woo-jin’s journey as the Disciplinary Director.
Goliath.
This was the end of the line.

chapters.title: Chapter 126
chapters.content:
What is freedom?
It is the fluttering of a bird's wings as it soars through the vast sky.
It is the steady journey of a sturdy ship navigating the boundless sea.
Freedom means there is no place you cannot go, nowhere you cannot set foot.
That was the kind of freedom Goliath pursued.
But what was Neo Seoul to Goliath?
Even though it was his homeland, it was merely a small pasture compared to the vast world, a place where humans fought to survive within its narrow confines.
Yet, humans are creatures of conflict, are they not? Even within that small pasture, they never ceased fighting, using schemes and trickery to secure their positions.
Indeed.
That is the nature of humans.
Goliath felt alive when he fought against the strong. He roamed outside the city, engaging in fierce battles with monsters.
He relished the vast world to his heart's content.
But what had all those countless battles given Goliath?
How had they changed him?
What desires had they stirred within him?
The answer lay here, now.
Boom!
As Goliath launched himself off the ground, a sonic boom echoed around him. His body shot forward like a cannonball, his fist clenched, aimed directly at Woo-jin.
Roar!
The gravitational waves gathered around his fist, turning it into a blow that would not merely destroy but warp Woo-jin’s entire body upon impact.
The fist of Neo Seoul’s strongest.
His unique ability,
Graviton Mastery
.
The second technique,
Ultimate Fist
.
Woo-jin didn’t charge in recklessly.
Crack.
A rift appeared in the air as space itself split open. Woo-jin leaped into the rift, looking for an opening to strike.
“I won’t let you escape!”
Goliath followed, diving into the rift after Woo-jin.
Inside the wormhole.
Goliath quickly caught up to Woo-jin.
Startled, Woo-jin instinctively raised his iron rod and three-section staff, crossing them defensively. His body moved purely out of reflex.
Goliath’s massive, bandaged fist unleashed a gravitational wave as it targeted Woo-jin.
Woo-jin’s electrified iron rod and staff met Goliath’s fist head-on, creating a shockwave that reverberated throughout the wormhole.
Boom!
The massive amount of magical energy that flowed through the wormhole shook violently as the dense forces collided, creating a powerful impact.
Both Woo-jin and Goliath were thrown back.
They flew through opposite ends of the wormhole, tumbling back into the real world as they skidded across the ground.
Crash!!
Even as he flew through the air, Goliath regained his footing and stabilized himself.
Both men bore the blessing of the
Golden Sheep
.
A surprise attack, using spatial manipulation to avoid Goliath’s strikes, wouldn’t work against him.
Crack!
In an instant, Woo-jin reappeared before Goliath, using spatial warping to close the distance.
Simultaneously, the air was filled with countless cracks.
Rumble!
From these cracks, bolts of lightning erupted, raining down upon Goliath.
The powerful lightning surged like a serpent, chasing Goliath as Woo-jin charged in with his iron rod.
Then—
Boom!!
“!”
The ground suddenly shattered beneath their feet, rising into the air. Woo-jin was thrown into the sky along with the debris.
Whoosh!
The building rubble and Woo-jin’s body quickly ascended.
"Gravity... reversed!"
Woo-jin kicked off a piece of floating debris and positioned himself beneath another. Now, he was hanging upside down, like a bat.
It was Goliath’s third technique,
Gravity Reversal
.
Goliath had also risen into the air, dodging the lightning attack by using the floating debris.
He kicked off a chunk of building, rocketing towards Woo-jin once more.
Roar!
Again, Goliath’s fist was enveloped in a powerful gravitational wave.
Crackle!
Woo-jin activated his three-section staff. Blue-green lightning crackled from the staff like chains, electrifying the air around him.
The wave of lightning followed Woo-jin as he swung his staff toward Goliath.
Boom!!
The thunderous explosion echoed as the massive electric storm enveloped Goliath.
But Goliath’s gravitational wave punched through the storm and continued its trajectory toward Woo-jin.
Woo-jin was caught in the shockwave and flung backward at tremendous speed, flying through the air like an arrow or a comet.
He streaked across the sky before crashing into a large rock.
Boom!
“Cough...!”
Woo-jin coughed up blood.
The rock crumbled as dust rose into the air, the acrid smell stinging his nose.
He looked around.
The dust quickly settled, revealing a strange sight.
A sky transformed into a swirl of strange colors due to the corrupted magic of monsters.
Trees drained of their green hues.
The ground marred with massive footprints.
This surreal landscape...
“Did I get thrown outside...?”
The world beyond the land blessed by the
Golden Sheep
.
A desolate wasteland, where the monsters’ magical corruption and radiation had rendered it uninhabitable for most humans.
This was the outside world.
At his current rank of seven, Woo-jin could withstand the air of the outside world thanks to his enhanced physical abilities.
‘This might actually be for the best.’
Woo-jin rose to his feet, gripping his iron rod and three-section staff.
A battle with Goliath would have caused severe damage to Neo Seoul. It was better to fight here.
Whoosh!
Boom!
Goliath crashed down in front of Woo-jin like a meteor, kicking up a cloud of dust. From within that dust, Goliath’s confident smile appeared, meeting Woo-jin’s gaze.
“First time in the outside world?”
“Yeah... thanks for the sightseeing.”
“No need for thanks...!”
Goliath grinned.
It was a joke, and Woo-jin caught onto it.
‘He’s been hurt.’
Woo-jin noticed that Goliath’s left fist trembled slightly. He had managed to land a significant blow.
Goliath’s right arm was unusable.
If Woo-jin could somehow disable his left arm, his chances of victory would increase.
Woo-jin smirked to himself.
If Goliath had been in perfect condition, how could he have possibly hoped to win?
Unlike the original story, the
Great Eater’s
ultimate technique had targeted Woo-jin instead of Goliath.
Had he not fought Se-ah, Goliath would have been invincible.
But Woo-jin dismissed those thoughts.
The sight of a man burning through his final moments stirred something inside him.
He felt a strange connection to Goliath’s sense of joy.
He extended his three-section staff once again and took a battle stance.
“Stop stalling. Come at me.”
“Hahaha!! Of course...!”
Boom!
Woo-jin and Goliath charged at each other once again.
Crash!!
Their fierce battle shook the battlefield as they clashed.
Woo-jin’s fourth magical technique,
Heaven’s Reversal
, inverted the sky and earth, while lightning and rain poured down like a storm.
Goliath’s third technique,
Gravity Reversal
, turned gravity in various directions, creating chaos across the battlefield.
They attacked and defended with all their strength, and as the battle continued, the entire landscape became unrecognizable.
Rumble!
A bolt of lightning struck down.
Woo-jin’s iron rod pierced through Goliath’s body, sending a surge of high-voltage electricity through him. The shockwave crushed Goliath’s internal organs, but he still grinned as his body flew through the debris, crashing into the ground.
Wham!
Goliath’s fist slammed into Woo-jin’s abdomen, sending him flying once again.
The gravitational wave distorted Woo-jin’s insides, causing him to cough up blood as he shot through the air at breakneck speed.
Clenching his teeth, Woo-jin kicked off the floating debris, using spatial warping to propel himself back toward Goliath.
Rumble!
Another wave of spatial lightning crashed down on Goliath.
Boulders and debris, controlled by Goliath’s gravitational powers, flew towards Woo-jin in return.
Whoosh!
A massive crack opened in the sky, releasing molten lava onto Goliath. The scorching lava poured over his body.
“Hahaha...! Feels like a hot spring!”
But Goliath remained unscathed, as though he had merely taken a shower.
Woo-jin chuckled to himself. This was exactly what he expected.
That’s what made Goliath worthy of being Neo Seoul’s strongest.
Rumble!
The crack in the sky grew even wider.
There had been limits to the range in the Central Area, but here, Woo-jin unleashed his full power.
The massive crack filled the sky, blocking out the heavens, and even from distant Neo Seoul, its overwhelming presence could be felt.
Far away, the citizens of the city watched in awe, holding their breath as they witnessed the clash of magical forces.
Boom!
The debris that had been falling from the sky was halted mid-air by Goliath’s
Gravity Manipulation
.
Woo-jin and Goliath stood on separate chunks of floating debris, staring each other down.
“Hah... hah...”
Woo-jin caught his breath, locking eyes with Goliath. Se-ah’s magic had left deep scars across Goliath’s body, and they had spread even further, consuming him.
Goliath’s body was weakened—he was at the brink of death. In fact, it was a wonder he was still standing at all.
Yet, Goliath’s grin remained, unwavering.
“You think you can take me down like this?” Goliath shouted, spreading his broken right arm and shaking left arm wide.
“I’m right here! Come at me!”
“…Fine.”
Woo-jin slowly raised his right arm. His heart pounded in his chest as he pushed himself beyond his limits, summoning the full power of his
Spatial Domination
ability.
His magic surged violently, threatening to tear him apart from within. It was as if his body was on fire, the sensation of his own energy burning him alive.
But Woo-jin didn’t fight it. He let himself be consumed by the energy, closing his eyes and embracing the overwhelming power.
He had already reached the threshold.
He hadn’t even realized it, but he had been knocking on the door of the eighth rank all along.
All that was left was to break through.
“I’m coming.”
As if waiting for this moment, Woo-jin’s body finally accepted the surge of energy. The power that had been raging inside him suddenly calmed and stabilized.
The magic now enveloped him like a warm breeze, soothing the burning sensation.
Woo-jin’s skin began to glow faintly, a soft, radiant light emanating from his body. His presence seemed to grow stronger by the second.
Slowly, he opened his eyes.
His irises shimmered with a blend of deep blue and violet, the colors of his unique ability shining with an otherworldly glow.
Goliath’s eyes widened in awe. The magic radiating from Woo-jin had become even more potent in just a brief moment.
"Heh… hahaha!!" Goliath burst into laughter, his voice filled with wild joy.
“You’ve done it! You’ve reached the eighth rank! You’re making this so damn fun, Ahn Woo-jin!!!”
The eighth rank.
The realm of the
Argonaut
, a level Goliath had reached long ago.
Now, Woo-jin had finally caught up.

chapters.title: Chapter 127
chapters.content:
The purest energy flowed through Ahn Woo-jin's body. His abilities had already surpassed the current level, allowing him to wield power far beyond others at the same tier.
"Haaa!"
Infinite energy surged through his right arm, extending outward into the sky and beyond.
Crack!!
A tear in the sky expanded all the way to space. Layers upon layers of similar-sized cracks spread across the heavens.
And then—
Roarrrrr!
"…!"
A terrifying shockwave reverberated from beyond the tear in the sky, and Goliath looked up in shock.
—"Ahn Woo-jin, did you know that the first murder committed by humankind was done with a stone?"
Suddenly, Goliath remembered the conversation he once had with Woo-jin.
A stone.
The very first murder weapon of humanity.
And according to the Bible, wasn’t it a stone that David used to bring down Goliath?
Goliath's heart raced, exhilarated by the sheer thrill of the moment.
Rumble!
Finally, the entity descending through the tear revealed itself. Its size was so massive it couldn't be fully captured by sight.
A gigantic boulder, enveloped in fire and green lightning, saturated with all of Woo-jin's power, was plummeting toward them.
It was a meteor.
It descended through the layers of tears in the sky, growing stronger and faster, radiating unstoppable force and awe across the world.
Unique ability: Spatial Domination. Ultimate technique. Magic Formula #5, "Heavenly Thunder Meteor Strike."
The meteor's brilliance illuminated the darkened world. Goliath, mouth agape in astonishment, finally burst into laughter.
"With that attack, at least half the Earth will be destroyed!"
"Then stop it if you can," Woo-jin replied coldly.
"Hahahaha! You're making this fun!"
Goliath clenched his fists, releasing all his remaining power.
Whooosh!
In his left fist, he concentrated the power of a black hole.
Unique ability: Graviton Mastery. Ultimate technique. Magic Formula #5, "Event Horizon."
Although his strength had weakened from his previous battle with Se-ah, it didn’t matter.
He was going to pour everything into this final strike.
Taking his stance—
‘When was it?’
As the Heavenly Thunder Meteor Strike filled his vision, Goliath's mind wandered back to the first time he looked out at Neo Seoul from beyond the walls.
He realized then how small his world had been.
The laws and morals humanity constructed within the boundaries of society were there just to keep that tiny world in balance.
It was simple, really.
The world was vast, and a single stone could kill a man.
That was the futile truth of life.
Yet, because of that, wasn’t the sight of humanity striving to create meaning in such a small, ordered world beautiful?
‘Beloved world.’
Goliath cherished the home that humanity had built.
He wanted Neo Seoul to become a better place.
But the definition of "right" varied from person to person, and without knowing the future, there was no way to tell what consequences each person's "rightness" would bring.
So Goliath watched, unsure if anyone's justice would bring the change the world needed. All he could do was witness the fate of his beloved city.
But one thing was clear.
Anyone who could overcome the adversity that Goliath represented, armed only with strength, could be trusted with everything.
So, beloved world—
‘Prepare to meet your hero!’
With that thought, Goliath hurled himself toward the meteor, roaring like a beast as he swung his fist.
For a moment, there was silence as the world seemed to freeze.
And then—
Boom!
The meteor shattered upon impact, absorbed into Goliath's fist. But it was so large that shards of it branched off, transforming into smaller meteors that rained down upon the outer world.
The staggering collision of their powers unleashed a destructive shockwave, sweeping across the land and turning everything to ruin.
Countless beasts in the distance met an unexpected death.
The floating ground was blown apart, and the shockwave reached as far as Neo Seoul, shattering the barren outskirts into pieces.
Woo-jin and Goliath’s powers, having exhausted themselves, slowly began to fade.
They were both caught in the shockwave and lost consciousness, crashing into the deep crater that had formed around them.
Explosions continued to echo across the world.
Many things were destroyed, and the air was filled with the noise of devastation.
And then… time passed.
...Drop.
In the mysterious sky of the outer world, a newfound silence began to fill the air.
“Ugh… cough! Haah…”
Woo-jin regained consciousness, groaning in pain.
His ears rang, but he had no time to dwell on it.
His hands were empty. He had no idea where his Iron Dragon Staff and his Tri-Segmented Staff had gone.
His priority was to stand up.
With a body at the brink of collapse, Woo-jin braced himself against the ground and managed to stagger to his feet.
“Haah… haah…”
The penalty?
He could still feel the effects lingering in his body. It seemed the penalty had passed while he was unconscious.
Exhausted, Woo-jin turned his gaze to where he sensed movement.
There was Goliath.
Even after losing consciousness, he still stood tall.
His body was covered in deadly wounds, and Se-ah’s magic had claimed half of his form.
“Hmph…”
Goliath’s eyes regained their light.
He had awakened.
With heavy steps, he freed his foot from the ground and began walking toward Woo-jin.
A menacing figure.
Grinning widely with his large, sharp teeth exposed, Goliath appeared like an indestructible gladiator.
Woo-jin couldn't help but smile silently.
The man was infuriatingly resilient.
His muscles, bones, and organs screamed in pain. Every part of him wanted to collapse right then and there.
But more than anything, the overwhelming desire to bring down the man before him burned brighter than all the pain.
If Goliath was going to burn through his final moments, then Woo-jin would, too.
He stood tall.
His tattered school uniform clung to him. Tearing off the bothersome half-sleeves revealed his muscular arms. He clenched his fists, assuming the stance of a boxer preparing for one last fight in the ring.
He was ready to see Goliath’s end.
Goliath took one look at Woo-jin’s stance, his eyes widening before he let out a chuckle, clenching his own fist.
His right arm was completely destroyed, twitching like a malfunctioning robotic limb.
His right leg, too, had given up after the last few steps.
Goliath knew half his body had already been ruined by Se-ah's magic.
But his left arm still moved. His left leg still worked.
He could still fight.
And that made him happy.
Both fighters had run out of power.
They couldn’t even reinforce their bodies anymore, but that didn’t matter. Just reaching the 8th tier had placed them within the realm of the strongest.
Without a word, Woo-jin dashed forward.
Goliath, leaving his dead right leg behind, pushed off the ground with his left and lunged.
Bam!
Woo-jin’s fist connected with Goliath’s torso, and Goliath’s fist crashed into Woo-jin’s body. Both men grunted in pain but smiled through it.
Punch.
They hit each other in the face.
Punch.
They blocked each other’s attacks, barely keeping up.
Kick!
Woo-jin landed a powerful kick to Goliath’s side.
It was a simple, straightforward fight.
Woo-jin’s mind could no longer function rationally. All he could do was throw his fists to end it.
But Goliath, whose life had already reached its limit, slowly lost strength and began to falter under Woo-jin’s relentless blows.
Finally, as Woo-jin raised his fist for one last strike—
Thud.
Goliath’s body gave out, and he collapsed, his energy drained completely.
Shallow breaths escaped Goliath's lips. Ragged gasps filled the air.
Finally, it was over, and Woo-jin’s body relaxed, forcing him to collapse to the ground.
Thud.
“Pant, pant…”
Woo-jin sat there, breathing heavily, staring at Goliath.
The battered man lay on his back, staring up at the sky.
The polluted skies of the outer world, tainted by the magic of the beasts, were strange and beautiful. Seeing it fill his vision, Goliath couldn’t help but let out a small laugh.
And then—
“…I’ve won.”
Woo-jin’s calm voice broke the silence.
“Hahaha… hahahahaha!!”
Goliath’s laughter boomed.
“Yes, I’ve lost…! Thanks to you, I fought to the very end…! I am grateful…!”
Covered in wounds, Goliath’s body was filled with the remnants of Se-ah’s magic, healing his injuries as his life force slowly faded away.
He could feel his life slipping away.
But his voice was stronger than ever.
“I accomplished everything I wanted…! I fought with those who wielded power, and I gave it my all…! What a romantic life I lived! I have no regrets at all…!”
Goliath’s golden eyes turned milky white, like someone who had gone blind. He could no longer see the beautiful sky.
With his last bit of strength, Goliath smiled wide and shouted his final words.
“What a joyous life it was…!”
Goliath’s voice echoed into the distance.
And then, silence.
The remnants of Se-ah’s magic, which had kept
Goliath’s voice echoed into the distance.
And then, silence.
The remnants of Se-ah’s magic, which had filled Goliath’s body, faded away, completing their task.
Goliath’s once vibrant form, now lifeless, lay motionless. His face, frozen in a wide grin, showed no trace of regret or sorrow.
“…Farewell.”
Woo-jin quietly bid Goliath his final goodbye, watching as the colossal man—who had fought to the very end—took his last breath.

chapters.title: Chapter 128
chapters.content:
"The defendant, Ahn Woo-jin, is acquitted."
In the Trial Academy, the AI judge rendered its verdict.
The spectators who had filled the courtroom rushed out to the front gates, where the representative student unfurled a large banner.
On the banner were the words:
[ NOT GUILTY ]
“Wooaaaahhhh!!!” “He’s innocent!!! Not guilty!!!”
The streets outside the school gates were packed with people who had been hoping for Ahn Woo-jin’s acquittal, and they erupted in cheers.
─ ... In other news, a case of monumental importance that will go down in history has reached its conclusion. Ahn Woo-jin, the Disciplinary Committee President of Aseong High School, led a rebellion against the late Headmaster Lee Doo-hee, which escalated into the major conflict involving Spartoi and the Hanyang Federal Academy, now known as the ‘Academy Great War.’ As the complex details of the incident came to light, the public was shocked, eagerly awaiting the verdict for those involved. Eventually, taking into account the unavoidable circumstances and the public interest, Ahn Woo-jin was acquitted...
It had been a month and a half since Ahn Woo-jin destroyed a part of Academy City.
As the truth of the incident unfolded, Neo Seoul erupted in outrage, and Woo-jin, along with the others who had rebelled against the Headmaster and the Martial Law Guards, was acquitted of all charges.
Given the highly unusual nature of the case, the fact that all eyes were on it, and the clarity of the evidence, the Trial Academy, aware of public sentiment, delivered a swift verdict.
The speed of the trial, enabled by the AI judge, was more procedural than anything else.
The facts were clear, and the entire population of Neo Seoul had risen in support of Woo-jin.
Though there was some criticism of Woo-jin for the destruction he had caused, most citizens argued that much of the damage had targeted the defense mechanisms set up by the late Headmaster, thus mitigating the legal severity of his actions.
Naturally, the student prosecutor did not appeal the ruling, and the case reached its final conclusion.
─ This is Park Dae-gi from Cheong-un High School. I’m currently at the Center Area, where cleanup efforts are underway. The remnants of the late Headmaster Lee Doo-hee’s regime are being removed, and plans are in place to reconstruct the area to make it safer...
─ Citizens’ anger toward the late Headmaster Lee Doo-hee escalated after the discovery of numerous children's bodies in the underground lair of techno-mancer Moon Chae-yeon, one of the Six Criminals. To honor the children who were unjustly sacrificed, a memorial is being established...
─ The factory-born children’s socialization programs, which have long been criticized for human rights violations, were continually defended by the late Headmaster Lee. These programs are now being dismantled, and more humane methods are being implemented for socialization processes...
─ In other news, an unprecedented suspended sentence has been granted to Kim Dal-bi, the Goblin, one of the Six Criminals. It was proven that she was forced into committing acts of terrorism due to the Headmaster’s threats, and despite this, she managed to avoid any loss of life. As a result, her resistance was recognized as the most humane possible. Her school, Aseong High, has decided not to expel her but to impose special educational requirements and community service...
The aftermath of the Academy Great War continued to dominate the news.
In response to the public’s demands, special agencies were established to monitor the Federal Council and the Hanyang Federal Academy's Student Council, weakening the absolute power of the Federal Council.
The fact that the Federal Council had hidden during the conflict out of fear of Woo-jin led to public backlash, further eroding their authority.
The position of Headmaster remained vacant, with a member of the Federal Council temporarily assuming the responsibilities. Elections for a new Headmaster were expected to be held soon.
“W-what?! Hanyang sent me a love call?!”
At Mahyeon High’s Disciplinary Committee, Chairman Lee Je-ho trembled as he read the official letter delivered by Vice-Chairman Shin Ga-yeon.
“Hrm, hrm!” Je-ho cleared his throat awkwardly.
The Student Council President had positively evaluated Je-ho's role in the Academy Great War and was trying to recruit him.
It was an opportunity to become a super-elite.
“You must be thrilled, Chairman. If you can join Hanyang, you’ll be more than a super-elite—a hyper-elite.”
“….”
Je-ho glanced at Ga-yeon. Her expression was calm, almost unnervingly so.
“Um, Vice-Chairman….”
“If you refuse because of me, I won’t let it go.”
“You won’t let it go? How?”
“I’ll get angry.”
Je-ho swallowed dryly, then adjusted his glasses with a cough.
“Hah….”
Je-ho leaned back in his chair.
Then, he tore the recruitment letter in half.
Ga-yeon gasped in shock.
“Chairman…!” “Do you think I’d go there? I don’t care about being a super-elite or a hyper-elite.” “…You’ve always talked about becoming an elite. Are you really not going because of me? I told you I’d be upset.” “It’s not because of you. It’s because the President is still here...!” “Siscon!”
Smack!
“Ugh!”
Ga-yeon punched Je-ho in the face.
“At least pretend it’s because of me! Do you know how much you’re hurting your girlfriend’s pride?!”
Smack! Smack!
“Y-you said you’d only get mad! What do you expect me to do?!” “You don’t understand a woman’s heart!”
As Ga-yeon hit him repeatedly, Je-ho couldn’t help but laugh. Ga-yeon was just too cute.
“Haha…!”
Seeing his smile, Ga-yeon shivered.
“Chairman, don’t tell me you’ve developed some kind of M tendencies…?” “No, absolutely not….”
Je-ho frowned, adamantly denying it.
Mahyeon High’s Disciplinary Committee had earned a massive mileage reward for their role in the Academy Great War, and Je-ho’s reputation continued to rise.
In another part of the city...
Kim Dal-bi leaned against her locker, staring intently at her smartphone, deep in thought.
Passing students glanced at her nervously.
“It’s the Goblin.” “What’s she up to?” “Looks suspicious….” “She’s scary. Is she plotting something?”
The students whispered quietly, but Dal-bi didn’t notice, too absorbed in her phone to care.
Now known to the world as one of the Six Criminals, Dal-bi had returned to Aseong High under her real identity, Kim Dal-bi.
Her true self, with long, flowing pink hair, was no longer in hiding.
Naturally, most students were still wary of her.
But that wasn’t Dal-bi’s biggest concern right now.
[ Hey, the weather’s nice today ]
She wrote a message on CoconutTalk, then deleted it.
“No, too casual. I need to be more direct…”
[ Want to grab lunch with me today? ]
Deleted.
“That’s too sudden...”
[ Hey Woo-jin, it’s me, Kim Dal-bi. Wanna— ]
[ The weather makes me crave bibimbap, how about— ]
[ What do you like for lunch, by the way? ]
[ Wanna grab some bibimbap with me? ]
[ Ahn Woo-jin! Come out! Let’s have lunch together! ]
And so, she kept typing and deleting messages over and over.
“Ugh…”
Dal-bi groaned, resting her forehead against her locker. Passersby flinched at the sight.
Her phone screen still showed her latest message draft.
The recipient? Ahn Woo-jin.
Dal-bi just wanted to have lunch with him.
But…
‘What should I write to make it sound natural?!’
She had been debating the message for over 20 minutes.
‘This is so frustrating! We’re still a little awkward with each other….’
Dal-bi sighed deeply and stared at her phone again.
“…Huh?”
Her face went pale as she realized what had happened.
[ Kim Dal-bi: Ahn Woo-jin! Come out! Let’s have lunch together ]
The message had been sent by mistake.
Thud!
Dal-bi collapsed to the ground, clutching her head in despair.
‘Nooooo!’
Dal-bi was mentally screaming in anguish.
Students watched from a distance, fascinated by the rollercoaster of expressions on her face.
‘What do I do? What do I do?! Can I delete it…?!’
She frantically searched for a way to retract the message.
But just as she was about to try, the ‘1’ indicator next to the message disappeared.
Woo-jin had read it.
‘He read it….’
Dal-bi’s world crumbled around her.
Her face flushed, her eyes spun in circles, and she grabbed at her hair.
‘He’s going to think I’m weird! No, he already thinks that! Why did I send something so embarrassing?! Ugh, I screwed up so bad!’
And just as she was about to wallow in despair—
Buzz.
Her phone vibrated, and Dal-bi looked at the screen.
[ Ahn Woo-jin: What do you want to eat? ] [ Ahn Woo-jin: Oh ] [ Ahn Woo-jin: I’ve got a list of places I wanted to try ] [ Ahn Woo-jin: Wanna check them out? ] [ Ahn Woo-jin: There are a lot of spots I wanted to take you to ] [ Ahn Woo-jin: (scratching-head dog emoji) ]
“Wow…!”
Sparkling, teary-eyed, Dal-bi’s face broke into a radiant smile.
Six whole replies, one of them even with a cute emoji!
To Dal-bi, this was a dream come true!
“Hehehe~.”
She hugged her phone to her chest, beaming with joy.
The students passing by found her happiness… unsettling.
“What’s gotten into her…?” “She looks… kind of crazy.” “Well, she’s one of the Six Criminals, after all. Something’s gotta be off.” “Still, she’s really pretty.” “Yeah, super pretty…”
But none of their whispers reached Dal-bi’s ears.

chapters.title: Chapter 129
chapters.content:
The backlog of work was overwhelming.
Vice-Head of the Aseong High School Disciplinary Committee, Oh Baek-seo, was unusually focused as she busily handled her administrative tasks. Haye-song, Park Min-hyuk, and Yoo Do-ha were no exception to the chaos.
“Ughhh…”
Haye-song trembled, her body visibly shaking.
Finally—
“Aaaah!!”
She exploded.
Everyone, except for Baek-seo, turned their attention to Haye-song.
“There’s too much work!! Ahhh!! Freedom, come to me!!”
She dashed to the window, threw it open, and screamed at the top of her lungs.
Under-eye bags darkening his face, Min-hyuk gave her a pitying look.
“Sit down. We’ve got to work… We’ve been busy with so much stuff, we can’t help it.”
“Park Min-hyuk!! Don’t you think something’s wrong with this?! I’ve been busy enough as it is! And exams are coming up soon! I want to watch my dramas! I want to play games!”
“Haaa…”
Min-hyuk sighed.
“Just deal with it. The Head isn’t here, so what can we do?”
Do-ha chimed in, casting a glance at Haye-song.
“Seriously, the Head has a meeting with Hanyang at a time like this? It’s like they planned it!”
